description: To the Editor: The New York City Commission on Human Rights has just concluded hearings on the Board of Education's hiring practices.

title: U.S. OFFICIALS SAY AWED DRIVE IS ON IN AREA NEAR LAOS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1  Officials here reported today that a major new allied operation involving thousands of South Vietnamese and American troops was under way in the northwest corner of South Vietnam.

title: Evonne Goolagong Upsets Mrs. Court in Victorian Final
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Feb. 1 (AP)  Evonne Goolagong, Australia's 19yearold tennis sensation, upset Mrs. Margaret Smith Court, the world's leading woman player, today in the final of the Victorian championships. Mrs. court had won this title the last seven years.

title: STUDENTS REPORT ON MARIJUANA USE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The largest Federal survey of marijuana on American college campuses, made public today, showed that almost onethird of the students had tried marijuana and that oneseventh used it regularly.

title: HENRY DABROWSKI
description: Henry Dabrowski, chief engineer of WABCTV since 1962, died of a heart attack yesterday at his home in Short Hills, N. J. He was 56 years old.

title: Illinois Officials Ordered To Disclose Their Assets
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 1 (AP)Gov. Richard B. Ogilvie ordered today that all appointed state officials and their major employes report in detail on their financial interests.

title: SECURITY TERMED BLACKOUT REASON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 1  From time to time in the decadelong history of United States involvement in Vietnam, the American military command has imposed a curb on all news about a particular military operation for reasons described as security.

title: Illinois Law Overturned; A Mother Has Abortion
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 1 (AP)A young mother of two underwent today the first publicized legal abortion in Illinois since a Federal court ruling last Friday declared the state's 97yearold abortion law unconstitutional.

title: Vanderbilt Wins, 640
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Feb. 1 (UPI) Vanderbilt took over (second place in the Southeastern Conference tonight by defeating Tennessee, 6560. Vanderbilt (106) improved its S.E.C. wonlost record to 62 while Tennessee dropped to 63 in the league and 134 ever all.

title: Tobias Clarke Weds Miss Walter
description: Tobias Clarke, assistant treasurer of the London office of the Bankers Trust Company, married in London Thursday Miss Charlotte Walter, whose ancestors founded The Times of London two centuries ago.

title: 2 Share Princeton Award
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Feb. 1Brian McCullough of Doylestown, Pa., a flanker, and Steve Saner of Westwood, N. J., a guard on offense, received Princeton University's highest football honor jointly tonight at the annual team dinner. The seniors were awarded the John Prentiss Poe Cup, presented each year to that member of the football team best exemplifying a combination of playing ability, loyalty, courage, perseverance and modesty.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Joseph Paul of San Francisco, chairman of the state's Committee of Two Million, a coalition of sportsmen and conservationists, now says that his group's effort to save California's three remaining wild riversthe Eel, Klamath and Trinityis gaining force.

title: SUNDAY DATES SET AT DELAWARE TRACK
description: STANTON, Del., Feb. 1 (AP) Sunday racing and a split meeting at Delaware Park were approved unanimously today by the Delaware Racing Commission.

title: SHERMAN JENNEY, 70, EXDISTILLER'S AIDE
description: WINTER PARK, Fla., Feb. 1Sherman Jenney, retired vice president of BrownForman Distillers Corporation, died Saturday at the age of 70.

title: Con Ed Without Reserves Despite Power Cut in Cold
description: On the second coldest day of the winter here, the Consolidated Edison Company reported yesterday that it used every single available kilowatt of its own and of purchased electricity to meet demand in New York City and Westchester.

title: Text of Apollo Statement
description: Following is a statement made yesterday by Capt. Chester A. Lee of the Navy, the Apollo mission director, at a news conference at the Manned Spacecraft Center in Houston:

title: For Town Hall, a Man Full of Ideas
description: I can't stand not to be busy, says Jerrold Ross, who took over the direction of Town Hall yesterday. The ways things look now, he is in no immediate danger of suffering from idleness.

title: Fly to Washington
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 1 (UPI)Governor Carter and Mr. Gambrell flew to Washington today for Mr. Gambrell's swearingin tomorrow.

title: Tax Plan's Family Effects
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1Here, according to estimates by state budget officials, is how the 10 per cent increase in the personal state income tax and the 1centonthedollar increase in the state sales tax would affect families of four at different economic levels:

title: BUSINESS SCHOOL OPENED IN SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 1The Soviet Union today formally opened a highlevel business administration school to train Soviet industrialists in the modern management techniques of the computer age.

title: Executive Changes
description: Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation announced yesterday that William T. Gossett, a senior partner in the Detroit law firm of Dykema, Gossett, Spencer, Goodnow & Trigg, and former president of the American Bar Association, has been elected chairman of the executive committee of the board of directors. Late last year Mr. Gossett was chairman of the special committee of outside directors of Fox to study the report on corporate operations made by Stanford Research Institute. Following the report of this committee at the Dec. 29, 1970 board meeting, Richard D. Zanuck resigned as president.

title: Advisory Panel Named to Find Work for Returning Veterans
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1Secretary of Labor James D. Hodgson announced today the formation of a national advisory committee, including seven Cabinet members as well as business and labor leaders, for a major program to final jobs' for returning war veterans.

title: Aide for Spoleto Festival
description: Harvey Lichtenstein, director of the Brooklyn Academy of Music, has taken on an additional post, that of director, U.S.A., for the Festival of Two Worlds in Spoleto, Italy. He will work with Gian Carlo Menotti, who founded and heads the festival. His responsibilities will include preparation of programs, dealing with American participants and fundraising.

title: Rangers Trade Arnie Brown, Robitaille for Wings MacGregor, Larry Brown
description: Coach Emile Francis telephoned Arnie Brown yesterday, and before the coach could say hello, Brown asked him, Which team am I traded to?

title: KNICKS, REVIVED, READY FOR ROYALS
description: Having demonstrated to skeptics that they still possess in abundance the glittering talents that brought them to the National Basketball Association championship last season, the Knicks will try to keep their current winning, surge alive tonight against the .:Cincinnati Royals at Mailison Square Garden.

title: CATHOLIC LEADERS QUIT IN ROTTERDAM
description: ROTTERDAM, The Netherlands, Feb. 1( Reuters)Leaders of Rotterdam Roman Catholics have resigned their posts to protest Pope Paul VI's appointment of a conservative priest as their new bishop, it was disclosed today.

title: GARAGE AGREEMENT AVERTS A STRIKE
description: A tentative agreement has been reached by the parties to the public parking garage negotiations, Meyer Drucker, director of state mediations services, said early today.

title: PACT OR BREAK SEEN TODAY IN OIL TALKS
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Feb. 1 (Reuters)Six Persian Gulf oilproducing countries held their fifth round of talks with representatives of major oil companies of the world today but apparently failed to reach agreement on higher prices for their oil.

title: HIALEAH WIENER RIDDEN BY YCAZA
description: MIAMI, Feb. 1 (AP)Manuel Ycaza, severely injured 12 months ago in a fall at Hialeah Park, returned to the winner's circle at the same tram today with a victory aboard Delta Traffic in the fourth race.

title: DETERGENT LABELS HELD IN VIOLATION
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz accused two of the country's leading soap and detergent producers yesterday of failing to obey a monthold state law requiring the labeling of the phosphate content of their products.

title: Expos Sign Gosger, Reed
description: MONTREAL. Feb. 1 (AP)the Montreal Expos announced today the signing of Jim Gosger, an outfielder, and Howie Reed, a pitcher, for the 1971 season.

title: Bill Rates Lose More Ground At Treasury's Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1Treasury bill rates, continuing their decline at today's auction receded last week's levels, the Government reported late this afternoon.

title: Night Police Plan Of Alabama Agency Is Rejected by U.S.
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Feb. 1  The Justice Department has rejected a request from the Alabama Law Enforcement Planning Agency for Federal funds to set up a blackuniformed special night police detail designed to frighten criminals.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your surprising, unsupported reference to New York State's sales tax as particularly repressive (editorial Jan. 23) flies in the face of considerable empirical evidence.

title: AntiSmut Day Sought
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1The Assembly voted 120 to 20 today to ask Governor Rockefeller to proclaim next Sunday as Community U.S.A.AntiSmut Day.

title: St. Peter's Beaten, 7774
description: GREENVILLE, N. C., Feb. 1 (AP)East Carolina University came from behind with 37 seconds left tonight and defeated St. Peter's College, 7774. Julius Prince scored two free throws that put E.C.U. ahead, 7574, and the Pirates held on.

title: Lockheed Accepts a Loss Of $200Million on C5 A
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1Faced with imminent bankruptcy, the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation yielded today to a Pentagon demand that it take a $200million loss on the controversial C5A jet transport as the condition for a financial rescue.

title: Books of The Times
description: What have we done that the American people want us to stop? Sitting Bull asked wearily of an American Army officer. And though neither answered, both knew the answer: Living.

title: Cruiser Nears Retirement
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 1 (AP)The heavy cruiser St. Paul steamed out of home port today for retirement at Bremerton, Wash.

title: College Art Group Dissidents Are Gaining Ground
description: CHICAGOAt 7:30 Friday evening at the Conrad Hilton Hotel here, participants in the 59th annual convention of the College Art Association faced a choice of entertainmentsan official banquet (9.75 a head, drinks not included), or a competing caucus (free, no food), organized by members of the New Art Association, a group of younger dissidents critical of the parent body.

title: Nassau Will Seek State Parkway Tolls
description: MINEOLA, L.L. Feb. 1 Faced with a $19.2million deficit this year. Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso announced today that he would attempt to obtain a fair share of the tolls collected by the state on parkways in the count.

title: State Rests Case In Penalty Phase Of Manson Trial
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 1 (UPI) The state rested its case today in the penalty phase of the Sharon Tate murder trial after calling only two witnesses to reinforce its demand for the death penalty for Charles M. Manson and three women defendants.

title: Go for Apollo 14
description: The daring decision has been made to try to have Apollo 14 carry out its full scheduled program of lunar exploration. Whatever the cause of the difficulties in the five unsuccessful docking efforts Sunday night, the sixth attempt was successful and the astronauts subsequent examination of the mechanisms involved revealed nothing wrong, nor any reason to suppose that there will be a malfunction when the next crucial docking maneuver is scheduled to take place. That is when the upper stage of the lunar module blasts off from the surface of the moon to rejoin the orbiting command module for the journey back to earth.

title: Jazz Club Gets Bobby Hackett And Dizzy Gillespie Together
description: A wall that split the jazz world into two bitter factions in the nineteenforties came tumbling down Sunday evening at the Overseas Press Club, 54 West 40th Street.

title: Phosphate Ban in Effect
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 1 (UPI)Sale of laundry detergents having a phosphate content higher than 8.7 per cent are illegal in Chicago as of today. Store owners violating the law are subject to a minimum fine of $100 for each conviction. The law, passed Oct. 14, says no phosphate detergents can be sold after June 30, 1972.

title: Dean at U. of Rochester
description: ROCHESTER, Feb. 1 (AP)James I. Doi, a professor of education at the University of Michigan, was named dean of the University of Rochester's college or Eaucation today. Mr. Doi will succeed William A. Fullagar as dean July 1. The latter left the post in 1968 to devote his time to teaching.

title: Nobel Money Deposited In Solzhenitsyn Account
description: STOCKHOLM, Feb. 1 (UPI) The Nobel Foundation said today that it had placed the $78,400 literature prize of Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn in a bank account at his request.

title: Comment on Paper Gold
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (Reuters)  A senior international financial official said today there was a growing sentiment among European authorities against reactivation of the Special Drawing Rights, or paper gold, created last year to help expand world trade.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: Article 8  No Title

title: Laotian Stand Reiterated
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 1Gen. Thongphan Knoksy, a Laotian military spokesman, reiterated today that Laos would be opposed to any military incursion by South Vietnamese troops.

title: STRIKE IS GAMED AT RENEWAL SITES
description: About 1,000 maintenance workers went on strike yesterday afternoon against the private company that manages 1,000 buildings at urbanrenewal sites housing 100,000 people waiting relocation.

title: Man In the News
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1A frequent sight late at night in the hallways of the Capitol is a tall man with a loping stride who looks as if he has spent the last 24hours on a crowded bus.

title: S. CAROLINA UPSET BY. DUKE, 82 TO 71
description: DURHAM, N. C., Feb. 1 (AP) Gary Melchionni hit six consecutive free throws in a seemingly endless Duke parade to the foul line tonight to pace the Blue Devils to an 8271 upset victory over South Carolina.

title: Extension Refused
description: JERSEY CITY,. Feb. 1 (AP)The Citywide Independent League, seeking to oust Mayor Thomas J. Whelan, lost a round in court today when Superior Court Judge Samuel A, Lamer refused to extend a 10day deadline for collecting additional signatures on recall petitions to replace thousands ruled invalid last week.

title: Thieu Using U.S. Surveys in Vote Campaign
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 1National surveys of Vietnamese public opinion, which are prepared and analyzed by the United States mission here, are being used to assist President Nguyen Van Thieu in his reelection campaign this year.

title: Chilean Socialists Choose a Radical As Party's Leader
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Feb. 1The Socialist party of President Salvador Allende Gossens today elected a new secretary general, Carlos Altamirano, who heads its young radical wing.

title: PRICES OF BONDS REGISTER A CROP
description: Interest rates rose and bond prices declined yesterday as Wall Street began to worry that the Nixon Administration's plans for the economy and the Federal budget would be inflationary.

title: 25 Dead in Mozambique
description: LISBON, Feb. 1 (AP)  The number of bodies recovered from the flooddevastated areas of the Portuguese East African territory of Mozambique has risen to 25, a communiqu said today.

title: and Rockefeller's Crisis Call
description: Governor Rockefeller has addressed his budget message primarily to Washington. It is a desperate appeal to the President and to Congress to rescue the stateits taxpayers and particularly its citiesfrom a fiscal deadend of instant austerity and imminent disaster. It informs Mr. Nixon that his initial revenuesharing proposal is at best a stopgap; it implores the Congress to give approval to at least that much first aid.

title: St. John's, Five Short of 1,000, Faces Tough Villanova Tonight
description: The countup is on at St. John's and it goes like this  996  997  998  999 1,000.

title: Common Market Hardens Line, Saying Britain Must Pay More
description: BRUSSELS. Feb. 1  The Common Market hardened its position tonight on a key British demand in the membership talks, but acted in such a way as to avoid an immediate crisis.

title: Mayor, as Promised, Visits the Tombs
description: Mayor Lindsay toured the Tombs yesterday and talked with prisoners, including four under indictment for their participation in last October's prison riot.

title: GUNNAR $AHN DIES
description: GUNNAR JAHN DIES; NOBEL OFFICIAL, 88

title: Lancaster Archery Victor
description: LAS VEGAS, Nevada, Feb. 1 (UPI)Jack Lancaster of the Air Force captured the United States indoor archery professional championship yesterday by winning a shootoff from Bill Mills of Phoenix, Ariz. Both shot perfect sequences of 300 arrows before Lancaster won the shootoff after five arrows. Denise Libby, Rancho Cordova, Calif., won the women's pro title with a score of 593.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It is encouraging that Senator Brydges has somewhat modified his proposal that the state establish and operate gambling casinos. Nevertheless, I think the plan illconceived.

title: Uganda's New Ruler Dismisses All Local Officials Identified With Ousted Regime
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Feb. 1Maj. Gen. Idi Amin, Uganda's new military head of state, dismissed all mayors, district councilmen and other local officials today because of their identification with the Government that he toppled in a coup d'otat on Jan. 25.

title: CAVALIERS SENDING M'LEMORE TO BUCKS
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 1 (AP)The Cleveland Cavaliers traded McCoy McLemore to the Milwaukee Bucks today in exchange for Gary Freeman plus Milwaukee's second college draft choice this year and an undisclosed amount of cash.

title: Bruins Get Center Too Depressed to Play for Leafs
description: TORONTO, Feb. 1  Mike Walton left today to join the firstplace Boston Bruins and said that he had just about despaired of playing hockey again this season until he learned he had been traded by the Toronto Maple Leafs.

title: Advisory Council Gives Itself a Birthday Pat
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The Council of Economic Advisers formally took note of its 25th birthday today with an unyouthfully modest claim concerning the achievements of its lifetime.

title: MARIAN HAGUE
description: Marian Hague, a connoisseur of laces, embroideries and textiles, formerly associated with collections at Cooper Union and the Metropolitan Museum of Art, died Sunday of a heart attack at her home, 333 East 68th Street. She was 97 years old.

title: Hanoi Expects Big Drive
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Feb. 1 (Agence FrancePresse)Hanoi expects a huge intervention in southern Laos shortly by the South Vietnamese Army, backed by the United States Air Force, Nhan Dan, the Communist party daily, indicated today.

title: REFUSES MORE AID TO CITY
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1New York City was told by Governor. Rockefeller today that no new state aid was available for the coming year beyond increases already mandated.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It will take a while for the country to grasp the significance of President Nixon's restructuring of Federal, state and city government functions and allocation of tax revenues. But when you think about it, he is merely trying to carry out what all agree is so necessary: spending tax dollars at the local level where they are most needed. [Editorial Jan. 11.1

title: Kosygin Denounces U.S.
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 1  Premier Kosygin said tonight that an outrageous invasiou of the southern provinces of Laos was under way and said that it further aggravated the situation in Indochina.

title: 71 Simcas Being Recalled
description: DETROIT, Feb. 1 (AP)The Chrysler Corporation announced that it was recalling 2,317 Simca passenger cars built by its ChryslerFrance subsidiary. The cars, 1971 model Simca 1204's, are being recalled to inspect and repair possibly inadequate lubrication systems on rear axle hub bearings, Chrysler said.

title: NO BAR EXAM BIAS FOUND BY AGNEW
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 Vice President Agnew criticized today suggestions that bar examination standards be eased to admit more Negroes to the practice of law.

title: DR. ALLEN KENISTON OF MEDICAL FAMILY
description: PORT JERVIS, N. Y., Feb. 1 Dr. Allen Hayward Keniston, an anesthesiologist and past president of the Orange County Medical Society, died today of a heart attack at his home. He was 50 years old.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: La Mancha to Move To Eden on March 2
description: Man of La Mancha, now in its sixth year of existence, will move from its Broadway home at the Martin Beck Theater to the Eden Theater at Second Avenue and 12th Street on March 2.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: Article 7  No Title

title: News Analysis
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1Governor Rockefeller has warned of serious fiscal problems in virtually every one of the annual budget messages that he has delivered over the lasst 13 years. But this year, more than ever before, his words of woe are backed up by statistics that point to a state of crisis that is likely to continue into the foreseeable future.

title: Would Like Reserve to Set Growth at 6 to 8% a Year
description: The Federal Reserve System should expand the nation's money supply this year at an annual rate of at least 6 per cent if the economy is to achieve the 9 per cent rate of growth in total output projected by the Nixon Administration, the President's chief economic adviser said here yesterday.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 1A communiqu issued by the Lebanese military said that there were no Lebanese casualties in Israeli raids on two villages last night. Palestinian commandos reported that one of their men had been killed and another had been wounded in the attacks.

title: Episcopal Church Urges G.M. To Close Plants in South Africa
description: The Episcopal Church in the United States urged the General Motors Corporation yesterday to cease manufacturing in South Africa and said it would offer a resolution on the matter at the company's annual stockholders meeting.

title: Mozambique Says Army Has Stopped 2 Drives by Rebels
description: LISBON, Feb. 1  Guerrilla forces have begun an offensive on two strategic fronts in Mozambique but have been put to flight, the military command in Lourengo Marques, capital of the East African Portuguese territory, announced today.

title: AGENT GOT HIGH WITH PANTHERS
description: A. police undercover agent admitted yesterday that he got high on marijuana and terrible bourbon while in Baltimore with several Black Panthers, but insisted that he was very much aware of what I was doing.

title: Revised Cuckoo Coming
description: A revised version of Dale Wasserman's drama One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest opens Feb. 22 at the MercerHansberry Theater, 240 Mercer Street, under the auspices of Ruth Golyn. Lee D. Sankowieh is directing.

title: A Show of Maya Glyphs Has Special Excellence
description: The only thing wrong with The Art of Maya Hieroglyphic Writing, an exhibition that opened to the public recently at the Center for InterAmerican Relations, is that it may make you feel you have wasted your life doing whatever it is you are doing instead of having zone in for archeology. Otherwise there is no fault to find with this small, carefully selected show of Maya sculptures and ceramics accompanied by photographs of sites under excavation at the turn of the century and documents concerning the earliest explorations of ruined cities in the Maya area of Yucatan and Guatemala. There are also a laymandirected summary of the efforts made to decipher Maya glyphs, and a small, heartbreaking group of photographs showing the kind of vandalism that is still destroying Maya monuments in situ.

title: YONKERS TO START NEW PACE SERIES
description: YONKERS, Feb. 1 Coffee Solicitor, a brown colt by Coffee Break out of the prolific brood mare Solicitor's Queen, is regarded as a dark horse in the Hopeful Pacing Series, which will start Wednesday night at Yonkers Raceway.

title: Mary Ormsbee Whitton, 84; Author of The New Servant
description: POUND RIDGE, N. Y., Feb. 1 Mrs. Mary Ormsbee Whitton, author of First First Ladies and other books about women in American history, died yesterday of a heart attack at her home on Fancher Road. She was 84 years old.

title: Appeals Court Bids Town Give Races Equal Services
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1A Federal appeals court, in a pioneering decision with possible implications for poor neighborhoods across the country, has ruled that a small Mississippi farm town must provide public services such as sewers, paving and traffic signals, on a racially equal basis.

title: Sports of Sto auto
description: In the regular election for Baseball's Hall of Fame no one made it, which underdoing it. In the special election by the veterans committee the day before yesterday, seven men made it, which overdoing it.

title: Truman Sees Apollo on TV
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Feb. 1 (UPI)Former President Harry S. Truman, 86 years old, followed the progress of Apollo 14 on television. Today, on his 12th day in Research Hospital, he was reported in good condition and continuing to regain his strength after a stomach ailment. There was no word on when he might be released.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Article 5  No Title

title: LUTHER LOOMIS, 57, BANKING EXECUTIVE
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Feb. Luther Loomis, assistant secretary of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, died last evening, apparently of a heart attack. He was 57 years old and lived in Sharon and at 20 East 76th Street in New York.

title: Seton Hall Loses, 79.67
description: PROVIDENCE. R. I., Feb. 1 (AP)Ernie DiGregorio scored 21 points and had 10 assists tonight in leading Providence to a 79.67 victory over Seton Hall.

title: Amerada Hess Steps Up Profits
description: The Amerada Hess Corporation reported yesterday consolidated net income of $114,009,829, or $3.22 a share. In 1969 the net was $84,655,776, or $2.36 a share after deducting an extraordinary charge of $1,820,000, or 5 cents a share. The charge represented a provision for consolidation and reorganization realignment expense, according to a company spokesman.

title: 5 Guerrillas Arrested
description: SANTIAGO, Feb. 1 (UPI)Five members of a MarxistLeninist guerrilla group, dissatisfied with the pace of social transformation, were arrested today after an exchange of fire with policemen who surprised them painting revolutionary slogans on a wall. The group, which had at least two teenagers, was charged with attempted homicide, illegal possession of firearms and automobile theft.

title: Sanitation Talks Reported Gaining
description: Walter L. Eisenberg, chief mediator in the negotiations between the city and the sanitationmen, reported yesterday that significant progress was being made on major contract issues and that the union had agreed to a further contract extension.

title: Poll Finds Muskie Leads President by 43% to 40
description: Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, leads President Nixon, 43 per cent to 40, as the choice for President if the 1972 election were held now, the Harris poll reported yesterday.

title: Post Crushes Pratt, 89.69
description: BROOKVILLE, LI., Feb. 1Ed Klimkowski tallied 28 points tonight to lead C. W. Post to an 8949 victory over Pratt. The Pioneers raised their wonlost record to 132.

title: Study of Detergent Enzymes Announced by Drug Agency
description: W.ASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (UPI) The Food and Drug, Administration spurning an industry after to, pay the bill, announced today a sixmonth scientific study on alleged health hazards of detergent enzymes.

title: 40 End Columbia SitIn, Police Stand By
description: A group of 40 Puero Rican students ended a 17hour occupation of a seminar room at Columbia University early today after a show of force by the administration and the city police.

title: Nixon Will Confer With Cabinet On Strategy for 6 Great Goals'
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V. I., Feb. 1President Nixon, tanned land rested from three days in the sun, flew home to Washington today to set in motion his program of domestic reforms.

title: Berlin Traffic Flows Again
description: BERLIN Feb. 1 (AP)  East Germany ended harassment of access to West Berlin today. Autobahn traffic was getting back to normal after six days of delays designed to protest West German political activities in West Berlin.

title: Article 11  No Title
description: Article 11  No Title

title: 44,000 ON STRIKE AT FORD IN BRITAIN
description: LONDON, Feb. 1Thousands of automobile workers, in a major challenge to the Government's efforts to slow wage inflation, struck Ford Motor Company plants in Britain today.

title: Giants Leading Draft Choice Revealed as 2Name Dropper
description: On the flat plains around Canyon, Tex., and in the modern midtown offices of the New York Giants, he is known as Rocky Thompson: good college runner, firstround pro football pick, promising wide receiver.

title: Persistent Inflation Tied to Defense Cuts
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The President's Council of Economic Advisers tentatively suggested today that one of the reasons for the persistence of inflation despite rising unemployment might be that so much of the economic slowdown had come in one sector of the economythe defense sector.

title: Dr. Joseph Herzstein, 74, Specialist in Cardiology
description: Dr. Joseph Herzstein, an internist who specialized in cardiology, died yesterday at Mount Sinai Hospital, where he had served on the staff for 38 years. He was 77 years old and lived at 175 East 79th Street.

title: Kosygin Urges Israel to Act to Spur Peace
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 1Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin called on Israel today to take concrete peaceful actions toi avoid worsening the Middle East situation, which he said was now at a critical juncture.

title: Marshall University Given $42.000 From TV Show
description: HUNTINGTON, W. Va., Feb. 1 (UPI)Marshall University has received a check for $42,000 as its share of a memorial fund raised in a nationally televised, Night of Stars, the development director John S. Callebs, said today.

title: LA BENZ CRITICAL OF MEET PAYOFFS
description: Chuck LaBenz, a topranking American miler, confirmed yesterday that athletes had been offered and received color television sets as prizes in the Sunkist invitation track meet Jan. 16 in Los Angeles.

title: Rare Nuclear Particle Discovered by Its Photographic Footprint
description: Physicists from the sity of California reported yesterday that they had discovered a rare and elusive nuclear particle within the atom.

title: G.M. Forms Department Of Environment Activity
description: The General Motors Corporatidn, in a tacit recognition of the growing demand for controls on air and water pollution created a new department yesterday to supervise company activities related to the environment.

title: Mother of 5 Dies in Fire
description: A mother of five children was killed last night in a twoalarm fire at 1101 Bergen Street in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn. The woman, Mrs. Shirley Jenkins, 35 years old, lived in the top floor of the fourstory building, which collapsed during the blaze.

title: Construction Spending Up
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (AP)The value of new construction activity in December reached a seasonally adjusted annual rate of $93.7billion, the Commerce Department said today.

title: BILL SET TO CURB CRIME IN SCHOOLS
description: Representative Jonathan B. Bingham said yesterday that he would introduce a safe schools act in Congress today that for the first time would make Federal funds available for school security programs.

title: A.C.L.U. Aide Named Senate Panel counsel
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (AP)Lawrence Speiser, an executive of the American Civil Liberties Union, will become staff director and chief counsel of the Senate subcommittee on juvenile delinquency.

title: PATERSON POLICE FOUND NOT GUILTY
description: NEWARK, Feb. 1Six members of the Paterson, N. J., Police Department were found not guilty today of Federal charges of conspiring to violate the civil rights of black residents and businessmen during racial disturbances in July, 1968.

title: Soviet Ousts British Student
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 1, (Reuters) The Soviet Union today expelled a British exchange student accused of photographing a defense installation, the British Embassy said. The student, Norman C. Bauer, said he had taken a picture of the sunset over the Neva River at Leningrad. Soviet regulations prohibit the phtographing of bridges and docks.

title: Festival Books a Play
description: The New York Shakespeare Festival will present Subject to Fits, by Robert Montgomery, at the Public Theater/The Other Stage, 425 Lafayette Street, on Feb. 14. Tickets will sell at $5 for Sunday through Thursday evenings and at $6 for Friday and Saturday nights.

title: Federal Bank Aide Dies in Storm On Snowmobile Trip in Montana
description: COOKE CITY, Mont., Feb. 1 Raging winds turned a 54mile snowmobile trip into the (spectacular Bear Tooth country just northeast of Yellowstone National Park Into a winter survival test that cost the life of the president of the Ninth Federal Reserve District in Minneapolis.

title: Brooks Robinson Is Athlete of Year In Hickok Voting
description: ROCHESTER, Feb. 1 (AP) Brooks Robinson, the outstanding player of last year's World. Series in the field and at bat, was named tonight as the winner of the 21st annual Hickok ProfessionalAthletcoftheYear Award.

title: Governor Sees $211Million Saving
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1Governor Rockefeller forecast in his budget message today that the state would spend only $6.916billion of the $7.127billion approved last year in the budget for the current fiscal year. But much of the $211million saving was more apparent than real.

title: Strike Blocks Sailing Were Of 2 Colombian Freighters
description: A strike by a Colombian mariners union canceled the scheduled departure last night of the Grancolombiana freighter Ciudad de Neiva from Pier 3 in Brooklyn.

title: Jawbone and Wishbone
description: The President's Council of Economic Advisers forecasts a tremendous increase in national output for 1971, with gross national product averaging $1,065 billionsome $15 billion to $20 billion higher than most private economists are predicting, as the Council itself concedes.

title: HARLEM SCHOOL UNIT CHOOSES A CHAIRMAN
description: Roland Collins has been elected chairman of the strifetorn local school board of Central Haikm, which has not had legally elected officials since it was started late last spring.

title: Bridge: Dutch and French air Take Championship in London Play
description: The world's strongest pair championship was won Sunday in London by a Dutchman and a Frenchman. Bob Slavenburg of the Netherlands, a former world Olympiad pair champion, and Leon Tintner of France, who has many times represented his country in international competition, scored an upset victory in a field of 18. pairs that included many of the world's best players.

title: JeanPierre Rampal Seconded By Baker in Rare Flute Recital
description: You don't have to be a flutist to have liked JeanPierre Rampal's flute recital at Philharmonic Hall Sunday night. As usual, the Frenchman played his instrument to a final trill and turn: musically, smoothly and with astonishing ease of delivery.

title: L.I.R. RIDERS ASSAIL TRAINMEN ON DEATH
description: FREEPORT, L.I., Feb. 1 (UPI) A group of angry commuters charged today that a delay by Long Island Railroad trainmen in getting help for a heartattack victim might have resulted in his death.

title: Poverty Aides Deny Coast PhaseOut
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1Federal antipoverty officials insisted today that, contrary to a statement by Gov. Ronald Reagan of California, their new sixmonth grant to a controversial legal services program is not a phaseout or a transition grant.

title: Panelist May Enter Politics
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb. 1 (UPI)Joseph Rhodes Jr., 22 years old, the youngest member of the Presidential Commission on Student Unrest, said today that he was seriously considering running for a City Council seat in his home town of PittsJcurgh, Pa. Mr. Rhodes, a junior fellow at Harvard, said he would make up his mind within two weeks.

title: ISRAELIS SAY RAIDS RAZED AN ARAB BASE
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 1 (AP)Informed sources said today that the Israeli raiding parties that attacked two villages in south Lebanon during the night had destroyed a Palestinian guerrilla regional headquarters.

title: Advertising Industry Warned To Reform by Mrs. Knauer
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (UPI) Virginia H. Knauer, President Nixon's adviser on consumer affairs, told the advertising industry today that it would either have to reform itself or be reformed by the Government.

title: CYANAMID SUING GOLDMAN, SACHS
description: The American Cyanamid Corporation announced yesterday that it had started legal proceedings in Federal District Court here against Goldman, Sachs & Co. and Sidney J. Weinberg Jr., one of the partners in this investment banking firm, seeking $120million in damages.

title: Democratic Committee Bars 72 New Hampshire Stand
description: MANCHESTER, N. H. Feb. 1 (AP)The Democratic State Committee has endorsed unanimously a resolution that prohibits it and its chairman from favoring any candidate in the state's 1972 Presidential preference primary.

title: A Tube Implant Corrected Shepard's Ear Disease
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 1A sliverthin, inchlong tube that doctors inserted by microsurgery into the left side of Capt. Alan B. Shepard Jr.'s head has enabled the 47yearold Navy astronaut to come back from a grounded flight status to the command of Apollo 14 on its moonlanding mission.

title: Samuels to Seek Revision of Offtrack Betting Legislation
description: RANCHO LA COSTA, Calif Feb. 1  Howard J. Samuels said today that the bill that created offtracic betting in New York was hastily drawn up and is in obvious need of revision.

title: Jersey Assembly Votes a Liberal Divorce Bill
description: TRENTON, Feb. 1A sweeping liberalization of New Jersey's divorce lawincluding provision to eliminate the requirement of finding fault with a spouse in some caseswon initial legislative approval tonight in the Assembly.

title: Site for Queens High School Protested
description: A crowd of 200 turned out in nearzero weather last night to hear most of the speakers at a raucous public hearing in a Flushing synagogue protest the city's plan to build a new midQueens high school in the Powell's Cove area.

title: President Seeks a Tax on Sulphur in Fuels as Incentive to Curb Air. Pollution
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 President Nixon has decided to go ahead with a proposal for taxing the sulphur content of coal, oil and natural gas as an incentive for industry to reduce emissions of sulphur oxide, one of the most hazardous of common air pollutants.

title: Unanswered Questions
description: The disclosure yesterday that John B. Connally Jr. received substantial secret payments from a foundation while serving as Governor of Texas raises questions about his nomination to be Secretary of the Treasury.

title: Zayyat Sees Jarring
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 1Dr. Jarring today received the Egyptian Government's latest statement from Mohammed H. ElZayyat, its representative, and transmitted it a few hours later to Yosef Tekoah, the Israeli delegate. Neither Mr. Zayyat nor Mr. Tekoah would describe the nature of the statement.

title: Article 10  No Title
description: Article 10  No Title

title: For Some, Being a Congressman's Wife Isn't That Glamorous
description: WASHINGTON  Not all Congressmen's wives in Washington play tennis, wear miniskirts to the White House, and sail from party to party, beaming and gracious, on the arms of their husbands.

title: ETHEL CASEY
description: MASTIC BEACH, L. I., Feb. 1 (AP)Mrs. Warner Schreiner, who appeared on the stage as Ethel Casey, died at her home here Saturday. She was 49 years old.

title: Denim Fad: It's From Head to Foot
description: It used to belong to farmers, cowhands, workers on the railroad and in machine shops throughout the country. American teenagers picked it up and made it a fad all over the world.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The following is an excerpt from the forthcoming worst seller, How to Fail in Business, Government and Practically Everything Else Despite a Heroic Struggle. It is by the distinguished American failure, John Fluppel.

title: Father's Day for the Golden
description: Father's Day, a new play by Oliver Halley, starring Brenda Vaccaro, opens March 16 at the John Golden Theater. Joseph Kipness and Lawrence Kasha are the producers.

title: Capital Press Aide Named
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 (AP) Frank Hewlett of the Salt Lake Tribune and Honolulu Star Bulletin was elected today as chairman of the Standing Committee of Correspondents, which supervises operation of the Congressional press galleries.

title: State Budget at a Glance
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1Following are the major parts Governor Rockefeller's proposed budget for the year beginning April I:

title: Advertising.
description: Without wasting any time, the Bulova Watch Company yesterday announced the 1971 advertising campaign plans for its Accutron, Bulova and Caravelle brands. Doyle Dane Bernbach, Inc., is the agency.

title: Mihajlov May Be Sentenced To Two Months for Article
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia. Feb. 1Mihalllo Mihajlov, the Yugoslav writer who served three and a half years in prison on charges of having published hostile propaganda, elaborated today on the new prosecution he faces.

title: AMEX IS UP AGAIN IN ACTIVE TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange posted their third straight advance yesterday in active trading.

title: NO CRISIS FOUND IN 1910 LIQUIDITY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1While many companies did experience a sharp drop in their liquidity last year, there was never any real liquidity crisis, according to the President's Council of Economic Advisers.

title: NIXON PROJECTS CUTS IN INFLATION AN JOBLESSNESS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1The Nixon Administration set a new target today for the nation's economy: a decline in unemployment to about 4.5 per cent and in the rate of inflation to about 3 per cent by mid1972.

title: The Screen: Pigeons
description: The movie industry's addiction to picaresque fictions seems as much a bid for temporary survival as it does an appreciation of a culturally current form. To a large degree, a reflection of the kinds of novels that have been published in the last few years, the picaresque movie usually finds itself trying to answer the question: What do we do when we haven't got a story? What we do, of course, is pretend we didn't want a storyand then fill up the empty places with charm.

title: PANEL TO STUDY WHELANPETITIONS
description: TRENTON, Feb. 1 (AP)The New Jersey Assembly today authorized an investigation of the possibility that the names of fictitious and dead persons appeared on petitions seeking to recall Mayor Thomas J. Whelan of Jersey City.

title: Dance: Falco's Troupe at the ANTA
description: This year's City Center American Dance Seasonwhich, just to add a little confusion to a muddled world, is taking place at the ANTA Theater on 55th Streetgot off to its third week, with the Louis Falco Company of Featured Dancers. This is the first of the season's split weeks; the Falco company, which will be seen again tomorrow afternoon and Friday evening, is sharing the engagement with Pearl Lang and Eleo Pomare.

title: Georgia Senator Appointed
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 1  Gov. Jimmy Carter of Georgia appointed today a close political ally, David Henry Gambrell, the Democratic State Chairman, to fill out the unexpired Senate term of the late Richard B. Russell. Mr. Gambrell, a 41yearold Harvard Law School graduate, made it clear at a brief news conference that while he had admired Mr. Russell, who died Jan. 21, his views on some important issues would not be the same as Mr. Russell's. The passage of time has changed a lot of things, the appointee remarked as he suggested that his position on civil rights would be more liberal than that of his predecessor. Mr. Russell had led the Senate opposition to the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and was regarded as a conservative on most matters of race.

title: In Connecticut Capitol: Calm Before the Storm
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 1On a recent afternoon in the ornate marble and granite Connecticut State Capitol, the business before the Senate was a resolution thanking the Wadsworth Anthenumthe nation's oldest art museum herefor a free lunch given to members of the General Assembly on opening day.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Article 6  No Title

title: First Pennsylvania Cuts Savings Rate
description: The largest commercial bank in Philadelphia announced yesterday a cut in the interest rate it pays on passbook savings accounts to 4 per cent from 4 per cent, and at the same time the largest savings bank in that city disclosed that it had reduced from 6 per cent to 5 per cent the maximum rate that it pays on two year savings certificates.

title: Merger News
description: Ashland Oil, Inc., of Kentucky is negotiating to acquire a controlling interest in the Home Oil Company, Ltd., of Canada in a merger move that could have international repercussions. The Canadian Government has recently been trying to develop a comprehensive foreigninvestment policy that would diminish United States economic influence in Canada. Home is the nation's largest Canadian con trolled oil company. Orin E. Atkins president of Ashland, said that conversations with R. A. Brown Jr., president of Home Oil, have been continuing over a considerable period of time.

title: GOVERNOR ASKS NEW TAXES OF AIBILLION FOR CRISIS;
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1 Governor Rockefeller sent to the Legislature today an $8.45billion budget for the 197172 fiscal year, along with proposed tax rises of $1.1billion  the largest taxincrease request in the state's history.

title: Budget Hearings Scheduled
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1 Public hearings on the budget,. which traditionally are held only in Albany, will also be held this year in New York City and Buffalo. Warren M. Anderson, chairman of the Senate Finance Committee, which will conduct the hearings jointly with the Assembly Ways and Means Committee, announced today that they would be held simultaneously on Feb. 17 and 18. The hearing here will be at Pace College.

title: Stars Sharpening Blades For New Skating Titles
description: BUFFALO. Feb. 1 With the national championships behind them, the best of the figure skaters left today to prepare for the North American championships.

title: Chile's TakeOver Plans Hit by Javits
description: Senator Jacob K. Javits warned yesterday that plans of the new Marxist Chilean Government for discriminatory expropriation of American companies would harm Chile's economy and scare off needed development investment elsewhere in Latin America.

title: Police in Madrid Arrest Five Prominent Socialists
description: MADRID, Feb. 1  The police arrested five prominent members of the Spanish Socialist party here yesterday.

title: Education: What Do We Need?
description: WASHINGTON  Rarely have the ideas dominating education anywhere been so wholly at odds with the needs of society than at this moment and in this country. Life in America depends on the smooth functioning of a complex sciencebased technology. The routine management of this technology is difficult enough. Far more difficult is the crucially important task of devising new ways to bring modern technology into harmony with nature.

title: Inco Earnings Climb to Record;
description: The International Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd., announced yesterday that its 1970 earnings were $208million, or $2.80 a share, in United States dollars. The Inco statement made no mention of the fact, but this was a record profit by a considerable margin.

title: STOCK INSURANCE MAY GET 1ST CASE
description: The Securities Investor Protection Corporation, established by Congress in December to protect customers of failing brokerage firms, has been notified to be ready for its first case.

title: Bunker to See Nixon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 1  Ambassador Ellsworth Bunker left Saigon today for a week of consultation with President Nixon and talks with officials at the Paris peace negotiations.

title: Forgotten Laughter, Forgotten Prayer
description: If you are thinking about making the world better for the future, what kind of knowledge about the past will you need? This can vary. I think that at this particular point in history, the things we have to studyand here we need the help of historiansare the various European revolutions, starting, let us say, with the Papal Revolution, then coming on to the Reformation, the English Revolution, the American Revolution, the French Revolution, the Russian Revolution. Those things have to be studied; we can learn from them. The rejection of the past, I think, is all nonsense.

title: Gilbert Kennedy, Lawyer, Dies; Served at Embassy in London
description: Gilbert F. Kennedy, an international lawyer who represented this country at the embassy in London, died of pneumonia at St. Luke's Hospital on Saturday. He was .99 years old and lived in Palisades, N.Y.

title: Jewish Activist Quits Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 1, (Retuers) Vitaly Svechinsky, an architect who has campaigned for the right of Soviet Jews to go to Israel, today left by plane for Vienna as an emigrant.

title: Heller Finds Shortcoming In Nixon Planfor Economy
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 Walter W. Heller, the economist who was an adviser to Presidents Johnson and Kennedy, commended today President Nixon's new approach to solving the nation's economic problems but said that it did not go far enough.

title: MARKET CLIMBS IN HEAVY VOLUME
description: The recent euphoria experienced by stock market investors continued in a big way yesterday as winners outpaced losers on the New York Stock Exchange by a ratio of better than 2to1.

title: Parents Become PupilsFor an Evening
description: Today is Friday. My job is juice, is the way Denny Saks had worded his announcement on the schoolroom easel.

title: Building Contracts Fell in December From Year Earlier
description: The total value of contracts for all kinds of construction issued throughout the country in December was $4,973,792,000, down 5 per cent from $5,226,764,000 in the yearearlier period, the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Information Systems Company reported yesterday.

title: RECORD OF $50,000 OFFERED IN TENNIS
description: A first prize of $50,000 will be the incentive in the final match of the $1million World Championship of Tennis, officials of World Championship Tennis announced yesterday.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The threeway deal that sent Mike Walton from Toronto to Philadelphia to Boston marked the first time in National Hockey League history that a psychiatrist's report enabled an unhappy player to be traded.

title: U.S. Remains Hopeful
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 United States officials said to day that they expected the ceasefire to continue on an openended basis past Friday's deadline.

title: WILDCAT COUNTRY VICTOR AT PIMLICO
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 1 (UPI)Wildcat Country tired in the stretch at Pimlico today but won the $6,500 allowance feature for 3yearolds at six furlongs.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Perhaps the new Postal Service might consider adopting an idea used in Canadian mailboxes: a pedal to open the box by foot.

title: Sudan Denies Incursions
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Feb. 1 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Sudan has denied making military incursions into Uganda and has expressed regret the release of false news from official sources in Kampala. General Amin had charged that Uganda had been attacked by the Sudan.

title: Now Why Are They Throwing Brickbats at Saint Laurent?
description: Yves Saint Laurent, the darling of the Paris couture for almost 10 years, has just received a drubbing from store buyers, manufacturers and most of the fashion press.

title: Cable Company Formed
description: The Continental Telephone Corporation and British Insulated Callender's Cables, Ltd., one of the largest producers of electric cable in the world, announced yesterday formation of a company to manufacture aluminum telephone cable in Jamaica, West Indies. The new company has been named Caribbean Telephone Cables, Ltd.

title: RETAILERS OPPOSE RISE IN SALES TAX
description: The Metropolitan New York Retail Merchants Association, made up of the city's leading department stores, plans to urge all state legislation from here to vote against Governor Rockefeller's proposed increase in the state sales tax.

title: LONDON LIST OFF IN QUIET TRADING
description: The London stock market drifted lower in very quiet trading yesterday.

title: AUSTIN D. SMITH
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Feb. 1Austin David Smith, chairman of the David Smith Steel Company of Brooklyn, died Saturday of a heart attack on a visit to Montego Bay, Jamaica. He was 77 years old and lived here at 130 North Van Dien Avenue.

title: Furrier Is Found Guilty
description: Max Scharfman, proprietor of the Rosalie Fur Company of New Rochelle, N. Y., was found guilty in Federal Court here yesterday on a charge of possession of stolen furs. The 53yearold furrier, who lives at 35 Glenwood Avenue in New Rochelle, could receive a maximum of 10 years in prison and a fine of $5,000 when he is sentenced on March 19 by Judge Edward C. McLean.

title: and Full Disclosure
description: Senator Case of New Jersey has reintroduced in the new Congress his bill to require full public disclosure of the personal financial interests of all senior Federal Government officials. The Connally case underscores the wisdom of this proposal. If the state of Texas had such a law, the relationship of John B. Connally with the Richardson interests during his governorship would have been public knowledge.

title: Connally Says He Did Not Violate Texas Law
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 John B. Connally Jr., President Nixon's nominee to be Secretary of the Treasury, told Senators privately today that he had not violated the Texas, Constitution in receiving deferred legal payments from the Sid W. Richardson Foundation while he was Governor of Texas.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Much is heard these days about the alleged need to reorder our national priorities toward human needs. But unless it is intended to suppress scientific research and technological development entirely, a grave error of judgment has occurred in one case: the budgetary restrictions on NASA, forcing it to abandon plans for an unmanned grandtour probe of the solar system later in the decade.

title: A SPACE TRANSFER IS AN ALTERNATIVE
description: HOUSTON. Feb. 1The astronauts of Apollo 14 are prepared to take a space walk, if necessary, to rejoin their mother craft after lifting off from the moon next Saturday, it was reported here today.

title: Secret Pact Reported The Washington Star
description: VIENTIANE, Feb. 1Authortative Laotian military sources said today that Laotian rightist generals had a secret agreement with the South Vietnamese that would permit South Vietnamese troops to cross into southern Laos in division strength if Saigon considered it necessary.

title: PROFITS SET MARK AT COLUMBIA GAS
description: The Columbia Gas System and subsidiaries reported yesterday a new high in 1970 earnings. The preliminary annual report placed total operating revenues at $822.8million, an increase from $773.5million a year earlier, while net income rose by 6.5 per cent to $86.8million, or $2.80 a share, from $S1.5mi'lion, or $2.66 a share, in 1969.

title: CHASE REORGANIZES ITS U.S. OPERATIONS
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank announced yesterday a sweeping reorganization of its domestic banking structure along functional rather than geographic lines.

title: Kansas in Front
description: LAWRENCE, Kan., Feb. 1 (UPI)Kansas, paced by a 25point performance by Dave Robisch, beat Kansas State, 7974, tonight before a sellout crowd of 17,000 in a Big Eight Conference game.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1When President Nixon asked Congress, a year ago, to provide $1.5 billion in emergency assistance for desegregating some schools and easing racial isolation in others, the idea might have seemed simple. Federal financial assistance would play carrot to the stick of court orders in eliminating Southern dual school systems. In Northern and bigcity schools that were segregated in fact but not by law, the quality of education would at least be improved.

title: School Attendance Is Cut 50% By Strike of Newark Teachers
description: NEWARK, Feb. 1For the second time in less than a year, teachers in the public schools went on strike here today. The strike, by the Newark Teachers Union, reduced teaching staffs and student attendance in the city's schools by about 50 per cent.

title: Article 12  No Title
description: Article 12  No Title

title: Ondine Leads Yacht Race
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 1 (Reuters)  The American yacht Ondine was ahead today in the 1,200mile Buenos AirestoRio de Janeiro race as the leading boats passed the Uruguayan resort of Punta del Este. Ondine, a 73foot ketch, owned by Sumner A. Long of New York, is a favorite to win.

title: $2Billion Rise Forecast By City Realty Assessors
description: The city came up with a tentative set of figures yesterday to show that taxable real estate values here have soared nearly $2billion over last year's final total.

title: Arab Fratricide and Hate of Israelis Grow in the Dust and Despair of Gaza
description: GAZA, Feb. 1  The first day of the month is pay day for the 7,250 local Arabs who overcame old political scruples and have started working for high pay in Israeli factories short bus ride up the Mediterranean coast from this town.

title: Nixon Returns to Capital
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 1 (AP) President Nixon returned to the White House today at 9:34 P.M. after his threeday stay in the Virgin Islands.

title: Soviet TV Shows Liftoff
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 1 (UPI) soviet television showed film of the launching of Apollo 14 today nearly 24 hours after the event. Izvestia, the Government newspaper, suggested that the docking difficulties encountered in the flight might jeopardize, the whole Apollo program.

title: Slaying of School Teacher Admitted by Queens Man
description: A 23yearold Queens man, charged with murdering a Long Beach, L. I., school teacher last June, pleaded guilty yesterday to a lesser charge of firstdegree manslaughter.

title: SCHOOL MEETING ENDS IN VIOLENCE
description: A community school board meeting in Queens was broken up last night, and a board member reportedly knocked unconscious, during a heated discussion over a boycott of a South Jamaica school.

title: Tides Bring New Floods To Northern Mozambique
description: LOURENCO MARQUES, Mozambique, Feb. 1 (AP)Strong tides pushed new floods inland today over the Zambezia area of northern Mozambique and disease and starvation threatened more than 300,000 Africans driven from their homes by a cyclone last week.

title: Teamsters Oppose Suggested Closing Of 3 Main Streets
description: A spokesman for the teamsters union here said yesterday that the ideas being discussed in the Lindsay administration to close some major streets to weekday traffic would raise horrible complications for truck drivers and could increase shipping costs of merchandise by 50 per cent.

title: Six G.I.'s Reported Killed in Attacks by Enemy
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 1The United States command reported today that six American soldiers had been killed and more than 26 wounded in an upsurge of enemy attacks on American positions in South Vietnam.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: HOPEFUL REPORT GIVEN ON SILVER
description: For discouraged silver speculators who have suffered from months of low prices, there was an ounce or two of optimism yesterday when Handy & Harman, the big silver refiner and fabricator, issued its latest annual silver review and forecast.

title: Kentucky Trounces Auburn
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Feb. 1 (UPI)Kentucky shot a sizzling 72 per cent in the first half tonight and romped to an easy 11476 victory over Auburn.

title: Excerpts From Governor's Message to Legislature Asking Increases in Budget
description: ALBANY, Feb. 1Following are excerpts from the budget message Governor Rockefeller sent to the Legislature today:

title: STUDENTS BOYCOTT DE WITT CLINTON
description: A oneday boycott to protest overcrowding kept most students out of De Witt Clinton High School in the Bronx yesterday.

title: Continental Oil Net Up Sharply;
description: Propelled by sharply higher fourth  quarter earnings, the Continental Oil Company reported yesterday a 9.6 per cent advance in profits in 1970.

title: British Reserves Increased By $175Million in January
description: LONDON, Feb. 2 (Reuters) Britain's gold and foreign currency reserves rose by $175 million last month, the Government announced today. It was the biggest single month's rise for four years and raised Britain's reserves to $3.002billion, the highest it has been since April, 1966.

title: REPORT ON ATTACK AWAITED AS NIXON MEETS KEY AIDES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 President Nixon called a meeting of his leading military and diplomatic advisers at the White House late today, apparently to review the progress of the major new allied operation under way in northwestern South Vietnam.

title: Illegal Party Line
description: Two Federal judges in separate cases have ruled that unauthorized wiretapping of radical groups by the Government is unconstitutional. This judicial challenge the Justice Department's enthusiasm for electronic surveillance represents a significant victory for the liberty of all Americans irrespective of political persuasions.

title: INVENTORIES DROP AT U.S. FACTORIES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 Manufacturers inventories declined by more than $300million in December and, in an encouraging sign for 1971, the key ratio of inventories to sales fell significantly, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Squires Rally to Win
description: HAMPTON, Va., Feb. 2 (AP) The Virginia Squires, leading the American Basketball Association's Eastern Division, rallied in the final period tonight for a 114111 victory over the Memphis Pros. Mike Barrett scored 26 points and Charlie Scott 25 for the Squires.

title: MARK REUBEN, OWNED THE ABSINTHE HOUSE
description: Mark Reuben, former owner of the Absinthe House restaurant, died suddenly on Monday while on vacation in. Nice, France. He was 55 years olds and lived at 414 East .52d Street.

title: Plebiscite for Namibia
description: South Africa's unexpected offer of a plebiscite to determine the political future of SouthWest Africa may be simply a tactic to confuse proceedings before the International Court of Justice concerning that territory, which Africans call Namibia. Whatever the motive, it should be a prime objective of the Court, of the United Nations, which brought the proceedings, and of representatives of the black Namibian majority, to put the Pretoria Government promptly to the test. The proposal should not be dismissed out of hand as the 11nation U.N. Council on Namibia did in a statement the other day.

title: Escaper Seized in Tampa
description: TAMPA, Fla., Feb. 2 (UPI)Stuart Hartlin Fuller, a Maryland prison escaper, was taken from a DenvertoMiami jetliner at Tampa International Airport last night, the Federal Bureau of Investigation reported today. Agents said that Fuller, 25 years old, of Boynton Beach, Fla., had escaped from the Prince Georges County Jail in Upper Marlboro, Md., on Jan. 23. He was being held on charges of armed robbery.

title: Advertising:
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 The proposal for a National Advertising Review Board was commended today by the chairman of the Federal Communications Commission who said it holds great promise for effective action.

title: Brazil Bus Plunge Kills 5
description: RECIFE, Brazil, Feb. 2 (UPI) Five persons died and 30 were injured today when a bus bound from Recife to Goiania went over a precipice.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: Article 8  No Title

title: HENRY L. SHATTUCK, DONOR TO HARVARD
description: BOSTON, Feb. 2 (AP) Henry Lee Shattuck, a Boston banker and former State Representative, died today at Massachusetts General Hospital after a long illness. He was 91 years old.

title: CARE Names Mrs. Nixon
description: Mrs. Richard M. Nixon was named honorary chairman of CARE's 25th Anniversary Committee yesterday, the Associated Press reported. Anniversary celebrations will be held in all parts of the United States in the coming months, highligted by a CARE World Conference in Washington during the week of May 10, CARE said.

title: BIGSTORE SALES ROSE IN JANUARY
description: Bigstore activity in New York City in January showed strong gains over the yearago month as a result of traditional semiannual clearances and a continuation of shopper response to strong value promotions.

title: COEDIS FOUND DEAD ON C.W. POST CAMPUS
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Feb. 2Linda Mae Jarrigan, a 19yearold sophomore of C.W. Post College, was found dead today in a wooded area of the 350acre campus.

title: Rutgers Track Coach Reinstated After 6Week Suspension on Race Issue
description: Les Wallack, the Rutgers track coach suspended six weeks ago for having instigated a racial conflict with letter to the student newspaper, was reinstated by the university yesterday.

title: 3 American Die in Ambush
description: SAIGON, Wednesday, Feb 3 (Reuters)  Three Americans were killed and one was wounded during the night when the enemy ambushed a convoy of the 18th Engineer Brigade, the United States command reported today.

title: Knicks Down Royals, 115 108 With Reed Getting 27 Points and 33 Rebounds
description: The final scoreKnicks 115, Cincinnati Royals 108surprised no one at Madison Square Garden last night, but some of the things that led to it did.

title: Clohessy Outpoints O'Melia
description: John Clohessy, undefeated in six bouts, scored his second victory in less than two months over a New Jersey school teacher, Brian O'Melia, on a sixround decision last night at Sunnyside Garden, Queens. O'Melia, from Jersey City, lost a fourrounder to Clohessy from the Bronx, last December at Madison Square Garden. Clohessy weighed 212 pounds, O'Melia 199.

title: Student Group Sues State U. on Disciplinary Rules
description: ALBANY, Feb. 2A student rights group that has been attempting to weld the campuses of the huge State University into a sizable power bloc filed its first lawsuit today, demanding greater dueprocess protection in student disciplinary procedures.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In judging President Nixon's statement that he inherited the war, which was repeated in your lead editorial of Jan. 10, may I suggest that the following be kept in mind?

title: 2D RUSSELL STOMP SLATED FOR FEE. 14
description: The second annual Pee Wee Russell Memorial Stomp, held in memory of the late jazz clarinetist, will take place on Sunday, Feb. 14, at 3 P.M. at the Martinsville Inn, Martinsville, N. J.

title: FREDERICK SINGER, DU PONT EXECUTIVE
description: GREENVILLE, Del., Feb. 2Frederick G. Singer, who retired in 1958 as manager of the Paris division of the develop. ment department of E. I. du Pont de Demours & Co., died yesterday at his home, Chevannes, after a long illness. He was 73 years old.

title: Foe's Return Reported
description: NEAK LEUNG, Cambodia. Feb. 2 (Reuters)Senior Cambodian officers said today that the Vietcong were returning to sanctuaries cleared by South Vietnamese and United States troops last summer and building new ones opposite South Vietnam.

title: Petitions Support Family in Brooklyn In Adoption Battle
description: A committee formed to support the efforts of a couple who are trying to prevent their 8monthold adopted daughter from being returned to her natural mother said it had gathered more than 10,000 signatures on petitions being circulated for the first time yesterday.

title: LAOTIANS REPORT BIG ENEMY PUSH
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Wednesday, Feb. 3Defense Minister Sisouk na Champassak announced today what appeared to be the beginning of a major North Vietnamese offensive in northern Laos.

title: Winner in 500 at Daytona To Get Minimum $45,600
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 2 (AP)Officials of the Daytona International Speedway said today that the winner of the Feb. 14 Daytona 500 would receive at least $45,600, plus lap prize money.

title: Article 10  No Title
description: Article 10  No Title

title: Rights Panel Throws Curve to Women's Lib
description: A cocktail waitress who complained that she lost her job because she was flatchested was not discriminated against because of her sex, the State Human Rights Division ruled yesterday.

title: Seismometer Awaiting Booster Crash
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 2  Early Thursday the upper stage of the Apollo 14 booster, weighing more than 15 tons, will crash into the moon at a speed of 5,683 miles an hour with an impact equivalent to the explosion of 11 tons of TNT.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Sometimes numbers might help. Spartak Beglov, defending the Soviet policy concerning Jewish emigration, writes, There are some Jews  who wish to go to Israel. The Soviet authorities consider such applications according to the usual norms. Thousands of Jews have, indeed, gone to Israel. [OpEd Jan. 22.] The number of such applications received, granted and rejected could indeed make it much easier to judge the issue. If it is argued that Sews and nonJews are treated alike, comparable figures for nonJews might be in order.

title: Debs Myers Political Press Aide, Dies
description: Debs Myers, a puckish former newspaperman who became an adviser to nationally prominent political figures, died of hepatitis yesterday in YaleNew Haven Hospital, New Haven. He was 59 years old and lived in Bethel, Conn.

title: Visiting a Prisoner: It's Punishment for Family, Too
description: The quotes in the following story are front not one but from many women, the wives of men in prison who serve their time on the outside. There is no Mrs. Helen Jackson; there are thousands of Mrs. Helen Jacksons. While the account is true, the character of Mrs. Jackson is a composite of wivesvisitors to many prisons of which Auburn is but one. Information has been gathered from a number of sources, including the Fortune Society, a group of former inmates dedicated to helping their fellows build a new future; Mrs. Sylvia N. Rachlin, director, Special Social Services, a nonprofit agency that works with the families of inmates; Russell G. Oswald, Correctional Services Commissioner; Superintendent Harry Fritz, Auburn Correctional Facility, Auburn, N. Y.

title: Seale Jury Now Totals 9; 991 Have Been Excused
description: NEW HAVEN, Feb. 2 (UPI) The number of persons called in an attempt to get a jury for the murderconspiracy trial of Bobby G. Seale and Ericka Huggins reached 1,000 today.

title: $57Million Charge For Writeoffs Set At Signal Concerns
description: The Signal Companies, Inc., plans writeoffs and writedowns approximating $57million against 1970 operations, which will result in a sizable loss for the year, the board of directors said in a letter to stockholders yesterday.

title: Yugoslav Reporter Loses Accreditation in Prague
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Feb. 2Czechoslovalt officials withdrew today the accreditation, of the Yugoslav press agency's correspondent in Prague, charging him with nonobjective reporting and protesting that his articles had been used in the Western press.

title: PLUMADORE DANCE CREATES TABLEAUS
description: Paul Plumadore's innate sense of ritual and feel for the theater results in his producing dance ceremonies of mysterious and glamorous interest. Circa (a journey) is his most recent work and was danced for the first time by his company Monday evening at the Cubiculo.

title: Egypt: A Kremlin Balance Wheel?
description: JERUSALEMEgypt is the most successful example of Soviet pragmatism, as witness the broad Russian attempt to establish footholds in a number of countries with the exploitation of success to the full when, as in Egypt, the breakthrough occurs.

title: Alcindor Scores 38 But Bucks Succumb To Blazers,123111
description: PORTLAND, Oreg., Feb. 2 (AP)The Portland Trail Blazers, after taking a 17point lead, was forced to rally in the last four minutes tonight to upset the Milwaukee Bucks, 123111, in a National Basketball Association game despite a 38point performance by the Bucks Lew Alcindor.

title: Article 11  No Title
description: Article 11  No Title

title: Blacks May Sue Networks
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (UPI) Three of the four major national networks have turned down a request by black Congressmen for equal time to answer President Nixon's State of the Union address, Representative William Clay, Democrat of Missouri, said today. He said that if the American Broadcasting Company, which has not responded, also rejects the request, the Congressmen might file a lawsuit against the networks.

title: Tires on Moon Cart Will inflate in Space
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 2 (UPI)The tires on the cart that the Apollo 14 crew will put on the moon were flat when they left earth. They depend on the vacuum of space to automatically inflate them.

title: Pistons Topple Bullets
description: DETROIT. Feb. 2 (UPI) Dave Bing and Otto Moore got 12 of their team's last 16 points after the score was tied 15 times and the lead had changed hands on 16 occasions as the Detroit Pistons beat the Baltimore Bullets tonight, 116113.

title: DETECTIVE JOINED PANTHERS IN 1968
description: A police undercover agent who infiltrated the Black Panther party and supplied evidence used to indict 13 members for an alleged bombing conspiracy testified yesterday that he was a member of the party before any of the defendants were.

title: Apollo 14's Crew Relaxes As Craft Coasts for Moon
description: HOUSTON, Wednesday, Feb. 3The Apollo 14 astronauts coasted closer to the moon today, quietly relaxing aboard a spacecraft pronounced sound for the nation's third manned lunar landing early Friday. Their aim was only a few miles off target. But that could be corrected, if necessary, with another firing of the spacecraft's main rocket.

title: SHIFT OF PRIMARY SCORED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Feb. 2A group of Democratic legislators and spokesmen for the State League of Women Voters and the Citizens Union opened an attack today on plans by Republican legislative leaders to put off the scheduled June primary election until September.

title: C.Y.O.'s Mara Award Goes to Rozelle Tonight
description: The John V. Mara Memorial Sportsman of the Year. Award will be presented tonight to Pete Pozelle, commissioner of the National Football League, at the New York Catholic Youth Organization's 35th annual dinner at the WaldorfAstoria.

title: And Now Laos
description: A drive of South Vietnamese troops into the southern panhandle of Laos would, if it should occur, have profound implications for the future of the Southeast.Asian conflict, none of them encouraging for the prospect American disengagement from the area.

title: CHRYSLER SETTLES AFTER 3HOUR STRIKE
description: DETROIT, Feb. 2The Chrysler Corporation and the United Automobile Workers reached tentative settlement for 10,000 salaried workers today after one of the shortest strikes in the union's history.

title: About Motor Sports
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 2  He was unshaven and his clothes were untidy, but he had had a few hours of sleep and he was contentedly sipping a Bloody Mary on the rocks in the Gulf Trailer behind the pits. It was 10:30 A.M. Sunday and his No. 2 car, driven by Pedro Rodriguez and Jackie Oliver, was cruising, just paddling along, as he put it, with at least a thousand r.p.m. in hand. John Wyer, the 61yearold director of the GulfPorsche racing team, was understandably complacent: The last time he had looked at the charts, his Porsche 917K was at least 56 laps ahead of the secondplace Ferrari, and there were only 4 hours left to go in the TwentyFour Hours of Daytona.

title: ExAssemblyman Faces Test of a Political Decision
description: A special election next Tuesday in Brooklyn will show whether William J. Giordano made the right decision in resigning an Assembly seat, to which he was elected three times to run for, the State Senate seat left vacant by the death of William J. Ferrall.

title: Theater: A Gun Play
description: HARTFORD  The first thing to be said about A Gun Play, which is having its world premiere engagement at the Hartford Stage Company, is that its author, Yale M. Udoff, is a discovery. On the strength of this, his first professionally produced play, it is clear that he has a comic vision, verbal facility, and a contemporary consciousness. I suspect that even more will come later.

title: Books of The Times
description: DEALING or The BerkeleytoBoston FortyBrick LostBag Blues. By Michael Douglas. 222 pages. Knopf. $5.95.

title: Bridg: Bidding Messages May Help Rivals More Than Partner
description: Giving information at the bridge table is a mixed blessing, in the bidding and the play. Messages you transmit may help the opposition as much as or even more than they help your partner.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE ON LONDON BOARD
description: The London stock market closed narrowly mixed but firmer yesterday.

title: Man in the News
description: ATLANTA. Feb. 2Nearly 40 years ago an infant wandered away from his nurseMaid and fell, into the fish pond outside the Governor's mansion a few blocks from lilt home here. The story goes that the Governor himself rushed outside and plucked the squalling toddler from the water. The child's name was David Henry Gambrell. The Governor was Richard E. Rim sell. Today fate again involved the two men. Mr. Gamhrell took the oath of office in. Washington to fill the vacancy in the United. States Senate created by Mr. Russell's death last mouth.

title: Armand G. Erpf, Senior Partner Of Loeb, Rhoades, Is Dead at 73,
