description: Armand G. Erpf, a senior partner in the investment house of Loeb,. Rhoades & Co., a patron of the arts and the financial architect of the current New York magazine, died yesterday of a heart attack while working in his office at 42 Wall Street. He was 73 years old.

title: BOYCOTTINGPARENTS TO WEIGH MEDIATION
description: Parents of Intermediate School 142 in South Jamaica, Queens, where a boycott has been under way since November, agreed yesterday to consider inviting mediators to settle their dispute with the local school board. The agreement came after a meeting with Dr. Harvey B. Scribner. Chancellor of the city's schools.

title: NATO B Satellite Launched
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Feb. 2 (UPI)The Air Force launched a second communications satellite tonight to provide nations of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization with an instant link to deal with crises.

title: ALGERIA WINS SUIT AGAINST SWISS BANK
description: GENEVA, Feb. 2  The Algerian Government has been awarded $9.1million in damages from a Geneva bank it had accused of helping to conceal funds collected to help finance Algeria's war of independence against France from 1954 to 1962.

title: NIXON PICKS CASEY TO HEAD THE S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 William J. Casey, a prominent New York tax lawyer, was selected by President Nixon today to be the chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: MASTERS MUSIC IN CHURCH SERIES
description: New Yorkers have access to a great deal of fine music in local churches, but one series of concerts has turned up this season that is distinctive. This is the one sponsored by the Central Presbyterian Church at Park Avenue and 64th Street. It is being given in memory of Hugh Giles, who was the church's choirmaster and organist for 28 years until his death in 1963. It uses only professional musicians in programs that cannot be faulted for their content. Admission is charged  unusual for a churchbut the ticket price is a modest $3.

title: WINDSWEPT CITY BESET BY BLAZES
description: Fires flared in unusual numbers throughout the city yesterday as the cold spell continued and strong winds helped to whip the flames.

title: CREDIT MARKETS AWAIT A BIG SALE
description: The credit markets settled down yesterday to wait for the American Telephone & Telegraph Company's $500million debenture sale next Tuesday.

title: Hanoi Party Heads Pressing for Gains In Economic Area
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Feb. 2 (Agence FrancePresse)The Central Committee of the governing Workers party has called on the nation's armed forces and people to make new efforts for ultimate victory and the progress of socialism in North Vietnam.

title: TV Review
description: George Plimpton is a reasonably engaging exhibitionist with a Social Register accent so there is little likelihood that he will stop making a trade of working out at other people's professions.

title: Ken O'Donnell's Brother Shot Preventing a Holdup
description: Ken O'Donnell's Brother Shot Preventing a Holdup

title: Major Postal Rate Rises
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Following is a table showing the Postal Service's principal suggested changes in rates and fees. The first step rates, which would be established in the first 12 months after the Postal Rate Commission and the governors of the Postal Service agreed to the changes, are not included in the table. Temporary rates would into effect about May 15 if commission has taken no action on proposed change.

title: DR. ANTHONY A. LAMY
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Feb. 2Dr. Anthony A. Lamy of 560 Newark Avenue, formerly a physician here for 50 years, died last night at the John E. Runnells Hospital in Berkeley Heights after a long illness. His age was 86. He retired in 1961.

title: EARNINGS DOWN IN 4TH QUARTER
description: Profits in manufacturing sagged during the final three months of 1970, the First National City Bank reported yesterday. But, leaving aside the impact of the strike at General Motors, the decline was not so great as earlier in the year.

title: Prison Guards End Strike
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Feb. 2 (UPI)  Ohio Penitentiary guards returned to work today and the warden, Harold Cardwell, reported normal operations at the 136yearold prison after an eightday strike for a wage increase:

title: Article 7  No Title
description: Article 7  No Title

title: Transcript of Connally Statement to Senators and Excerpts From the Questioning
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Following is a transcript of a statement by former Gov. John B. Connally Jr. at a confirmation hearing today before the Senate Finance Committee on his nomination for Secretary of the Treasury and excerpts from the questions and answers:.

title: Paris Concerned Over Laos
description: PARIS, Feb. 2, (Reuters)President Pompidou today expressed increasing concern over expansion of the Indochina conflict. He reaffirmed at a Cabinet meeting France's particular interest in Laotian independence and neutrality, amid reports of a South Vietnamese incursion into Laos.

title: Are the Lights Turned Off?
description: The electric power difficulties suffered yesterday New York City and environs were both predictable and inevitable. For several days the combination of extremely cold weather and lack of reserve generating capacityresulting from the long shutdowns of Big Allis and Indian Point No. 1 generatorshad repeatedly forced voltage reductions and appeals for cuts in electricity use.

title: OCEAN HILL FUND NEARINCITS END
description: ALBANY, Feb. 2Assemblyman Samuel D. Wright said today that state funds to run a special $2.6million education program in the Ocean HillBrownsville section of Brooklyn had virtually run out and that more than 800 people who worked in it would lose their jobs if the program was terminated.

title: More Aid Asked for Puerto Rican Students Here
description: An organization of Puerto Rican students has begun a campaign to win increased financial and academic assistance for Puerto Ricans attending three colleges here.

title: Three Killed in Plane Crash
description: SPALDING, Neb., Feb. 2 (UPI)  Two students and teacher were killed today in the crash of a light plane near here

title: CARLOS LAZO
description: Carlos Lazo, a former partner in the law firm of Tibbets, Lewis, Lazo & Rand, died Monday after a long illness. He was 73 years old and lived at 755 Park Avenue.

title: City Is Purchasing Five S.I. Landmarks From Snug Harbor
description: Part of the Sailors Snug Harbor complex on Staten Island, described as the greatest group of Greek revival buildings in the country, will be bought by the city.

title: Britain. Warns Common Market Against a  Painful Initiation
description: BRUSSELS, Feb. 12  Britain's chief Common Market negotiator served notice today that his Government would break off the membership talks if the six market countries insisted on demanding the painful initiation of a new entrant to a secret society.

title: 3 Youths Killed and 41 Injured In Manila in Clashes With Police
description: MANILA, Feb. 2 Disturbances flared today in five seceons of the greater Manila area as students barricaded roads in support of a transport strike and fought the police with homemade bombs. Three youths were killed and 41 wounded.

title: SOUTH AFRICA SEEKS TIGHTER FILM CURBS
description: CAPETOWN, Feb. 2, (Reuters)The Government introduced a bill today that would tighten already rigid censorship laws.

title: MERCURY SUSPECTED AS PREGNANCY PERIL
description: ALBANY, Feb. 2Pregnant women should not eat tuna or swordfish because of the possible harmful effects on unborn children, according to the State Health Commissioner.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Article 5  No Title

title: Issel Scores 40 Points
description: DALLAS, Feb. 2 (UPI)  Dan Issel the leading candidate for rookieoftheyear honors in the American Basketball Association, scored 40 points in pacing the Kentucky Colonels for 122116 victory tonight over the Texas Chaparrals.

title: Sayers of Bears to Undergo Knee Surgery on Feb. 16
description: CHICAGO. Feb. 2 (AP)Gale Sayers of the Chicago Bears will undergo additional surgery on his left knee on Feb. 16, it was announced today by Dr. Theodore Fox, the Bears physician.

title: Meeting on Berlin Canceled by West In Traffic Protest
description: BERLIN, Feb. 2  Annoyed over East German harassment of Berlin traffic last week, the political counselors of the three Western allies called off a meeting scheduled for today with a Soviet representative.

title: Fumes Overcome 31 in Pool
description: SHEPHERD, Mich., Feb. 2 (UPI)  Thirtyone seventhgrade boys swimming in a community pool were overcome today by carbon monoxide fumes leaking from an adjoining boiler room. 28 boys were taken to Community V Hospital in Mount Pleasant three others were hospitalized at Gratiot Community Hospital.

title: Incursion Issue Splits Laotian Leaders
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 2Reports here of a possible incursion by South Vietnamese troops against the Ho Chi Minh Trail in southern Laosso far tmconfirmedhave revived differences within the nation's leadeiship over the conduct of the war in Laos.

title: Cavaliers Trim Braves
description: ROCHESTER, Feb. 2 (UPI)The Cleveland Cavaliers beat the Buffalo Braves, 10191, tonight for their sixth consecutive victory over their fellow expansionists.

title: New Lobby Fights Special Interests
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2The new public interest lobby called Common Cause comes up for its first real test of political impact tomorrow when House Democrats vote to retain or dismiss a senior committee chairman.

title: Amin Appoints Council
description: KAMPALA, Feb. 2General Amin today appointed a Counoil of Ministers made up almost entirely of civilians, half of them civil servants from the old Government.

title: Talks on a Sanitation Pact Scheduled to Resume Today
description: Negotiations on major contract issues between the city and the Uniformed Sanitationmen's Association are scheduled to resume today.

title: Times of Highlights of the Apollo 14 Moon Mission
description: Following are highlights of the Apollo 14 flight plan. The timetable is subject to change at any time during the mission. Times are Eastern standard.

title: Woolf Jockey Award Is Won by Lambert
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Feb. 2 (UPI)  Jerry Lambert, who achieved his greatest fame riding Native Diver, was named the winner today of the 1971 George Woolf Memorial Jockey Award as the rider whose career reflected the greatest credit to himself and his profession.

title: UGANDAN LEADER OUSTSPARLIAENT
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Feb. 2 (Reuters)Maj. Gen. Idi Amin today dissolved Uganda's Parliament and personally assumed all executive and legislative powers.

title: French Cellist, in Protest, Refuses Concerts in Soviet
description: GENEVA, Feb. 2  Pierre Fournier, the French cellist, said today that he had refused an offer to play in the Soviet Union on the ground that the Kremlin conducted an antiJewish policy.

title: SPRINT CAPTURED BY NORTHFIELDS
description: MIAMI, Fla, Feb. 2 (AP)John M. Olin's Northfields, the oddson favorite, held on to win the feature race at Hialeah today as Mr. Gemini and Colonel Abe closed with a rush.

title: Hobart Goes on Trial Over Campus Disorders
description: CANANDAIGUA, N.Y., Feb. 2Hobart College went on trial here today in what is believed to be the first time that a college has been taken to court on criminal charges in connection with a campus disorder.

title: Vietnam Fighting Increases
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 2 (AP)Allied commanders reported a series of small ground clashes and a surge in enemy rocket and mortar attacks today. They said that as a result, battle action in South Vietnam was at its highest point in about 10 months.

title: PACERS AND ROCKETS MAKE 4MAN TRADE
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Feb. 2 (UPI) The Indiana Pacers and the Denver Rockets of the American Basketball Association made a fourplayer trade today.

title: PROBLEMS DELAY SESSION IN POLAND
description: WARSAW, Feb. 2The new Polish leadership of Edward Gierek appears to be experiencing difficulties preparing for the next meeting of the Communist party's policymaking Central Committee.

title: MRS. GEORGES KLEEFELD
description: Mrs. Cecile Kleefeld, the wife of Dr. Georges Kleefeld an ophthalmologist, died on Monday at her home. She 71 years old and lived at 115 Central Park West.

title: Madrid and the Vatican Are Deadlocked Over a New Concordat
description: MADRID, Feb. 2The effort to work out a new concordat defining the status of the Roman Catholic Church In Spain remains deadlocked between the Spanish Government and the Vatican, two and a half years after Pope Paul asked Generalissimo Francisco Franco to give up his role in the naming of bishops.

title: Groundhog Forecasts Cold
description: PUNXSUTAWNEY, Pa., Feb. 2 (AP)Punxsutawney Phil, the groudhog, gave his Groundhog Day forecast today  six more weeks of cold weather. The animal reportedly saw his shadow and, frightened, returned to his burrow. That return, supposedly to hibernation, is interpreted to mean more winter is on the way.

title: Japanese Report Invasion On
description: TOKYO, Feb. 2  The oftrumored invasion of Laos by South Vietnamese troops has begun, the Kyodo news agency reported today in a dispatch from its Saigon correspondent. Though all major Japanese newspapers here have correspondents in Saion, none of them matched the Kyodo report. In the absence of any confirmation, sources here tended to evaluate the report with caution.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2There is an old rule of politics that you should never give your opponent a clear and easy target to shoot at, but President Nixon seems to be hoisting a new one every other day.

title: Power Cuts Extend to Subway Heating
description: New York City squirmed through another electric power crisis yesterday by turning off heat in the subways for six hours, putting the telephone system on its own generators and making unusual arrangements for outside supplies. Voltage was ordered cut statewide to help out.

title: Slumping Rangers Hope to Turn Around Against Black Hawks Here Tonight
description: Arnie Brown and Mike Robitaille said goodby to the Rangers and playoff money yesterday in a tense scene at the club's workout.

title: POLICE EXPANDING WARRANT SQUADS
description: The Police Department announced yesterday the consolidation and expansion of its warrant squads to halt the practice that has long permitted hundreds of defendants each week to escape prosecution.

title: Diluted Kidnapping Convention Is Adopted by the O.A.S., 13 to 1
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2The conference of hemisphere foreign ministers today approved a diluted interAmerican convention against kidnappings of diplomats by terrorists, but six delegations boycotted the final vote.

title: $250,000 Given for Library
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., Feb. 2The Andrew W. Mellon Foundation of New York City has awarded a $250,000 library expansion grant to Connecticut College, it was announced today. The college is seeking to raise $3million to expand its library facilities.

title: 76ERS TURN BACK CELTICS BY 108106
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 2 (UPI)  Bill Cunningham scored 31 points and Hal Greer made four clutch free throws in the final 35 seconds as the Philadelphia 76ers withstood a Boston rally and gained a 108.105 victory in a National Basketball Association game tonight.

title: U.S. JURY INDICTS MINE UNION AIDE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2An official of the United Mine Workers of America in the mountain coal fields of southwestern Virginia was indicted here today on eight counts of embezzling union funds.

title: 2 City Firemen Honored for Role In Capture of Murder Suspects
description: Mayor Lindsay used a commendation ceremony for two firemen who helped capture two murder suspects as the occasion yesterday to urge policemen and firemen to live in the city.

title: Monday Night Fights
description: Tampa, Fla.Joe Roman, Tam pa, outpointed Jose Rondon, Venezuela, 10 rounds, heavyweights.

title: Seaver ($90,000) and Koosman ($55,000) Sign Mets Contracts
description: The New York Mets took a doubleheader of sorts yesterday when they signed Tom Seaver and Jerry Koosman, the best and most expensive young pitchers in the nineyear history of the franchise.

title: Bulls Defeat Sonics
description: CHICAGO. Feb. 2 (UPI)Chet Walker scored 29 points and Bob Love 27 tonight to lead the Chicago Bulls to a 118101 victory over the Seattle Supersonics in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Advertising:
description: The International Playtex Corporation and Young & Rubicam yesterday mutually announced the termination of a 10year relationship.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: GARAGE STRIKE ON; $40 RAISE SPURNED
description: Union garage workers voted last night to reject a proposed contract settlement and to go on strike this morning against 650 parking garages in Manhattan and the Bronx.

title: Tenneco Quarter Profit at Peak
description: Tenneco, Inc., achieved record fourthquarter earnings with a 25 per cent increase but net for all of 1970 was down 4.2 per cent, according to the report yesterday of the company engaged in natural gas pipeline business, oil, chemical packaging, machinery, shipbuilding and other activities.

title: Rizzo Resigns to Run for Mayor of Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 2Frank L. Rizzo, Philadelphia's police commissioner, resigned today to run for mayor.

title: School Board 2 Here Accused Of Meddling in Parents Group
description: In genteel but emphatic terms, a parade of parents accused Manhattan Community School Board No. 2 last night of trying to meddle illegally in the affairs of Parent Associations.

title: Executive Changes
description: Johnson & Johnson announced yesterday that Richard B. Sellars, president of Johnson & Johnson Worldwide, has been elected chairman of the executive committee. He succeeds Gustav 0. Lienhard, who retired upon reaching age 65. Mr. Sellars was elected president of Johnson & Johnson Worldwide and of Johnson & Johnson International last year.

title: Truman Is Back Home; Found in Good Health
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Feb. 2 (Reuters)Former President Harry S. Truman was released today from Research Hospital, where he had been treated for en intestinal disorder, a hospital spokesman said.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Lucy Kavaler's Jan. 26 OpEd article suggests that the reproductive cells of men with outstanding gifts might be frozen  and thawed whenever a woman wished to mother child of genius.

title: Israel Approves Appeal
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 2Israel responded promptly today to Secretary General Thant's appeal for continued quiet along her ceasefire lines with Egypt and Jordan and pledged to observe the truce as long as the Arabs did pot shoot.

title: SPECIALISTS FUND IS TESTED BY AMEX
description: The American Stock Exchange announced yesterday that it had begun testing a new program to bolster the capital of specialists on the exchange's trading floor in times of market stress.

title: Capsule of Missing F1 11 Is Found With Two Dead
description: MANDEVILLE, La., Feb. 2 (AP)Two men digging drainage canal tonight found the ejection capsule from an Air Force F111 warplane missing more than three weeks. The bodies of two airmen were inside the capsule.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: Bejart Ballet Adds Week To Brooklyn Academy Stay
description: The Brooklyn Academy of Music has scheduled an additional week by Maurice Bejart's Ballet of the 20th Century, which will present the local premieres of Mr. Mart's Firebird, Four Last Songs and a suite of dances from Romeo and Juliet. Sunday night's program, which has been changed, will now include Firebird in place of Bhakti. Next week's schedule is as follows:

title: Economic Analysis
description: The great mystery of the Nixon Administration's budget for fiscal 1972 and of the Economic Report of the President is how the Council of Economic Advisers arrived at a gross national product forecast of. $1,065billion for 1971$15 to $20billion higher than that predicted by most private economists, including some who have been close to the Administra tion. At Monday's luncheon of the New York Association of Business Economists, during which Dr. Paul W. McCracken defended the Administration's boomy forecast, Alan Greenspan, president of Townsend  Greenspan & Co., who is an active consultant not only of President Nixon but also of his Council of Economic Advisers, declared that his own forecast remained $1,045billion for 1971.

title: DREAM EXPRESS YONKERS CHOICE
description: YONKERS, Feb. 2Most horsemen disagree, but many horse players insist that during cold weather, the road to riches may be paved by betting on geldings and mares.

title: Arthritis Fund Aide Named
description: The appointment of Daniel E. Button as the executive director of the Arthritis Foundation was announced yesterday. Mr. Button, 53 years old, served from 196,7 through 1970 as Representative from the 29th (AlbanySchenectady) Congressional District. Previously he had been executive editor of The Albany TimesUnion and assistant to the president of the State University of New York.

title: Clark Prefers McGovern Over Muskie for 72 Race
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Ramsey Clark said today that he would prefer Senator George S. McGovern of South Dakota over Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine as the Democratic Presidential nominee in 1972.

title: CANADIENS WIN, 52; BELIVEAU GETS PAIR
description: VANCOUVER, Feb. 2 (UPI)Jean Beliveau scored two goals and assisted on one tonight to bring his career scoring total to 497 goals and lead the Montreal Canadiens to a 52 National Hockey League victory over the Vancouver Canucks.

title: L.I.U. Beats Wagner
description: Walter Jones and Mooley Avishar poured in 24 points each to pace Long Island University to a 104.69 victory over Wagner at the winner's court in Brooklyn last night.

title: Laver Goes for 8th in Row In Tennis Series Tonight
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Feb. 2 (AP)Rod Laver, who is unbeaten and has earned $70,000 in the Tennis Champions Classic, goes after his eighth straight in the series tomorrow night when he meets Roger Taylor of England in a $10,000, winnertakeall match at the Forum.

title: Market Place: IncmeBearin Mutual Funds
description: Most people are presumably ready to get back into the stock market now that the pot is boiling again.

title: Israel: Is It a Democracy?
description: It is exceedingly disheartening to hear American politicians continuously praise Israel as a democracy. Ambassador Averell Harriman proposed recently a lend  lease program to Israel, asserting that Israel was a democracy in the Middle East and deserved American support.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It seems rather difficult to understand the logic of your Jan. 24 editorial Securing Middle East Borders. You are definitely right in stating that it is essential that a Middle East settlement be reinforced with effective international guarantees, but does not this right approach underwrite the Israeli attitude that the first and elementary necessity is to arrive at such a settlement, including secure and mutually recognized borders?

title: President Seeks Revision in Civil Service
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2President Nixon asked Congress today to give the Civil Service Commission wider authority to hire, discharge, promote and shift senior civil service employes who are now virtually locked into their present jobs.

title: Kashmir Hijackers Blow Up Indian Plane in Pakistan
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Feb. 2 Two Kashmiri youths who hijacked an Indian Airlines plane from Indian Kashmir on Saturday blew up the plane at Lahore airport today.

title: Texaco Seeks Oil in Africa
description: Texaco, Inc., announced yesterday it had obtained oilexploration rights to a 37millionacre region in the eastern part of Mauritania in noithwestem Africa.

title: CONNALLY BACKED BY SENATE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2The Senate Finance Committee apprdved today the nomination of John B. Connally Jr. to be Secretary of the Treasury after he testified that there was nothing illegal about the $450,000 in legal fees that he received while Governor of Texas.

title: Paperwork Jam Grows With Trading
description: Tumultuous trading volume on the New York Stock Exchange apparently has produced a sharp increase in the paperwork problems afflicting Wall Street, but has not yet severely strained its overall processing capacity.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Committee on Apartheid11 A.M.

title: FRED E. MASEK
description: CHATHAM, N. J., Feb. 2Fred E. Masek, a former department head at Bell Laboratories, Whippany, died yesterday at his home. He was 68 years old and lived at 34 Longwood Street in Chatham.

title: Lindsay Says Government Hampers Waste Recycling
description: Mayor Lindsay said yesterday that despite concern expressed by Washington over the country's growing garbage problem, Federal actions actually were making the problem worse.

title: Gasoline Reaches Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Feb. 2 (AP)  A convoy of 34 trucks, each loaded with 2,000 gallons of gasoline, drove into Pnompenh today from the port of Kompong Som, the first to reach the capital over Route 4 in more than two months.

title: Mrs. King Wins Finals In Singles and Doubles
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Feb. 2 (AP)Mrs. Billie Jean King won the singles final from Rosemary Casals, 16, 76, 6.4, then teamed with Miss Casals to take the doubles final in the fourth tennis tournament of the new women's professional tour last night.

title: BADILLO GAINS AID IN TRANSFER BID
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Representative Herman Badillo of New York, the first Puerto Rican to be a voting member of the House, appeared to have gained support today in his efforts to change his assignment from the Agriculture Committee to a committee dealing with urban problems.

title: PANTHERS IN ALGIERS HOLD LEARY IN HOME
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Feb. 2 (UPI)Eldridge Cleaver says the Black Panthers are so incensed at the madness of the psychedelic culture that they have placed one of its leaders, Dr. Timothy Leary, under protective custody at his home in Algiers.

title: BROTHER MARCELLUS
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Feb. 2Allan M. Knight, who as Brother Marcellus was professor of modern languages at Iona College, died today at New Rochelle Hospital.

title: C.I. Patton Slapped Is Dead
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind. Feb 2 (UPI)Funeral services will be held tomorrow for Charles H. Kill 55 years old, the man Gen. George S. Patton slapped in a Sicilian hospital during World War II. Mr. Kuhl, a South Bend factory worker, died Sunday of a heart ailment. He was an Army private hospitalized at Palmero when General Patton entered, accused him of being healthy and slapped him with a pair of gloves. General Patton lost his command of the United States Seventh Army as a result of the incident.

title: Shapp Asks an Income Tax for Pennsylvania
description: HARRISBURG, Feb. 2  Gov. Milton J. Shapp proposed today Pennsylvania's first state personal income tax, a 5 per cent levy retroactive to Jan. 1, to raise $1.5billion through the next fiscal year and avert bankruptcy.

title: Chinese Mixed Marriages Increasing
description: HONG KONGWhen Chi Cheng, Taiwan's 26yearold track star, announced in December that she was planning to be married to Vincent Reel, her American coach, she met with opposition from her Chinese parents. It was not so much the 30year age difference between Miss Chi and Mr. Reel that bothered them as the prospective bridegroom's race.

title: 3 HIGH DEMOCRATS IN CITY TOMORROW
description: One candidate for the Democratic nomination for President in 1972 and two potential candidates are scheduled to appear tomorrow at a dinner of the New York City Democratic Committee. County committees of the party give dinners from time to time, but this will be the first dinner of the city committee.

title: U.S. Warns Chile Her Plan to Take Over Copper Holdings Could Hurt Relations
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Feb. 2 United States diplomats have officially cautioned Chilean officials here that the Government's plan to nationalize American copper interests could seriously damage relations between the two countries.

title: SALINGER RESIGNING SOME GRAMCO POSTS
description: LONDON, Feb. 2  Pierre Salinger will resign as deputy chairman and a director of Gramco, U. K., Ltd., the London sales company for the U.S.I.F., a realestate fund whose sales and redemptions have been suspended since last fall.

title: Warriors 10199 Victors
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 2 (UPI)Jeff Mullins scored 11 of his 26 points in the final period, including the goahead basket with 18 seconds remaining, to give the asn Francisco Warriors a 10199 triumph over the Atlanta Hawks tonight.

title: Sony Displays New TV Camera
description: The Sony Corporation feels certain it has scored a major breakthrough with a new lowcost, singletube color television camera it has developed.

title: 2 TEENAGERS HELD IN A BANK ROBBERY
description: Two Queens boys aged 16 and 17 were held in bail of $100,000 each in Federal Court in Brooklyn yesterday on charges of armed bank robbery and the illegal purchase of highpowered rifles.

title: Book Publishers Feel Economy Pinch
description: Five years after book sales in America reached the $2billion mark and publishing became big business, the industry is facing a time of trouble and soulsearching even though more books are being bought than ever before.

title: MARQUETTE SINKS WISCONSIN, 8975
description: MADISON, Wis., Feb. 2 (UN) Marquette displayed a dazzling offense and a rugged defense to beat Wisconsin tonight, 8975.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I should like to amplify my remarks about the Albany Mall project as it appears in your Jan. 28 Quotation of the Day.

title: The Big Givers
description: In America today, one of the gravest threats to democracy is inequality of access to political power. Now that civil rights laws have begun to enfranchise the Southern Negro, every citizen is equal at the polling place on Election Day. But what about an ordinary person's ability to get his own name on the ballot? Or, if it is there, of getting his political message to the public? Or of registering his potential supporters in time?

title: Fair Lawn Strike Goes On
description: FAIR LAWN, N. J, Feb. 2 (UPI)Teachers here and in Union City stayed off their jobs again today, giving more than 16.000 schoolchildren a holiday.

title: POSTAL SERVICE REQUESTS 8C RATE FOR LETTER MAIL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2The United States Postal Service announced today proposed new rates that would substantially increase the cost of mailing letters, postcards, commercial mail, books and especially newspapers and magazines.

title: 7 IN FAMILY KILLED IN UPSTATE BLAZE
description: STOCKPORT, N. Y., Feb. 3Seven members of one family died in a fire late last night in this town north of the city of Hudson, on the Hudson River. Two others in the family survived the fire.

title: 13 Die in Netherlands Fire
description: ROLDE, the Netherlands, Wednesday, Feb. 3 (Reuters)At least 13 patients died when fire swept through three wards of a Roman Catholic home for the mentally retarded here early today.

title: $60,000 PRIZE SET IN WOMEN'S GOLF
description: MIAMI, Feb. 2 (AP)The women's liberation movement has sparked the corporate idea of putting on a record $60,000 golf tournament for women.

title: TEACHERS BEATEN IN NEWARK STRIKE
description: NEWARK, Feb. 2About 15 striking men and women teachers were beaten to the ground with clubs and fists in a swift attack today by a band of 25 Negro men.

title: Wolfe Novel Makes Play
description: The Web and the Rock, an adaptation by Dolores Hutton of Thomas Wolfe's novel, will be presented here next fall by Altamont Productions. The play will be tested on Feb. 24 at the Washington Theater Club.

title: Mills Sees 10% Pension Rise Instead of 6% Asked by Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 Wilbur D. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, predicted today that Congress would give 26.2 million Americans a 10 per cent increase in Social Security benefits, instead of the 6 per cent sought by President Nixon.

title: U.S. Officers Mentioned
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 1 (UPI)The Soviet Government newspaper Irvestia said today:

title: PATRIOTS RESHUFFLE STAFF, SHIFT ELIAS
description: BOSTON, Feb. 2 (AP)Bill Elias, the former Navy coach who has been on the Boston Patriots staff for two seasons, resigned as defensive coordinator to accept an administrative position with the team:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Jan. 16 OpEd article by J. C. Thomson Jr. proposes an open admission of American defeat in Vietnam followed by a precipitate withdrawal:

title: JAILING OF AN EDITOR UPHELD IN WISCONSIN
description: MADISON, Wis., Feb. 2The Wisconsin Supreme Court upheld today the jailing of Mark Knops, an underground newspaper editor, for refusing to answer questions in a grand jury inquiry into campus violence.

title: Clarkson Six Tops Cornell
description: POTSDAM, N. Y., Feb. 2 (AP)  A goal by All Maki with only 42 seconds left in overtime earned Clarkson a 21 hockey, victory over Cornell tonight.

title: Airlines Ask for Authority To Lift Fareson Their Own
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Leaders of the airline industry asked Congress today for virtually unregulated authority to raise their passenger fares, but got a distinctly cool hearing before the Senate Commerce Committee.

title: Morris H. Cook, 73, Headed Bell Laboratories Division
description: MURRAY HILL, N. J., Feb. 2  Morris H. Cook, a former vice president of Bell Laboratories, died yesterday at his home. He was 73 years old and lived at Essex Road.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your Jan. 22 editorial rightly stresses the connection between the extravagant claims of most LatinAmerican countries to exclusive jurisdiction over 200mile zones from their coasts, and the expanding claims of the technologically advanced countries to appropriation of the oceanbed resources.

title: Dance: Pearl Lang and Her Company
description: The Pearl Lang Dance Company, which made its first appearance of the City Center American Dance Season at the ANTA Theater last night, has been operating for nearly 20 years. Miss Lang is one of our most distinguished modern dancers. She was for a number of years a stalwart of the Martha Graham company, and her own company is strong, vigorous and gifted.

title: BANKAMERICA CORP. SETS NEW VENTURE
description: The BankAmerica Corporation announced yesterday the formation of a venture capital management partnership that will invest $18million in United States and Western European companies undergoing a very strong growth phase.

title: REV. PAUL L. M'KAY, HEAD OF MILLIKIN U.
description: DECATUR, III., Feb. 2The Rev. Dr. Paul L. McKay president of Millikin University here, died today in Decatur Memorial Hospital after a long illness. He was 53 years old.

title: Soviet Allows 8 Jews to Fly Here Alter Seeking Visa for 18 Years
description: A 62yearold Russian Jew who had been trying to leave the Soviet Union for 18 years arrived here with his wife and six children last night to make a new life in America.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Article 6  No Title

title: PRESIDENT TO ASK MEDICARE FEE RISE AND BENEFIT CM
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2The health care proposals that the Administration will send to Congress later this month will include both a cut in Medicare hospital benefits and a rise in payments by the 20 million Americans in the insurance program.

title: Kosygin Again Charges That U.S. Is Widening War in Indochina
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 2Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin said today that the latest developments in Indochina demonstrated that despite repeated statements about peaceful intentions, the United States still advances along the road of aggression.

title: Aussies Make Bid to Gain Cricket Draw With English
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Feb. 2 (Reuters)Australia's opening batsman, Keith Stackpole, put on a strong stand today in an effort to help his side save the sixth cricket test against England, which leads, 10, in the series with one match remaining. There have been three draws and one match was abandoned because of rain.

title: AMEX RISES A BIT AS VOLUME SLIPS
description: Prices were irregular yesterday on the American Stock Exchange in active trading. The market opened stronger, drifted downward but closed with a small rally. The exchange index closed at 24.53, up 0.02.

title: Queens on Top, 6863
description: Queens College defeated Massachusetts Institute of Technology last night, 6863. John Molinari, with 20 points, led the Knights. Harold Brown scored 25 for M.I.T., which held a 3832 margin at the half.

title: Muskie Introduces $25Billion Water Pollution Control Measure
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Senator Edmund S. Muskie introduced today a water pollution control bill that would authorize a fiveyear, $25billion program for sewage plant construction, with the Federal Government paying half the cost and the states and cities the other half.

title: NEW 70 ISSUES HIT HIGH OF $39BILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (AP) New corporate securities offered for cash sale nationwide reached a record $39billion last year, the Securities and Exchange Commission said today.

title: Reagan Seeks Relief Cuts To Balance Peak Budget
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Feb. 2A $700million reduction in welfare and health care expenditures was proposed today by Gov. Ronald Reagan to balance a record $6.7billion state budget.

title: News Analysis
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 2Recycling is becoming almost as popular as cycling. But it continues to be a far more frustrating exercise.

title: Japanese Ring Victor
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Feb. 2 (AP)  Japan's sixthranking bantamweight, Atsuyoshi Kanazawa, knocked out the former World Boxing Association flyweight champion, Berkrerk Chartvanchai of Thailand, in the fourth round of a scheduled 10rounder last night.

title: Vast Truck Movement
description: QUANGTRI, South Vietnam, Feb. 2 (Agence FrancePresse) Thousands of military trucks moved bumper to bumper today along the two highways leading toward Laos and North Vietnam. Along the sides of the roads troops with full field packs and arms were also moving in uninterrupted columns. Hundreds of helicopters passed overhead.

title: CONDORS DEFEAT NETS, 119 TO 111
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 2John Brisker, the American Basketball Association's No. 2 scorer, led the Pittsburgh Condors to a 119111 victory over the Nets in the second game of a doubleheader tonight.

title: December Mortgage Loans Set High for Thrift Units
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (UPI) The Federal Home Loan Bank Board said today the nation's insured savings and loan associations closed a record $2.4billion worth of mortgage loans in Decemberalmost 25 per cent more than the month before and 60 per, cent higher than one year earlier.

title: 3 Perish in Fire in Home
description: PINCH, W. Va., Feb. 2 (UPI) Three persons were killed today when fire destroyed two homes and severely damaged a third here. The victims were identified as John Lee Smith, 30 years old, and his two children, Audrey Lynn, 10, and Clay William, 8. The authorities said that Mr. Smith died when he ran into the burning home to rescue his children after leading his wife Frieda, to safety.

title: Stennis Favors 4Year Draft Extension, but Laird Asks 2 Years
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2Thel most intensive Congressionall review of the military draft since World War 11 began today with the chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee, John C. Stennis, expressing renewed skepticism that the Nixon Administration could meet its goal of ending draft calls by the middle of 1973.

title: Pact on Nazi Trials Signed
description: BONN, Feb. 2 (Reuters).France and West Germany today signed an agreement allowing West German courts to try Nazis who had been sentenced in absentia in France and never brought to trial. West Germany now must determine which cases it can investigate under the statute of limitations.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The world of sports has always been microcosm, a little world in itself. It faithfully reflected the outer world, of which it was a tiny part. When life was simple in the old days, the sporting life also was simple. But when it grew complicated, those complexities spilled over in tumbling fashion to engulf the entire sphere of athletics, professional and amateur, and that vast murky shadowland in between.

title: Gambling Operation Broken Up; 3d Raided in Nassau in 18 Days
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Feb. 2For the third time in 18 days the police today broke up a Nassau County gambling operation that they said did a, multimilliondollar business.

title: Article 3  No Title

title: ALAN THOMAS, 40, A BANK OFFICIAL
description: Alan C. Thomas, vice president and treasurer of the Union Dime Savings Bank of New York, died at Jamaica Hospital in Queens, on Monday after a brief illness. He was 40 years old and lived at 10 Catherine Street, Lynbrook, L. 1.

title: Sadat Meets Top Officials
description: CAIRO, Wednesday, Feb. 3With the ceasefire along the Suez Canal nearing its scheduled end, President Anwar elSadat conferred yesterday with the handful of top Egyptian officials forming the country's National Defense Council to decide whether to agree to another extension of the truce with Israel.

title: Villanova Routs Redmen, 9982, As Kraft Gains 200th Victory
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Feb. 2Jack Kraft's 200th victory as Villanova basketball coach was an impressive one tonight as his Wildcats trounced St. John's, 9982, in the Villanova Fieldhouse.

title: A Hint of Green Amid the Ice
description: Patrick J. Grimes was unanimously elected Grand Marshal of the 209th annual St. Patrick's Day parade last night. Criminal Court Judge James J. Comerford, the parade committee chairman, announced the election after about 114 presidents of organizations that march in the parade voted at the Commodore Hotel. Mr. Grimes, who lives in Yonkers, is publisher of The Irish Echo, a weekly IrishAmerican newspaper.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Several Senators, Democrats and Republicans alike (including John Sherman Cooper) emerge from a briefing on Cambodia by Secretary Rogers, almost awash with contrition for having suspected that our Air Force was violating the CooperChurch amendment. I wonder what sophistic legerdemain Secretary Rogers performed to persuade the Senators that closeground support already given to Cambodian troops was really interdiction of enemy supply routes.

title: Duquesne Light Co. Posts a Higher Net In Quarter and 70
description: The Duquesne Light Company reported yesterday gains in Operating revenues and net income for the fourth quarter and for 1970.

title: Ten Senators Back Seats in U.N. for Two Chinas
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 group of 10 influential Senators led by Jacob K. Javits, Republican of New York, introduced a resolution in the Senate today urging the United States to drop its opposition to Communist China's admissiorr to the United Nations.

title: Hunt for Jet in Lake Fails
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Feb. 2 (AP)A sixth day of searching Lake Champlain for a private jet with five men aboard ended unsuccessfully today.

title: Policemen Defend Right To Live Outside the City
description: Would you let your wife walk these streets at night?

title: MACKEY OF COLTS SLATED TO TESTIFY
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 2 (AP)John Mackey, tight end of the world champion Baltimore Colts, is expected to testify next Monday when a Federal grand jury resumes its investigation of National Football League operations, Federal sources said today.

title: Beverly Sills Sings at the White House
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 2Beverly Sills, soprano of the New York City Opera, made her debut at the White House this evening with what she called a mishmash of everything I'd ever dreamed of singing in my Walter Mitty fantasies about performing for the President.

title: Albano on State Senate Payroll to Save Pension
description: ALBANY, Feb. 2Vincent F. Albano Jr., Manhattan Republican leader and chairman of the board of a bank, is on the Senate payroll as a general clerk at a salary of $500 for the current session of the Legislature.

title: Nixon, at Prayer Breakfast, Bids Nation Seek Understanding Heart
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 (UPI) President Nixon said today that the nation should pray for an understanding heart.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 2Sew eral times American field commanders and rearechelon planners have unsuccessfully requested authority to mount ground thrust into Laos to cut the Ho Chi Minh Trail.

title: Nancy Reagan May Be ShyBut She Still Takes a Stand
description: When Mrs. Ronald Reagan gets mad, she holds long conversations with herself in the bathtub. Lately, these talks have probably included women's lib and hot pants and dirty movies.

title: Sonny May Buys Mortgages
description: The State of New York Mortgage Agency, the new enterprise known as Sonny May, an flounced yesterday that it had completed its first mortgage purchase program with $45mtllion pumped into the housing market since last fall. Of the 34 banks that participated, the largest sales to Sonny May were by the Williamsburgh Savings Bank, $3.13million; Dime Savings Bank of New York, $6.94million, and Hudson Valley Federal Savings and Loan Association, $6million.

title: Excerpts From Egypt's Note to jarring
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 2Following are excerpts from an Egyptian memorandum submitted yesterday to Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nations intermediary, and transmitted today to this month's President of the Security Council, Charles W. Yost of the United States by Dr. Mohammed H. elZayyat, the Egyptian representative, with the request that it be circulated as an official document:

title: Japan's Motor Exports Up
description: TOKYO, Feb. 2 (Reuters)Japan's vehicle exports in 1970 exceeded the million mark for the first time, the Japan Automobile Manufacturers Association announced today. The exports totaled 1.086,776including 725,586 cars, 351,611; trucks and 9,579 buses.

title: An Adventurous Pianist
description: Olegna Fuschi must have been a very tired young lady at the end of her concert in Tully Hall on Monday evening. With an orchestra conducted by Maurice Peress, she played four wildly unknown 19thcentury works for piano and orchestraall demanding, all difficult. The very fact that Miss Fuschi memorized them was something unique. If nothing else, she is probably the only pianist in the entire world who has in her repertory the Hummel A minor and Moszkowski E major Concertos, the SaintSans Africa Fantasy and Franck's Les Djinns.

title: Lakers Down Rockets
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Feb. 2 (UPI)Jerry West pumped in 28 points tonight as the Los Angeles Lakers breezed to a 133105 victory over the San Diego Rockets, who lost their 15th game in 16 starts. West made good on 10 of 12 shots from the floor in playing only 31 minutes.

title: MRS. ARNOLD LOEWY
description: WOODMERE, L. I., Feb. 2Mrs. Bertha Kauffmann Loewy of 403 Barnard Avenue, widow of Arnold Loewy, who founded the Loewy Advertising Agency, died today in St. Joseph's Hospital, Far Rockaway, after short illness. She was 85 years old.

title: New Tuna Is Called Safe
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 2 (UPI)The first three boatloads of tuna brought from Central American fishing grounds this year do not contain unsafe amounts of mercury, industry officials said today. The Federal Food and Drug Administration ordered the test on three boats that returned during the weekend.

title: New Lawyers in Old Firms
description: CAMBR1DGEThe subject of law students is one that should, and does, command a high degree of interest.

title: Merger News
description: TORONTO, Feb. 2  The Canadian Government confirmed today that it is trying to prevent an American oil company, Ashland Oil, Inc., from acquiring a controlling interest in the Home Oil Co., Ltd., of Calgary, Alberta, Canada's biggest Canadiancontrolled oil producer. J. J. Greene, the Minister of Energy, Mines and Resources, promised the House of Commons that the Government would do everything possible to block the takeover.

title: Thant Urges Extension of Mideast Truce
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 2  Secretary General Thant appealed to the United Arab Republic, Jordan and Israel today to continue their indirect peace talks under Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, his special representative, and to withhold fire and  exercise miliItary restraint.

title: Fire Kills 13 Dutch Boys
description: AMSTERDAM, Feb. 2 (AP)Fire driven by strong winds destroyed a dormitory at a hospital for the mentally retarded tonight, killing 13 young boys. Officials said the cause of the fire, at the Mariecamp institution, had not been determined.

title: 4 Jovial Britons Sing and Dance With High Spirit
description: Four jovial musicians and singers from Northumberland, the High Level Ranters, brought a delightful collection of highspirited dances and lusty songs to the Washington Square Church, 135 West Fourth Street, on Monday night.

title: Intruders Find Bellevue Is an Easy Target
description: Along the dozens of long and winding corridors that connect the 14 buildings of Bellevue Hospital Center, clusters of men gather daily near 4 telephone booths and elevators, lean notsocasually against pillars and walls, linger near doors and stairwells.

title: Stock Volume Hits 22.0.3Million High;
description: Trading volume on the New York Stock exchange soared to a record yesterday in a highly selective market.

title: Lady Oppenheimer, Widow Of Diamond Company Heads
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Feb. 2 (AP)Lady Oppenheimer widow of two South African mining magnates and aunt and stepmother of the present head of the family, died today in a nursing home. She was 71 years old.

title: Most of Governor's Taxes Expected to Win Approval
description: ALBANY, Feb. 2Although stunned by the size of Governor Rockefeller's record $1.1billion tax package, many Republican and Democratic legislators predicted today that most of the proposed tax increases would be approved eventually.

description: The police seized 12 demonstrators for the Southern Christian Leadership Conference yesterday in the lobby of 420 Lexington Avenue, where the Great Atlantic & Pacific Tea Company has its offices.

This is obviously part of the psychological warfare preceding possible offensives by both sides.

title: FINES ADVOCATED BY TENNIS PANEL
description: It's going to be costly for tennis players who do not mind their manners on the court.

title: WHEAT, SOYBEANS AND CORN IN GAINS
description: Prices of wheat, corn and soybean futures moved upward together yesterday.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Space. President Nixon sent a report to Congress calling for increased international cooperation in space exploration, joint space ventures and exchanges of scientific and technological knowledge. He said the United States was greatly encouraged by European interest in joining the United States in cooperative postApollo planning.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: Laotian Positions Overrun
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 3Striking during the night in northern Laos, North Vietnamese troops overran several Laotian positions on the northwestern fringes of the Plaine des Jarres and near the royal capital of Luang Prabang, the Defense Ministry here reported.

title: Westmoreland in Ethiopia
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Feb. 3 (AP)Gen. William C. Westmoreland, Chief of Staff of the United States Army and former commander of the American forces in South Vietnam, arrived here today. He will visit a number of army installations and also tour the communications base at Asmara. From here he will go to India, Thailand and Iran.

title: Hendricks for State Senate
description: A special election in Brooklyn's 22d State Senatorial District next Tuesday presents that area's voters with an opportunity to send an unusually enlightened and energetic representative to Albany. He is Nathaniel Hendricks, running on the Republican line with the active endorsement of several reformminded Democratic groups. His principal opponent is former Democratic Assemblyman William Giordano, a product of the regular Democratic organization who seldom participated in floor debate and made virtually no impact on state affairs during four years in the lower house of the Legislature.

title: Schaefer's 'Doctors' Wives':Dyan Cannon Portrays Unfaithful Spouse 4 Other Features Bow in Local Showings
description: "Doctors' Wives have everything. Except husbands." This is what it says on a placard outside the Loew's State 2, but it isn't exactly true. For example, inside the Loew's State 2 there is a new movie in which doctors' wives have everything including husbands. And one doctor's wife has all the doctors' wives' husbands, except possibly her own, and she has another doctor's wife as well.It is last, this super-doctor's wife (Dyan Cannon) whose infideity of the afternoon is the occasion, but not the cause, of her husband's (John Colicos) shooting her dead in bed and with the same bullet almost killing the doctor who happens to be with her. Immediately all the other doctor's wives (by luck, listening to the same news broadcast at the country club bar or wherever their desires have taken them) fall to wondering whose husband it might be now in emergency in the hospital where practice the doctors who pool their specialties and their wives.If this seems to you a reasonable way to begin a movie (as it surely does to me), then George Schaefer's "Doctors' Wives," which opened yesterday at the Loew's State 2 and the Loew's Cine, may promise pleasure enough for an afternoon escape or an evening away from the family. Actually, George Schaefer's contribution should not be ignored, for he builds some very creditable suspense in places, efficiently shepherds his cast through what can only have been for them sustained embarrassment, and manages almost too successfully to minimize the nonsense in a cinema the first principle of which is the shock cut between operating room and bedroom.With one of those community behavior-pattern plots that succeeds by grace of never having to follow any one disaster for too long, "Doctors' Wives" often forfeits logic completely. But what it lacks in, say, motivation, it more than makes up in open-heart surgery. And at the last, who will not thrill as John Colicos races against time to beat a murder rap while in the midst of a delicate brain operation to save the life of the little son of chief nurse Diana Sands, mistress of surgeon Richard Crenna, whose wife, Janice Rule, has just become hooked on morphine (which in her caseone in a hundredis an aphrodisiac) in order to alleviate her pesky migraines?More fun to think about than to sit through, "Doctors' Wives" is yet never as awful as it ought to be. Where it does go wrong it fails mainly in moral energyfor there is surely something missing in a world in which all do evil and yet everybody is a good guy except Dyan Cannon and John Colicos, who immediately get theirs.There is also something vaguely discomforting in the cast, in which the men are more memorable than the women. I would except Janice Rule and Marian McCargo, two very classy girls. Their coolness seems more in keeping with the director's sensibility than all the others' warmth or silliness or sexinessfor whom we can only, in the words of the advertising copy, forgive them their trespasses.

title: Plan Given to S.E.C. Cuts the Value of Securities Used in Computations
description: The New York Stock Exchange disclosed yesterday that it was moving forward with a broadbased effort to strengthen the capital requirements affecting its member firms.

title: SURGERY TERMED HEART ATTACK AID
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3Within about five years doctors may be able to treat some heart attacks promptly enough by surgery to prevent major damage to the heart muscle, an expert suggested today.

title: Guitarist Enters Plea
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., Feb. 3 (AP)Steve Stills, 25 years old, a rock guitarist, pleaded not guilty today to charges of possession of narcotics and dangerous drugs. He will go to trial April 20 in Superior Court.

title: PRISON CRITICIZED BYVANDEN HEUVEL
description: The housing of adolescent prisoners in the same upstate penal institution with adult males serving regular terms was criticized yesterday as a serious violation of the younger inmates rights.

title: Richard Hellmann Dies at 94; Founded Mayonnaise Company
description: RYE, N. Y., Feb. 3Richard Hellmann, founder of the mayonnaise company that has made his name familiar for more than half a century, died last night in a Greenwich, Conn nursing home after a short illness. He was 94 years old and lived here on Park Drive South.

title: As in the U. S., Cities in Sweden Feel Pinch as Services Expand
description: STOCKHOLM, Jan. 29 Swedish Municipalities face some of the same financial pressures as American ones as demands for more and better services conflict with the ability to raise the needed revenues.

title: Electric Rate Rise Sought For Orange and Rockland
description: Orange and Rockland Utilities, Inc., asked the State Public Service Commission yesterday to approve new electric service effective March 4 for their customers in those counties. Under the proposed schedules, monthly rates would rise $3.08 a month for residential consumers and $29.43 for industrial and commercial consumers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your otherwise excellent Jan. 23 editorial on Africa's Hidden Wars was flawed by a serious factual error.

title: BAR WILL STUDY PRACTICE BY AIDES
description: Acting on a request from Mayor Lindsay, the bar association here appointed a special committee yesterday to look into the propriety of city officials retaining private law practices while they are on the municipal payroll.

title: Major Stevedore Here Accused Of Association WithGenoveses
description: A Waterfront Commission lawyer charged yesterday that the owners of the Erb Strapping Company had welcomed infiltration by Vito Genovese nd his brother, Michael, and asked that the concern's stevedore license be revoked.

title: Mixed Gas Held Cause Of Slow Stove Lighting
description: Many persons in the metropolitan area have been experiencing delayed ignition of their gas heaters and stoves.

title: C. W. Post Tops Hofstra
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Feb. 3C. W. Post withstood a secondhalf rally by Hofstra to score a 7666 victory tonight.

title: East and West Germans Meet in Bonn 5th Time
description: BONN, Feb. 3The negotiations between East and West Germany were resumed here today with no outward signs that the tension had been relaxed.

title: MOSCOW ASSAILS U.S. ARMS STAND
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 3The Soviet Union today criticized the United States's negotiating position at the talks on limitation of strategic arms. It accused Washington of trying to gain unilateral advantage in offensive weapons by refusing to discuss curbs on American fighterbombers deployed near the Soviet Union.

title: United Drops 494 Pilots,
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 3 (AP)United Air Lines announced today the suspension of 394 pilots and 100 stewardesses in a measure to reduce a $40.9million deficit reported by the airline for 1970.

title: Union Bank Declines to Cut Interest on Time Deposits
description: Union Bank, Los Angeles said yesterday it would not follow the lead of its five larger California competitors in cutting the interest rates it pays on consumertype time deposits.

title: RULES AT HOBART ENTERED AT TRIAL
description: CANANDAIGUA, N. Y., Feb. 3  A copy of Hobart College's rules governing student conduct on campus was introduced as evidence in State Supreme Court here today as part of the prosecution's contention that the college was guilty of recklessness and should be convicted of criminal charges of coercion.

title: J.D.L. TOLD TO GIVE LETTERS TO U.S. JURY
description: Rabbi Meir Kahane and other officials of the Jewish Defense League were ordered yesterday to turn over the organization's correspondence to a Federal grand jury here tomorrow morning, but Rabbi Kahane said later he would refuse to comply.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Figure skating has been called, with more than a little condescension, the silent majority's ballet by people who maintain there is something beautiful, even noble, about men with sticks scrambling over ice after a small rubber disk. Dave DeBusschere, usually one of the most reasonable Knicks, tends to don a righteous mask when he discusses the Harlem Globetrotters, who, he feels, distort the basic truth and dignity of professional basketball. Football fans are tolerant enough to forgive Ernie Ladd and Wahoo McDaniel, among others, for becoming professional wrestlers, but can't understand how anyone could find pleasure in Chief Wahoo's epic battles with The Viking. And this week, several fairly sophisticated sports watchers who can justify 3Y2 boring hours at a baseball game with one sparkling, though unimportant, backhand stop on the thirdbase line were surprised to find themselves lifted out of their seats, as if by overhead magnets, in the closing moments of the Roller Derby.

title: Happy Thing in Art: Discount Store
description: The signs outside 924 Madison, between 73d and 74th Streets, say it is a discount store. Inside, there are stacks of tractor tires, bags of seed, a doughnut machine manned by a 10foot woman, a counter where bras and girdles are jumbled together for pawing over, and a thousand and one other wonders, plus salesmen and customers, all built of wood, cloth, or whathaveyou by a young American artist, Red Grooms, with his wife, Mimi Gross Grooms, and a hunch of other kids as assistants. It's the happiest thing that's happened to Madison Avenue in years.

title: Vampire Story With a New Angle Appears at the Penthouse
description: Despite a seeming affinity between titles, "The Vampire Lovers" is the only innovative dish in the double helping of horrors served up yesterday at the Penthouse Theater. The other course, a largely tasteless concoction called, "Cult of the Damned," is a diffuse variant on a generation gap theme that eventually leaves more gaps than is necessary. But "The Vampire Lovers," praise be, does manage to be a departure from a hackneyed, bloody norm. It also is professionally directed, opulently staged and sexy to boot.The Women's Lib movement notwithstanding, Roy Ward Baker, the director of the British-made "Vampire Lovers," and his writers, have had the diverting temerity to present their chief vampire as a photogenic temptress with distinct Lesbian drives. Perhaps this isn't a precedent, but it's certainly one of the first moves to modernize the ghoul business since the late Bela Lugosi began baring his outsized incisors for cinastes ages ago."The Vampire Lovers" is not a complete switch on the genre. The evil mixture is generally the same as before. This time, we're in early 19th-century Styria. Carmilla, the beauteous, last descendant of the undead Karnstein nobility, turns up to start making eyes and passes at Laura, heiress of the rich general. Naturally, Laura finally expires from this supercharged affection, even with a pining fianc around. Then, still bloodthirsty, there's a new campaign with Emma, daughter of another member of the landed gentry, and so it goes until the inevitable vampire expert shows up to drive that stake into the heart of our insatiable vampire.Ingrid Pitt is a vampire to delight any red-blooded Peeping Tom, despite her German-accented English. Sure, she also entices and destroys a couple of guys, but only because they're in her way en route to those gorgeous girls. Miss Pitt, specifically, is a luscious brunette, who is exposed in a nude scene and who prowls about the rest of the time in a diaphanous shift that leaves little to the imagination. And her willing victimsPippa Steele, Madeleine Smith and Kate O'Mara, as Miss Smith's governessare just as nobly endowed. Vampirism, which has become a silly business on screen, is, at least, easy on the eyes in this case.Little is easy on the eyes or ears in "Cult of the Damned." Holly Near, as the plump daughter of Jennifer Jones and millionaire Charles Aidman, has trouble respecting her parents. Matters aren't helped when she becomes involved with Jordan and his group. And they're further confused when Christopher entices mama and, in the end, is eying papa. It's disjointed fare, despite a plethora of anti-Establishment remarks, that leaves little impact even on a willing viewer.Miss Jones, properly harried, says, at one point;" You're all insane."It sounded logical at the moment.

title: Students and Strikers Clash With Manila Police Again
description: MANILA, Feb. 3Disorders continued in several sections of the Manila area today, the third day of the transport strike, as students and striking jeepney, or jeep bus, drivers barricaded roads and fought riot policemen with stones and fire bombs. Three persons were killed in clashes yesterday.

title: Nunn Backs FOrmer Aide For Governor of Kentucky
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Feb. 3 (UPI) Thomas D. Emberton, 38 years old, of Frankfort, a political newcomer, today announced his candidacy for the Republican nomination for Governor with the backing of Gov. Louie B. Nunn.

title: MATTEAWAN CASE IS DUE IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Feb. 3  The case of Mae Neustadt, a 72yearold woman who was freed after 40 years in Matteawan State Hospital for the Criminal Insane, is back before the State Legislature.

title: ANTIWAR MOVEMENT SETS APRIL RALLIES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3The antiwar movement proclaimed itself reunited today and announced that it would hold demonstrations in the spring to protest the expansion of American air action in Indochina.

title: California Is Rated Best in Wide Study Of SO Legislatures
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3The first comprehensive comparative study of the 50 state legislatures shows California and New York to have the best and Alabama and Wyoming the worst.

description: The seizure of 600 pounds of hashish and the arrest of four alleged members of a major drugsmuggling ring was announced yesterday by Edward R. Neaher, United States Attorney for the Eastern District of New York.
