title: LOC ED SEEKS U.S. ENGINE NOW
description: The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation, its once acclaimed transAtlantic industrial marriage with RollsRoyce suddenly torn asunder in London, said yesterday it would explore the ossibility of buying a United Statesbuilt engine for its Tristar jetliner.

title: NEW MOOD IN U.S. SEEN BY BUCKLEY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4Senator James L. Buckley, New York ConservativeRepublican, said tonight that a new mood in America could give conservatives a chance to reshape the politics of this country.

title: The Quest for Lunar Knowledge
description: As the Apollo 14 astronauts made their perilous lunar landing this morning, they probably had little time to reflect on the appropriate symbolism of their destination: the Fra Mauro hills. There once was a Fra Mauro. He was an Italian monk who earned immortality in 1457 by drawing the most accurate map of the world that had yet been seen. Now, half a millennium later, his name is fittingly attached to the target of twentiethcentury explorers whose purpose, like that of their ancient predecessor, is to add to human knowledge.

title: McGovern, Speaking at Dinner Here, Urges Presidential Primary in State
description: Senator George S. McGovern of South Dakota, here for dinner of the New York City Democratic Committee, said last night that he hoped the New York Legislature would approve a Presidential primary in the state in time for the 1972 campaign.

title: Impact of Booster on the Moon Fails to Locate Primitive Crust
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 4 (AP) Dr. Gary Latham of Columbia University reported today that the crash of Apollo 14's S4B booster early today near the seismograph erected by Apollo 12 astronauts produced seismic waves that penetrated only 25 miles into the moon in the Ocean of Storms.

title: FLYERS TRIUMPH OVER HAWKS, 62
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 4 (UPI)  The Philadelphia Flyers, without a victory in their last 16 games against Chicago, erupted for four goals in the second period and defeated the Black Hawks, 62, tonight to take over third place in the National Hockey League West Division. The Flyers posted their highest total ever against the Hawks.

title: Dining: Some of It Is Inspired Cooking
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored where indicated.

title: Rockets Hit Airport Camp
description: PNOMPENH, Friday, Feb. (Reuters)  Four Sovietmade 122mm. rockets were fired into a transport camp on the edge of Pnimpenh's international airport early today.

title: INSURERS RAISING STATE AUTO RATES
description: Automobile insurance rates will go up sharply throughout New York State in the next few months. Many car owners have already received bills for higher premiums.

title: The Screen: Film as a Political Act
description: At Fort Dix in the mid1950's, at the start of basic training, which was to include, among other miseries, the dullest and most intensive moviegoing of my life, we were shown an indoctrination film intended, I guess, to instill us with pride in America's past and to assure us that basic trainees were the hope for its future.

At the same time, he offered to allow immediate clearance of the warblocked Suez Canal if Israeli troops would begin a partial withdrawal from the eastern bank of the waterway.

description: MIAMI, Feb. 4 (UPI)A man who said he was carrying explosives hijacked a jetliner today carrying 27 persons and got out in Havana with a cheery Right on, baby.

description: Merck & Co., Inc., a leading ethical drug concern producing both bulk and packaged fine and medicinal chemicals, achieved record sales and earnings in the fourth quarter and for 1970, Henry W. Gadsden, president, reported yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The events of the last year left no doubt in the minds of virtually everyone in Greece that the Nixon Administration would eventually announce publicly the resumption of heavy arms shipments to the military regime that rules there. The reports that American diplomats were working behind the scenes to dissuade the nations of the Council of Europe from ousting Greece; the appointment of Henry J. Tasca as Ambassador; the gradual and probably deliberate leaking of his recommendation to resume heavy arms shipments; the constant linking of American foreign policy in Greece with the Middle East crisis, and, finally, the revelation that the Pentagon had been secretly providing heavy arms to the colonels  all this had prepared us for the September announcement.

title: Tristar Success Is Key to U.S. Plan for Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4The announcement by RollsRoyce, Ltd., that it cannot proceed with production of engines for the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation's new Tristar civil airliner could threaten to unravel the Nixon Administration's plan to rescue Lockheed from possible bankruptcy. This was the consensus of comment by Administration and aerospace industry officials today.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BELFAST, Feb. 4 (Reuters) Trouble flared in two Roman Catholic districts here tonight, only a few hours before British troop reinforcements were scheduled to arrive. Rioters in the New Lodge Road and in streets off the Crumlin Road hurled bricks and stones at British soldiers, who answered the bombardment with rubber bullets.

description: LONDON, Feb. 4 (AP)Some of the men who dress Britain's gentlemen were outraged today at what Prince Charles, heir to the British throne, did to them last night. Some, but not all.

title: WASHINGTON

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: We were astonished to read the front page report in The Times, Jan. 28, that the New York Board of Rabbis has gone on record in support of government aid to parochial schools. We the undersigned are members of the New York Board of Rabbis, two of us past presidents, and are fully cognizant of the procedures of the Board in arriving at decisions on public policy.

title: Kennedy Portraits Go On View at White House
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4Pensive and quite unconventional, although official, portraits of President John F. Kennedy and his widow, now Mrs. Aristotle Onassis, will finally go on show to the public tomorrow at the White House.

title: When Felony Had Style
description: I complain, Mayor Lindsay, not that crime in New York has increased but that its quality has deteriorated. And to that I offer the testimony of Thomas Byrnes, famous nineteenthcentury head of the New York cops, one of the first to publish photographs with dossiersof what must have been some of his favorite crooks and methods. Even routine burglars were craftsmen then, often ingeniously designing their own tools, which Inspector Byrnes shows us (almost proudly, I think). And one thing didn't work, something else was bound to.

title: Man In the News
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4The president pro tempore of the Senate is, by definition, the patriarch of the chamber, its leading man in seniority and, usually, in age. As a consequence, he is also likely to be the quintessential oldline Senator: wise, calm, politic and unshakably conservative. Allen Joseph Ellender of Louisiana is some of these things, but others of them he most certainly is not. At 80, he is the oldest of the Senate's senior citizens; last month he completed 34 years in the Senate, four more than the total of his nearest competitor.

title: YONKERS CLIMATE MAY AID GELDING
description: YONKERS, Feb. 4Harness horses are said to be able to withstand cold weather better than humans, even though some drivers are fortified with masks, gloves, heavy jackets, boots and thermal undergarments.

title: New Drives Into Cambodia
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 4 (UPI)  Military spokesman reported today that 11,000 South Vietnamese troops had pushed across the border into the Fishhook region of Cambodia to join about 7,500 other Cambodians clearing enemy sanctuaries.

title: PROCESS SERVER CONVICTED HERE
description: The president of the Association of Process Servers in New York was found guilty in Federal District Court yesterday of signing affidavits that he had served summonses that were never served.

title: Jay C. Flippen, Actor, Dies at 70; Was Entertainer for 50 Years
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 4Jay C. Flippen, the comedian and character actor whose career spanned more than a halfcentury, died early yesterday in Cedars of Lebanon Hospital at the age of 70.

title: Kimmel Incliana Driver, Hurt In Wreck at Daytona Track
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 4 (AP)  Bill Kimmel, a 42yearold driver from Clarksville, Ind., was badly hurt today in a spectacular wreck at Daytona International Speedway. Kimmel was on the first lap of a qualifying run for Sunday's 300mile race when he lost control of his 1971 Chevelle and overturned several times.

title: Daryl's Joy, $4.40, Wins By Half a Length on Coast
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Feb. 4 (UPI) New Zealandbred Daryl's Joy, making his first start since October, raced to a halfalength victory today in the $44,000 Arcadia Handicap at Santa Anita on the turf course.

description: All grain and soybean futures contracts traded on the Chicago Board of Trade dropped sharply in the early trading yesterday but a late rally trimmed some of the losses.

title: KNICKS AGAIN HIT JAM IN SCHEDULE
description: DETROIT, Feb. 4The Knicks arrived here tonight braced for another challenging stint of seven National Basketball Association games in the next nine days. The string begins tomorrow night against the Detroit Pistons at Cobo Arena.

title: Angina Is Called No Greater Risk After Heart Attack
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 4The outlook for the patient who develops angina pectoris after heart attack is no worse than that of the person whose angina develops without ny attack, a major Go ernment study has shown.

title: Peking Ministry Warns U.S. On Laos Border BuildUp
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 4Communist China, in a statement condemning the allied troop buildup along the VietnamLaos border, said today that she would absolutely not allow the United States to do whatever it pleases in Indochina.

title: New Pact Lets U.S. Use Australian Tracking Sites
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Feb. 4 (AP)  Australia and the United States space agency reached agreement today on a $101million. 10year contract for use of five Australian space tracking stations.

title: U.S. Sees Partial Triumph By TAD SZULC

title: STOCKS SLIP A BIT IN HEAVY TRADING Dow Industrials, Off 4.72 at 12:30, Rally to Close Day Down 1.44 at 874.79 VOLUME IS 20.86 MILLION Gains Outpace Declines by Slight Margin Airline Issues Are Lower

title: Defense Study Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 (UPI) A bill was introduced by a group of Democratic House members today to set up a 16member commission to tudy the nations defense, security and intelligence agencies.

title: Mackell Criticizes Police on Report In Narcotics Case
description: Queens District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell assailed the Police Department yesterday on the ground that it had released a confidential report that directly relates to two pending cases. He asserted that this violated freepress and fairtrial guidelines.

title: Dresser Officer Resigns
description: Dresser Industries, Inc., announced yesterday that Donald H. Hartmann had resigned as executive vice president and a director. He will become president of the Crutcher Resources Coroporaton of Houston.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 4  It was, as one man put it, just a dusty and rambling combat outpost drawn like a girdle around a 3,000foot airstrip. But its name, Khesanh, became in 1968 one of the darkest horrors of the Vietnam war.

title: Wider War in Laos?
description: The strategy of widening the war territorially in Southeast Asia in order to reduce the American involvement defies all logic. Yet the Administration, having chosen that route in Cambodia, has had to argue that that strategy is succeeding. In the process, it may have convinced itself that the war should be widened furtherinto Laos.

title: Imprisoned Greek General Will Be Moved to Hospital

title: New York Soccer Club Is Nicknamed Cosmos
description: Cosmos became the nickname yesterday for New York's entry in the North American Soccer League. The name was chosen from 3,000 entries filed in a contest conducted throughout the metropolitan area.

title: Percy Joins Kennedy Board

McPherson Jr., a lawyer here, have been elected vice chairman of the board of trustees of the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, it was reported yesterday. The two were elected at the board's annual meeting last month at the same time Roger L. Stevens was renamed chairman and Robert 0. Anderson was reelected a vice chairman.

title: New String Is Tied to Revenue Plan
