description: In a democracy, a dissident radical minority can make its presence forcibly felt by civil disobedience, violence, theat ricals, or a mixture of the three. They are all as Ameri can as apple pie and as old as the Boston Tea Party. With the development of mass media and the growing sophistication of the public through mass education, the atricals are now more and more important. Theatrical politics have become as sig nificant as political theater, although it is sometimes dif ficult to distinguish between them.

title: Architectural and Engineering Fees for Albany South Mall Put at $23.4Million
description: ALBANY, Feb. 7Architec tural and engineering fees for the South Mall state office building project will cost the state at least $24,332,350 a check of state records disclosed yesterday.

title: U.S. AGENCY FINDS HUGE ARMS WASTE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 7The General Accounting Office will publish a detailed report in dicating that the armed forces have dribbled away billions of dollars because of a chronic in ability to decide what weapons they want and when they want them.

title: Brooklyn Academy of Music Reawakens From Its Cultural Limbo
description: Not since those memorable baseball games between the Brooklyn Dodgers and the New York Giants have so many Manhattanites been venturing across the East River for an evening's enjoy ment.

title: 400 SUBWAY FARE FORECAST IN STUDY
description: The fare on the city's sub ways will rise to 40 cents by next January unless Federal, state or local sources provide substantial aid before then, the Citizens Budget Commis sion warned yesterday.

title: Paris: The Revolution as Inspiration
description: Arts Abroad

title: Florida Police Report Gains In Investigation of 2 Killings
description: DANIA, Fla., Feb. 7 (UPI) Detectives said today that they were making good progress in investigating the slayings of George W. Beck, a Revlon Corporation executive, and his wife, but added that no ar rests were imminent.

title: Laotian Says Key Base Is Periled by Desertions
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 7 (UPI)  Desertions and the absence of the commanding general from his headquar ters at Long Tieng have caused a serious deteriora tion in the defense of north eastern Laos, a Laotian Gov eminent official said today.

title: Credit Markets Awaiting Terms of A.T.&T.'s Issue
description: The bond market is swiftly approaching a moment of truth.

title: BLUES TOP FLYERS FOR BOWMAN, 62
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 7 (UPI) Fran Huck scored two goals today in helping the St. Louis Blues mark Scotty Bowman's return to coaching with a 62 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers.

title: Danny Kaye Injured, Out of Two by Two
description: Danny Kaye, who injured an ankle while performing as Noah in the first act of the musical Two By Two, last Friday night at the Imperial Theater, is out indefinitely. He has been replaced in the role by his standby, Harry Goz. Mr. Goz has been por traying Shem, one of Noah's sons, since the opening of the musical on Nov. 10.

title: U. S. Strategy on the Kremlin Debate
description: The critical period of decisionmak ing underway in the Kremlin in prep aration for the postponed Communist party Congress March 30, the first since 1966, has set off a parallel de bate in Washington. A reluctant White House is being urged by State Depart ment, C.I.A. and outside Soviet an alystsincluding some in the Soviet Embassyto send a new signal to the Moscow summit to influence decisions there on Russia's national priorities in the 1970s.

title: Students Here Press Klein on Laos
description: Herbert G. Klein, President Nixon's Director of Communi cations, came here yesterday to talk to journalism students about Presidential news con ferences but spent much of his time answering their angry questions about Laos. United Press International reported.

title: Shaw's Golf Stock on the Rise Despite Fluctuations
description: Tom Shaw, professional golf's newest star and its leading moneywinner on the 71 tour, has a wide grin, a long swing and a game that's often unpredictable. When he's good, he's very goodso good that he is the only golfer this year who has won two tournaments, earned $69, 752 in less than two months and beat his hero, Arnold Palmer, twice in downtothe wire finishes.

title: Cars Damaged in Athens
description: ATHENS, Feb. 8Three cars two owned by United States military personnelwere slight ly damaged last night by ex plosions in two residential sub urbs of Athens. A United States Embassy spokesman confirmed that two of the cars belonged to members of the Joint United States Military Aid Group to Greece.

title: The Theater: Istanboul
description: Rochelle Owens's play Is tanboul is set in 15thcen tury Constantinople, and, oddly enough, the fact that it is called Istanboul and not Constantinople gives a fairly decent measure of its stand ard of humor. Indeed, the title of this play, which opened last night at the Ac tors Playhouse, may well be its best joke.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Feb. 8, 1971 THE PRESIDENT

title: Apollo Flight Highlights As Journey Nears End
description: Following are highlights of the Apollo 14 flight plan. The timetable is subject to change at any time during the mis sion. Times are Eastern stand ard.

title: LastPlace Floridians Deal Condors a 10697 Setback
description: MIAMI BEACH, Feb. 8 (AP) The Floridians moved within a game of leaving the cellar of the American Basketball As sociation Eastern Division to night with a 10697 victory over the Pittsburgh Condors. Mack Calvin was high scorer for the Floridians with 29 points despite a 7for23 per fomance from the floor. George Thompson was high for Pittsburgh with 26.

title: POLICE CORRUPTION IS CALLED ISOLATED
description: City Investigation Commis sioner Robert K. Ruskin said last night that he had no evi dence of widespread corruption in the Police Department.

title: Marshall U., on Road Back, Names New Athletic Director
description: College Sports Notes

title: SONG RECITAL GIVEN BY EVE ROBINSON
description: For her Carnegie Recital Hall concert late Sunday afternoon, Eve Robinson chose an imag inative program of songs and interpreted them tastefully and, on the whole, communicatively. Her bright mezzosoprano has a pleasantly warm metallic luster with a touch of Slavic vibrato (no doubt due in part to her RussoHungarian parentage) just enough to give the timber an appealing individuality.

title: Judge and 2 Dairymen Indicted in Bankruptcy Case
description: A State Supreme Court jus tice and two dairymen were in dicted yesterday on charges of having fraudulently transferred nearly $250,000 in assets of two bankrupt Long Island dair ies to their own benefit in 1965 and 1966.

title: Loan to Northeast Approved
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8 (AP) The Civil Aeronautics Board ap proved today a loan by the Storer Broadcasting Company to Northeast Airlines of up to $1.5million in addition to $26 million in Storer loans previ ously authorized.

title: Executive Changes
description: The North American Rockwell Corporation an nounced yesterday in El Segundo, Calif., the major realignment of the company into four groups: aero space, automotive divisions, electronics and indus trial products. Under the reorganization, R. C. Wil son, president of commercial products, will be named corporate executive vice president for the industrial products group and the electronics group. For an interim period, he also will serve as acting president of the industrial products group. W. B. Bergen, who has headed the aerospace operations, will serve as president of the aerospace group. D. L. Williams, formerly president of the Autonetics Divi sion, will be president of the electronics group. The automotive divisions will report directly to R. An derson, president and chief operating officer of North American Rockwell.

title: Egyptian and Israeli Delegates Meet Separately With Jarring
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 8  Indirect ArabIsraeli peace talks continued here to day as the Egyptian and Israeli representatives conferred sep arately with Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nations intermediary.

title: STEINBERG TO LEAVE BOSTON SYMPHONY
description: William Steinberg has in formed the Boston Symphony Orchestra that he will not renew his contract as music director when it expires at the end of next season.

title: Heavy Enemy Fire Reported
description: KHESANH, Feb. 8 (UPI) We took so much fire I couldn't believe it, a helicop ter pilot who was shot down during today's South Viet namese incursion into Laos said on his return here. There were a lot of Communists all over the place.

title: PROF. MAX KROLIK
description: Max Krolik, an assistant professor of mathematics at St. John's University. Jamaica, Queens, died Sunday after a short illness at his home, 97 Perry Street. He was 42 years old.

title: BUCKS HAND SUS 11894 TROUNCING
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 8 (UPI) A 39point performancce by Lew Alcindor tonight led the Milwaukee Bucks to a 11894 triumph over the Phoenix Suns in a National Basketball Asso ciation game.

title: Bullets Release Tucker
description: BALTIMORE. Feb. 8 (AP)  The Baltimore Bullets of the Na tional Basketball Association placed Al Tucker on waivers to day, reducing their roster to 11 players. Tucker played in 31 games this season and had a 4.1point scoring average.

title: Most States Plan Tax Increases Despite Efforts to Slash Costs
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8Gov ernors and other state officials, declaring their treasuries bank 1:rupt and without new sources of revenue, are moving to levy additional taxes for covering the deficits.

title: Plan to Cut Enemy's Lines in Laos Long Rejected, Was. Revived 3 Months Ago
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 8The old plan for a ground attack on the Ho Chi Minh Trail network in Laos took on new life here at least three months ago in talks between South Vietnamese and American of ficials.

title: Condemnation in Paris
description: PARIS, Feb. 8The Commu nist delegations to the Vietnam peace conference here joined with the French Government today in condemning the incur sion into Laos by South Viet namese forces as an extension of the war. Both the North Vietnamese and the Vietcong, however, refrained from threats to boycott the talks.

title: Sunday Afternoon Racing
description: DOVER, Del., Feb 8 (AP) Sunday horse racing will begin in Delaware Feb. 21 at Dover Downs, the track announced to day.

title: China Charges Provocation
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 8Com munist China has described the Laos incursion as a grave prov ocation against the Chinese people as well as the people of Indochina and the whole world.

title: SIMON E. FLAHERTY
description: MOUNT KISCO, N. Y., Feb. 8  Simon E. Flaherty, a retired bond broker, died today in a Westchester nursing home. He was 78 years old and lived in the Ridgecrest Apartments here.

title: MEL HEIMER IS DEAD; A TV COLUMNIST, 55
description: Mel Heimer, television and New York columnist for King Features Syndicate, died last evening in St. Luke's Hospital after a long illness. He was 55 yearsold and lived at 58 Cedar Street, Yonkers.

title: STOCKS RETREAT ON LONDON BOARD
description: Prices closed generally lower on the London stock exchange yesterday. Business was re strained by the RollsRoyce fi nancial situation and by the approaching national change over to decimal currency that will shorten this week's trad ing by two days.

title: Geneva Accord Excerpts
description: Following are excerpts from the declaration signed at Geneva on July 23, 1962, by 13 nations including the United States, North Vietnam and South Vietnam:

title: Bettor Wins $25,257 for a $2 Wager in Record Exacta at New Orleans Track
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 8 (UPI)  The 11and1 combination paid $25,257, a North American record, today in the exacta betting at the Fair Grounds race track.

title: Rangers Oppose Bruins Minus Giacomin Tonight
description: BOSTON, Feb. 8The bump er sticker on the red Volks wagen reads, God Bless Orr Country.

title: Graham Elected Chairman Of Amex for a Third Term
description: Frank C. Graham Jr was re elected yesterday to a third oneyear term as chairman of the American Stock Exchange. He is a partner in Purcell, Gra ham & Co.

title: STALLWORTH DUE TO REJOIN KNICKS
description: Sobered after a lost week end in Detroit, New York and Philadelphia, the Knicks will attempt to regather their mis placed skills tonight against the Atlanta Hawks at Madison Square Garden.

title: ROBERT BUTLER, 87, FEDERAL ATTORNEY
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn. Feb. 8 Robert P. Butler, who served as United States Attor ney for Connecticut from 1934 to 1945, died yesterday at his home, 25 West Hill. Drive. He was 87 years old.

title: Is the AllMale U.S. Power Squadron Running Against Tide?
description: Mrs. Lisa Kasak got a letter the other day informing her about a forthcoming meeting of the Cross County Power Squadron in Westchester County.

title: Men's Wear Retailers Are Optimistic
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 8 We had a depressed year last year and we came in a few percentage points under 1969. So our problem in 1971 is how to increase our vol ume and keep pyramiding.

title: TWO BANKS PLAN HOLDING COMPANY
description: The formation of another new, $1billion bank holding company in upstate New York was proposed yesterday.

title: 21,812 AT GARDEN SEE MORALES PIN KOLOFF
description: Pedro Morales, of Culebra, Puerto Rico, defeated Ivan Ko loff of the Soviet Union last night in a heavyweight wres tling exhibition at Madison Square Garden.

title: Fairfield U. Students Occupy Campus Center
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Tues day, Feb. 9A group of stu dents protesting the Nixon Administration's policies in Laos took over the Campus Center at Fairfield University last night.

title: Venice Art Thieves Loot Peggy Guggenheim's Home
description: LONDON, Feb. 8 (AP).Peg gy Guggenheim, wealthy Amer ican art patron, said last night that a Picasso and nine other modern paintings worth thou sands of dollars had been stolen from her home in Ven ice. Italy.

title: Yugoslavs See Hope
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Feb. 8  Yugoslav diplomats, after an energetic round of consulta tions with Arab representatives, believe that the United Arab Republic is ready to take serious steps toward a nego tiated peace in the Middle East. They are also hopeful that President Tito, who is to visit Cairo next week can take with him some hint from Washing ton that Israel is also ready to soften her position.

title: VOTE DRIVE BEGUN BY COMMON CAUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8  John W. Gardner, chairman of the new public interest lobby called Common Cause, an nounced today that his organ ization had opened a cam paign to eliminate restrictions on voter registration and on voting itself.

title: WARRIORS THREATEN NOT TO PLAY SONICS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 8 (AP)  Franklin Mieuli, owner of the San Francisco Warriors, says he is seriously consider ing refusing to let his team play against the Seattle Super Sonics here Wednesday night because of Spencer Haywood.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Battle Message Wins by Length As Bowie Winter Meet Begins
description: BOWIE, Md., Feb. 8 (UPI) Battle Message took the lead at the start and led all the way today to win the $12,000 Belair Purse as Bowie Race Course opened a 59day meeting.

title: Music: A Memorable Hammerklavier
description: When you dine with a tiger, the tiger dines last. The origins of that old saying are obscure, but it could easily date from the time some wit first heard a pianist being eaten alive by Beethoven's Hammerklavier Sonata. Forget great; even good per formances of the mighty Op. 106 are as rare as vege tarian tigers. Listen to the famous Schnabel recording, if you want to hear a su preme artist being clawed by the technical and musical de mands of this sonata.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Dead Canary Found On Chest of a Man Slain in L.I. Home
description: BRENTWOOD, L. I., Feb. 8 A 32yearold television repair man was found murdered in his home here yesterday with a dead canary on his chest. He had been shot six times in the head.

title: Marymount Group to Help Defense of an Indicted Nun
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y., Feb. 8 A group of students and faculty members at Marymount College announced today the formation of a committee to raise money for the defense of Sister Elizabeth McAlister.

title: Madras Students Embittered by Curbs on English
description: MADRAS, IndiaAt a dimly lit road junction in a middle class district of this South In dian city, a public meeting was in progress.

title: Dumping of Pantyhose Into U.S. Laid to Foreign Manufacturers
description: Foreign manufacturers are dumping pantyhose into the United States market, it was, charged yesterday by Dominic P. Toscani, chairman of Aberle Industries, Inc., of Stowe, Pa.

title: Albee's New All Over in Rehearsal
description: Edward Albee put his new play, All Over, into re hearsal yesterday. The scene, on the first day, as has be come his custom, was the liv ing room of his homefor the last two years a light, lofty apartment overlooking Central Park and the Metro politan Museum of Art.

title: Advertising:
description: During the partial blackout Sunday night in New York, when all of the broadcasters who beam out from the Empire State Building were off the air, WNBCTV led all the rest in audience figures. That's right, between 7:15 P.M. and 9:30 more New York households were not watching any thing on Channel 4 than were not watching anything on any other channelbut WABC was close.

title: Ocean Spirit Leads Way
description: RIO DE, JANEIRO, Feb. 8 (AP)The British yacht, Ocean, Spirit, was first across the line today in the 3,600mile Cape townRio race, finishing 100 miles ahead of the next boat in the fleet bf 69, Fortuna of Argentina.

title: More Rain Keeps Driving Conditions Here Hazardous
description: More rain fell in the metro politan area last night, con tinuing the hazardous driving conditions that had plagued motorists on flooded highways earlier in the day.

title: Sailing of Queen Delayed
description: PORT EVERGLADES, Fla., Feb .8 (AP)The sailing of the aging Queen Elizabeth, re christened the Seawise Univer sity, today was tentatively postponed until 6 a.m. Wednes day. The former luxury liner had been scheduled to sail for Hong Kong at 5 a.m. tomorrow, but the authorities said the postponement was necessary because of anticipated high winds. The trip to Hong Kong is expected to last 45 days. The chip will he converted into a floating university.

title: City Atop Electric Checkerboard
description: One of the Sunday night blackout's odditiesthe west side of Broadway as bright as ever, the east side of the street in darknesswas a result of the grid system in which Con solidated Edison's power lines are laid.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In his Jan. 21 OpEd article, Can dor Toward the Press, Eric Sevareid asserts that a President has an in escapable obligation to hold news conferences since he cannot be sum moned by either Congress or the Court and can, in this age of electronics, argue his case uninterrupted to the whole nation directly, and at times and under circumstances of his own choosing.

title: U.S. Aides Decide Sailor Doesn't Want Asylum
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 8Federal officials determined today that a Yugoslav sailor who had said lie was sick and tired of his job on a Liberian tanker did not want political asylum.

title: Bridge:. Some Deals Are Like Onions And Often Bring On Tears, Too
description: Some bridge deals are like an onion. What seems to be a simple and straighforward product turns out, when peeled, to have a series of analytical layers, each deep er than its predecessors.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, Feb. 8 (AP)The Van couver Canucks purchased Bob Schmautz, a wing, from the Seattle Totems of the Western League today. In the same transaction, Ed Hatoum and Jim Wiste, forwards, go to the Totems for the remainder of the season.

title: Governor Warns of a Parochial School Aid Veto
description: ALBANY, Feb. 8Governor Rockefeller today virtually killed a major parochial school aid bill by declaring that it would be the first step to un dermine, if not destroy, the public school system of our country not just our state.

title: Insurer Sets Sales Mark
description: BOSTON. Feb. 28 (UPI) Sales of new life insurance by the John Hancock Mutual Life Insurance Company during 1970 surpassed $8billion for the first time in the concern's 108year history, officials said today. Sales totaled $8.4billion.

title: Article 14  No Title
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Feb. 8 (UPI) Spurts by the University of Dayton in each period tonight carried the Flyers to a 6360 victory over Western Kentucky. The Flyers rallied from an eightpoint deficit to a 2322 lead with 3 minutes left in the first half, but Western forged in front early in the second half. In the last seven minutes, Dayton spurted ahead again.

title: Taylor Dancers Revive Parable; Now it's Wickeder and Gayer
description: The Paul Taylor Dance Com pany, led by one of modern dance's major figures, opened a twoweek run last night at the ANTA Theater as part of the City Center American Dance Season.

title: Tennessee Triumphs, 8074
description: KNOXVILLE. Tenn., Feb. 8 (UPI)  Tennessee downed Mississippi tonight, 8074, with Don Johnson getting 26 points to lead the Vols. The nation's leading collegiate scorer, Johnny Neumann of Mississippi, got 22 and fouled out with about a minute and a half to play.

title: Black Ratio Lags in JobPlacing Unions
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8  Black membership in referral labor unions, those that place their cardholders on jobs, re mained at the same rate9.2 per centin 1969 as in 1968 de spite a major effort to increase minority membership, the Equal Employment Opportu nity Commission reported in statistics made public today.

title: Cambodians Voice Hope
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Feb. 8Cambodians who learned of the South Vietnamese attack in Laos voiced hope tonight that it would take pressure off their own country. The news reached here tonight, but for the last week there had been rumors and speculation about the pen etration into Laos.

title: Mayor's Panel Seeks Power Solution
description: Mayor Lindsay's Interdepart mental Committee on Public Utilities, which has been very busy since last summer's power problems, was called on yes terday to investigate why the power failed in midtown Sun day night.

title: SOUTH VIETNAMESE REACH FOE'S SUPPLY LINE IN LAOS; 2 U.S. COPTERS SHOT DOWN
description: KHESANH, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Feb. 9South Vietna mese troops moved into some areas of the enemy's supply route network in southern Laos yesterday, hours after having swept across the border in armored columns and Ameri canpiloted helicopters.

title: Advertising:
description: Betting that the new light whisky, when it is intro duced in July, 1972, will be a winner, Four Roses Distillers has reformulated its flagship brand to give it the flavor of the coming category.

title: 6 Church Groups Fighting Mine Project
description: Representatives of six major Protestant denominations that own stock in two metal con cerns have joined forces in an attempt to delay a copper min ing venture in Puerto Rico.

title: Coast Official Named To Antipoverty Post
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8 (AP)President Nixon today named Philip V. Sanchez, 41 yearold administrator of Fresno County, Calif., to be assistant director of the Of fice of Economic Opportunity.Mr. Sanchez will become the highest ranking official of MexicanAmerican descent in the Nixon Administration if he is confirmed by the Sen ate. Before he resigned re cently, Hillary Sandoval held that distinction as head of the Small Business Admin istration.

title: TEXAS STOCK DEAL DENIED BY EXAIDE
description: DALLAS, Feb. 8 (UPI) Waggoner Carr, former Attor ney General of Texas, denied under oath today that he had a part in stock dealings involv ing top state officials.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: S.E.C. Says It Wants Reports On New Issues Alter 6 Months
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8The Securities and Exchange Com mission proposed today that all firsttime issuers of securities be required to report the re sults of their offerings at the end of six months.

title: RED'S COPY SCORES IN HIALEAH DASH
description: MIAMI, Feb. 8 (UPI)Red's Copy held on gamely through the stretch at Hialeah Park to day to win the $10,000 allow ance feature at seven furlongs.

title: G.O.P. IN KENTUCKY STRESSING UNITY
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Feb. 8 While two prominent Demo crats are competing for their party's nomination, the Repub licans have dispensed with in tramural feuding to support one candidate for Governor this year.

title: ACCUSED IN QUEBEC OUSTED FROM COURT
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 8 (Canadian Press)Paul Rose, the Quebec separatist on trial in the stran gling of the Quebec Labor Min ister, was expelled from court today for the duration of the hearing. He has interrupted the trial repeatedly since it began two weeks ago.

title: EUROPEANS SET GOAL OF SINGLE CURRENCY
description: BRUSSELS, Feb. 8The Gov ernments of the Common Mar ket countries tonight declared themselves resolved to estab lish a single currency area over the next decade, but continued their arguments over what their specific working plans would involve.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8 (UPI) The Defense Department to day listed the names of the following Army men from the New York area as having been killed in the war in Indochina.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Senate, Without Debate, Confirms Connally for Treasury Post
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8 Without debate or opposition, the Senate confirmed today the nomination of John B. Con nally Jr., former Governor of Texas, to be Secretary of the Treasury.

title: U.S. Strength in Vietnam Declines to 335,000 Men
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 8 (AP) The United States Command announced today that American troop strength in South Vietnam dropped Iast week by 800 men, lowering the total to 335,000.

title: Seeker of Peace in Laos Souvanna Phouma
description: Man in the News

title: Fire Kills Harlem Woman
description: A Harlem woman burned to death yesterday when fire broke out in her oneroom apartment, the Fire Department reported. The victim was identified as Helen Tyler, in her 50's, of 138 West 117th Street. The fire, which broke out at about 2:30 P.M., was confined to the groundfloor apartment of the fivestory building.

title: Soviet Wins Two CrossCountry Ski Relays at PreOlympics Meet
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Tuesday, Feb. 9 (AP)The Soviet Union continued its strong showing today in a preview of the 1972 Winter Olympics with a victory in the women's 15kilometer crosscountry ski relay while last year's world champions from West Germany captured the twoman bobsled competi tion.

title: The Problem of MIRV: II
description: WASHINGTONThe control of MIRV's, which would provide such great security and economic benefits for both the United States and the Soviet Union, can be achieved by im posing a ban on MIRV testing and production as well as deployment.

title: Purpose in Laos: A Shorter War
description: News Analysis

title: Remember Oradour
description: Remember, says a sign near the French village OradourSurGlane, but only a handful of the men and women are alive who experienced that dayJune 10, 1944when exactly fourteen of the villagers survived the massacre staged by the Fuehrer Regiment of an elite Nazi tank division. Altogether, 642 were murdered; of these, 242 women and 202 children were burned alive the village church. Not long ago HeinzBernhard Lam merding, the SS general in command of the murderous unit, died in Bavaria after a postwar career as a suc cessful industrialist.

title: Nixon Aide Gets Party Post As Communications Deputy
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8 (AP) The appointment of Franklin C. Nofziger as deputy chair man for communications of the Republican National Committee was announced today.

title: U.S. Calls Move Limited;
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8The United States today portrayed the Americanbacked South Vietnamese invasion of Laos as a limited operation to protect the security and safety of American forces in South Viet nam.

title: French Convicts End Strike
description: PARIS, Feb. 8 (Reuters) Thirteen prisoners in French jails ended a long hunger strike today for privileges normally granted to political detainees. Their lawyers announced that the prisoners, jailed for of fenses they say were committed in the cause of Communist revolution, had been granted most of the privileges they sought.

title: HISTORIAN NAMED TO HEAD AMHERST
description: AMHERST, Mass., Feb. 8 Dr. John William Ward, a 48 year old historian at Amherst College here, was named presi dent of the college today, ef fective July 1.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Decline Sharply at Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8 Treasury bill rates declined sharply again at today's auc tion falling from last week's levels to their lowest yields since June, 1967, the Govern ment reported late this after noon.

title: GROUP IN '68 RIOTING IS FREED BY MEXICO
description: MEXICO CITY, Feb. 8 (AP) Charges against 72 university professors and students have been dropped and they have been released over the last two months.

title: 2 PANTHERS' BAIL ORDERED REVOKED
description: The trial of 13 Black Pan there accused of a bomb con spiracy was halted yesterday because two defendants failed to appear in court.

title: Hockey Coach Dismissed
description: ROCHESTER, Feb. 8 (UPI) Dick Gamble was dismissed to day as coach and general man ager of the Rochester Ameri cans of the American Hockey League. The club named John O. Flaherty as coach and Doug Adam as the new general man ager. Gambles ouster followed the team's three straight losses to the Springfield Kings.

title: Ulbricht in Soviet for Rest
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 8 (UPI)  Walter Ulbricht, the East Ger man leader, arrived in the So viet Union with his wife today for a rest. Tass, the Soviet press agency, gave no hint yhere they were staying.

title: Notre Dame Beats Butler, 9381, as Carr and Pleick Spark 2dHalf Drive
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Feb. (AP)  Austin Carr and John Pleick teamed for 33 of Notre Dame's first 35 points in the second half as the Irish beat Butler, 9381, tonight.

title: ALLEGRA KENT TAKES ROLE IN PAS DE DEUX
description: Just before packing its regu lar repertory away until the spring season, New York City Ballet presented Allegra Kent in Pas de Deux for the first time at State Theater Sunday evening.

title: Enlarging the War
description: Hours after South Vietnamese troops crossed into Laos with strong American logistical and fire support, the State Department declared that this massive operation is not an enlargement of the war.

title: Associate Justice Named
description: ALBANY, Feb. 8 (UPI)State Supreme Court Justice Frank A. Gulotta of Lynbrook, L. I., was named an associate justice of the Appellate Division of the court in the second department yesterday by Governor Rocke feller. Mr. Gulotta, who is 63 years old, succeeds Justice Mar cus G. Christ, who retired.

title: DISSIDENTS UNITE ON JERSEY WAR
description: JERSEY CITY, Feb. 8 Two rival insurgent political organi zations that are independently seeking the ouster of Mayor Thomas J. Whelan reluctantly joined forces here today in a lastminute attempt to bring about this city's first mayoral recall election.

title: FUTURES TRADER IS SURVEY TOPIC
description: With record trading last year in commodity futures, many ob servers have wondered what a typical commodity futures spec ulator looks like.

title: Frazier Shifts to Escape Snow
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N. Y., Feb. 8With almost the speed of a train dispatcher rerouting a limited because of a sudden emergency, Joe Frazier broke his training camp at the Con cord Hotel today.

title: Jane Fonda Hearing Off
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 8 (UPI) A hearing for Jane Fonda, the actress, on charges of assault and battery against a police man was continued today un til March 1.

title: Back Accepts Saints' Terms
description: MOREHEAD, Ky., Feb. 8 (UPI)Ron Gathright, an all Ohio Valley Conference defen sive back at Morehead State University, signed a contract today with the New Orleans Saints.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: An intensified campaign to make the striped bass a game fish in New York State has been promised by Al Ristori of Hackensack, N. J., the new president of Save Our Stripers, Inc.

title: 150P.B.A.MEMBERS STRIKE IN JERSEY
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Feb. 8About 150 members of three Patrolmens' Benevolent Association locals walked off their jobs here this morning, forcing supervisors, clerks and others to take over the duties of the Middlesex County Sher iff's office in patroling parks and roads, transporting prison ers to and from jails and courts, maintaining order in court rooms and operating the county workhouse.

title: XRAYS SHOW HULL SUFFERED NO BREAK
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 8 (AP) Bobby Hull of the Chicago Black Hawks was released from a hospital early today after Xrays proved there was no fracture of his badly bruised right hip and elbow. He was inqured last night in a National Hockey League game against the Pittsburgh Penguins.

title: Turnover Sets a Record As Dow Climbs by 5.55
description: Volume surged to a record yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange, helped in the first hour by the largest single block of shares ever traded on the Big Board, as the Dow Jones average of 30 industrials rose 5.55 points to a recovery high of 882.12.

title: Counter Market Activates New Quote Unit
description: The most revolutionary in novation in the history of the overthecounter market, an automatedquotation system, went into operation yesterday as most counter issues finished higher in steppedup trading.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 13,624 See Yonkers Leader Score With 4 in Row
description: YONKERS, Feb. 8  Ben Webster, the 3??yearold reins man from Len??aster, N. Y., the leading driver of the season's first meeting at Yonkers Race way, brought home five win ners tonight. Undaunted by a sloppy track, Webster increased his total of firsts to 39, since competition started here on Jan. 4.

title: Girl's Body Found in Car
description: The nude body of a girl was found in the trunk of a car near the West Side Highway yester day. The body of the girl, a Negro about 18 years old, was discovered at 10:30 A.M. when a tow truck began to haul away a 1964 Chevrolet that had been left at the base of the north bound exit ramp of the highway at 125th Street. There were no license plates on the car which had been abandoned Saturday.

title: MRS. ROSENSTIEL ACCUSED IN A SUIT
description: Mrs. Susan L. Rosenstiel, the estranged wife of a key figure in a state committee's investi gation of organized crime, was accused of perjury yesterday in a threecount information filed by the office of Manhattan District Attorney Frank S. Hogan.

title: Sports of at Times
description: No one has labeled the seven newly elected members of baseball's Hall of Fame as representing a vintage crop. The more discerning tasters would classify the selec tions by the veterans' committee as being barely palatable. But there is one with fullbodied excellence, so good as to match the crop of any year.

title: Mississippi State Loses
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Feb. 8 (AP)  Kentucky snapped out of its doldrums midway in the second half tonight and rolled to a 10283 Southeastern Con ference victory over Mississippi State.

title: Mia Farrow Is Seen In Honegger Joan; London Critics Cool
description: LONDON, Feb. 8  The critics were cool to Mia Far row's reading of the title role of Joan of Arc at the Stake at the Albert Hail here Friday night. They were less than en thusiastic, too, about the whole production of Honegger's ora torio to Claudel's poem.

title: Tories Assailed on Rolls
description: LONDON, Feb. 8  The Conservative Government came under pressure from the Oppo sition today to continue the costly jet engine that Rolls Royce, Ltd., was developing for the Lockheed Corporation's Tristar airbus.

title: British Envoy Sees Nixon
description: WASHINGTON Feb. 8Pres ident Nixon and Lord Cromer very briefly discussed the Rolls Royce bankruptcy and its potential impact on the beleagured Lockheed Aircraft Corporation when the new British envoy presented his credentials at the White House today, British sources said.

title: Ondine First to Finish
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 8 (AP)Ondine, owned and sailed by Sumner A. Long of New York, became today the first yacht to cross the line in the Buenos Aires to Rio regatta three times. She scored a clear cut victory in the 1,200mile race of 29 yachts.

title: ELSIE GROSSENBACHER
description: PASSAIC, N. J., Feb. 8 Elsie Grossenbacher, who had been a teacher in the New York school system for 51 years until she retired in 1951, died today in Passaic General Hospital after a brief illness. She was 89 years old and lived at 252 Van Houten Avenue.

title: NEW PARTY SHIFTS IN POI AND HINTED
description: WARSAW, Feb. 8The first indication of when the sixth Communist party congress would, meet in the wake of the December riots was given to day, when a Polish official said that the session would probably be held a year from now.

title: Text of the U.S. Statement on Laos
description: WASHINGTON, Feb.8 (AP) Following is the text of a statement made today by the State Department on the South Vietnamese incursion into Laos:

title: HOBART COLLEGE ACQUITTED IN RIOT
description: CANANDAIGUA, N. Y., Feb. 8  Hobart College was ac quitted today of criminal charges of coercion that had been leveled at it by a special grand jury investigating a riot on the college's campus in Geneva last June 5.

title: Dr. Egon Waltuch Dead at 71; Physician Fled Nazis in 1938
description: Dr. Egon Waltuch, a fellow of the American College of Chest Physicians, died Sunday apparently of a heart attack at his home, 68.61 108th Street, Forest Hills, Queens. He was 71 years old.

title: Street Meet Paves Girl Runner's Way
description: When Katheryne Jones was 11 years old, small and shy, she showed up for a street track meet in her ward on the south side of Chicago. Although Ira Murchison, once a world class sprinter, encouraged her, she didn't run after that for two years.

title: Challenger in South Korea Would Negotiate with North
description: TOKYO, Feb. 8Kim Dae Jung, South Korean presidential candidate, said here today that if elected he would seek limited negotiations with North Korea and a fourpower guarantee of peace on the Korean peninsula.

title: APOLLO 14 CREW, IN TV INTERVIEW, HAILS SUCCESSES
description: Excerpts from the Apollo broadcast are on Page 26.

title: Esposito Over 100 Points In Hockey Scoring Again
description: Phil Esposito of the Boston Bruins became the first player in National Hockey League his tory to score over 100 points ??n two different seasons last week, and Bobby Hull of the Chicago Black Hawks moved ??to a secondplace tie behind ordie Howe of the Detroit Red Wings on the alltime scoring list.

title: Dr. Julie BraunVogelstein Dies; German Party Leader's Widow
description: Dr. Julie Braun  Vogelstein, an art historian, the widow of Heinrich Braun, German Social Democratic politician and jour nalist, who died in 1927, died Saturday in Flower and Fifth Avenue Hospital after a long ill ness. She was 88 years old and lived at 299 Riverside Drive.

title: New Austrian Defense Chief
description: VIENNA, Feb. 8Brig. Karl Liagendorf was sworn today by President Franz Jonas as Aus tria's new Defense Minister. He succeeds Gen. Johannes Freihsler, who resigned because of serious illness.

title: Gould to Discontinue Broadcast Reviews; O'Connor New Critic
description: Jack Gould, radio and tele vision critic of The New York Times, will give up reviewing at his own request.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Jersey Suspends F. Lee Bailey From Practice
description: TRENTON, Feb. 8F. Lee Bailey was suspended today by the New Jersey Supreme Court from practicing law in this state for one year for having violated state judicial canons against pretrial publicity.

title: Kansas Beats Colorado
description: LAWRENCE, Kan., Feb. 6 (UPI)  Mark Williams broke Colorado's zone defense with five longrange field goals in the first half tonight and Kan sas defeated the Buffaloes, 9167. The victory, the Jay hawks' 17th in IS games, boosted their Big Eight confer ence record to 60. Colorado is 33.

title: City Is Striving to Abolish Uniformed Men's Overtime
description: City Budget Director Ed ward K. Hamilton indicated yesterday that, in its present contract negotiations, the city was seeking to eliminate over time for its uniformed serv ices.

title: F.D.A. Finds Lead Hazard In Some Pottery From Italy
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8 (AP) Some pottery imported from Italy and distributed nationally contains high levels of poison ous lead that can be absorbed by food and drinks on contact and could cause serious injury, the Food and Drug Administra tion announced today.

title: Guard Seizes Church Abandoned by Blacks in Wilmington, N.C.
description: WILMINGTON, N. C., Feb. 8  Racial peace was restored to Wilmington today when armed black high school students abandoned an old brick church they had used as a sanctuary for the last several days.

title: Berrigan Sentence Upheld
description: RICHMOND, Feb. 8 (AP) The United States Court of Ap peals for the Fourth Circuit up held today the validity of a six year prison sentence imposed on Father Berrigan when he was convicted of pouring blood over draft board records in Baltimore.

title: 7.06% YIELD SET FOR A.T.&T. ISSUE
description: The American Telephone & Telegraph Company's $500mil lion bond issue for sale today will yield 7.06 per cent.

title: MOMENTUM NOTED IN TALKS ON BERLIN
description: BERLIN, Feb. 8 The four power talks aimed at improv ing the situation for this trou bled city gained some momen tum today, even though offi cials cautioned that there was no breakthrough yet.

title: TV: Paley's Move Casts a Shadow Over Industry
description: News Analysis

title: A Newsman Charges His Camera Was Seized
description: QUANGTRI, South Viet nam, Feb. 8A South Viet namese cameraman working on assignment for the Na tional Broadcasting Company said today that an American helicopter crewman forcibly took his movie camera from him and threw it from the helicopter as it flew South Vietnamese combat troops over Laos. According to the newsman, Hoang Trong Nghia, the crewman had said he was acting under orders.

title: Soviet Warns U.S.
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 8 (Reuters) Tass, the Soviet press agency, warned the United States to day that it had taken on grave responsibility before world opinion by deciding on fur ther dangerous expansion of aggression against the peoples of Indochina.

title: Jet Carrying Lindsay Lands in Wrong Place
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8 An American Airlines Boe ing 727 carrying Mayor Lind say, Senator Jacob K. Javits and other passengers from New York City to Washing ton made an unscheduled landing in Baltimore this morning after the pilot re ported a fire warning in one engine.

title: Nixon to Address Reception
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8 (AP) President Nixon will join his wife and speak briefly at a re ception tomorrow for the Com mittee of One Thousand, finan cial backers of the Freedoms Foundation at Valley Forge, Pa., which promotes under standing of the Constitution.

title: More Exactas in Canada
description: TORONTO, Feb. 8 (Canadian Press)  The Jockey Club an nounced today that the exacta will be offered daily in the last seven races on ninerace cards at Jockey Club tracks. The rul ing is subject to amendment of Federal Agriculture Department regulations.

title: Six Plead Not Guilty to Plot Charges
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Feb. 8 The Harrisburg Six, as the per sons charged with conspiring to blow up heating tunnels in Washington and kidnap a Pres idential adviser, Henry A. Kissinger, have become known were arraigned today.

title: NEW DANCE WORK BY BERT BOWS
description: The Brooklyn Academy of Music, which has scheduled a third week by Maurice Bjart's Ballet of the 20th Century, presented the local premiere Sunday night of Firebird, one of Mr. Mart's latest works.

title: L.I.U.'s Coach Gives Players Voice in Scheduling Opponents
description: Roy Rubin has taken a new tack in communicating with his players.

title: Article 15  No Title
description: STORRS, Conn., Feb. 8 (AP) Connecticut weathered a strong Florida Southern come back tonight and held on for an 8274 victory.

title: MRS. ALLAN J. M'INTOSH
description: BEDFORD, N.Y., Feb. 8 Mrs. Josephine Hoffman Mc Intosh of Sunnyfield Farms, wife of Allan J. McIntosh, a partner in Fahnestock & Co., stockbrokers, died Saturday night in the Harkness Pavilion of ColumbiaPresbyterian Medi cal Center after a long illness. She was 63 years old.

title: Galanos Goes to ExtremesShorts and the Anklette Look
description: To no one's surprise, James Galanos showed shorts yes terday. They were generally hidden under long dresses or capes, but there was no ques tion about itthey were there.

title: German Bishops Decline to Judge a Rebel Theologian on Issue of Infallibility
description: BONN, Feb. 8  The Con ference of German Bishops, in a statement widely interpreted as a milestone of tolerance in the Roman Catholic Church of this country, declared today that judgment of a rebel theo logian lay outside its compe tence.

title: Lockheed Layoffs Loom;
description: BURBANK, Calif., Feb. 8 The Lockheed California Com pany will lay off workers from its buffeted L1011 Tristar air bus program, pending any solu tion eventually arranged to as sure the delivery of engines from bankrupt RollsRoyce, Ltd., a union official said here today.

title: Benefits Seen in Vientiane
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 8 There was a general feeling here today that if the South Vietnamese incursion into southern Laos went well it would deal a serious blow to the North Vietnamese. It was felt that the drive could prove beneficial to Laos in the long run even if at the moment it added to the problems of her international relations.

title: Environment or Politics?
description: Senator Edmund Muskie has started the Congressional machinery for another effort to establish a Joint Com mittee on the Environment. The last attempt was ap proved by both houses, only to die a tawdry political death in conference when the 91st Congress adjourned.

title: Pathet Lao Protests
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 8 (Reuters) The proCommunist Pathet Lao in an urgent protest has asked Britain and the Soviet Union to take steps to compel the United States to halt its aggressive operation in Laos.

title: Seoul's Troops to Replace G.I.'s on Armistice Line
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Feb. 8President Chung Hee Park announced today that South Koreans would take over the defense of the 155mile Korean armistice border soon as a re sult of the current 20,000man reduction of the American forces here.

title: Lufthansa Is Flying Again As 10Day Strike Ends
description: BONN, Feb. 8Lufthansa, the West German airline, re sumed regular services today, following yesterday's vote by ground personnel to accept a 15 per cent wage increase as a settlement of their 10day strike.

title: COLUMBIA TO MOVE SCHOOL OF THE ARTS
description: Dr. William J. McGill, presi dent of Columbia University, announced yesterday that the School of the Arts, which has suffered severe financial cut backs, would move in June to the Dodge building on the uni versity's main campus from its present home in a cityowned building at 440 West 110th Street.

title: JUROR IS EXCUSED IN TRIAL OF SEALE
description: NEW HAVEN, Feb. 8 (AP) Over strenuous defense objec tions, the newest juror in the murder conspiracy trial of Bobby G. Seale and Mrs. Ericka Huggins, two Black Panther party members, was excused today and Mr. Seale's lawyer told the presiding juge that he had concluded that we cannot get a fair trial.

title: First Battle lit Laos
description: SAIGON, Tuesday, Feb. 9 (Reuters)  South Vietnamese troops engaged in their first battle with North Vietnamese forces in Laos and lost three dead and 20 wounded, a Gov ernment military spokesman said here today.

title: Second Disk Jockey Guilty Of Accepting Radio Payola
description: Hipolito Vega, a Spanishlan guage radio disk jockey, was convicted by a Federal Court jury yesterday of playing records for pay and lying when he denied it five years ago in a thensecret hearing.

title: CITY AIMS TO ASSAY SCHOOL EFFICIENCY
description: The Board of Education an nounced plans yesterday for a pioneering project aimed at developing a way to measure the effectiveness of the city's schools and their teachers and supervisors.

title: CON EDISON LIMITS OUTPUT OF POWER. IN MIDTOWN PLANT
description: The Consolidated Edison Company limited power yester day from its electric plant sup plying midtown Manhattan, the scene of a fourhour blackout Sunday night, and also pro vided an independent backup line for the area.

title: Representatives Hold Forum on Noise
description: A group of 15 Representa tives from New York City held an ad hoc hearing here yesterday on noise pollution and came away convinced that what was needed was help for the victim.

title: HolidaysOne Through Five
description: Two and a half years ago Congress passed a law mak ing four national holidays fall by legislative fiat on Monday. At the time it seemed to us that the law was a good idea, but now that it is about to go into effect, we freely admit to misgivings. Indeed, the closer comes the necessity of celebrating Washington's Birthday on Feb. 15, the more we resent this conversion of historic anniversaries to mere legislative devices for stretching out the weekend.

title: CocaCola to Set Up 17 Depots To Buy Bottles and Cans Here
description: The CocaCola Bottling Com pany of New York will open collection points at 17 of its branches in the metropolitan's area for glass bottles and aluminum cans to help reduce refuse.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Market Place: All the Details Of a Big Trade
description: If you're a small investor and you have watched sev eral dollars per share evap orate when an institution trades a big block of your stock, you're probably as worried as Wall Street is about the impact of institu tional trading.

title: ANTIDIVORCE DRIVE IS BACKED IN ITALY
description: ROME, Feb. 8The Roman Catholic hierarchy of Italy in effect endorsed a drive to repeal the twomonthold divorce act by asserting today that Catholics had the right and duty to resort to all legitimate means to de fend their values.

title: U.S. Will Pay Bonding Fees To Aid Anyone Seeking Job
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8 (UPI) The Labor Department has offered to pay bonding fees for any job seeker who is refused an employment bond by com mercial sources.

title: The New Libertarian Creed
description: Recently a great deal of publicity has been given to a burgeoning split in the right wing, a split between the dominant BuckleyNational Review conservatives and the new libertarians.

title: KEMP IS A WITNESS AT HEARING ON N.F.L.
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 8 (AP) Jack Kemp, former pro football quarterback and now a Repub lican Representative from Buffalo, was questioned today by a Federal grand jury investi gating ownerplayer relations and possible illegal restraints in the National League.

title: Eclipse of Moon Tonight Will Give Thermal Shock to Instruments
description: Tonight and early tomorrow the moon will pass through the earth's shadow and, within minutes, the temperature at the two lunar sites where in struments left by Apollo 12 and Apollo 14 are operating will drop radically.

title: New Freeport Sulphur Name
description: Stockholders of the Freeport Sulphur Company will be asked at the annual meeting April 19 to approve a change in the company's name to the Free port Minerals Company, Thorn as R. Vaughan, president, an nounced yesterday. The new name was chosen, he said, to reflect the company's widened activities as a diversified min erals producer.

title: RICHEY, SANTANA VICTORS IN TENNIS
description: HAWTHORNE, N. J., Feb. 8 Cleanair tennis came to smogfree Hawthorne today. with half the starstudded field of 32 independent pros and amateurs seeing action at the start of a new $30,000 tourna ment. All the profits will go toward fighting pollution.

title: GATEWAY PROJECT AFFIRMED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8In terior Secretary Rogers C. B. Morton assured Mayor Lindsay today that the Federal Govern ment would pursue develop ment of the proposed Gateway National Recreation Area at the entrance of New York Harbor.

title: South Africa Eases Apartheid To Gain Labor for Construction
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Feb. 8The South African Government, faced with a crit ical skilledlabor shortage in the construction Industry re laxed apartheid regulations today to permit Africans of mixed ancestry to do jobs pre viously reserved for whites.

title: CITY AND UNIONS SET WAGE TALKS TODAY
description: Negotiators for the city were scheduled to resume bargaining talks today with both the Uni formed Firefighters Association and the Uniformed Sanitation men's Association.

title: Kennedy Gets License Alter Year's Revocation
description: BOSTON, Feb. 8 (AP) Senator Edward M. Kennedy. Democrat of Massachusetts has received a new driver's license to replace the one that was revoked for one year fol lowing an accident on Chan paquiddick Island in July, 1969, the Registry of Motor Vehicles reported today.

title: Incursion by Saigon Generates Only Scattered Protests in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8The South Vietnamese incursion into Laos generated only scat tered protests around the na tion today, in marked contrast to outbursts last spring follow ing the move into Cambodia.

title: Anaconda Estimates a Drop In 1970 and FourthQuarter Net
description: The Anaconda Company estimated its consolidated net income last year declined to $67,913,000, or $3.10 a share, be fore an extraordinary charge and 863,608,000, or $2.90 a share, after the $4,305,000 charge, the preliminary report disclosed yesterday.

title: JACK GOLDSTEIN SCREEN PUBLICIST
description: Jack Goldstein, vice president in charge of advertising and publicity of Allied Artists Pic tures Corporation, died yester day at New York Hospital aft er a long illness. He was 65 years old and lived at the May flower Hotel, 15 Central Park West.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8United Press International reports that a pub man ager in Salisbury, England, has opened a promising sideline business renting drunks to add life to parties. Renta Drunk, as his business is called, be gan as a joke but ceased being a laughing matter when the number of calls from interested hosts revealed that it filled a genuine need.

title: Mine Pension Trustee Says Others Acted Without Her
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8 (AP) Josephine Roche, one of three trustees of the United Mine Workers Welfare and Re tirement Fund, testified today that miners' pensions were in creased in 1969 without her knowledge or consent.

title: Can Workers Ask Increase
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 8 (UPI) The steelworkers have asked the nation's four major can manufacturers for wage in creases totaling $1.30 an hour over the next three years.

title: Separate Pact With Steel Union Planned by WheelingPittsburgh
description: The WheelingPittsburgh Steel Corporation, the country's ninth largest steel producer, an nounced yesterday that it planned to negotiate independ ently with labor this summer and not as a member of the committee that bargains in be half of most of the major steel concerns.

title: Cambodian Casualties Put at 17,848 Soldiers
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Feb. 8 (UPI)Premier Lon Nol said today in a stateof thenation message that 17,848 Cambodian soldiers had been killed, wounded or listed as missing since the war in Indochina spread to Cambodia 11 months ago.

title: PANEL WILL STUDY PRESS AND THE LAW
description: The Twentieth Century Fund announced the establishment yesterday of a panel to define the rights of journalists to pro tect their sources of informa tion.

title: Books of The Times
description: COTILLION. Or One good Bull Is Half the Herd. By John Oliver Killens, 256 pages. Trident. $6.50.

title: HoffmannLa Roche Cuts Price of Drug For Parkinsonism
description: HoffmannLa Roche, Inc., an nounced yesterday that it would reduce the price of its brand of LDopa, a drug used in the treatment of Parkinson's dis ease, by more than 35 per cent, effective Feb. 16.

title: Army Vehicle Kills Ulster Girl, Stirring More AntiBritish Riots
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Feb. 8A 5yearold girl was run over and killed by a British Army scout car tonight, and four teenagers were hit by machinegun fire in rioting that followed.

title: 12 Agree to Decree
description: DALLAS, Feb. 8 (AP)  Frank W. Sharp agreed to a consent decree in court today. The decree stipulates that he will not participate in stock manipulations in violation of Securities and Exchange Com mission regulations.

title: Nixons Plan Florida Stay
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8 (UPI) President and Mrs. Nixon are expected to spend the corning weekend at Key Biscayne, Fla. They probably will leave Thurs day and stay in Florida through Monday.

title: Nixon Asks Cleanup Code To Restore Environment
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8President Nixon called today for new initiatives to regulate noise, surface and underground mining, power plant sites, ocean dumping and pesticides as part of a comprehensive environmental program for 1971.

title: Class 44: Teacher Veers Between Elation and Despair
description: Ever since Javier Romero transferred out of Class 44 to another school, depriving its teacher of her favorite monitor, his old friends in the class have been sending him regular bulletins on its progress.

title: DR. EARL MARTIN, BIOLOGIST, DEAD
description: NAPLES, Fla., Feb. 8Dr. Earl A. Martin, chairman of the biology department at Brooklyn College for 30 years, died Fri day after a long illness. He was 80 years old.

title: CON EDISON SEEKS BLACKOUT SOURCE
description: It appears that this is the culprit, the engineer said, pointing an accusing finger down at the thicket of insulat ors, cables, relays and wind ings that make up Transformer No. 1 at Consolidated Edison's 13th Street switching substa tion.

title: Treaty on Seabed Arms Will Be Signed Thursday
description: LONDON, Feb. 8 (Reuters) Britain, the United States and the Soviet Union will sign an armscontrol treaty for the sea bed here Thursday, the Foreign Office announced today.

title: Garage Owners Get Court Order In Effort to End Strike Here
description: The Metropolitan Garage Board of Trade obtained a court order yesterday aimed at ending the strike by 3,000 workers that has shut 600 ga rages in Manhattan and the Bronx since last Wednesday.

title: Law Ending Certificates Urged as BusyVolume Aid
description: A member of the Securities and Exchange Commission charged yesterday that Wall Street's capacity to handle sus tained heavy trading volume in the stock market was inadequate and that all the efforts to cope with the problem so far had fallen short.

title: Thant Deplores Operations
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. Feb. 8 (AP)  Secretary General Thant expressed fear today that operations in Laos by the North Vietnamese and now the South Vietnamese might be the death blow for the 1962 Geneva agreement. A statement issued by his office said: The report ed incursion into Laos of South Vietnamese armed forces sup ported by the United States Air Force is one more deplorable episode in the long history of the barbarous war in Indo china.

title: TALKS CANCELED IN SCHOOL STRIKE
description: NEWARK, Feb. 8The Board of Education canceled sched uled talks with representatives of striking teachers today and announced that it would refuse to negotiate as long as the teachers continued picketing.

title: FRED R. DICKSON
description: VACAVILLE, Calif., Feb. 8 Fred R. Dickson, a penologist who retired in 1964 as warden of San Quentin Prison, died, Saturday at Ross General Hos pital alter a heart attack. He was 70 years old.

title: TRADER IN POTATOES FINED ON VIOLATIONS
description: Samuel Cohen, a millionaire realestate investor, was fined $140,000 in Federal Court here yesterday for violating regula tions of the Commodities Ex change Commission.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8The Depart ment of Health, Education and Welfare has submitted to Congress a monu mental report on the smoking of mari juana, the general tone of which seems to be that not enough is known about pot and its effects to justify major recommendations. The trouble with that is that we probably never will know that much.

title: Miss Devlin Critical
description: KINGSTON, R. I., Feb. 8 (AP)  Bernadette Devlin, the 23 yearold militant Catholic Mem ber of Parliament from North ern Ireland, said here today that the presence of the Duke of Kent in Ulsterhe is a cousin of Queen Elizabeth II would spur the rebels to new action. He is a major in the Royal Scots Grey.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: U. S. Now Seeks New ABM To Supplement Safeguard
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8The Defense Department has de cided to step up development of a cheaper antiballistic mis sile system for defending the launching sites of interconti nental Minuteman missiles, ac cording to Pentagon sources.

title: HARVARD, BOSTON U. CRUSH HOCKEY FOES
description: BOSTON, Feb. 8 (AP)Steve Dolloff fired in three goals and eight teammates had at least one goal each as Boston Univer sity trounced Northeastern, 122, in the opening round of the Beanpot hockey tournament at Boston Garden tonight.

title: CARSWELL NAMED TO POST BY NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8 (AP)  Former Judge G. Harrold Carswell of Florida, who was rejected by the Senate for a place on the United States Su preme Court, was named today by President Nixon to a non paying job on a council that seeks ways to improve legal procedures of Federal agencies.

title: Along the Road to Laos: Noise, Dust, Confusion
description: BANHOUEKATANG, South Vietnam, Feb. 8The artil lery fired over this little bor der crossing into Laos all night, and the young South Vietnamese Rangers who climbed aboard their boxy ar mored personel carriers to invade Laos this morning said they had not been able to sleep well.

title: Governor Says Democrats Play Politics With Aid Plan
description: ALBANY. Feb. 8Governor Rockefeller accused the state's Democratic Congressmen today of opposing revenuesharing proposals for reasons of party politics. He urged a concerted public drive to get the Repre sentatives behind his own aid plan.

title: Happy Reunion of American Paintings
description: It looks like old home week in the new quarters of M. Knoedler & Co. at 21 East 70th street, where the open ing exhibition of American painting is filled with famil iar faces from the art history books. It is an extremely happy reunion, with tlele gates from 35 museums and 22 private collections, each in great shape after all these years (the exhibition begins early in the 18th century) and proclaiming that the world is a great placeor at least was a great place up to 1930 in the part of it called America.

title: Windward Passage Sails Home First
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 8 (AP)Windward Passage and American Eagle became the first yachts in a fleet of 85 today to complete a rugged St. Petersburg  to  Fort Lauderdale ocean race.

title: Two Textile Dye Concerns Plead Guilty on Pollution
description: Two textile dye concerns pleaded guilty in Federal Court here yesterday to charges that they had discharged industrial waste into tributaries of the Hudson River.

title: Understandable, Britain Says
description: LONDON, Feb. 8 (UPI)Brit ain today termed the South Viet namese action in Laos fully understandable. A Foreign Office spokesman said that the British Government was in con stant touch with the South Vietnamese and United States Governments on the situation in Southeast Asia.

title: Pan Am Views Merger As a Fight for Survival
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8Na jeeb E. Halaby, president of Pan American World Airways, told the Senate Commerce Com mittee this morning that his long search for a merger with a domestic route system was now a fight for Pan Am's sur vival.

title: WIDOW ARRESTED IN SLAYING ON L.I.
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. 1, Feb. 8 The widow of an electronics executive slain last August and the former lawyer of a man accused of the murder were charged today as coconspira tors in the murder.

title: I. C. C. CHIEF SEES PENNSY VIOLATION
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8 (UPI) The chairman of the Inter state Commerce Commission has held that the Penn Central Transportation Company vio lated Federal regulations when it purchased and charged to business expenses, $10million in insurance to protect its of ficers against wrongdoing.

title: Sneakers at a Charity Ball? Yes, After Some Challenging Tennis
description: Jim Brooks turned up in red plaid pantshe hoped they would prove distracting to the champions. Wayne Lachman wore shrimpcolored velvet bell bottoms with his brown velvet jacket.

title: Mrs. Raymond W. Emeritz; Led Newsday Department
description: LEVITTOWN, L.I., Feb. 8 Mrs. Betty Frear Emeritz, pub lic service director of Newsday and wife of Raymond W. Emeritz, chief engineer for re search and development of General Camera Corporation, died Jan. 28 in Marathon, Fla., where she was recuperating from an operation. She was 54 years old and lived at 136 Springtime Lane West, here.

title: McBurney Bluegrass Concert Is Given by Osborne Brothers
description: The bluegrass groups that appear in the continuing se ries presented by Bernie Klay at the McBurney Young Men's Christian Association, 215 W. 23d Street, usually count on instrumental virtuosity to carry them, letting the sinn ing fill in on a catchascatch can basis. But with the Os born Brothers, who gave three performances at the Mc Burney Y on Sunday, the bal ance is reversed even though, in Sonny Osborne, the group has an unusually imaginative and skillful banjo picker.

title: City Asks Power to Make Loans At Low Cost for Industrial Parks
description: ALBANY, Feb. 8In an ef fort to speed up renewal of its blighted industrial areas, New York City will ask the Legisla ture for power to make special ilowinterest loans to private businesses.

title: Knoedler's, in New Home, Still Looks to Old Masters
description: The carpeting is down, the pictures are up and the glass front door is open for busi ness. After nearly half a cen tury on East 57th Street, the august concern of M. Knoed ler & Co., Inc., which in 125 years of art wheeling and dealing may have parted more collectors from more cash than any other gallery in the city (except possibly its archrival Wildenstein & Co.), has ensconced itself in elegant new quarters at 21 East 70th Street.

title: Laotians Report Gains
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 8 (Agence FrancePresse)  Gov ernment forces today were reported to have recaptured some positions they had lost in northern Laos above the royal capital, Luang Prabang. But a spokesman, Gen. Thong panh Konksy, said enemy pres sure continued.

title: WIRETAP ARRESTS REPORTED RISING
description: TOKYO, Feb. 8 Deputy Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst told the leaders of the American Bar Association today that the Nixon Adminis tration's use of wiretapping against organized crime had resulted in more than 800 arrests and 72 convictions in the last two years.

title: Big City Mayors Urge Priority for Public Jobs Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8 Mayor Lindsay and the Mayors of 15 other major cities ap pealed to a Senate subcommit tee today for quick passage of an emergency measure to pro vide public service jobs during periods of high unemployment.

title: HARPSICHORDS VARY, A RECITALIST SHOWS
description: Edward Brewer played not one but three harpsichords at his Tully Hall recital Sunday night. In so doing, he not only enlivened his program consid erably (all three were beautiful  but different in appearance and sound), but also gave his audience a pleasant historical lesson.

title: U.S. Moving to Sue Farmers for Trace Of Drugs in Cattle
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8 (UPI) The Government has begun the first criminal prosecution of farmers who ship livestock con taining illegal drug or hormone residues. It will also intensify testing for traces of these resi dues, especially one that has caused cancer in mice.

title: WHITE HOUSE ACTS TO HALT RATE RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8The Nixon Administration has taken its first official steps toward implementing a new policy of trying to keep the Government's own regulatory agencies from adding unjustifiably to infla tionary pressures.

title: BID BY AQUITAINE CO. FOR BANFF IS BACKED
description: The Aquitaine Company of Canada, Ltd., and Banff Oil, Ltd., announced yesterday they have received a favorable ruling on the Canadian tax consequences of the previously proposed merger of Banff into Aquitaine.

title: Chronology of U.S. Involvement in Laos
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. RFol lowing is a chronology of events and decisions that marked the increasing United States in volvement in Laos:

title: Their Eating Habits Would Make a Nutritionist Wince
description: Any spare change? Brown hair limp down the shoulders of her Army sur plus jacket, the East Village girl hardly looks affluent. But her plump, solemn face sug gests she's not starving, either.

title: New Plea for Mendoza
description: MANILA, Feb. 8 (Reuters) An attorney defending Benja min Mendoza y Amor Flores, the Bolivian painter accused of hav ing tried to kill Pope Paul VI, asked today that the case be dismissed on the grounds that the prosecution had been un able to substantiate the charge. Mr. Mendoza is on trial on charges of having attempted to stab the Popo at the Manila airport on Nov. 27.

title: 10 EXPORTERS DOUBT OIL WILL BE CUT OFF
description: VIENNA. Feb. 8 (UPI)A spokesman for 10 oilproducing countries said today that he doubted there would be a cut off to consumers even if West ern oil companies refused to meet demands for price in creases.

title: The MiniBlackout
description: The miniblackout which shrouded much of midtown Manhattan in absolute darkness for several stormy hours Sunday evening has pointed up, once again, the shocking vulnerability to breakdowns of the city's aging electrical generating system. Overstrained because major generat ing stations at Ravenswood and Indian Point have been out of commission for some time and an Arthur Kill plant was operating at half capacity, the system snapped at its oldest point. The break came in a tributary of the Waterside plant, constructed in 1901. This plant and its substations were trying to make up too large a share of the power normally supplied by these other stations.

title: Mets Sign 4 Free Agents, Top SecondaryDraft Pick
description: The New York Mets signed their No. 1 pick in the sec ondary baseball draft and four free agents from Puerto Rico yesterday. All will be assigned to the minor league training camp at St. Petersburg, Fla.

title: Swiss Women Tackle Inequalities but See Long Fight
description: GENEVA, Feb. 8The aboli tion of basic economic and social inequalities, not the more farreaching aims of women's liberation, will be the immediate objective of women's rights leaders now that Swiss women have won the right to vote in federal elections.

title: David Eisenhower Due For Duty on Cruiser
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 8 (AP) David Eisenhower, Presi dent Nixon's soninlaw, has been assigned to a guided missile cruiser and will get special training as a navi gator.

title: Excerpts From Apollo News Conference
description: Following are excerpts from the transcript of a news conference yesterday be tween newsmen in Houston and the Apollo 14 astro nautsCapt. Alan B. Shep ard Jr. and Comdr. Edgar D. Mitchell of the Navy and Maj. Stuart A. Roosa of the Air Forceas recorded by The New York Times. The ques tions were relayed to the spacecraft by Gordon Fuller ton, capsule communicator.

title: U.S. Navy Struck in Japan
description: YOKOSUKA, Japan, Feb. 8 (AP)  About 5,000 Japanese workers at the headquarters of the United States Seventh Fleet went on a 24hour strike today, demanding postponement of dismissals until the workers find new employment. Union officials said about 3.000 work ers at the Yokosuka naval base would be dismissed by June in the reduction of United States forces.

title: Higher January Sales Set By 2 Leading Retail Chains
description: Lane Bryant. Inc., New York, and Peoples Drug Stores, Inc.. Washington, two leading retail chains, reported yesterday high er sales in January over the yearearlier month.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION OFF 1.5% IN WEEK
description: Steel production fell by 1.5 per cent last week, compared with output the week before, but it was the first weekto week decline of 1971. Previous ly, production showed five substantial gains in a row.

title: NEWARK'S TEACHERS WARNED OF ARRESTS
description: NEWARK, Feb. 9A warn ing that striking teachers would be arrested if they con tinued to picket Newark schools was made today by Jesse Jacob, president of the Board, of Education.

title: Loss in Nassau Seen
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Feb. 9 (UPI) Marvin D. Cristenfeld, Demo cratic leader of Nassau County, said today that the proposal for state assumption of local welfare and state court costs would result in a $33million annual loss to taxpayers in his county.

title: Fighting Near Plain
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 9 (UPI)  North Vietnamese troops and Pathet Lao guerrillas have opened attacks against Government positions around ong Tieng, Laotian military pokesmen said today.

title: GOVERNOR ASSAILS DEMOCRATS AGAIN
description: Governor Rockefeller kept up his attack yesterday on the state's Democratic Congress men who have failed to endorse President Nixon's $5billion revenuesharing plan.

title: G.M. Reports Spending Plans
description: DETROIT, Feb. 9 (UPI)Genoral Motors plans to spend $1.1billion, for new plant and equipment in 1971, James M. Roche, chairman, said in the annual report to stockholders today.

title: Rain, Fog and Mud Slow Drive Into Laos
description: QUANGTRI. South Vietnam, Wednesday, Feb. 10Heavy rains and dense fog fell un expectedly over the South Viet ramose drive against enemy sup ply trails in Laos yesterday, virtually halting United States helicopter supply flights and other air support.

title: U.S. Wins 6 Sunfish Races
description: NAIGUATA, Venezuela, Feb. 9 (UP)The United States won the first six races today in the first international Sunfish Class championship races. Puerto Rico was second, followed by Venezuela, the Virgin Islands and the Netherlands Antilles.

title: Homosexuality: Parents Aren't Always to Blame
description: Scrawled in large black letters on a subway wall:

title: Pluft Probable Victor
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 9 (AP)Although America's On dine was the first to finish, Brazil's Pluft appeared to be the correctedtime winner to [day in the Buenos Aires to Rio de Janeiro yacht race.

title: COMMON MARKET WILL UNIFY MONEY
description: BRUSSELS, FEB. 9  After months of argument, the six members of the European Eco nomic Community agreed today on a concrete plan to make their trade bloc into a single currency area over the next decade.

title: Sierra Club Shifts Site
description: DENVER, Feb. 9 (UPI)The Sierra Club's board of directors will open a twoday gathering in Denver on Saturday, marking the first time in 80 years that it has held a quarterly meeting outside California. The direc tors of the 115,000member na tional conservation organiza tion will discuss and draft leg islative proposals for reforms of public land law.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Paige Is First Star of Old Negro Leagues to Be Selected for Hall of Fame
description: Satchel Paige, the legendary pitcher, was elected to base ball's Hall of Fame yesterday as the foremost star of the old Negro leagues.

title: White House Newsmen Elect a Woman Officer
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (UPI)Helen Thomas, White House reporter for United Press International, today became the first woman ever elected an officer of the White House Correspon dents Association.

title: Stones Smash 4 Windows Of U.S. Consulate in Taipei
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Feb. 9  Four windows of the United States Embassy's consular sec tion, situated on the second floor of a downtown com mercial building, were broken by stones early this morning.

title: Advertising:
description: Never let It be said that those agency people aren't aware of what's going on in society: Cunningham $ Walsh, known for its finger on the pulse, is dragging the women's lib movement into its current Loyalists cam paign for 21 Brands Bal lantine's Scotch.

title: Argentine Minister Resigns
description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Feb. 9 (Reuters)Welfare Minister Francisco Manrique re signed today at the request of President Roberto Marcelo Levingston, it was announced.

title: Rise Seen in Business Aid to the Arts
description: Corporate philanthropy in the United States will at least double in the next decade, and a rising share of that increase, which will total in the billions, will be in con tributions to cultural insti tutions.

title: P.G.A. Aide Promoted
description: Joseph D. Schwendeman was promoted yesterday from public information director to execu tive secretary of the Profes sional Golfers' Association tournament players division, the commissioner, Joseph C. Dey Jr., announced. Schwende man will succeed Fred J. Mock, who resigned. John Ross will replace Schwendeman.

title: BENJAMIN P. ROOSA, BEACON LAWYER, 67
description: BEACON, N. Y., Feb. 9Ben jamin P. Roosa, former City Court judge and senior partner in the law firm of Roosa & Roosa, died yesterday in Stuart, Fla., after a short illness. He was 67 years old.

title: MRS. T. L. LINCOLN, LEUKEMIA PATIENT
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 9  Mrs. Nancy Webb Lincoln of Santa Monica, Calif., a medical re searcher who lived longer than any other victim of acute granulocytic leukemia in the nation, died yesterday of the disease after almost two years of experimental medication. The wife of Dr. Thomas L. Lincoln of New Haven, she was 42 years old.

title: 102Floor Climb Hailed
description: Two policemen who per formed a strenuous task during Sunday night's electrical black outa 48minute climb up stairways to two Empire State Building observatoriesre ceived certificates of merit from Police Commissioner Pat rick V. Murphy yesterday. Sgt.
