Joseph Raguso and Patrolman Harry Goulding of the West 35th Street station were hon ored for bringing lighting, food and reassurance to 60 sightseers on the 86th and 102d floors.

title: Laird and Rogers, Explaining Drive, Seem to Modify G.I Withdrawal Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9The Secretary of State and the Secretary of Defense went to Capitol Hill today with the message that the incursion into Laos would insure American troop withdrawals from Viet nam and shorten the war.

title: ANTIWAR SOLDIER WINS COURT PLEA
description: A Federal judge in Brooklyn ordered the Army yesterday to return to duty at Fort Wads worth, S. I., a member of the 26th Army Band who was trans ferred to Fort Bliss., Tex., last July after he had engaged in antiwar activity.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9In this latest crisis in the. Indochina war, when we are being told once more that the latest adventure into Laos will surely put an end to the long agony, it may be pru dent to look back at the record.

title: BONN SEES A RIFT IN SOVIET POLICY
description: BONN, Feb. 9The West German Government believes that a division has developed in the Soviet leadership over Chancellor Willy. Brandt's pol icy of seeking improved rela tions with Eastern Europe.

title: Dance: Paul Taylor's Big Bertha Has Premiere
description: There has for long been a touch of the macabre in Paul Taylor's choreography  a touch that could be seen in works as diverse as Three Epitaphs and Scudorama. But with Big Bertha, given its premiere last night at the ANTA Theater, Mr. Taylor really made our flesh creep.

title: Julie Holmes of U.S. Takes Big Lead in Figure Skating at PreOlympic Meet
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Feb. 9 (AP)Julie Lynn Holmes of Lit tleton, Colo., traced three com pulsory designs with nearper fect precision today and took a big lead for women's figure skating honors in the preview of the 1972 Winter Olympics.

title: Snell Is Ready and Willing for 1971
description: After four months of un certainty, Matt Snell dis closed yesterday his intention of returning to the New York Jets next season following serious heel surgery.

title: Chemical Maker Net Falls in Quarter
description: The Dow Chemical Company reported yesterday that its net income in 1970 before extraor dinary items totaled $132, 400,000, or $4.38 a share, down from $148,700,000, or $4.91 a share, after special credits in 1969.

title: Court Urges A.&P. President To Meet Breadbasket Leaders
description: A State Supreme Court jus tice said yesterday that there were great social issues in the dispute between the A. & P. food stores chain and Opera tion Breadbasket here.

title: Florida Golf Postponed
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Feb. 9 (AP)The Florida Citrus open golf tournament, scheduled for Feb. 25 through 23 at Tampa, has been postponed until the fall, the tournament players di vision of the Professional Golf ers' Association announced to day.

title: Senate Republicans Give Thurmond Full Seniority
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (AP)  Senate Republicans settled a sixyearold question today by voting unanimously to give Senator Strom Thurmond of South Carolina full seniority. That ranks him 12th on the seniority list of Republican Sen ators.

title: Blue Cross in Jersey Asks A Rate Rise of 18 Per Cent
description: TRENTON, Feb. 9 (AP)The Blue Cross hospital service plan of New Jersey proposed today an average rate increase of 18.4 per cent for nearly 2.2 million of its subscribers.

title: Postal Employe Killed During Pilfering Arrest
description: A postal inspector last night fatally shot a postal employe while he was being arrested for allegedly pilfering mail at the Morgan Post Office Annex at 341 Ninth Avenue.

title: Baltimore Museum of Art Finds Director on Coast
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 9 (AP) Tom L. Freudenheim, assistant director of the University of California Art Museum at Ber keley, has been named director of the Baltimore Museum of Art.

title: North Vietnam Election Set
description: HANOI. North Vietnam, Feb. (Agence FrancePresse)North Vietnam will hold its first legis lative elections since 1964 on April 11, an official statement said today. The country will elect 420 members of National Assembly. The voting age in North Vietnam is 18.

title: Advertising:
description: Recently, the folks who are in charge of advertising for Gimbels New York de cided that what they needed, instead of one art director overseeing everything, was two art directors with re sponsibilities divided like the rest of the store's merchan dising.

title: 2 Doomed in Ritual Killing
description: JAIPUR, India, Feb. 9 Reu ters)  Two men have been sentenced to death at Udairmr near this centralIndian city for the sacrificial killing of a 12yearold boy to appease Hindu goddess.

title: CHRYSLER SHOWS 4THPERIOD PROFIT
description: DETROIT, Feb. 9The Chrys ler Corporation reported today that it earned $7.6million, equal to 15 cents a share, in its fourth quarter, but lost $7.6 million in the full year.

title: MRS. BERNARD ARKIN
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 9Mrs. Dorothy Cantor Arkin, widow of Bernard Arkin, a founder of ArkinMedo, Inc., a photographic supply house in Flushing, Queens, died yester day of a heart attack. She was 78 years old and lived at 41 Park Avenue in New York.

title: Unbeaten Marquette Five Posts 19th Victory, 9856
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 19 (UPI) Unbeaten Marquette rolled methodically to its 19th victory of the season and 31st in a row over two years tonight, routing WisconsinMilwaukee, 9856.

title: The Marines Stand Fast
description: WASHINGTON Marines are facing new challenges. Transition is the key word, undiminished professionalism is the standard. For the marines and for the Corps, the commandant set a minimum requirement lean, tough, professional, disciplined, fully combat ready. In spite of troop withdrawals that have reduced the Marine Corps commitment from a 1968 high of 86,730 to the present strength of 24,800, the marines' pacification and Vietnamization efforts continue.

title: Soybean Futures Show Some Gains As Grains Decline
description: Soybean futures managed to gain more than a cent a bushel for most deliveries in moderate ly active trading yesterday. However, the bean prices played follow the leader, mov ing up after a show of strength early yesterday in soybean oil and meal.

title: RISE IN BET TAX AROUSES FRENCH
description: PARIS, Feb. 9The French Government has just decided to increase its slice of parimutuel betting on horse racing by an other 43 per cent.

title: Ministers Join the Army
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Feb. 9 (Agence FrancePresse)  All ministers in the new Govern ment have been enlisted in the army, an official source said to day. They will undergo military training and then be commis sioned.

title: Suns Defeat Bullets
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 9 (UPI) The Phoenix Suns, fighting for a playoff berth, pulled away in the final three minutes to beat the Baltimore Bullets, 120115 tonight despite a season high of 38 points by Earl Monroe.

title: POP GROUP CONCERT CANCELED IN LONDON
description: LONDON, Feb. 9 (UPI)A joint concert by The Mothers of Invention, an American pop group, and the Royal Philhar monic Orchestra at Royal Al bert Hall was called off last night when officials at the hall objected to the program.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: AMERICAN EAGLE WINS OCEAN RACE
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 9 (AP)While about 20 boats still fought their way through 10foot seas, American Eagle was named the official winner of the St. Petersburg toFort Lauderdale ocean yacht race tonight, with Running Tide second and Windward Passage third.

title: PEKING WIDENING TIES WITH ARABS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 9 After more than three years of selfimposed isolation because of the Cultural Revolution, Communist China is making both a political and economic comeback in Arab countries.

title: Nice Guy and Nice Place Recognized
description: About Motor Sports

title: Abortion Brokers Are Under Study
description: July 1, 1970, was the day on which it became legal for any woman to obtain an abortion in New York State and, as it has turned out, a day of opportunity for a handful of entrepreneurs who have found in the hard won reform the basis for one of the most lucrative businesses of the year.

title: 21 Policemen Face Knapp Investigation In a Theft of Meat
description: The Knapp Commission, which has been investigating reports of police corruption, has subpoenaed 21 policemen for questioning about the bur glary of a Greenwich village meatpacking plant last month.

title: Auto Insurance Resumed
description: The Nationwide Mutual In surance Company of Columbus, Ohio, the fifthlargest auto insurer in the nation, said yes terday it would resume, on a limited basis, the sale of auto insurance to new customers. The company stopped selling to new customers last September because it did not have the financial capacity to handle it.

title: Senators Acquire Janeski
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (AP) The Washington Senators ac quired Jerry Janeski, a right handed pitcher, from Chicago today. The White Sox got an outfielder, Rick Reichardt, in exchange.

title: Miss Atkins Testifies She Killed Sharon Tate
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 9 (UPI) Susan Atkins confessed to day that she had personally killed Sharon Tate, the actress, but that the killings in the Tate home had been the idea of the state's key witness, Mrs. Linda Kasabian.

title: State of the Environment
description: President Nixon's message to Congress on the en vironment is highly reassuring on several counts. Com prehensive in scope and forthright in language, demonstrates the degree to which the physical state of the country's air, land and water is now accepted as a serious national issue.

title: Electronic Bullishness
description: Economic Analysis

title: Reds Said to Buy Laotian Rice
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 9 Wellinformed American sources here say that the South Vietnamese incursion into the Ho Chi Minh Trail area in the northern sector of the Laos panhandle will not cut the North Vietnamese off from food supplies.

title: European Interest in Apollo Dwindles
description: LONDON, Feb. 9European interest in the United States space program has, with nota ble exceptions, dwindled since the first manned moon landing of Apollo 11 in July, 1969, and the troublefraught flight of Apollo 13 last April.

title: Assembly Studying Plan To Ease Localities' Costs
description: ALBANY, Feb. 9Details of a plan under which the state would relieve localities of most of the costs of welfare and court systems were released to day in a study document by the staff of the Assembly Ways and Means Committee.

title: Laos Incursion Is Given Vietnamese Code Name
description: Operation Dewey Canyon II, the United States com mand announced in Saigon yesterday, is no more. The command has adopted the South Vietnamese designa tion, Lam Son 719.

title: 13 Hurt in 23d St. Bar Explosion
description: At least 13 people were in jured yesterday morning, two of them critically when a gas explosion tore through the Golden Goose Bar and Res taurant at 67 West 23d Street, east of the Avenue of the Americas.

title: A Winner Is Forgetting What It's Like
description: YONKERS, Feb. 9Car mine Abbatiello may have lost 41 straight racesor morein the past, but no one, including Carmine, could recall tonight when he had suffered so long a losing streak at Yonkers Raceway.

title: Soviet Gives No Sign. It Will Act on Laos
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 9The So viet Union continued to de nounce the United States today for the allied incursion into Laos but gave no sign that it would take any action to bol ster the Communist cause in Indochina.

title: DISNEY PRODUCTIONS SUES GOLDMAN FIRM
description: In a $1.5million lawsuit, Walt Disney Productions, of Burbank, Calif., accused a New York brokerage house yester day of a fraudulent scheme. The Disney concern said it had been persuaded to buy promis sory notes of the Penn Central Transportation Company.

title: ISRAEL IS WILLING TO DISCUSS CANAL
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 9Pre mier Golda Meir declared today that Israel was ready to sup port the reopening of the Suez Canal, and to discuss with the United Arab Republic a mutual deescalation of the military confrontation.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE BATTLE STALIN LOST. Memoirs of Yugoslavia 19481953. By Vladimir Dedi jsr. 341 pages. Viking. $8.50.

title: Bruins Crush Rangers, 63, and Gain 9Point Lead;
description: BOSTON, Feb. 9Winning a game they had to, by scoring when they had to, the Bruins to night dealt the Rangers a crushing 63 defeat, knocking the New Yorkers 9 points be hind them in the National Hockey League's East Division.

title: ADVERTISED PRICES ROSE IN DECEMBER
description: Merchandise advertised by department stores was only fractionally higher in price dur ing December than in the year before, according to the Bureau of Advertising, a division of the American Newspaper Publish ers Association.

title: Leo Samuels, an Executive In Movie Industry, Was 62
description: MERRICK, L. I., Feb. 9Leo Samuels, a motionpicture in dustry executive, died yester day. He was 62 years old and lived at 1852 Carroll Avenue.

title: LAM BY SMITH WINS FOR BUCKS
description: DETROIT, Feb. 9 (UPI)Greg Smith sank a layup with 22 seconds to play, enabling the Milwaukee Bucks to defeat the Detroit Pistons, 107106, before 11,468 spectators in the Na tional Basketball Association tonight.

title: Car Division to Continue
description: LONDON, Feb. 9 (UPI) E. Rupert Nicholson, Rolls receiv er and manager, said today that he would take all nec essary steps to continue the car division of the company, which manufactures luxury au tomobiles.

title: EDWARD L. WHELAN
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Feb. 9 Edward L. Whelan, a real es tate and insurance broker here and Union County Democratic chairman from 1931 to 1951, died of a heart attack today at his home. He was 79 years old and lived here at 220 West Jer sey Street.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Gustav Davidson Dies at 75; ExOfficial of Poetry Society
description: Gustav Davidson, former sec retary of the Poetry Society of America and authority on the appearances of angels in litera ture, died Saturday of a heart attack at his home, 200 East 36th Street. He was 75 years old.

title: City, With New Coach, Bows To Hartford Quintet, 7369
description: WEST HARTFORD, Feb. 9 Tom Meade converted two free throws with nine seconds re mining to insure a 7369 bas ketball victory for Hartford over City College tonight.

description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 9 (AP) The Democratic National Committee named its first Na tional Finance Council today with a dual goal of reducing the party's 59.3million debt from 1968 and preparing for next year's Presidential cam paign.
