description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 11  Yields on 91 and 182day Treasury bills dropped sharp ly again at today's weekly auc tion, the Government an nounced late this afternoon.

title: Fire Officers Demand 20% Hazard Bonus
description: The Uniformed Fire Officers Association yesterday demand rd a 20 per cent bonus in its new contract as hazardous ehity pay and predicted trou ble for the city if it did not get it.

title: Squires Beat Floridians
description: MIAMI BEACH, Feb. 11 (AP) The Virginia Squires scored 8 points in the final 59 seconds tonight to defeat the Floridians, 125119.

title: Ad Director Is Moving To McCall's Magazine
description: Joseph P. R. Welty, who has been advertising director of House Beautiful, will be moving from that Hearst Magazines publication to McCall's. The title, however, remains the same.

title: Accord Is Seen Near In Garage Dispute; Union Vote Planned
description: Union representatives for 3,500 striking workers who have closed down 600 parking garages in Manhattan and the Bronx have scheduled a ratifi cation vote for tomorrow on possible new agreement.

title: Purge in Warsaw
description: Poland's Communist leadership has undergone its sec ond purge in less than two months. Wladyslaw Gomulka, who ruled Poland dictatorially for well over a decade, has now been suspended from the Central Committee, saved from expulsion only by his illness. Men who only a few weeks ago were regularly praised as the wisest Communists in Poland are now being routinely de nounced as incompetents and worse.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Trout Unlimited and the Association of Northwest Steelheaders, together rep resenting about 12,000 sports men  conservationists, have joined forces. Trout Unlim ited is a national organi zation dedicated to the con servation and protection of trout and salmon and the waters that support them.

title: $40,000 Pact Makes Swoboda Only Half Contrite
description: The new Ron Swoboda, who said he had matured, signed his 1971 Mets' con tract yesterday, along with his close friend and restau rant partner, Ed Kranepool.

title: Juice Futures Dip As Report Implies Big Orange Crop
description: Prices of frozen orange juice concentrate dropped yesterday following a Government crop report. The report indicated that supplies of Florida oranges are larger than last year despite talk of the effects of a freeze.

title: Papp Shakespeare Unit To Offer 4 New Works
description: The New York Shakespeare Festival, which faced the pos sibility of having to close last summer because of inability to meet mortgage and construc tion payments, has come back strong this season with one of its most ambitious programs.

title: 50 CHILDREN FLEE FIRE IN BROOKLYN
description: A fire forced about 50 chil dren  all of them reported fathered by a selfappointed ministerto flee their dormi tory quarters in a fourstory building in Brooklyn yesterday.

title: Congressmen Visit Kenya
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Feb. 12 (Reuters)Three United States Congressmen arrived in Kenya today as part of a study tour of Africa. They are Represen tatives Charles C. Diggs, of Michigan, chairman of the House subcommittee on Africa, J. Irving Whalley, Republican of Pennsylvania, and J. Herbert Burke, Republican of Florida.

title: Protest by Pathet Lao
description: TOKYO, Feb. 12 (AP)  Prince Souphanouvong, head of the Pathet Lao, the Commu nistled Laotian rebels, has ur gently asked the cochairmen of the Geneva Conference to stop what he called an aggressive operation in Laos by United States and South Vietnamese troops.

title: Stores Are Bridging Generation Gap With Buyers Under 30
description: When I walk into a Seventh Ave nue manufacturer's for the first time and say, I'm from Bergdorf. Show me the line, they think I'm kidding.

title: Big Gap at the Briefings on Laos
description: News Analysis

title: Realities of Abortion
description: On Oct. 8, 1970, a 20yearold unmarried clinic patient from Manhat tan had an abortion at the Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center. During the procedure one of the instruments perforated the wall of her uterus. Over the next few hours it became apparent that she was bleeding inter nally. She was returned to the operat ing room, where a hysterectomy was performed. Ten pints of blood were administered, She has survived and done well.

title: First Steps Reported
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Feb. 12  Premier Lon Nol took few steps alone this morning for the first time since his stroke, according to a high ranking Cambodian military of ficer who visited the Premier today.

title: Wiechers Shoots a 64 and Ties With Palmer for Bob Hope Golf Lead at 204
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Feb. 12 (AP)  Jim Wiechers shot a remarkable eightunderpar 64 today and moved into a tie with Arnold Palmer for first place at 204 in the third round of the $140,000 Bob Hope De sert Golf Classic.

title: Princeton Tops Yale, 81.71
description: NEW HAVEN, Feb. 12 Princeton scored 10 straight points midway through the first half tonight to break open close game and register an 81 71 Ivy League victory over Yale.

title: MRS. PETER ZENKL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 Mrs. Pavia Zenkl, wife of Dr. Peter Zenkl, a noted leader of democratic Czechoslovakia, died here last Friday after long illness. She was 84 years old.

title: Sports of The Times At the Gloves
description: At 14, Joe Barresi was sickly and skinny and soft prey for every bully in Bayonne, N. J. With his father's encour agement, he took boxing lessons, and within three years fought his way into the semifinals of the Golden Gloves. A year later, he won the Hudson County Diamond Belt tournament at 147 pounds. But his greatest triumph, he says, the finest moment of his life, occurred only nine months after he began taking the lessons. The most threat ening bully of his childhood tried to crash ahouse party of Joe's social club. When Joe barred the way, the bully said, You want to step outside?

title: 2 Rabbis Here Score Governor For Stand on PrivateSchool Aid
description: The heads of two major Jew ish Orthodox groups criticized Governor Rockefeller yesterday for what they said was his failure to keep a pledge to aid nonpublic schools.

title: U.S. Embassy in Manila Hit
description: MANILA, Feb. 12 (UPI)A bomb went off on the grounds of the United States Embassy Chancery tonight, blasting, a hole into the wall and shatter ing two windows. No one was hurt. It was the first such ex plosion on the embassy's grounds, although bombs hard previously been set off in front of the building.

title: China. Italy Name Envoys
description: ROME, Feb. 12  The For eign Ministry announced today the names of ambassadors whom Italy and Communist China had earlier agreed to ex change. Italy has accepted the nomination of Shen Ping, 52 years old, who for several years was charg d'affaires in Lon don. The Italian envoy will be Folco Trabalza, 57, who has been ambassador in Belgrade since 1967.

title: VILLANOVA POSTS FASTEST MEDLEY
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 12Marty Liquori's brilliant onemile anchor leg of 3 minutes 57.4 seconds helped Villanova run the fastest distance medley re lay ever tonight in the United States Track and Field Federa tion's national indoor cham pionships at the Astrodome.

title: MERGER PLAN SET ON ROSS MEDICAL
description: Merger News

title: Lockheed Is Discussed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 (Reuters)Treasury Secretary John Connally today called in the British Ambassador, the Earl of Cromer, to discuss the transatlantic crisis over the Lockheed Tristar airliner, in formed sources said.

title: Layoffs Set at Fiat
description: TURIN, Italy, Feb. 12 (UPI) Fiat, Europe's largest car build er, announced today it would have to lay off 37,000 work men for, at least three days next week because of a continued shortage of plastic parts. A wildcat strike by men making the plastic parts already has caused several days of layoffs.

title: C.A.B. CHIEF GOING TO ROLLS TALKS
description: The chairman of the Civil Aeronautics Board, Secor D. Browne, plans to fly to Britain tomorrow to look into the prob lems of the RollsRoyce jet en gine that has created a turmoil in the aviation world.

title: MRS. ALICE ROWLAND, LEGISLATOR, 76, DIES
description: RIDGEFIELD, Conn., Feb. 12 Mrs. Alice V. McSherry Row land, former state legislator from this community for six terms and the first woman dep uty sheriff in Fairfield County, died yesterday at her winter home in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. Her age was 76.

title: Mauduit of France Victor In PreOlympics Slalom
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Feb. 12 (AP)  Georges Mauduit of France won the men's giant slalom today and the Soviet Union finally was shut out in the race for gold medals in the International Winter Sports Week.

title: University's Tuition Stands
description: OLEAN, N.Y., Feb. 12 (AP) In an effort to hold the line on costs, St. Bonaventure Univer sity said today that it would not raise tuition next year. Tuition is now $1,600. The Rev. Reginald Redlen, president of the university, said the effort was being made ...because we recognize the tremendous squeeze inflation places on every one. He said, however, that the price of room and board would be raised for the 197172 academic year by $100 to $1,200.

title: UNION VOTES TODAY ON GARAGE ACCORD
description: About 3,500 workers in 600 parking garages in Manhattan and the Bronx will begin vot ing today at 8 A.M. on a proposed new contract offer designed to end a strike now in its 11th day.

title: Army Plans Raise For Combat Forces To Spur Volunteers
description: A shortage of volunteers for combat forces  infantry, ar mor and artilleryis emerging as the major problem in raising the volunteer Army sought by President Nixon.

title: MRS. HAMILTON HARVEY
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., Feb. 12 Mrs. Marion Condit Harvey, widow of Hamilton St. John Harvey, a vice president of the advertising firm of Albert FrankGuenther Law, Inc., in New York, died yesterday at the Crestwood Nursing Home in Whippany. She was 87 years old and lived at 16 Miller Road.

title: PERSONAL INCOME REGISTERS, A GAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12  Personal income rose by $7.9 billion in January, about twice as much as in the average month of 1970, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Lost Glory Sought in a SoupedUp Tractor
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Feb. 10  The last 12 months have not been good to John Klug.

title: Steel Production in Britain Fell 1.3% in Last Quarter
description: LONDON, Feb. 12 (UPI)  British steel production dropped an estimated 1.3 per cent In the last quarter of 1970, com pared with the previous quar ter, the Department of Trade and Industry said today. Be cause of the postal strike, only about half of the normal re turns reached the department, so the figures were only tenta tive.

title: A.B.C. Report Is Denied
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 12 (AP)The United States Command issued a state ment today denying a report by the American Broadcasting Company indicating that Amer ican advisers were operating with South Vietnamese air borner units in Laos.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Funding Family Planning
description: Four years ago the United States Agency for Inter national Development had a budget of only $4 million for family planning assistance and there was no popula tion program as such at the United Nations. This year the agency has $100 million earmarked for family plan ning activities, of which $12.5 million has just been pledged to the United Nation's threeyearold Fund for Population Activities. The hope is that the American pledge will be matched by other nations, thus meeting a goal of $25 million for the world fund in 1971.

title: SCIENTISTS OPEN APOLLO 1.4 ROCKS
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 12  Scien tists got their first look today at some of the rocks returned from the moon by the Apollo 14 astronauts.

title: Auto Output Declines
description: DETROIT, Feb. 12 (AP) With the American Motors Cor poration shut down this week for inventory adjustments. Un ited States auto production schedules dropped by 6,700 cars this week, the trade paper, Automotive News, reported yesterday.

title: U.S. Says Lon Nol Will Fly to Hawaii For Recuperation
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 (Reuters)  Premier Lon Nol of Cambodia will be flown to Honolulu for medical treatment at the United States Army's Triplar Hospital, the State De partment said today. The Pre mier suffered a stroke in Pnom penh on Monday.

title: U.C.L.A. Defeats Oregon On Bibby's Late Shot, 6968
description: EUGENE. Ore., Feb. 12 (UPI) Henry Bibby stole the ball and sank a layup with 43 sec onds to play tonight to give topranked University of Cali fornia, Los Angeles, a 6963 victory over Oregon.

title: Isabelle Mir Captures World Cup Giant Slalom by 26100ths of a Second
description: BEAUPRE, Quebec, Feb. 12 The French came up with dark horse special and a 123 finish today as the internation al ski racing circus moved into the St. Lawrence River valley country for a threeday stand.

title: Clarkson Six Routs R.P.I.
description: POTSDAM, N. Y., Feb. 12 Clarkson College led all the way to defeat Rensselaer Poly technic Institute in hockey, 81, tonight. Eight Clarkson players scored.

title: TAXICAB BILL DUE FOR A VOTE SOON
description: Taxicab legislation, stalled so long that it has become an embarrassment for City Council leaders, is expected to be brought out for Council action next week.

title: Underworld Hoodlum Indicted In Beating at the Playboy Club
description: A grand jury that Is inves tigating alleged unorthodox practices in the New York Playboy Club has indicted man described by investigators as an underworld hoodlum on charges of beating and slash ing a West Point cadet at the club last April.

title: WEEKLY TV PROGRAM TO STUDY CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 Congressional leaders from both parties will be invited to participate in a nonprofit tele vision series beginning Feb. 28.

title: G.E. to Cut Output Of Big Appliances
description: There was some good news and some bad news yesterday for employes of major compan ies.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: NEW WEEKLY BIOGRAPHICAL SERVICE. The New York Times Biographical Edition. Profiles of today's newsmakers in a loose leaf edition. Write: The New York Times. Library Services. Box FP480, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N. Y. 10036.ADVT.

title: No Room for Reason
description: The abrupt embargo clamped by Federal officials on slum clearance funds due New York City escalates the destructive spirit of contest and confrontation that has regularly marred progress in this delicate area of governmental enterprise. There can be no worthy, excuse for it.

title: EMIGRE CROUP SAYS LITHUANIAN IS DEAD
description: An antiCommunist Lithu anian organization asserted yesterday that the Lithuanian sailor who was denied asylum aboard a Coast Guard cutter last fall is dead.

title: Turned On by Windmills
description: SANTA FE, N. M.Last August, to get away from suffocating smog, I drove my family west to Santa Fe. The car radio kept us informed about the ordeal of the big cities and their faltering machines, but around us the Great Plains told a far different story. Above all we marveled at the sight of working windmillscreaky senti nels of a bygone ageand the con trast left me with windmills on my mind.

title: Executive Changes
description: Richard H. Humm has been elected president and general manager of the StephensAdamson Division of BorgWarner Corporation.

title: Maryland Aide Withholds Study of Rap Brown Charge
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 12Attor ney General Francis B. Burch of Maryland said today that he had completed a special in vestigation of charges that H. Rap Brown was falsely indicted for arson in Maryland in 1967, but he refused to disclose his findings.

title: Du Pont Calls Off Plant
description: Du Pont of Canada, Ltd., an nounced yesterday that it had abandoned plans to build a polyesterfiber plant at Mait land, Ontario, becaus of eco nomic conditions. The plant was to have cost more than $20million. E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc., owns close to 75 per cent of the Canadian company's outstanding shares.

title: Japanese Diplomat on Trip To improve Ties to China
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 12 (Reu ters)A former Japanese For eign Minister, Aiichiro Fujiya ma, left here by train for Peking today to sound out prospects for improving relations between China and Japan.

title: Honda Announces Engine That Limits Exhaust Gas
description: TOKYO, Feb. 12 (Reuters) The Honda Motor Company to day announced the develop ment of a new auto engine that can reduce exhaust gases to onefifth of those of conven tional engines.

title: OTTO J. MEIDENBAUER
description: Otto J. Meidenbauer, who had been with the New York Mer cantile Exchange for 43 years, died Thursday evening at his home, 6149 62d Road, Middle Village, Queens. He was 60 years old.

title: QUOTA Cur IS URGED BY COFFEE COUNCIL
description: LONDON, Feb. 12 (UPI)  Sixtysix member nations of the International Coffee Agreement decided tonight to slash the amount of coffee earmarked for the world market this year by three million bags if prices continued to drop.

title: MRS. ABZUG OPENS A DISTRICT OFFICE
description: From uptown, downtown, midtown, Chinatown, City Hall and points between, a wide spectrum of constituents and friends (some former opponents) crowded around Bella Abzug yesterday to celebrate the opening of her new Congres sional office here.

title: STATE FORECASTS $499MILLION RISE IN FUNDS FOR CITY
description: ALBANY, Feb. 12Richard L. Dunham, the State Budget Director, estimated today that New York City would receive, $499million out of the $950 million in additional aid to local communities provided for in Governor Rockefeller's proposed $8.45billion budget for 197172.

title: National Airlines to Drop 16 Flights From 6 Cities
description: National Airlines announced yesterday that it planned to eliminate 16 daily flight depar tures from six cities next week. The cutback will reduce its flight operations by 4 per cent to 748 hours a month, the air line said.

title: Tuition Rises at Clark U.
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Feb. 12 (AP)A $159 tuition rise to maintain a balanced budget was announced today by Clark University. The increase, effec tive next September, will bring tuition to $2,600.

title: 20 FLORIDA CONVICTS WOUNDED BY GUARDS
description: RAIFORD, Fla., Feb. 12 (AP)  Shotgunarmed guards opened fire on about 600 in mates at Raiford State Prison tonight, wounding 20 prisoners, as a onedayold hunger strike erupted in violence, prison of ficials said.

title: SAILOR IS FREED IN LOYALTY CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 (UPI)  The United States Navy Court of Military Review has reversed the courtmartial conviction of Seaman Roger L. Priest of Houston on charges of promoting disloyalty in the armed fortes by publication of an antiwar newsletter.

title: Knicks Lose Sixth in Row, 125116, as Bellamy Paces Hawks With 33 Points
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 12Walt Bellamy, a former Knicker bocker, took advantage of the absence of Willis Reed tonight to score 33 points and grab 18 rebounds, leading the Atlanta Hawks to a 125116 victory over the Knicks before a capac ity crowd of 7,129 at Alexan der Memorial Coliseum.

title: SUBURB HOUSING OPPOSED IN COURT
description: Residents of Ramapo in Rock land County charged in Fed eral Court yesterday that two proposed lowincome housing projects would ruin the town's quiet suburban quality.

title: Some Fellow Mayors Believe Lindsay's a Good Bet for 1972
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 12 Several of John V. Lindsay's fellow mayors said today that they expected him to rise on the rubble of the citiesas one of them put itand be come a candidate for President in 1972.

title: Michigan Parsons Bank Is Put Into Receivership
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Feb. 12 (AP)  The Federal Deposit In1 surance Corporation was named receiver today of the Birmingham  Bloomfield Bank, which was ordered closed aft er state officials found it in solvent.

title: U.N. Agency Backs Indoor Use Of DDT to Combat Mosquitoes
description: GENEVA, Feb. 12  The World Health Organization de fended today the use of DDT to kill mosquitoes indoors.

title: Canucks Clip Wings, 53
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, Feb. 12 (UPI)Mike Cor rigan tallied a pair of goals tonight, one to open the scor ing in the first period and the other breaking a tie late in the third, to spark the Vancouvex. Canucks to a 53 triumph over the Detroit Red Wings.

title: Show to Cut Glenn Debt
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Feb. 12 (UPI)Backers of John H. Glenn Jr. will try to reduce the $163, 434 debt from the former astro naut's unsuccessful sersate cam paign last year with a show in Cleveland March 20. The show will be called An Evening With the Stars.

title: Wheat Futures Register a Drop As Trading Slows for Holiday
description: Trading moved more slowly than usual on the nation's commodity futures exchanges yesterday because of the Lin coln's Birthday holiday yester day. Several of the major ex changes, such as the Chicago Board of Trade and the Chicago Mercantile Exchange, remained open, but many of the others were closed.

title: 80,000 Are Permitted to Return To Their Homes in Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 12 (AP) Thousands of evacuated fam ilies were allowed to return to, their homes today. They had been evacuated after Tuesday's earthquake cracked the dam of the city's largest reservoir, cre ating fears of a rupture.

title: S.E.C. Seeks Court Curb On HomeStake Production
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 (UPI) The Securities and Exchange Commission today asked the Federal court in Washington to enjoin the HomeStake Pro duction Company from further violations of the securities law.

title: W. EUGENE KOGER
description: SCOTCH PLAINS, N. J., Feb. 12  Eugene Roger, vice presi dent of the IngersollRand Com pany, New York machinery distributor, died today after short illness. He was 45 years old and lived at 2222 Edgewood Terrace.

title: 3 Firemen Hurt in Blaze That Leaves 79 Homeless
description: Three firemen were reported Injured yesterday while fight ing a threealarm fire that de stroyed two fivestory apart ment houses at 125 and 127 St. Ann's Avenue in the South Bronx. leaving 79 persons homeless.

title: Mays Leaves Hospital
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 12 (AP)  Willie Mays returned home today after three days in a hospital for treatment of a cyst on his right arm. Mays said the cyst was clearing up and he wanted to rest. He said he planned to join the San Francisco Giants spring camp at Casa Grande, Ariz., on Feb. 22.

title: Dr. Nathaniel Freeman Dies; Expert in Periodontal Field
description: Dr. Nathaniel Freeman, an oral surgeon and a leader in the periodontal field, died of leu kemia Thursday evening in St. Croix, Virgin Islands. He was 75 years old and lived in Piscat away, N. J.

title: HAIMOWITZ OFFERS BEETHOVEN SONATAS
description: It takes a brave pianist to make a program out of Beetho ven's last three sonatas. They are difficult technically, even more difficult musically. Yet this is the program that Ely Haimowitz chose for his New York debut in Alice Tully Hall on Thursday night. A Floridian by birth, he now lives at the other end of the country as an associate professor at the Uni versity of Nevada in Reno.

title: BUCHANAN KEEPS CROWN ON COAST
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 12 (UPI)  Ken Buchanan of Scotland used a pistonlike left jab to pound out a unanimous 15 round decision over Ruben Na varro of Los Angeles tonight in his first defense of the world lightweight championship.

title: Optimism in Cairo
description: CAIRO, Feb. 12  A bit of optimism stirred here today on the chances for an extension of the Suez Canal ceasefire, scheduled to expire March 7, as Cairo indicated approval of a peace initiative by Dr. Gun nar V. Jarring.

title: PISTONS SUBDUE 76ERS, 118 TO 109
description: DETROIT, Feb. 12 (UPI) Scoring bursts by Dave Bing, Jimmy Walker and Bob Lanier enabled the Detroit Pistons to defeat the Philadelphia 76ers. 118109, tonight in a National Basketball Association contest.

title: KOCH OUSTS RICHEY IN CM AIR NET
description: Topseeded Cliff Richey of San Angelo, Tex., was ousted from the $30,000 Clean Air Tennis Classic last night by Tom Koch of Brazil. Two Iron Curtain players and a New Yorker joined Koch in the semi finals.

title: TV Liquor Ads Contemplated If Economic Slump Continues
description: A few distillers and liquor, dealers have made highly con tingent plans for spot adver tising on television if the cli mate of public opinion and video's depressed economics make more likely plugs for whiskies, brandies and other hard spirits.

title: Timothy N. Pfeiffer Dies at 84; Led Legal Aid Society 5 Years
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Feb. 12 Timothy N. Pfeiffer, for five years president of the Legal Aid Society of New York, died today at his home, 30A Castle Howard Court. He was 84 years old.

title: PENN RALLY TOPS BROWN, 70 TO 56
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Feb. 12 Penn's basketball team with stood Brown's mini slowdown and three variations of zone defenses tonight to record its 19th consecutive victory, in cluding seven in the Ivy League, 7056.

title: Israel Critical of Jarring's Latest Moves
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 12  Israel was reported today to be strongly opposed to the way Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring; the United Nations intermediary had carried out his role in the indirect ArabIsraeli peace talks this week.

title: STRELITZIAS SET FOR YONKERS PACE
description: YONKERS, Feb. 12Strelit zias were the elite guards who protected the czars of yester year Russia. Strelitzias now is the name of a 6yearold New Zealandbred pacer who will start from the rail in a $7,500, Class A2 onemile event at Yonkers Raceway tomorrow night.

title: Laos Declares Emergency As Red Pressure Mounts
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 12 Laos declared a state of emer gency today and transferred in ternal security matters from the police to military officers. A Government statement said that the change had been made because of recent develop ments in the military situation.

title: Bayh Supports 18YearOld Vote in All Elections
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 12 Senator Birch Bayh, sounding like a man with his eye on the 1972 national campaign, grasped the initiative today in the cam paign to lower the voting age to 18 an all elections.

title: RED CHINA WARNS ON MOVE IN LAOS
description: HONG KONG, Saturday, Feb. 13Communist China declared yesterday that it will not re main indifferent to the recent incursion into Laos by large numbers of U.S. and puppet forces.

title: ROBERT HOYT SR., HOSPITAL OFFICIAL
description: PERTH AMBOY, N. J., Feb. 12 Robert Stephens Hoyt Sr., di rector of Perth Amboy General Hospital for almost 10 years, died there yesterday, after hav ing been a patient for three weeks. He was 54 years old and lived at 720 Dartmoor, Westfield.

title: The NotSoLimited War
description: The barriers to a perilously wider war in Asia are crumbling fast. Last spring, when President Nixon ordered an allied attack against Communist sanctuaries inside the Cambodian border, he denied he was enlarging the war and indicated the incursions would be limited in time and space.

title: Mrs. Gropper Rewed
description: Mrs. Susan Weingarten Gropper of New York, widow of Jerome F. Gropper, a toy manufacturer, was married here yesterday to Harold A. Loewenheim, a widower, of Larchmont, N. Y. Rabbi Na than A. Perilman of Temple ErnanuEl performed the cere mony in his study. The bride groom was graduated with the class of '32 from Prince ton University and is a man ager of the Home Life In surance Company, New York.

title: Mrs. Hobson, Marketing Aide Wed in Suburbs
description: RYE, N. Y., Feb. 12Mrs. Angela Kelly Hobson, widow of William Heverin Hobson 3d, was married here this afternoon to Clair L. Farrand Jr. The bridegroom's brother, the Rev. John S. Farrand, performed the ceremony in the chapel of the Roman Catholic Church of the Res urrection.

title: Three Convicted of Theft Of $542,000 From Brink's
description: BOSTON, Feb. 12 (AP)  Three men were convicted to day of armed robbery in the $542,000 cash holdup of a Brink's, Inc., truck in 1968 and were sentenced to 25 to 50 years in state prison.

title: Donald Keats, Head Coach For Rhodes School, Dies
description: Donald B. Keats, athletic di rector and head coach of the Rhodes School, 11 West 54th Street, died Thursday night of a heart attack at Jamaica Es tates, Queens. He was 40 years old and lived at 176 Charing Cross, Lynbrook, L.I.

title: Cardinal Denies He Discussed Any Plan for the Pope to Resign
description: VIENNA, Feb. 12 (UPI) Franz Cardinal Knig, the Rom an Catholic Archbishop of Vienna, denied today that be had ever discussed a plan for Pope Paul VI to resign.

title: Polish Note Deplores U.S. Intervention in Laos
description: WARSAW, Feb. 12  The Polish Government moved to day as a member of the In ternational Control Commission for Laos to seek an end to American military intervention there.

title: Market Place: Cause of Clouds In Economic Sky
description: Is the outlook for the economy in 1972 and 1973 gloomy or buoyant? Albert H. Cox Jr., chief economist for Lionel D. Edie & Co., a Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., subsidiary thinks the gloom is over drawn.

title: Market for New Stock Issues Lists 8th Rise in Heavy Trading
description: The new issue market bounded ahead in heavy trading this week, posting its eighth consecutive advance.

title: Oilmen Fight for Guarantees As Deadline on Prices Nears
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Feb. 12 A group of 22 Western oil companies held out tonight against the demands of six Per sian Gulf states for increased oil revenues exceeding one bil lion dollars a year.

title: Why the Baits Rebel
description: NORMAN, Okla.The tragedy of Simas A. Kudirka, the Lithuanian sailor who was cynically returned to the Rus sians so that his defection would not jeopardize a fishing arrangement, brought national attention to an in credible violation of the American tra dition of granting sanctuary to political refugees.

title: SUPERVISORS VOTE TO JOIN A.F.LC.I.O.
description: FREEPORT, the Bahamas, Feb. 12  New York City school supervisors have voted, by 1,653 to 126, to affiliate with the American Federation of Labor and Congress of In dustrial Organizations.

title: FORDHAM TO TEST ST. JOHN'S TODAY
description: Fordham and St. John's meet in basketball at Madison Square Garden this afternoon and the outcome could do a lot in de termining whether Fordham goes to the National Invitation Tournament or the National Collegiate Athletic Association tourney.

title: 42 in Colombia Killed As a Bridge Collapses
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Feb. 12 (Reuters)At least 42 persons were reported killed today in northern Colombia when a bridge collapsed, hurling the truck in which they were riding into a river.

title: Hart Schaffner Negotiating For Joint Venture in Japan
description: Marubeni Iida, a Japanese trading and investment con cern, has announced in Tokyo that it is negotiating with Hart Schaffner & Marx, the Amer ican clothing manufacturer, to establish a joint venture in Japan.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Feb. 12Stuart Hamp shire, the English philosopher, wrote recently of the impact of Freud's dem onstration that human behavior is gov erned less by conscious than by unconscious thoughts and feelings. It was a Copernican revelation for men who understood, he said; it destroyed the comfortable feeling that we are easily in control of our own thoughts and purposes.

title: FEDAYEEN REPORT A JORDAN SUCCESS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 12 Arab commando spokesmen said here today that their men had destroyed a helicopter at Amman airport and had used captured artillery to rout Jor danian soldiers during a day of fighting on the outskirts of the capital.

title: LAVER, MRS. KING GAIN SEMIFINALS
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 12 Methodically, without the tradi tional fanfare that should ac company such feats, Rod Laver and Mrs. Billie Jean King are hiding winning streaks worthy of any in sport.

title: Dartmouth Triumphs, 8365
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Feb. 12 James grown, a sophomore, scored 24 points to pace Dart mouth to an 8365 Ivy League victory over Cornell tonight.

title: Post Office Is Enjoined On Pornography Law
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 12 (AP) A Federal judge has tem porarily blocked the Post Of fice from enforcing a new law under which persons who do not want sexually oriented mail can have it stopped automatically.

title: Book Prize Panel Picks 37 Leading Nominees
West Point Alumnus Released Honorably As a War Objector
description: A West Point graduate has won an honorable discharge on the ground that he is a con scientious objector.

title: J. C. Penney of Store Chain Dies; Built Business on Golden Rule
description: J. C. Penney, founder of the department store chain, died yesterday morning at the Hark ness Pavilion, ColumbiaPres byterian Medical Center. His age was 95.

title: Three Attractions Closing
description: Two Broadway productions and one Off Broadway musical will end their runs this week end. Conduct Unbecoming, the Barry England play, closes at the Barrymore Theater after tomorrow's matinee. It will have played 144 performances. Bob and RayThe Two and Only gives its last showing the 158th, tonight at the Golden Theater. And, Youre a Good Man, Charlie Brown ends its engagement tomorrow night at 1 the Theater 80 St. Marks after 11,597.

title: L.I. Nuptials for Dale D. Miller And Robert Max Frehse Jr.
description: GARDEN CITY, L. L, Feb. 12The Episcopal Cathedral of the Incarnation was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Dale Dunlap Miller, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Robinson Miller, to Robert Max Frehse Jr., son of the Rev. Dr. and Mrs. Frehse of Detroit. The bridegroom's father performed the ceremony. He was as sisted by Canon William God frey of the cathedral.

title: Theater: Basic Brecht
description: There is something very appropriate about seeing a Brecht play in a storefront theater on the Bowery in the company of an audience of appreciative young people. One visits the Workshop of the Players Art (W.P.A.) not to be comforted by sight lines, soft seats, and produc tion values, but to be arrested by basic Brecht  A Man's a Man.

title: Upstate Soldier Is Killed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 (UPI) The Defense Department an nounced today that Army Pfc. David A. Semmler of Webster, N. Y., near Rochester, had been killed in action in Indochina.

title: BonnIsrael Air Accord
description: BONN, Feb. 12 (AP)  West Germany and Israel signed an air traffic agreement today.

title: College Football Hall of Fame Names Neely and Anderson
description: Jess Neely and Dr. Eddie Anderson, each a college football coach for four dec ades, have been elected to the College Football Hall of Fame for 1971. They will be joined by eight former play ers later this year with in duction set for Dec. 7 here at the National Football Foundation's 14th annual awards dinner.

title: Plastic Welded Ultrasonically
description: Patents of the Week

title: RABBI IN DISPUTE WITH TRUSTEES
description: Members of a 126yearold Reform synagogue on the Up per East Side and its board of trustees are divided on wheth er to retain their longhaired rabbi, who is charged with be having in an irreligious man ner.

title: Mobil Oil Charged by U.S. With Fouling Indiana Canal
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 (UPI)The Justice Department filed criminal charges today against the Mobil Oil Corpora tion and another company in East Chicago, Ind., for pollut ing the Indiana Harbor Canal.

title: Cambodian General Killed, First of War
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Feb. 12 (UPI)  A Cambodian gen eral and 14 of his men were killed in a battle with enemy forces 65 miles south of Pnom penh, the Cambodian high com mand announced today. He was the first Cambodian general to die in the war in Cambodia.

title: Save the Gateway
description: Secretary of the Interior Rogers C. B. Morton has done something, but not quite enough, to quiet the growing uneasiness over prospects for the Gateway National Park. According to Mr. Morton, the disposal of Federal surplus land at Sandy Hook to the state of New Jersey need not prejudice its ultimate use as a key segment of the seashore project. But, if it is still the Government's intention to establish the park, why did the Department of the Interior needlessly release its hold on the tract in the first place, thus signaling the General Services Administration to get rid of it?

title: Bridge:Becker Is Sorry He Opened Hand on Which Slant
description: One of the bestknown fig ures in the world of bridge, locally, nationally, and inter nationally, is missing from the Greater New York Bridge Association's sectional tournament under way at the New York Hilton.

title: Art: A Documentary at Guggenheim
description: I guess it's sort of documentary. said an early visitor, relieved to find some thing to call the Sixth Gug genheim International Exhi bition, which opened at the Guggenheim Museum yester day. And documentary comes pretty close. Twenty one artists, many of whom object to being called artists, from eight countries, have installed demonstrations of their ideas (not exactly the same thing as works of art) in the minimal and/or con ceptual field of endeavor and its branches. The earth works branch is represented by some Brooklyn mud rubbed into patterns on the floor of the museum's top spiral.

title: Suit Against Mack Trucks Is Filed by Public. Leasing
description: The Public Leasing Corpora tion, an Oklahoma City truck leasing concern, filed a 653.5 million suit yesterday in Federal Court against Mack Trucks, Inc.

title: STOCKS END MIXED IN PARIS MARKET
description: The London Stock Exchange remained closed yesterday in preparation for Britain's change to decimal currency Monday.

title: Lockheed Layoff Met Philosophically
description: PALMDALE, Calif., Feb. 12The big orange and white jetTristar 1001cruised majestically above this desert plateau yesterday. The firstand perhaps lastof the Lock heed Aircraft Corporation's L1011 aircraft to fly, contin ued its flighttesting program without a hitch.

title: Alion Voices Objections
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 12Deputy Premier Yigal Alion criticized in a speech today the way Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nations representative, was conducting the indirect peace talks.

title: Greene Leads Bogota Golf
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Feb. 12 (AP)Bert Greene shot a six underpar 66 and took a two stroke lead over Roberto de Vicenzo today in the second round of the Lagartos interna tional golf tournament. Greene had a 36hole total of 136. Ro gelio Gonzalez, who tied for the firstround lead with de Vi cenzo at 68, fell to third at 139.

title: 4 BIG CAN COMPANIES IN LABOR PACT TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12Ne gotiators for the United Steel workers of America and four major can companies headed into a weekend of intensive bargaining over a new labor contract here tonight with the two sides far apart on basic money issues.

title: Auxiliary Bishop in Chicago
description: ROME, Feb. 12 (AP)Pope Paul VI has named Msgr. Nevin William Hayes, a missionary bishop, to be auxiliary bishop in Chicago, the Vatican an nounced today.

title: Jury Asks the chair For Two Bronx Men In Officer's Slaying
description: KINGSTON, N.Y., Feb. 12 (AP)  An Ulster County Court jury recommended a sentence of death today for two Bronx men convicted in the 1968 slay ing of a deputy sheriff.

title: Black Studies and White Myths
description: American intellectuals and Ameri can oppressors of blacks have often been closely, sometimes indistinguish ably linked. This perverse tangle once caused Sterling Brown, the poet and authority on American culture, to re mark that the black man has met with as great injustice from American scholarship as he has from American life. Nowhere is the Brown maxim more easily demonstrated than in American scholarship on Africa.

title: AMEX REGISTERS WIDE PRICE GAINS
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange advanced broadly yesterday, with 600 issues clos ing higher, 305 declining and 239 unchanged.

title: Things Are Just Fine in Iceland Except for Inflation, Taxes and...
description: The Talk of Revkjavik

title: Books of The Times
description: Though the British psychiatrist R. D. Laing has become a cult figure, he isnext to Erik Eriksonthe most important and original depth psychologist writing for lay men today. But just as Erikson's thought is both diminished and extended by such disciples as Robert Jay Lifton, Robert Coles and Kenneth Keniston, so Laing's work has now been cheapened by his disciple and coworker, David Cooper.

title: MAYOR DEPLORES ES. AID EMBARGO
description: Mayor Lindsay's office yes terday assailed as politically suspect a Federal decision to embargo funds for new slum clearance here because the an nouncement of the move fol lowed on the heels of the Mayor's attack earlier Thurs day on President Nixon's budget.

title: Loustalot, on 65 for 201, Scores by Stroke on Coast
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Feb. 12 (UPI)  Vic Loustalot shot a finalround 65 today to win the satellite $12,000 Hope of Tomorrow golf tournament by a stroke.

title: RATE OF DISCOUNT LOWERED TO 4%
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 The Federal Reserve Board an nounced today another small reduction in the discount rate, from 5 to 4 per cent.

title: Foes of Smoking Criticized
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., Feb. 12 (UPI)Antismoking crusaders were accused today of conceal ing the real cause of cancer and thus alienating millions of Americans who will not or can not break the habit. The charge was made before delegates to the annual midwinter meeting of the Tobacco Association of the United States by Horace R. Kornegay, a former North Caro lina Congressman, who de nounced Thou shalt not smoke crusades.

title: BEN JOSEPH
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Feb. 12  Ben Joseph, a dealer in den tal gold, died today of a heart attack in the Miami General Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived at 420 East 55th Street in New York.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SKI CARNIVAL LED BY NEW HAMPSHIRE
description: HANOVER, N. H., Feb. 12 Peter Dascoulias, a senior at the University of New Hamp shire, won the 15kilometer crosscountry race today and pushed the Wilcats into the team lead at the midway mark of the 61st annual Dartmouth College Winter Carnival.

title: Sack Cloth For Jeans: $14 a Pair
description: Shop Talk

title: Small Calculator Planned
description: TOKYO. Jan. 29 (Reuters) Two Japanese companies will start marketing this summer the world's smallest portable electronic calculator, a model developed jointly with the Mostek Corporation of Texas. The Busicom Corporation of Tokyo and the Nippon Calcu lating Machine Corporation of Osaka said today the pocket size calculator measured 5.7 by 2.2 by 0.8 inches.

title: Music: Mahler Addition
description: Conducting the Mahler First Symphony, Seiji Ozawa on Thursday evening took the New York Philharmonic through not only the usual four movements but also the recently discovered Blu mine andante. Originally Mahler included a second movement named Blumine A Chapter of Flowers. He dropped the movement when the score was pub lished, for reasons best known to himself. Perhaps he did not like it. Or perhaps he thought the symphony was long enough with four move ments. Or perhaps the pub lisher had something to do with the decision.

title: Malaysia Parliament to Reopen Amid Race Tension
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia Feb. 12 (AP)They are rolling back the barbed wire from Malaysia's glittering Parlia ment House as the country gingerly picks its way back to the democracy lost in racial violence.

title: U.S. Sees No Intervention
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 United States officials said to day there were no indications that Communist China intended to intervene in the fighting in Laos.

title: GEORGE CARPENTER, OUTDOOR COLUMNIST
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 12 (Cana dian Press)  George Hiram (Chief) Carpenter, outdoor col umnist and internationally known conservationist, died to day after a long illness. He was 81 years old.

title: President's Cousin, on Welfare, Discloses Plight to Aid the Poor
description: GRASS VALLEY, Calif., Feb. 12 (AP)  Philip Milhous, a cousin of President Nixon, and his wife said today that they were on welfare and were mak ing the disclosure to help Cali fornia Rural Legal Assistance and other legal aid programs for the poor.

title: Alan Cobb Marries Miss Bullock
description: JOHNSONVILLE, S. C., Feb. 12Miss Elizabeth Well man Bullock was married here at home this afternoon to Alan Morrow Cobb. The Right Rev. Dr. Gray Temple, Bishop of the Episcopal Dio cese of South Carolina, per formed the ceremony.

title: Ries and Sarich Capture Daytona Speedway Races
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 12  Billy Ries of Shakopee, Minn., won the Florida Citrus 250 for sportstype sedans to day. Driving a red 1969 Ca maro, Ries covered 67 laps of the 3.81mile road course of Daytona International Speed way in 2 hours 26 minutes 10 seconds for an average speed of 102.697 miles an hour.

title: The Dance: Don Quixote
description: Balanchine's Don Quixote, which was given by the New York City Ballet at the New York State Theater on Thurs day night, is a surprising bal let. Balanchine has staged an epic spectacular  the chore ographer who, above all oth ers except Robbins, has been associated with pure dance, here gives us a ritual. There is dancing, of course, and much of it is brilliant, but the power of Don Quixote lies in its dramatic produc tion.

title: Barry Miles Trio At Noon Concert Has Drummer, 14
description: Barry Miles, who burst on the jazz scene 11 years ago as a 12yearold drum prodigy, yesterday revealed that such prodigiosity runs in the family. Now a 23yearold pianist and composer, Mr. Miles brought a trio to the weekly noontime Jazz Adventures series at Downbeat, Lexington Avenue at 42d Street, that included, as its drummer, his 14year old brother, Terry Silverlight (which is the family name).

title: Scarlett O'Hara Might Like the New Atlanta
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 12In her bonnet and veil and 12 flow ing yards of flowered muslin hoopskirt, what would Miss O'Hara think now?

title: M'DONNELL CHIEF GETS SUSPENSION
description: The New York Stock Ex change announced yesterday that T. Murray McDonnell, for mer chairman and chief exec utive of the nowdefunct Mc Donnell & Co., had agreed to accept a twomonth suspension from working as a securities salesman, as well as an indefi nite bar from ever again being either a member of the Big Board or acting in a super visory capacity for any mem ber firm.

title: PRESIDENT URGED TO OUST OFFICIAL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12  Representative Ken Hechler, Democrat of West Virginia, asked President Nixon today to demand the resignation of Under Secretary of the Interior Fred 3. Russell for flagrant violations of the law in the appointment of unqualified per sons to an advisory board on coal mine safety research.

title: Ducks Tie Johnstown
description: COMMACK, L. I., Feb. 12 (AP)Thirdperiod goals by Marty Desmarais and Nelson Tremblay earned the Long Is land Ducks a 22 Eastern Hockey League tie tonight with Johnstown.

title: DALEY OF SABRES STOPS SEALS, 30
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 12 (AP) Joe Daley registered his first goaltending shutout of the Na tional Hockey League season tonight as the Buffalo Sabres beat the California Seals, 30.

title: All Gaullism Divided in 2 Parts Over French Party's Direction
description: PARIS, Feb. 12  Andre Malraux once said that every one was is or will be a Gaul list, but the debate continues in Franca over interpretation of the faith now that Charles de Gaulle is dead.

title: N. HENRY JOSEPHS, A LAWYER. WAS 67
description: N. Henry Josephs, a corpor ation lawyer, died Wednesday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home. 5 East Ninth Street. His age was 67 and his office was at 40 Wall Street.

title: children, Drugs Doctor's Approach
description: A young doctor, horrified by the deaths of two 13 yearold boys from over doses of heroin, writes a book. The publisher, whose daughter attends public school, asks the principal for her opinion of the book. The principal sees educational possibilities in it that extend beyond the library into the classroom.

title: Laotian Rattle Reported
description: SAVANNAICHET, Laos, Feb. 12 (AP)Laotian troops cap tured Phalane but were driven out again officers at this mili tary headquarters reported to day.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: New Apparel. Group Head Urges Business Morality
description: If you're 40 years old, president of a well run family owned men's apparel store and a pillar of your church and community, what do you do for an encore?

title: Ruling Is Costly to Hill
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Feb. 12 (UPI)  Dave Hill was dis qualified today from play in the Bob Hope Desert Classic because he continued to play while misinterpreting a rule. Hill hit his ball into a palm tree on the fifth hole at Ber muda Dunes. He played on, in terpreting the situation as an unplayable lie while in actuality it was a lost ball since he was unable to identify his ball.

title: Coup in Uganda Clouds Outlook For 3Nation East African Bloc
description: DAB ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Feb. 12  Many East Africans fear that the East African Com munity, which is heavily de pendent upon mutual trust be tween its members, Kenya, Tanzania and Uganda, will be a casualty of the coup d'etat in which the Ugandan Army overthrew President Milton Obote on Jan. 25.

title: 3 Douglass Award Winners Announced by Urban League
description: Three winners of the annual Frederick Douglass awards of the New York Urban League were announced yesterday by Robert A. Bernhard, president of the league.

title: Antiques: A Good Market in London
description: London is a great place to shop for antique furniture if you know the ground rules.

title: Boycotting Parents at I.S. 142 And Board Agree to Mediation
description: Parents who have been boy cotting Intermediate School 142 in Jamaica, Queens, for the last three months agreed yesterday to end their protest and enter into mediation of their dispute with the local school board.

title: STOCK PRICES UP; WEEK IS BUSIEST
description: The New York Stock Ex change ended its busiest week in history yesterday as most issues scored gains in active trading.

title: Mrs. Carrie Medal e, 86, Dies; On Board of Higher Education
description: Mrs. Carrie Kaplan Medalie, a former member and secre tary of the Board of Higher Education, died yesterday in her apartment in the Croydon Hotel. She was 86 years old and the widow of George Z. Medalie, former State Court of Appeals Judge and United States Attorney for the South ern District, who died in 1946.

title: TEEGARDEN'S GROUP SINGS AT BITTER END
description: Teegarden & Van Winkle and John Stewart, a fine and odd combination of rockers and folk singers, are sharing the bill through Sunday at the Bitter End, 147 Bleecker Street.

title: SnowLaden Roof Gives Way And Kills Four in Upstate Diner
description: PORT JERVIS, N. Y., Feb. 12 Four, persons were killed and at least 20 others injured at noontime today when the roof on five stores in the Downtown shopping area collapsed from a winter's weight of snow.

title: Republic Corp. and Banks Agree on Extension of Debt
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 12 (Reu ters)  The Republic Corpora tion said today that it had reached agreement In principle with a group of banks provid ing for extension of repayment terms of existing debt and the granting of an additional $9 million in revolving credit dur ing 1971.

title: Textron, Inc., Earnings Fell For 4th Quarter and for Year
description: Ne income of Textron, Inc., fell in the quarter and year ended Jan. 2, the company an nounced yesterday.

title: Morodi Wins 10Rounder
description: PERTH, Australia, Feb. 12 (AP)Anthony Morodi of South Africa outpointed Toro George of New Zealand, the British Empire featherweight cham pion, in a 10round nontitle bout tonight. Each fighter weighed 126 pounds. There were no knockdowns.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Port Unit Under Fire
description: News Analysis

title: Senate Likely to Reopen Hearings on S.E.C. Chief
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12The Senate Banking Committee will probably reopen its hearings on the nomination of Wil liam J. Casey to be chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission on the basis of disclosures that Mr. Casey was once accused of being in volved in an illegal sale of stock. The private suit was settled before it came to trial.

title: Sudanese Premier Asks People To Destroy, Communist Party
description: CAIRO Feb. 12Maj. Gen. Gaafar alNimeiry, the revolu tionary leader of the Sudan, accused the country's strong Communist movement today pf subversive and treasonous activities.

title: 2 MORE COPIERS OF U.S. DOWNED IN DRIVE ON LAOS
description: QUANGTRI, South Vietnam, Saturday, Feb. 13The United States command announced early today that intense enemy antiaircraft fire had brought down two more American helicopters supporting the South Vietnamese drive against Communist supply trails in Laos.

title: RANGERS, BLUES TO MEET TONIGHT
description: The New York Rangers, who have won three of their last four games, face the Blues, who have won only one of their last eight, in St. Louis tonight. It is the first game of a week end homeand home series that will conclude the season be tween the National Hockey League clubs.

title: JOAN BAEZ CONCERTS FILL CARNEGIE TWICE
description: Joan Baez gave two concerts at Carnegie Hall Thursday night to audiences that filled the auditorium and spilled over onto the stage. In both cases, she followed her current cus tom of limiting her performance to an hour and limiting the price of tickets to $2.

title: STATES PRESS BIDS IN NEW SPACE RACE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 Hundreds of politicians, lob byists and local boosters are seeking a piece of what may be come the biggest single Federal project everthe multibillion dollar space shuttle.

title: Joyce A. Gagen Becomes Bride
description: DOVER, Del., Feb. 12  Miss Joyce Ann Gagen was married here this afternoon in the Holy Cross Roman Catholic Church to Joseph Patrick McMurray Jr. The Rev. Charles McGinley per formed the ceremony.

title: Students and Faculty at N.Y. U. Perform at U.S. Music Festival
description: WNYC's 32d annual Ameri can Music Festival began yes terday afternoon with a con cert at Carnegie Hall broad cast by the city's radio station. The concert was planned and performed by students and fac ulty members of the New York University Division of Music Education.

title: Reputed High Mafia Figure Is Shot to Death in Jersey
description: ROSELAND, N. 3., Feb. 12 Louis Luciano, reputedly a top figure in the Newark under world, was shot to death and a companion was wounded in an apparent assassination plot, the police said.

title: U.S. Denies Combat Role
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Feb. 12The White House insisted again today that there are no United States combat forces or advisers committed to the South Vietnamese operation in Laos.

title: Big Volume on Wall Street
description: Buoyed by rising optimism about the economic outlook, stock market trading has been soaring. The New York Stock Exchange this week has had its two biggest trading days in history, with turnovers of 25.59 million shares on Monday and 28.25 million shares on Tuesday.

title: Rolls Nationalization Voted
description: LONDON, Feb. 12 (Reuters)  The House of Commons early today agreed to nationa lize most of the collapsed Rolls Royce concern after a debate lasting more than 12 hours. A bill under which the Govern ment will take control of the vital air and marine engine divisions of the company was given an unopposed third read ing.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ENZYMES DROPPED FROM A DETERGENT
description: The Lever Brothers Company said yesterday that it had dis continued using enzymes in its Drive detergent on Feb. 4.

title: Downtown Scene: Force in Aluminum
description: Despite a few shortcom ings, the abstract construc tions of David von Schlegell have always represented a re markable sculptural achieve ment. Ever since 1961, when he began to make them, his work has grown progressive ly better. The early metal andwood sculptures and the later aluminum pieces re flected an influence of Alex ander Calder and David Smith in the conception and, because of a complexity of parts in the work, the whole did not always accomplish a happy resolution between technique and form. None theless, Mr. von Schlegell used influences to his own ends and produced a sculp tural statement that was at once highly personal and strongly assertive. He demon strated a commendable mas tery of material and a sharp precision in his craftsman ship.

title: Shrine Game in Giants' Park
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 12 (AP)  The Shrine EastWest pro football game will be played at Candlestick Park, home of the baseball Giants, the next five years, with this year's game slated Dec. 31, the San Francisco Recreation and Park Commission said. The game was played at Kezar Sta dium for many years, but was at Stanford Stadium and the Oakland Coliseum the last two years.

title: City Policemen Get, Guidebook On Their Role at Mass Rallies
description: Despite his personal opinions or any frustrations he may feel, a policeman at a demonstration must maintain an objective cool neutrality and seek to minimize confrontation, the Police Department reminded its 32,000 members yesterday.

title: Isaksson Sets Record Of 177 in Pole Vault
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Feb. 12 (UPI)  Kjell Isaksson of Sweden set a world indoor record in the pole vault with a mark of 17 feet, 7 inches in the Los Angeles Times Games tonight. John Mason and Henryk Szordykowski of Poland ran the fastest indoor mile in three years.

title: Massachusetts Official Files Suit Against War
description: BOSTON, Feb. 12 (UPI) State Attorney General Robert Quinn filed suit in United States District Court today on behalf of 12 Massachusetts soldiers challenging the con stitutional authority of De fense Secretary Melvin R. Laird to send them to fight in Southeast Asia.

title: HARRIS AND MATHIAS ASK SENIORITY CURB
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 (AP) Senators Fred R. Harris, Dem ocrat of Oklahoma, and Charles McC. Mathias, Republican of Maryland, asked the Senate Rules Committee today to change the rules to permit se lection of committee chairmen on some basis other than sen iority.

title: Ziegler Denies Threat to China
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Feb. 12  Ronald L. Ziegler, the White House press secretary, said here today that the Nixon Administration did not believe that the Souh Vienamese ef fort to cut the Ho Chi Minh Trail network would provoke Chinese Communists into cross ing the Laotian border in force.

title: Moscow Expels 2 Members Of German Magazine Staff
description: HAMBURG, Germany, Feb. 12 (AP)  Stern magazine re ported today that two members of its staff were expelled from the Soviet Union in an ap parent Soviet campaign to dis courage contacts between its citizens and Western newsmen. The two had been touring the Soviet Uzbek Republic.

title: Brain's Signals in a Test Foretell Action
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 There was a chimpanzee in California with a talent for playing ticktacktoe.

title: Harvard Tops Columbia, 7371, On Dover's Shot in Last Seconds
description: Dale Dover sank a 24foot jump shot from the top of the key in the closing seconds last night to give Harvard a 7371 victory over Columbia before 1,756 fans in the losers' gym. Just when he did it, however, is subject to debate.

title: Canada Cuts Rate to 5%
description: TORONTO, Feb. 12  The Bank of Canada, Canada's cen tral bank, lowered the bank rate tonight by a quarter point, to 5 per cent, effective Mon day.

title: Elise Drobnes Wed To Ronald A. Epner
description: NORWICH, Conn., Feb. 12 Miss Elise Ann Drobnes and Ronald Alan Epner were married here this afternoon by Rabbi Arnold Fine at the home of the bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Sidney Drobnes. Dr. Drobnes is a psychiatrist who practices in Norwich.

title: Duvalier's Son ls Voted Next Haitian President
description: PORTAUPRINCE, Haiti, Feb. 12 (AP)The residents of Haiti have voted over whelmingly to approve Jean Claude Duvalier, the son of President Franois Duvalier, as the next leader of the re public.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Muskie Will Assay Economic Aspects Of Pollution Curbs
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 12 Senator Edmund S. Muskie an nounced today that the Senate Public Works Subcommittee on Air and Water Pollution would hold hearings this spring on economic problems arising from environmental control orders.

title: Striking Lorraine Miners To Resume Work Monday
description: PARIS, Feb. 12A weeklong strike in the Lorraine coal mines all but ended today when 1,500 miners at Faulquemont voted to return to work Monday.

title: Central Belfast Untouched by Fighting
description: BELFAST, Northern Ire land, Feb. 12  At the center of Belfast ten minutes' walk from where British soldiers are shooting it out with the Irish Republican Army, life goes on untouched by the drama that has captured world attention.

title: MRS. VIEVA D. SMITH, LITERARY EDITOR, 82
description: Mrs. Vieva Dawley Smith, literary editor and former con cert accompanist, the widow of Y. K. Smith, writer and edi tor, died Sunday in Metropoli tan Hospital. She was 82 years old and lived at 39 West 67th Street.

title: Hollway Replaces Winner As Head Coach of Cards
description: Bob Hollway, who spent two decades in football working for other bosses, became his own yesterday when the St. Louis Cardinals appointed him as their new head coach. Holl way, 45 years old, came from Bud Grant's staff at Minnesota, where he had been in charge of the Vikings' defense for four years.

title: COMA TARGET OF LAOS PROTEST
description: Three offices in Columbia's School of International Affairs were wrecked and a student and three policemen were in jured yesterday after a meet ing held to protest the incur sion into Laos. One student was arrested.

title: SCHOOL INQUIRY PLANTS ONE REPORT
description: ALBANY, Feb. 12  The chairman of the commission studying the state's elementary and secondary education system said today that an interim re port would not be sent to the Legislature for action this year.

title: Illinois Man Recovers $183,000 Brink's Lost
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 12 (AP) Brink's, Inc., announced to day that a man from sub urban Downers Grove, Ill., had recovered and turned over to the company $183.000 lost earlier in the week when two money bags fell from an armored truck.

title: ADDICT A SUICIDE IN BROOKLYN CELL
description: A 23yearold narcotics ad dict was found hanged in his cell at the Brooklyn House of Detention shortly before mid night Thursday.

title: Quaker Landmark for Sale
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 12 (UPI)The 12th Street Friends Meetinghouse, built in 1812, will be given away to anybody willing to pay the cost of mov ing it. It is situated on a plot of land destined to become park ing facilities for a proposed downtown office building in center city.

title: 1844 Elizabeth Barrett Poem Pledged Valentine Love
description: How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.

title: Copier Commander Robert F. Molinelli
description: Man in the News

title: E.E.C. Gives Reply To Criticism by U.S. Over Farm Policy
description: BRUSSELS, Feb. 12  The European Economic Community has replied to United States criticism of its allegedly pro tectionist farmsupport system. In its report on 1970 the E.E.C. commission says that such crit icism fails to take account of the real problems which European agriculture has to face.

title: Fire Truck's Tire Shot
description: A man drew a pistol and fired three shots into the left rear tire of a Fire Department ladder truck last night as it pulled away from a call at East 187th Street and Beaumont Avenue in the Fordham section of the Bronx. No one was in jured. The gunman escaped with sevaral other men in waiting car. The truck, which has double wheels, was not dis abled in the incident, which took place shortly after 10 P.M.

title: Foreign Notes
description: There are 3.1 million wom en in Switzerland and just 2.9 million men. But up to last week Swiss women along with those of Jordan, Kuwait, Saudi Arabia, Ye men and Liechtensteinhad not been allowed to vote in Federal elections (although they had the vote locally in many regions). Especially in some Germanspeaking areas, the role of women has been confined to Kinder, Kirch and Kuechechildren, church and kitchen.

title: U.S. to Give the Boy Scouts $700,000 for Job Program
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 (AP)  The Federal Government agreed today to give the Boy Scouts of American $700,000 to help train for posts as paid Scout leaders 200 disadvan taged persons who are jobless or underemployed.

title: CEAUSESCU PLEDGES AUTHENTIC UNIONS
description: VIENNA, Feb. 13 (Reuters) President Nicolae Ceaucescu of Rumania has promised workers genuine labor union protection and a 20 per cent increase in real wages between 1972 and 1975.

title: Foreign Notes
description: BELFAST  Extremists dedicated to bringing Ulster. (Northern Ireland) into the Irish Republic are taking on the British Army. This is a new tactic, and it has emerg ed over the past week in a pattern of violence that in cluded the killing of the first British soldier on duty in Northern Ireland.

title: Mary Webster, Teacher, Bride Of William H. Levit Jr., Lawyer
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 13 Miss Mary Elizabeth Web ster and William H. Levit Jr., both of New York, were married here this afternoon. The Rev, John W. Cyrus per formed the ceremony in the First Unitarian Church.

title: Half scourge and half redeemer; The Sword Of the Golem
description: For the Jewish people, mem ory and forgetfulnessoppos ing forces forever at war in the heart of manmust have an additional dimension. The eternal wanderings of the Jews, their laments in exile by the waters of Babylon, their cen turies of persecutions culminat ing in the holocaust of the six millionthese must be events too anguishing for recall. Yet these same memories constitute the binding together of a peo ple, its fierce sense of destiny, its sense of God as a living force answering man's need for unity and a reconciliation of his own inner duality.

title: 4 IN MONTANA QUIT IN GAME AIDE RIFT
description: HELENA, Mont., Feb. 13The four incumbent members of Montana's Fish and Game Com mission resigned this week in the continuing controversy be tween the Governor, the com mission, and its director, Frank Dunkle.

title: Columbia Defeats Dartmouth, 8483, on Gordon's Basket With 0:16 to Play
description: For the second night in a row, 40 minutes of frenetic basketball came down to a dis pute at the final buzzer for Columbia, but this time the Lions won the argument and the game, 8483, over Dart mouth last night before 1,655 fans in University Gym.

title: Syracuse Scores, 10290
description: Syracuse, N. Y., Feb. 18 (AP) Syracuse gained its eighth victory in its last nine games by defeating West Virginia, 10290, tonight.

title: A Piaf Neighborhood... Will It Survive?
description: PARISVive La Mouffe! It looks as if one of the old neighbor hoodsthe Paris of which Edith Piaf sangmay be saved from the demolition crews. A drive is on to abandon the proposed construction of a through street in the Rue Mouffetard section, known familiarly as La Mouffe, thus saving it perhaps for an other generation.

title: Gail Robinson Sings Rosina at the Met With Cool Dignity
description: The Metropolitan Opera ob viously has an attractive new soprano in Gail Robinson. Earlier this season, she had done very well in the title role of Lucia di Lammermoor, and on Friday night she gave a very charming performance as Rosina in Il Barbiere di Si viglia.

title: Lovely Ladies And Sugared Sex
description: Music

title: Braine in bed, Drury on Mars, Jones in Paris, Buechner in Dixie
description: Briefcases? Pocketdiaries? Pan tries? When did you last read fiction about people who use neckties? On the first page of this novel, it's stated that the leading character has his hair trimmed by the (same) bar ber every week, and that he uses Cuticura powder after showering. I was so overwhelmed by this informa tion that I immediately reread Room at the Top. Mr. Braine's first novel, published in 1957, was often discussed as a denunciation of the British class system. Joe Lampton's gleeful heelishness was said to per sonify the brutalization of the work ingclassesespecially when they tried to writhe to the level of their employers enties, it merely squeaks of con formity. Room at the Top can re mind American readers that we ex cel at exporting our worst qualities and that other nationalities adore them. Still, may we wistfully blame some of this on the mossy material ism of the fifties?

title: Miss Hillary A. Horwitz Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Sol Horwitz of Kew Gardens, Queens, and Chicago, have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Hillary Anne Horwitz, to Howard William Yagerman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack L. Yagerman of Brooklyn. The wedding is planned for August.

title: Bill Seeks Larger House
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 (AP) A bill Lo increase the size of the House of Representatives from 435 to 437 members and assign one extra seat each to Oregon and Connecticut has been introduced in the House.

title: Pompidou Back Home After His African Tour
description: PARIS, Feb. 13 (Reuters) President Pompidou returned home today after a 10day tour of Frenchspeaking Af rican countries during which he laid stress on economic cooperation and steered clear of political issues.

title: MOSCOW PRODDING BRANDT ON ACCORD
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 13The So viet Union today expressed ir ritation over West Germany's continued refusal to ratify the sixmonthold MoscowBonn treaty until progress is made in the Big Four talks on Berlin.

title: Wagner Loses, 8369
description: Susquehanna, paced by the scoring of Jan Mroz, handed Wagner College its 15th defeat last night, 8369, in a Middle Atlantic Conference game on the loser's court.

title: Stocks: Darn Is Holding
description: For the first time in two long and lean years, Wall Street is basking in the warm glow of prosperity. Business is booming for a change and visions of Miami Beach and bonus checks are dancing in stockbrokers' heads.

title: Reader's Report
description: There are marginal human characters in this novel, but the real protagonist is a disas ter, caused by the massive leak age of radioactive fuel at a nuclear power station. What happens? Well, to begin with, the evacuation of Toronto. (The epicenter, or focus, is 20 miles away.) Deaths due to panic and asphyxiation Fire. Snafu in high places. Evacuees pluckily muddling through. Mr Jackson has done his technical homework thoroughly: his view of how the catastrophe occurs is as horribly plausible as a highway accident. Makes Con Ed's fuelburning power plants seem a lot friendlier.

title: Those Poor, Poor Women in the U.S. Upset Her
description: PARIS Franoise Partur ler, the French novelist and columnist, holds Betty Frie dan and the late President de Gaulle responsible for her recent, futile attempt to jolt the Acadmie Franoise that most inviolately male of all French institutions  by seeking election to it.

title: The Ultimate Washington's Birthday Weekend Tour
description: ALL you really serious patriots who have long since made pilgrim ages to the traditional George Washington Slept Here sites are now qualified for the real connoisseur's tour: places where he didn't sleep. These places he didn't or couldn't or wouldn't sleep uniquely reveal to us George Washington, the man: the vital, com manding, stubborn, hotblooded and sometimes profane leader of our Revo lution not the grim, distant and tedi ous alabaster saint of patriotic myth.

title: Art
description: THE name of Hans Har tung, who was born in Leipzig in 1904 and has lived and worked in Paris since 1935, is as familiar to Americans as those of most of the other painters of his generation who were early participants in the develop ment of abstract painting and have lived to become the grand old men of its triumph. His honors have included the Grand Prix for painting in the Venice Biennale of 1960 and the Grand Prix des Beaux Arts of the City of. Paris last year. But he has always been more highly es teemed in Europe than in this country.

title: Lawyer Is Fiance of Edith Harkness
description: The engagement of Miss Edith Hale Harkness to Ken neth Perry McKinnon, a Washington lawyer, has been announced by Mrs. Rebekah Harkness of Sneden's Land ing, N. Y., mother of the future bride and patron of the dance. Mr. McKinnon is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Angus K. McKinnon of Fort Myers, Fla., formerly of Potomac, ??.

title: Keith Jurows Have Son
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Feb. 13 A son was born Jan. 11 to Mr. and Mrs. Keith Jurow at the Mary Fletcher Hospital here. Mrs. Jurow is the for mer Janet Keller of Bayside, Queens, New York. The child has been named Lorin Reed. His father is assistant pro fessor of political science at St. Michael's College in Winooskie.

title: Vicar of Old North Church Is Retiring
description: BOSTON, Feb. 13  In one of his first acts on becoming vicar of the Old North Church, the Rev. Howard P. Kellett or dered the removal of protectivel wiring from the windows of the edifice that was made famous by Paul Revere,

title: Kathy L. Gelb Plans Nuptials
description: SHAKER HEIGHTS, Ohio, Feb. 13Mr. and Mrs. Victor Gelb have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Kathy Lee Gelb, to Dana de Windt, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Mandell de Windt of Lyndhurst.

title: The World
description: PARISThe banter went something like this last Tues day in Brussels, following the historic decision by ministers of the Common Market to es tablish a single currency in 10 years:

title: Specialists Consider California Unprepared for a Big Earthquake
description: A number of earthquake spe ?? believe that the tremors, ?? rocked California last ?? were but a small sample ?? must be expected be ?? century is out. Further ?? they consider the region ?? grossly unprepared for ?? disaster.

title: More Women Are Using Nassau Job Counselors
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Feb. 13 Many women forced to return to work to help supplement their families' incomes because of rising unemployment and economic hardships on Long, Island are turning to Nassau County's vocational guidance center for women.

title: It's Said With Flowers
description: THE Valentine is a relatively mod ern invention, but the impact of flowers on the sentiments of man is as old as time itself. Hearts and flowers have been linked almost from the moment there was anyone around to notice that roses are red and violets blue.

title: Boston U. Six Wins, 83
description: BOSTON, Feb. 13 (AP)Bos ton University, beaten once and tied once, posted its 19th hock ey victory, 83, over New Hamp shire tonight.

title: SQUIRES TURN BACK COLONELS BY 128123
description: HAMPTON, Va, Feb. 13 (AP)  The Virginia Squires fought off a Kentucky rally in the final quarter today and in crease their Eastern Division lead over the Colonels to nine games with a 128123 Ameri can Basketball Association vic tory.

title: Home Improvement
description: THE unusual looking tel evision antenna illus trated at right is spe cifically designed for easy do  it  yourself instal lation, since it eliminates the need for a mast and it can be attached to any roof by simply driving in a few nails or screws. Suitable for use with FM radios, as well as for both color and blackand white television (UHF and VHF), the antenna will pull in signals clearly from sta tions up to 50 miles away.

title: One of the finest fogcutters in Washington
description: There are a number of ways of going about being a journalist in Washington, and at some point, con sciously or not, most writers make a choice. One can be an insider, an outsider, or try to be both. Each course has its advantages and its drawbacks. The insider can bring us the innermost thoughts of those uppermost in power  or at least what the powers that be want us to think that they are thinking, as faithfully relayed by the trusted writer. The jounalist who travels this route is rewarded with scoops, the acknowledgment on the part of his peers that he is in, and the flattery of mingling with and even having his own opinions sought out  or seem ing to be  by the most powerful people in the country. But such heady stuff can be highly priced, for it is hard for the insider to maintain his independence. Some become so ab sorbed in taking down the words from the horse's mouth that they fail to notice that they have become a joke.

title: City Opera Slates March 7 Premiere For Menotti Work
description: Gian Carlo Menotti's latest opera, The Most Important Man, will be given its world premiere by the New York City Opera during the third week of its spring season, be ginning March 2, at the State Theater.

title: Los Angeles Roulette
description: Sheer fortunate happenstance was all that kept the huthan toll of the Los Angeles earthquakeabout sixty dead and 1,000 injured from being far greater. The earth's mighty convulsion there took place at about 6 A.M., when most people were still in bed, and schools, highways and other public facilities were generally empty. Had the powerful tremor taken place three four hours later, the list of victims would have been ??

title: Ticket Shortage Has Markson Ducking
description: For most people, lunchtime is a relaxing interlude. But for Harry Markson, it's a problem now.

title: Man, 20, Mistaken For a Cafe Robber Slain in Brooklyn
description: A 20yearold laborer who the police said was mistakenly identified as a robbery suspect, was shot and killed by two men who chased a group from a Brooklyn restaurant early yesterday.

title: Henry A. Perry to Marry Miss Anne Draper Grant
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 13 Miss Anne Draper Grant and Henry Atterbury Perry, a de scendant of Commodore Mat thew Calbraith Perry and Oliver Hazard Perry, plan to be married in Chestnut Hill on Sept. 11 at St. Martin's in the Field Episcopal Church.

title: TEMPLE DEFEATS N.Y.U. BY 9066
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 13 Temple University survived a surge in the second half by New York University and defeated the Violets, 90.65, before 9,200 fans at the Palestra tonight.

title: 5 CIRCUIT JUDGES TO RETIRE IN YEAR
description: By a quirk of circumstances, President Nixon shortly will be in a position to appoint a work ing majority of the highest Federal court for the region consisting of New York, Con necticut and Vermont.

title: The Nation
description: The stock market is surging again. Last week's trading vol ume on the New York Stock Ex change broke all previous rec ords. Since midNovember, stock prices have moved up strongly and by Friday's closing had climbed a third of the way out of the depths of 1970's bear mar ket.

title: KNICKS BEAT SUNS, 11497;
