description: When it was starting to ap pear that they had lost the habit completely, the Knicks finally won last night.

title: PENTAGON TO END PANAMA COMMAND
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 President Nixon is to take a step soon toward simplifying the United States defense struc ture by abolishing the Southern Command, now one of sev en commands combining all branches of the armed services.

title: WeightLifting Mark Falls
description: PARIS, Feb. 13 (AP)A Bul garian weight lifter, Ladev Kuchev, set a world record for the press in the lightweight di vision today with 332 pounds. The former record of 330 pounds had been set by Dehnavi of Iran last January.

title: Princeton Routs Brown, 7456
description: PROVIDENCE, Feb. 13Brian Taylor scored 21 points to night to lead Princeton to a 7456 victory over Brown and a tie with the Bruins for fourth place in the Ivy League.

title: RIDGEBACK'S TROPHY IS RETIRED BY KARRO
description: The Rhodesian Ridgeback Club's challenge trophy was re tired yesterday at the Hotel New Yorker by the topwinning ridgeback in the United States, Ch. Blankeeridge Karro, who took the national specialty for the third consecutive year.

title: Carey Acquiring New Influence In His Role on Ways and Means
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13  The Borough of Brooklyn, long accustomed to having representatives with influ ence in Congress, has a new mantosee at the Capitol this year.

title: Hanoi Says U.S. Marines Are Set for DMZ Landing
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Feb. 13 (Agence France Presse)North Vietnam to day called on all its regions to prepare for an American military landing along the demilitarized zone.

title: How to Be Profitably Hip
description: They speak the language of love and when it's backed up by knowhow, it makes good dollars and business sense.

title: Planetarium With 12,000 Stars Nears Completion in Centerport
description: CENTERPORT, L. I., Feb. 13 A planetarium with a main projector capable of producing on a domed screen the image of 12,000 stars3,000 more than any planetarium projector in the world is nearing com pletion there.

title: Italy: Too Soon for Taps
description: For some time now it has been fashionable to write political obituaries for Italy's 25yearold democratic system and Emilio Colombo, the man who is still trying to make it work. It is certainly a fact that in six months as Premier, driving an unruly fourhorse coalition chaotic political weather, Mr. Colombo has surmounted more perils than Pauline.

title: Miss Roscia Bride Of Harry Meyer 2d
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 St. Mary's Chapel in the Cathedral of SS. Peter and Paul here was the scene this afternoon of the marriage of Miss ElizabethAnne Roscia, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Jay Roscia of Pacific Palisades, Calif., to Harry Meyer 2d. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Harry Meyer of New Orleans, where his father is a physician.

title: The Indian Prime Minister prepares for an election
description: THE red sandstone bulk of the In dian Parliament loomed above lawns and bright, feathery trees. The avenues beyond it seemed to lead lengthily to some unforeseen horizon. The Delhi winter had brought a new purity and clarity to the air, and a cool pale sun squinted down from the blue arch of the sky. The ugly, sprawling capital city, in this weather, assumed an unfaltering beauty: Every day could be sipped and turned on the palate, like a very light, slightly fizzy wine. But today was different from other days. Par liament was to open today for its winter session. Streams of cars and people were flowing down the end less arrowlike avenues towards the red sandstone amphitheater.

title: The City Record, In Economy Move, To Drop an Edition
description: The City Record, whose oversized columns and under sized type list the official data on a variety of municipal ac tionsminutes or meetings, bid advertisements, budget changes is the latest announced vic tim of the Lindsay Administra tion's economy moves.

title: Foreign Notes
description: The hot, dry Island of Ibi za off the coast of Spain has scenic villages and one of the best winter climates in the Mediterranean. For years it escaped the hordes of tourists that engulfed oth er Mediterranean resorts, but more recently Britons, then Europeans and finally Amer icans discovered the island's charms. Hotels sprang up all over.

title: SETASIDE FOR CORN PUT AT 20 PER CENT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 (UPI) The Nixon Administration has announced final plans for 1971 planting controls on grains and cotton. Included is a 20 per cent acreage setaside require ment for feed grains.

title: Niagara Beats lona, 9065
description: Iona College lost to Niagara, 9065, last night at Mount St. Michael Academy in the Bronx.

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: Stratton Mountain near Londonderry, Vt., may not see the head of the Sneath family as regularly as in the past.

title: BAROQUE CONCERT GIVEN AT HUNTER
description: It is always a pleasure to ob serve the efficiency and ap parent ease with which sea soned professionals adjust to unexpected situations, and the concert at Hunter College As sembly Hall on Friday night of fered the opportunity to do just that.

title: Chrysler Contract Ratified
description: DETROIT, Feb. 13 (UPI) Chrysler Corporation's 10,000 salaried employes in the United States and Canada have rati fied a new master contract agreed to by bargainers Feb. 2 after a threehour strike. Doug las A. Fraser, a vice president of the United Auto Workers, said the three personnel groups ratified their agreements by large margins.

title: When Opera Buffs Go Pub Crawling
description: IMAGINE a small country town, pop ulation 12,000, miles from cosmo politan life. It has a narrow main street of threestory buildings, some with a hint of old elegance but many on the shabby side. There are two good hotels, two movie houses, a Chinese restaurant. . . .

title: 1,143,853 in City Schools, Record High Registration
description: The city's public schools set a record this year in pupil regis tration with 1,143,853, an in crease of 7,910 or 1.5 per cent, from last year.

title: BLACK CANDIDATE UPSETS CHICAGO
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 13  Wheth er the Rev; Jesse L. Jack son, national director of Oper ation Breadbasket, will be al lowed to run as an indepen dent candidate for Mayor of Chicago is still very much in doubt.

title: Golfer Agnew Hits 3 Fans, Steals Show From Palmer
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Feb. 13Vice President Spiro T. Agnew clipped three spectators with his first two shots today as he upstaged Arnold Palmer and the other golf pros in the fourth round of the $140,000 Bob Hope Desert Classic.

title: Industry Alters Pacific Image
description: Mention of the South Seas for many Americans evokes images of a great tropical cookoutpilau feasts, surf riders and Polynesians and palm trees swaying with a hula beat.

title: NEW ANTIU.S. RIOTING ERUPTS AT QUINHON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 13 (AP)  AntiAmerican riot ing broke out in the coastal city of Quinhon again today. Rioters threw stones and set fire to American vehicles and a building before the South Vietnamese national police dis persed them with tear gas.

title: Army Outpoints Rutgers in Track, Sweeping 2 Events and Winning 8 Others
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Feb. 13 Army defeated Rutgers in track today, 83 to 31, finishing first in 10 of 14 events. The victory was Army's eighth of the season against two losses. Rutgers has not won in three meets.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Defense and Smart Money
description: All the talk by the Nixon Administration about reorder ing national priorities from a wartime to a peacetime economy has not caused Wall Street to lose sight of the fact thatif the President has his waythe defense budget will actually be going up by $6 billion in budget authority for military and military assistance programs in the next fiscal year.

title: Art
description: WITH the victory of the proletariat will come the victo ry of Constructiv ism. What a world of hope, illusion, tragedy and genius is summed up in this state ment, written in 1923 by the Russian critic Osip Brik about the Constructivist sculptor, painter and designer Alexan der Rodchenko. Yet such hopes and such illusions once had, or seemed to have, ample historical justification. Here was an authentic, avant garde not only allied to a radical political program but actually functioning (at least in its own eyes) as an es sential part of a momentous revolution. The very name of the journal in which Brik's statement appeared  LEF (Left Front of Art), founded by Mayakovskysignified the hope of the perfect world to come in which the esthet ic impulse, now at last fully realized, would be indistin guishable from the practical tasks of social reconstruc tion. Art and life would, fi nally, be united in a single, organic effort.

title: Campus Bus Lines Boom as Colleges Expand
description: KENT, Ohio, Feb. 13A surprisingly urban sight, suf fused in soft blue light, looks up out of the night on the rolling campus of Kent State University: A transit bus.

title: Forest Fire Toll Rises
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 (UPI) Forest fires on national forest lands in 1970 were the costliest in history, Edward P. Cliff, chief of the Forest Service, has reported. He said seven lives were lost fighting the 15,000 separate fires which burned 555,831 acres of national forest land last year.

title: Lou Nol Arrives in. U.S.
description: HONOLULU, Feb. 13 (UPI) Premier Lon Nol arrived at Hickam Air Force Base outside Honolulu this afternoon after a 12hour flight from Pnompenh. He was taken by military am bulance to Tripler Hospital a few miles away.

title: Berlin Protest on Laos Held
description: BERLIN, Feb. 13 (Reuters) Several thousand young left wing demonstrators marched through West. Berlin streets here today, protesting against the drive into Laos and calling for the immediate withdrawal of all United States troops from Indochina.

title: Soviet Appoints New Head Of Party in Leningrad City
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 13 Boris I. Aristov, the Deputy Mayor of Leningrad, was today named the head of that city's Commu nist party organization, replac ing Georgi I. Popov who re tired, Tass, the Soviet press agency, announced.

title: Marilyn and Barbara Cochran Finish 1, 2 in World Cup Slalom in Quebec
description: BEAUPRE, Quebec, Feb. 13 Marilyn Cochran and her sister Barbara, crediting their moth er's cooking, finished 1, 2 today in the women's special slalom for the first American victory in World Cup competition this season.

title: PENN SWIMMERS HALT YALE SKEIN
description: NEW HAVEN, Conn., Feb. 13 Yale lost its first swimming meet in five years here today, bowing to the University of Pennsylvania squad, 6449.

title: Where Unlocked Doors Don't Perturb Families
description: PROSPECT, KyHarold Morris was sitting in the guardhouse, his 38caliber pistol strapped to his side, watching the only entrance to Hunting Creek, prosperous young development outside Louisville.

title: Yale 70 Hockey Victor
description: PRINCETON, Feb. 13Terry DeMeza, a senior center, tal lied two goals today as Yale's hockey beat Princeton, 7 to 0. Mark Fitzsimmons and John Cole made 28 saves to blank Princeton.

title: National Notes
description: The nation's construction unions said No last week, and they said it twice. Meeting in Florida, leaders of the Buildings and Construction Trades Depart ment of the A.F.L.C.I.O. de clared that they would fight a proposed new Federal regulation requiring them to take on a specific quota of nonwhite ap prentices. And they added their determination to ignore a re quest by President Nixon that they come up with a program to stabilize wages in the build ing industry.

title: Marriage Set By Miss York
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Feb. 13 Mrs. Georgia Hartman York of Princeton and Eugene Liv ingston York of New York have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Constance York, to Terrence David Lynch, son of Mr. and Mrs. Gerald J. Lynch of San Marino, Calif. The wedding is planned for March 4.

title: I Was an Angel For Stag Movie
description: Scene 1. A plush East Side apart ment just off Fifth Avenue. The time is a hot night in late summer last year.

title: Miss Susan June Goldberger Engaged
description: The engagement of Miss Su san June Goldberger, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Goldberger of New York and Mamaroneck, N. Y., to James J. Jacoby has been announced by her parents. An April wed ding is planned.

title: South Vietnamese Drive Into Laos Put at 14 Miles
description: KHESANH, South Vietnam, Feb. 13 South Vietnamese troops were reported today to have advanced about 14 miles into Laos in their sixdayold drive to cut the enemy supply network there.

title: Minnesota Five Defeats, Michigan State, 9786
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Feb. 13 (UPI) Minnesota, shooting better than 50 per cent in the first half, defeated Michigan State, 9786, in Big Ten basketball tonight.

title: Drama As We Have Known It Is Terminated
description: NOW that we have Waiting for Godot again in a production directed by Alan Schneider, who may know more about Samuel Beckett than any man living, it becomes infinitely clearer why certain purists should have objected so strenuously to the lovely performance given by Bert Lahr in the Broadway mount ing of 15 years ago. Mr. Lahr completed things. Every once in a while, even if only for a little while, something changed for him.

title: The Courting Owls
description: MidFebruary, and back in the hills the great horned owls, biggest and most truculent of the nocturnal tribe, are starting to nest. The courtship preliminaries are both loud and eerie, so the nights echo wherever great horned owls are resident.

title: Photography
description: HONEYWELL Photo graphic Products, Box 1010, 5501 South Broadway, Littleton, Colo. 80120, long a producer of medium and high priced electronic flash units (among other photographic products) is now marketing a low priced flash that is primari ly designed to properly in troduce amateurs to the eco nomy, convenience and speed of a fine electronic unit.

title: Braine in bed, Drury on Mars, Jones in Paris, Buechner in Dixie
description: In Allen Drury's new novel, laid about a decade in the future, the United States commits its money, scientific knowhow and prestige to a manned landing on Mars. One's first reaction may be that, even if the trip lasts 18 months, it shouldn't take 18 months to read about it. It doesn't, quite, but it seems to. Despite some chilling incidents of purest melodrama, there are plod ding wastes in this long bookwhen, instead of getting to Mars, you get nowhere.

title: Dance
description: WHAT is one to say about Maurice Be jart and his Ballet of the 20th Century which tonight ends its New York debut engagement at the Brooklyn Academy of Music? Critically, it has been disastrously received  very few American writers or crit ics finding many good words to say for it. Yet it seems to have done very well at the box office, so before discuss ing the season critically, it seems pertinent to consider whether Bjart has succeeded in attracting an audience that normally does not attend bal let, and indeed knows noth ing about balletin short, the audience that Bjart works for.

title: Movies
description: THAT bookish Bronte brood is back in a big way. On Thursday, AIP's spankingnew version of Emily Bronte's Wuthering Heights bows at the Music Hall, with Timothy Dalton and Anna CalderMarshall doing the HeathcliffCathy bit done so beauti fully by Laurence Olivier and Merle Oberon in William Wyler's 1939 film. And later this year we'll be seeing another cinematic edition of Charlotte Bronte's Jane Eyre, starring George C. Scott and Susannah York as Rochester and Jane, the roles played by Orson Welles and Joan Fontaine in 1944.

title: Hamptons Museums Are Putting People in the Picture
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I., Feb. 13  The art museum of Guild Hall, the cultural center of East Hampton, will be turned into a showcase of the area tomor row when an exhibition with the McLuhanesque title of Know Your Neighbor: Global Community opens.

title: The Nation
description: It was billed as one of the biggest trials in years, bigger even than the trial of the Chicago 8, and when the hear ings began, one year and two weeks ago, that did not seem too much of an exaggeration. There was the issue of a political party's right to survive. The issue of police harassment. The issue of entrapment. The ques tion of the courts' ability to give radicals a fair trial.

title: Letters
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Mail:
description: To the Editor:

title: Montclair State Beaten
description: GLASSBORO, N. J., Feb. 13 Glassboro State College scored 10 consecutive points late in the second half tonight and dropped Montclair State from the undefeated ranks in the New Jersey State College Con ference with a 6660 triumph.

title: Space
description: HOUSTONThe Apollo 14 mission was barely over, but Space Agency scientists and engineers were already de scribing it as a turning point in moon explorationthe end of a period of testing and reconnaissance and the start of a wideranging and methodical campaign of dis covery.

title: MINING PLAN HITS ECOLOGICAL SNAG
description: SAN JUAN, Feb. 13A series of developments this week im peded on grounds of environ mental protection the plans of two American copper compa nies to exploit $3billion in cop per deposits in Puerto Rico's central mountain region.

title: Headliners
description: Youth's Day in Court

title: Miss Nesbitt To Wed in May
description: Miss Carolyn Ralston Nes bitt, who is on the design staff of Ellen L. McCluskey Associates, and Stuart Levin, owner of Le Pavillon Restau rant plan to be married in May.

title: Isaksson Sets Pole Vault Mark Of 177 in Coast Competition
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 13 Suddenly pole vaulters are pop ping up all over the world faster than you can say fiber glass. Sweden's contribution to the soaring brigade, Kjell Isaks son, set a world indoor record of 17 feet 7 inches last night.

title: Bee Gees, Australian Brothers, in Song Program
description: The Australian brothers Gibb Barry, Robin and Maurice who formed the Bee Gees more than a decade ago, rose to great commercial success and then went their separate ways, are back together again. The two concerts they gave on Fri day night at Philharmonic Hall with the Staple Singers marked their return to New York as brotherly group.

title: Quinton Hallett to Be Bride July 10
description: ROLLINSFORD, N. H., Feb. 13Miss Quinton Hallett of San Francisco and J. Steven Hoglund of Palo Alto, Calif., plan to be married on July 10 at the St. Thomas Episcopal Church in Dover.

title: Out of the Park Wins
description: BOWIE, Md., Feb. 13 (AP) Brandyaint Hills Farms' Out of the Park, the 5to2 favorite, held on gamely through the stretch today and won the $20,000 Southern Maryland Handicap by a length at Bowie race track.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Diane Marie Bosley Is Wed Here to Edwin Ray Hazen Jr.
description: Miss Diane Marie Bosley and Edwin Ray Hazen Jr. were married here yesterday afternoon in Christ Church United Methodist by the Rev. Dr. Harold A. Bosley, father of the bride and senior min ister of the church.

title: Maccabee Patrols Monitoring Police In Fight on Crime
description: Samuel Schrage, the Hasidic rabbi who six years ago formed the Maccabees citizenlawen forcement group in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn, says his organization has switched its emphasis to mon itoring the police to make sure that they were doing their job.

title: Lion Country By Frederick Buechner. 247 pp. New York: Atheneum. $5.95.
description: Africa, for the New Yorker, be gins at East Orange. Once he has reached the loblolly latitudes of Dix ie where Habakkuk and realestate prices are quoted with the same pitched whine, the New Yorker is, like the protagonist of Frederick Buechner's sixth novel, among Tua regs and Tshiluba. He is a subway rider in lion country.

title: Beatrice Blakeman Is Married In Princeton to Kaare Karstad
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Feb. 13 Miss Beatrice Bruce Blake man and Kaare Karstad were married here this afternoon in Trinity Episcopal Church. The Rev. John M. Scott of Philadelphia performed the ceremony. He was assisted by the Rev. E. Rugby Auer of Trinity Church.

title: The Travel Underground
description: I'M not a joiner. About the only organization I belong to is the BookoftheMonth Club. But a few days ago I plunked down $10 and signed up as a member of the Caledonian Friendship.Society. I have no idea who else belongs to the society, where its headquarters are or even if it really exists. Like many others, I joined solely because each Friday this pos siblydummy organization sponsors a suspiciously unorthodox charter flight from New York to London at very real knockdown ratesmore than onethird below those charged by the scheduled airlines.

title: Thousands Flee the Towns of America's Lonely Plains
description: McCLUSKY, N. D., Feb. 13 As the sprawling metro politan areas of the East and West struggle with the miseries of overcrowding, the vast plains of the American midlands  from Montana and the Dakotas through Texasare growing more desolate.

title: Expansion of Legal Prostitution Weighed by Counties in Nevada
description: MUSTANG, Nev., Feb. 13 The world's oldest profession is Nevada's newest legal business.

title: Coming Attractions By Sandra Berkley. 212 pp. New York: E. P. Dutton & Co. $5.95.
description: Coming Attractions, a novel of Hollywood in the 1930's, operates on the principle of Murphy's Law: if something can go wrong, it will. Four yearold Cassie Keen comes West to meet her new step daddyand he turns out to be a child molester. Grandma, with whom she is farmed out, is a nasty frump in a Mae Murray maquillage. Daddy Number Three is a deadbeat. Mama is a narcissist who changes her name periodically to conform with the top Hollywood 10; one year she is Hedy, the next she is Myrna. The Keens go from stucco palace to bunga low court to sumptuous ranch property, depending on the for tunes of Daddy Dick, an assist ant film director.

title: Jeff Tarr Is Fiance Of Patricia Goldstein
description: The engagement of Miss Patricia Goldstein to Jeff Tarr has been announced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Hartley J. Goldstein. Mr. Tarr is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank Tarr of Auburn, Me. The wedding will take place here in May.

title: Heavy Rain and Fog Hit Area; Flood Danger Seen in Jersey
description: Heavy rains pelted the met ropolitan area yesterday, bring ing a warning from the National Weather Service that flash floods might occur in most of New Jersey and parts of Dela ware and Pennsylvania.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Brooklyn on This Side, Queens on That And an Urban Microcosm In Between
description: It does not show on any map, so it is altogether sur prising to discover that the 21.4mile border dividing Queens from Brooklyn be gins with a dune that is as bleak and beautiful, in its way, as a bit of the Sahara.

title: Rain and Fog Cancel Last 5 Lincoln Races
description: LINCOLN, R. I. (AP)Lin coin Downs canceled the last five races of its card today after two horses fell in rain and fog. The spillat the far turn  occurred in the fourth race. Neither the jock eys nor the horses were in jured. After the fifth race, a delay was announced to per mit jockeys to look at the turn with the track superin tendent, Arthur C. Patenaude. They decided the course was too slippery and the visibili ty too poor to continue the program.

title: Kerr on The Trial of the Catonsville Nine
description: IF you are moved by The Trial of the Catonsville Nine, as I think you will be, it will not be because you are involved in a play or anything like one. The eve ning is polemic. Theatrical tricks, shapes, skills have very little to do with its emo tional effect as you listen, seated in the pews of the Good ShepherdFaith Church on 66th Street, to a priest in black, gold medallion glint ing on his breast, recount the steps that led him to the burning of draft files in Maryland; or as you listen to the eight men and women who joined him explain that they have intentionally bro ken a law as the only effec tive means of saying that a higher law is being broken daily.

title: Schaaps Have Daughter
description: A daughter was born on Jan. 13 to Dick Schaap, the author, and Mrs. Schaap of Greenwich, Conn., in the Lenox Hill Hospital. Mrs. Schaap is the former Miss Madeleine Gottlieb.

title: Paper Closes in Strike
description: YORK, P., Feb. 13 (UP1) The York Dispatnb stopped publishing today until further notice because of a strike by the International Printing Press man and Assistants Union.

title: Foreign Notes
description: As he was driving into the capital of Mauritania, some one threw an egg at him. In Senegal they composed a rhumba0Pompidou, 0 Pompidou!  in his honor. In Cameroon a stamp and gold coin bearing his like ness went on sale. In Gabon he was carried in a swaying sedan chair. In the Ivory Coast lie conferred with lead ers of that country and other er former French colonies: Niger, Dahomey, Upper Vol ta and Togo.

title: Music
description: PASSION, sentimentality, fire, anger, and explosive laughter those eminently Italian traits hover like a windswept, multi studded cloak over the short and buxom frame of Piedmontese mezzosoprano Fiorenza Cossotto. In action the diva (for that is what she is quickly becom ing) has the tempefarnent of an ebul lient steamwhistle. The sound of her speaking voice alone announces the presence of a woman securely in com mand of her lifea singer fully aware of her star status  but also of a per son who has the wisdom to laugh at it all.

title: Child to Mrs. Leon Kafka
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Leon Kafka on Jan. 30 at the New York Ly ingIn Hospital. Mrs. Kafka tis the former Miss Leslie Adler of Weirton, W.Va. Mr. Kafka is senior vice presi dent and public relations di rector of Edward M. Meyers Associates, Inc., New York advertising agency. The child has been named Elizabeth Mara.

title: Paris short story
description: The Paris couture, which last year was drowning in long skirts, came up with a snappy alternative this springshorts, from the briefest variety to comparatively sedate Bermudas. Some shorts are out in the open, others are partially concealed by slit skirts. But every couturier, from avantgardist to conservative, is part of the act.

title: THAIS REBUILDING A WARTIME ROAD
description: PAPAE, ThailandA moun tain road to Burma that was a trail of death for Japanese and Allied personnel during World War H is being rebuilt through here as part of the Bangkok Government's efforts to spread its influence, improve the economy and combat Com munist penetration in the rugged hill country of northern Thailand.

title: Bay Ridge Strums Country Airs
description: Across the Gowanus, in the shelter of Loew's Alpine The ater, lies Brooklyn's oasis of country and Western music. Four nights a WeekWednes day, Friday, Saturday and Sun daycountry guitars and coun try voices, imported from Nash ville or locally bred, twang and wail at Henry's, 68th Street and Fifth Avenue.

title: Chess
description: ASERIES of elimination matches, starting in the Spring and end ing in the Fall of 1971 will in clude the six qualifiers from the recent Majorca, Spain, round robin knockout and the two Soviet stars, former champion Tigran Petrosian and Viktor Korchnoi.

title: Lawyer Here Named Aide To Inquiry on Schweitzer
description: ALBANY, Feb. 14Lawrence E. Walsh, a member of the New York City law firm of Davis, Polk & Wardwell, has been designated counsel to the Court on the Judiciary, which is to investigate the judicial conduct of State Supreme Court Justice Mitchell D. Schweitzer.

title: PENN OVERCOMES YALE FIVE BY 9177
description: NEW HAVEN,, Feb. 13 (UPI) Pennsylvania became the first major college basketball team in the East to win 20 games this season when it defeated Yale, 9177, tonight.

title: Catholic Teacher Honored
description: ORADELL, N. J., Feb. 13  Brother James H. Vaughan, an English teacher at Bergen Catholic High School here, was honored tonight at a dinner on his 50th anniversary as a mem ber of the Congregation of Christian Brothers, a worldwide teaching order. More than 200 guests atended the dinner, held at the school.

title: Executive Foresees Social Audits for Businesses
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Feb. 13 Corporate managers will soon have to submit to social as well as fiscal audits, accord ing to the head of one of the nation's leading research and management consulting firms.

title: Canadiens Triumph, 52
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 13 (UPI) John Ferguson and Phil Roberto scored goals 25 seconds apart in the second period tonight to break up a close contest and lead the Montreal Canadiens to a 52 victory over the Cali fornia Golden Seals.

title: Grapefruit League Squeezes 'em in
description: T. PETERSBURG, Fla.It is 9 A.M. at HugginsStengel Field, and the New York Mets do not begin their practice session until 10, but al ready several dozen baseball fans sit patiently on the sunny bleacher boards, awaiting the start of action. They will shortly see some of the world's best ballplayers performing at very close range, free of charge.

title: SCHENK, FORNAESS WIN SKATE TITLES
description: GOTEBORG, Sweden, Feb. 13 (AP)Ard Schenk of the Neth erlands, the defender, won the 5,000meter event in record time today and Dag Fornaess of Norway took the 500meter race in the world speed skating championships.

title: PENN STATE WINS FROM NAVY, 7362
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Feb. 13 (AP)All five Penn State starters scored in dou ble figures today as the Nittany Lions overcame a secondhalf comeback by Navy for a 73 62 basketball victory.

title: Tax on Port Authority Is Urged to Add $30Million Yearly to City's Income
description: A reevaluation of the for mula by which the Port of New York Authority makes payments to New York City was called for yesterday by Richard Lewisohn, the city's Financa Administrator.

title: NEW YORK
description: The three great problenis in the world today are how to bring popu lation, military arms and machines under control. How to keep the funda mental issues in the front of our minds, this is what we'd, like to know.

title: Joan Frances Roby Wed
description: PONTE VEDRA, Fla., Feb. 13The marriage of Miss Joan Frances Roby to John Thayer Davol took place here today in Christ Episco pal Church. The Rev. Alex ander Juhan performed the ceremony. The bride is a daughter of Mrs. Luther Ed ward Roby and the late Mr. Roby. Mr. Davol is a son of Mrs. M. Stuart Roesler and Dr. Rector Thomson Davol, both of Greenwich, Conn.

title: The Environmental Conflict
description: Fresh air and clean water and a healthy environment are essential if human beings are to enjoy a life worth living on this crowded planet. But economic growth is necessary if the nation is to avoid worsening unemploy ment and a depressed standard of living. Last week President Nixon managed to position himself on both sides of this complex issue.

title: Midwest Stock Exchange Automates Paperwork
description: While the New York Stock Exchange worried last week about what the surge in trad ing volume might do to the backoffice operations of its member fims, the Midwest Stock Exchange came to town offering what it termed a solution.

title: Cornell Six Tops Dartmouth In Winter Carnival, 4 to 1
description: HANOVER, N. H., Feb. 13 Cornell produced two goals with a man short and another on a power play to score a 41 Ivy League hockey victory over Dartmouth in the annual Winter Carnival game today at Davis Rink.

title: De Vicenzo and Gonzalez Tie For Lead at 208 in Bogota
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Feb. 13 (AP)Roberto de Vicenzo of Argentina and Rogelio Gonzalez of Bgota shot 70's today for 54hole totals of 203 and tied for first place in the Lagartos international golf tournament.

title: Troubled Soledad To Begin Program Of Conjugal Visits
description: SOLEDAD, Calif., Feb. 131 (UPI)  One of California's most troubled prisons is about to begin a radical new program of conjugal visits for some of its inmates.

title: Guevara rides again
description: The English title for this Bolivian novel is confusing. Does it denote the singular of trousers? A place of ambush? The breaking off or abandon ing something? Or a slot on a rifle barrel, slammed open and shut to admit a cartridge?

title: Railpax Directors Excited By Prospects of Success
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13If the new Railroad Passenger Corporation works the same charm on travelers that it is casting on Its own Presidential ly appointed directors, it will be a smashing success.

title: Soviet Economic Mystery
description: Analysts of the Soviet economy are wrestling with an intriguing mystery: Now can the Soviet Government claim that the industrial out put goal of the just concluded fiveyear plan was success fully reached when almost all the available detailed pro duction data suggest, output actually fell well below the desired levels?

title: Braves Sink Cavaliers
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 13 (AP) Don May scored 35 points, a pro career high, to lead the Buffalo Braves to a 111106 victory over the Cleveland Cav aliers in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Hoover Denies Charge Of Doghouse in Butte
description: HELENA, Mont., Feb. 13 (AP)J. Edgar Hoover, direc tor of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, says it is a lie that the F.B.I. office in Butte, Mont., is a doghouse for agents out of favor.

title: A Birthday for Mrs. Truman
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Feb. 13 (AP)Mrs. Harry S. Truman observed her 86th birthday to day with the former President, who, she said, is feeling pretty well. Mr. Truman was hospi talized for 13 days recently with an intestinal ailment.

title: Women Golf Pros Are Taking On a New Appearance
description: Money, fashion, and all things nice, that's what the women's pro golf tour should be made of, emphasizes Kathy Whitworth, president of the Ladies Professional Golf As sociation.

title: Photography
description: IT could have been Walker Evans whom songwriter Paul Simon was describ ing in his America, though the details are a little off. So far as I know, Evans does not favor gabardine suits, and the camera was not in his bowtie but hidden in his overcoat. For that matter, it was the subway and not a Greyhound line he rode; but Evans was, indeed, a spy. There, at least, Simon was right, though he failed to recognize in the spirit Evans he sketched his own predecessorfor, when Paul Simon was in his infancy, Walker Evans was already gone to look for America.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: The Truth About Yalta
description: PARISThursday was the 26th an niversary of Yalta, meaning the day Roosevelt, Churchill and Stalin signed their agreement. By chance I had lunch with Chip Bohlen, one of the few key survivors of that famous conclave, so I asked how he would describe Yalta in history's light.

title: Cards Sign 3 Catchers
description: ST. LOUIS, Feb. 13 (UPI) Ted Simmons, Jerry McNertney and Bob Stinson, all catchers, have signed their 1971 con tracts, the St. Louis Cardinal general manager, Bing Devine, announced today. The signings bring to 26 the number of Cardinals who have agreed to terms.

title: Conservative Union Names Indiana Editor as Chairman
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 (AP)  The American Conservative Union has announced the elec tion of M. Stanton Evans, edi tor of The Indianapolis News, as its new chairman.

title: OMAN LAUNCHING DRIVE ON REBELS
description: MUSCAT, Oman, Feb. 13 The new Government of this sultanate on the Arabian penin sula is embarking on its most determined military drive yet against leftist rebels in the southern province of Dhofar.

title: 2 SECTIONS TO GET HOUSE TRAILERS
description: The Lindsay administration has selected the Brownsville section of Brooklyn and the Arverne section of Queens as the first sites for house trailers to shelter families now in welfare hotels or removed from urbanrenewal sites or un safe housing.

title: Friday Night Fights
description: Los AngelesKen Buchanan, 134 pounds, Scotland, outpointed Ruben Navarro, 135, Los Angeles, 15 rounds. Buchanan retains world lightweight title.

title: Buchanan's Fistic Skill Lauded By Navarro, His Defeated Foe
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 13 (UPI) Ken Buchanan increased his stature as the world's light weight champion last night as he pounded out a unanimous decision in 15 rounds over Ruben Navarro of Los Angeles. It was the smoothboxing Scots man's first defense of the crown he won last September from Ismael Laguna.

title: NAYAR ADVANCES IN SQUASH RACQUETS
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 13In his first tournament since a skiing accident that kept him in cast for a month, Anil Nayar began defense of his national squash racquets championship today by advancing to the quarterfinal round.

title: There's more to sickness than the healing
description: Paul Ramsey has something of a reputation as the curmudg eon of the community of scholars in the field of Chris tian ethics. When everybody else was concerned with the relevance of the churches to social and political questions, Ramsey asked: Who Speaks for the Church? Just after the obituary of just war theories, he wrote The Just War.

title: Sara Wheeler To Be a Bride
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 Mr. and Mrs. T. Ames Wheel er, formerly of Sewickley, Pa., have made known the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Sara Ames Wheel er, to Dieter Forster, assist ant professor of physics at the University of Chicago. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Willi Forster of Gaildorf, Ger many, where his father is an engineer.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  The un certainty and confusion outside of this town over what the Government is or may be doing to influence private price and wage deci sions is nearly equaled inside it.

title: The Nation
description: LOS ANGELES  When the earthquake struck southern Cal ifornia at 6:01 A.M. last Tues day, Donna Farfalla grabbed her daughter, Debbie, and yelled: It's the end of the world! The Lord has come!

title: Villanova Replaces Buffalo On Syracuse's 1975 Slate
description: Syracuse has added Villanova to its 1975 football schedule as a replacement for the contest originally scheduled for that date between Syracuse and the University of Buffalo. Buffalo dropped intercollegiate football last month.

title: Big Health Science Center Is Rising at Stony Brook
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., Feb., 13Doctors have been coming here in increasing numbers to, work and teeth at the Health Sciences Center, which is under obnstruction and has been par tially open since the fall.

title: ACKLEY ASSAILS NIXON'S POLICIES TO SPUR ECONOMY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13A leading Democratic economist said today there was little or no chance that President Nixon's targets for the economy this year could be achieved with the policies now proposed.

title: Tests on the Astronauts Reflect Problem of Reaction to Drugs
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 13  Dur ing their nineday flight to and from the moon, the Apollo 14 crew, unlike astronauts who preceded them into space, nev er reached into the medical kit in their spacecraft for a pill.

title: NEWTOWN STAR EQUALS RECORD
description: Harold Williams of Newtown High School reaffirmed his superiority among scholastic sprinters yesterday by defeat ing an outstanding 100yard field in the New York Univer sity track games at the 102d Engineers Armory.

title: Dance: Lively, Sensitive Rock Ballet.
description: BOSTON, Feb 13If you have lost heart in what is laughingly called avantgarde dance, with tits young and notsoyoung ladies and gen tlemen selfindulging them selves with incompetent ama teur theatricals, take new courage. Louis Falco is at hand.

title: Arthur Hadley Weds Susan Bryant
description: FRAMINGHAM CENTRE, Mass., Feb. 13In the Plym outh Congregational Church this afternoon, Miss Susan Keith Bryaht was married to Arthur T. Hadley, writer, jour nalist and historian. About 100 guests attended the cere mony, which was performed by the Rev. Harvey F. Am merman.

title: Penn Track Team Wins
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Feb. 13 Capturing eight of 13 events, Penn's track team collected 70 points today to 55 for Prince ton and 12 for Columbia to win the 33d annual Polar Bear Track Meet at Jadwin Gym nasium.

title: Course on Death Is Popular at N.Y.U.
description: Two hundred and twenty students have registered for a course titled The Meaning of Death at New York Univer sity this spring. Dozens of oth ers were turned away.

title: Garage Men Accept Pact, Ending an 11 Day Strike
description: Striking car attendants, washers and foremen accepted a new management contract, proposal yesterday and ended an 11day walkout against 650 garages in Manhattan and the Bronx.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Risk and uncertainty are ingredients of the fashion and textile industries. But, like the mills that weave denim, those turning out corduroy, one of the most versatile in the broad spectrum of tex tiles, seem to have an as sured and growing market for their product.

title: Dogs From 43 States Listed To Compete at the Garden
description: Dogs owned by fanciers from 43 states, the District of Co lumbia, Puerto Rico, Canada and Bermuda will be benched at Madison Square Garden for the Westminster show.

title: Good any time
description: Venison used to be a sometime thing, available only during hunting season, but since the advent of the freezer, venison fanciers can enjoy it whenever the fancy moves them. It is, of course, one of the choicest of meats and never better than when served with poivrade (black pepper) sauce. Another natural complement to venison is sweet and sour red cabbage. Here are recipes for the cabbage, the sauce and roast venison.

title: Harvard Wrestlers Rally To Defeat Columbia, 2016
description: Trailing, 1611, Harvard's wrestlers won the final three bouts to defeat Columbia, 20 16, at the loser's University Gym yesterday.

title: New Royal Scoreboard Shows a Fancy Figure
description: KANSAS CITY, Feb. 13, (UPI)  Ewing Kauffman, owner of the Kansas City Royals, has disclosed plans for a 10story scoreboard in the Harry S. Truman Sports Complex, scheduled to be opened for the 1972 baseball season.

title: Excited by Pictures
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 13 (AP)The Apollo 14 astronauts, still excited about their lunar adven ture, are reliving it through the films they made on the moon and in space, a space agency spokesman said today.

title: Oriole Computer Fast At Fielding the Figures
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 13 (AP) The Baltimore Orioles will use computers in preparing their daily statistical informa tion this season.

title: TV Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: S. MICHAEL RESS
description: S. Michael Ress, a lawyer for more than 50 years, who spe cialized in wills and estates law, died yesterday at Sanger's Nursing Home, 500 West 57th Street. He was 82 years old and lived at 240 West End Avenue.

title: Thomas Isherwood Will Marry Miss Allison R. Turek Aug. 14
description: SOMERVILLE, N. J., Feb. 13Mr. and Mrs. William E. Ozzard of Somerville and Palm Beach Shores, Fla., have announced the engagement of Mrs. Ozzard's daughter, Miss Allison Randolph Turek, to Thomas Isherwood, son of Mr. and Mrs. Howard Isher wood of Rumson.

title: Miami of Ohio Scores
description: ATHENS, Ohio, Feb. 13 (AP) Miami of Ohio moved a step closer to the MidAmerican Conference crown today by eliminating thirdplace Ohio University, 7473.

title: Ohio State Downs Illinois
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Feb. 13 (UPI)Ohio State's Luke Witte, a 7  foot center, scored 27 points despite sitting out much of the second half to lead the Buckeyes to a 9272 victory over Illinois in a Big Ten game today.

title: Miss McEvoy Set for Jumper Event
description: Horse Show News

title: Bay State Rent Bill Upheld
description: BOSTON, Feb. 13 (AP)The Massachusetts Supreme Court has unanimously upheld the legality of the state rent con trol law and a Brookline town ordinance that was passed to extend the state law. The opin ion, written by Justice Paul C. Reardon, was in four cases con solidated from suits involving Brookline and Cambridge.

title: Suffolk Farmer Will Stick to the Soil
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Feb. 13At a time when many young men here are leaving the farm, Thomas Halsey has decided to stay and continue profiting from the rich soil that has sustained his family for more than 300 years.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: One almost uncontested ar gument for British member ship in the European Econom ic Community has been the E.E.C.'s superior record of economic growth.

title: Seale Asks Court to Authorize Goatee Forbidden by Jail Rules
description: NEW HAVEN, Feb. 13The hair on Bobby Seale's chin re turned as a major issue this week in his Federal Court fight against Connecticut jail offi cials.

title: Georgia Tech Score
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Feb. 13 (UPI)Rich Yunkus became the first player in Georgia Tech history to score more than 2,000 points when he tallied 24 tonight to lead a 7366 victory over North Carolina State.

title: How Con Ed's System WorksAnd Why It Sometimes Doesn't
PHELPS'S SYSTEM CLICKS WITH RAMS
description: Dick Phelps, the Fordham basketball coach, spooned up the last of his vanilla fudge ice cream at the Rams' pre game dinner a few days ago and then joined his players for the ride to the gymnasi um  where they won an other game.

title: 44 Youths Crowd L.I. Unit Where 3 Attempted Suicide
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Feb. 13  There are 44 boys and girls at the Nassau Detention Center for Children here, where three girls attempted suicide last week, and they live, In many cases two each, in cagelike rooms 8 by 10 feet with two footsquare windows covered by security screens.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: It was with what can only be described as untrammeled delight that I read a release from the National Audubon Society, which disclosed that there is one bird of the North American continent north of Mexicothe marble murrelet whose nests ornithologists have been unable to find.

title: CHEATING ON FARE GROWING ON L.I.R.
description: The only honest way to beat the high cost of commuting is, of course, to stay home. Recently, however, a lot of Long Islanders have been tak ing a differentand far riskier approach: cheating the Long Island Railroad out of its fares.

title: Religion
description: Ecumenical considerations undoubtedly played a part in the Vatican's decision to let pass without official no tice last year's 100th anni versary of Vatican Council and its promulgation of the contentious doctrine of infal libilitythe doctrine that the Pope cannot err when, in the authority of office, he speaks on faith and morals.

title: The man who's made the most solid contribution to the arts of any President since F.D.R.
description: WASHINGTON.

title: Farmer Takes 300 Marred by Crashes
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 13Charles (Red) Farmer of Hueytown, Ala., driving a 1968 Ford, today won the Permatex 300, an accidentstrewn race for oldermodel stock cars at Daytona International Speed way. Only 16 of the 40 starters were running at the finish.

title: Letters to the. Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Top Sailors Lured by Snipe Series
description: Former world, North Amer ican and United States cham pions will be among the sail ors congregating in Nassau on March 5 for the annual Bahamas Snipe Class winter championships.

title: JUMP RECORD SET AT IRON MOUNTAIN
description: IRON MOUNTAIN, Mich., Feb. 13 (AP)A hill record of 338 feet was established today by Lars Grini of Norway in the first round of the Pine Moun tain international ski jumping tournament.

title: A Revolutionary may To See Guatemala
description: TIKAL, GuatemalaThe ideal time to visit Guatemala, I have dis covered, is when it's cold in New York, when the moon is full over Tikal, and when the Guatemalan Gov ernment is in a state of turmoil. Polit ical disruption occurs frequently enough down here to make this conjunction of circumstances more usual than it sounds, and from what I have observed, Guate malan political turmoil is the quietest in the world.

title: Tax Time
description: If you are about to sit down with your tax return, you may choose to look upon it as a sort of historic adven tureif you are in the mood for simile at a time of stress. You will be dealing with a fundamentally restructured law, a result of the Tax Re form Act of 1969, one of the more significant pieces of legislation in recent years.

title: 2 RAILROADS TRY PLASTIC WINDOWS
description: The two main railroads in the metropolitan area have be gun to install plastic window panes to protect train occu pants from glass  shattering stones thrown by vandals. The railroads also hope to save money on window replace ments.

title: Recordings
description: NOT all requiems, of course, use the tra ditional Latin text of the Catholic Church. One thinks of Brahms's A German Requiem or Hinde mith's When Lilacs Last in the Dooryard Bloom'd. In stead of using different words, Britten complemented the Latin with the poems of Wil fred Owen for his War Requiem.

title: FitzGibbon, Adams Gain Final in Eastern Tennis
description: Herb FitzGibbon of New York, the defending champion, used his eexperience to turn back Art Carrington of Eliza beth, N. J., 62, 63, 97, in the semifinals of the Eastern men's indoor tennis championship yesterday.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON Cleaning up the environment poses immense, almost intractable, problems technical, financial, legislative and legal. Even attempting to deal with these problems creates problems, and especially for Republican Administration.

title: Education
description: Traditionally students have been held accountable for their own records in school. The classroom has been the teacher's castle, and schools have largely escaped the bur den of responsibility for any lack of student achievement.

title: Wilson Assails Heath's Market Policy
description: LONDON, Feb. 13 Harold Wilson, leader of the Labor party opposition, charged Prime Minister Heath tonight with seeking humiliatittg terms for entry into Europe

title: NETS TO SEE ACTION IN DENVER TONIGHT
description: A sixgame trip, covering eight days, starts for the New York Nets today as Lou Car neseca's club faces the Denver Rockets at Denver this after noon. Other contests in the, Nets' longest journey of the season follow: tomorrow, Utah Stars, Salt Lake City; Wednes day, Virginia Squires, Rich mond; Friday, Carolina Cougars, Greensboro, N. C.; Saturday, Texas Chaparrals, Dallas; next Sunday, Kentucky Colonels, Louisville.

title: Selling to the Individual
description: Some years ago, David J. Riesman's The Lonely Crowd startled readers with its stress on the forgotten pockets of the American pop ulation.

title: Spread of Coffee Fungus Forcing Changes in Brazil
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 13 A devastating plant disease has spread 1,000 miles through Brazil's coffee plantations in year, presenting the country with the need for radical and expensive changes in the way growers produce about one third of the world's coffee.

title: Chile Acts to End Seizure of Farms by Peasants
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Feb. 13 With illegal seizures of farms by peasants continuing daily, the Government announced to day that special legislation will be sought to punish the in stigators.

title: For Young Readers
description: In this convincing story of a young. Indian's first encounter with white men in the 1850's, Hatilshay, a young Apache, and Turtleneck, nephew of the tribe's shaman, are traveling across the desert. After Turtleneck injures himself, they meet a band of white soldiers who introduce Hatil shay to some of the strange new tools of the whites. Before leaving the soldiers, the Apaches are shown a carved wooden figure that resembles Turtleneck. Highly superstitious and distrustful of the white man's baleful magic, Turtleneck becomes convinced that his injuries will not heal unless this spirit carving is destroyed.

title: Avery Rockefeller Jr. Weds Mrs. Anne Sammis Patterson
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Feb. 13  The marriage of Mrs. Anne Sammis Patterson to Avery Rockefeller Jr., presi dent of Dominick & Domi nick, stockbrokers, took place here this morning. The Rev. Dr. Otis A. Maxfield of the Second Congregational Church of Greenwich per formed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Jesse F. Sammis 3d, brother and sisterinlaw of the bride.

title: NEW CITY SCHOOL TO STRESS FLYING
description: Twentynine years ago, as the country still reeled from the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor, Woodrow Wilson Vo cational High School hastily opened its doors in Queens to train young meti and women for warrelated industries.

title: Daytona Limits Carburetors To Equalize the Competition
description: About Motor Sports

title: Grumman Expects to Stabilize Jobs, Leveling Off at 24,000 in 1971
description: BETHPAGE, Feb. 13  Long Island's largest employer, the Grumman Corporation expects its employment to level off at about 24,000 this year from a payroll of 37,100 two years ago, Llewellyn J. Evans, presi dent, said in a recent interview.

title: Falmouth Rejects Plan To Put Sewage in Sea
description: FALMOUTH, Mass., Feb. 13 (AP)The Town of Falmouth has rejected a proposed $7.7 million sewer and marine out fall system that would have dumped partly treated sew age into Vineyard Sound.

title: Police Trainee, 19, Arrested
description: A 19yearold offduty police trainee was arrested in Brook lyn yesterday and suspended for allegedly possessing two yellow pills believed to be LSD. The suspect, Salvatore Maffet tone, of 2232 Bragg Street, Sheepshead Bay, Brooklyn, was appointed Jan. 30, 1970 and worked in the Identification Section. The trainee, two other youths and a girl were arrested at 1:15 A.M. in the athletic field of Fort Hamilton High School at 8301 Shore Road, Bay Ridg??

title: Sow Your Own Amaryllis
description: THE pleasure of grow ing house plants from seeds is increased when seedpods can be picked from your own plants. In order to achieve this end, though, the gardener must cast himself in the role of honeybee and brush pollen from one flower onto the stigma of another flower of the same kind of plant to encourage seed set.

title: WALKIN CENTER COUNSELS YOUTHS
description: WOODMERE, L.I., Feb. 13 I've just taken 20 pills and I'm afraid I'm going to die.

title: Ailing Cambodia Premier Flies To Honolulu for Convalescence
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Feb. 13Cambodia's ailing Premier, Gen. Lon Nol, was helped aboard a special United States Air Force jet here under tight security this afternoon and took off for an indefinite convales cence at the Tripler United States Army hospital outside: Honolulu.

title: Letters to the. Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Announcements
description: Anniversaries

title: FIREMEN'S DEATHS STIR PITTSBURGH
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb, 13A sixalarm fire that took the lives of two firemen this week has rekindled a contro versy between the firemen's union and the city administra tion.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Prof. Cyril McDermott, 67, Law Librarian at St. John's
description: Prof. Cyril Lavelle McDer mott, law librarian and a mem ber of the faculty, of St. John's University Law School since 1947, died Thursday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived at 160 Henry Street, Brooklyn.

title: Barbara Bachmann Is Betrothed
description: Miss Barbara Lynn Bach mann and Thomas Wolff Strauss, who met through their interest in the New Leadership Division of the Federation of Jewish Philan thropies of New York, plan to be married at the St. Re gisSheraton Roof on March 21.

title: Women Revolt in Tennis
description: Women's tennis, once known more for frilly fashions than crosscourt forehands and flat first serves, is achieving un paralleled growth, identity and unity as a professional sport.

title: NEW LAW CONTROLS USE OF EXPLOSIVES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 (UPI) New Federal regulations have gone into effect putting the sale and use of explosives under strict controls. More than 50 persons have been killed in bombing incidents since offi cials began keeping a record Jan. 1, 1969. The Bomb Data Center, established by the In ternational Association of Chiefs of Police last July, re ports that bombings continue at an average of 150 a month.

title: Aussies Throw Beer Cans In Protest of Hit Batsman
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 13 (Reuters)Captain Ray Dilling worth led his team off the field when England's fast bowler, John Snow, was peppered with beer cans on the second day of the seventh and last test against Australia. Play was in terrupted for seven minutes.

title: Tennessee Downs Georgia
description: ATHENS, Ga., Feb. 13 (UPI) Mike Edwards hit on a. free throw with three seconds remaining tonight and Don Johnson tipped in the missed second free throw to give Ten nessee a 64.61 victory over Georgia.

title: Stamps
description: A NUMBER of new stamps, postal cards and enve lopes are in the offing from the United States Postal Service. On Feb. 2, James W. Hargrove, Assist ant Postmaster General, an nounced that new postage rates had been requested by the Postal Service. These would increase first class rates to 8 cents (from 6 cents), the postal card rate to 7 cents (from 5 cents) and the air post rate to 11 cents (from 10 cents). In addition, higher rates were requested for second class mail (maga zines and newspapers), for mailing books and for third class mail (usually referred to as junk mail). Fourth class parcel postal rates are not due for a raise, inasmuch as they were increased last November.

title: 8YEAROLD SKIER IS JUMPING VICTOR
description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, N.Y., Feb. 13  Little Todd Brooks, a strong, 8yearold ski jumper from Brattleboro, Vt., won the Bear. Mountain junior ski hon ors for competitors 9 and under.

title: Stars Subdue Chaparrals
description: DALLAS, Feb. 13 (UPI) Merv Jackson led a late rally that carried the Utah Stars to a 121114 victory over the Texas Chaparrals tonight. Jack sonu hit 9 point in the last three minutes.

title: New Freak Printing Discovered
description: FREAK printing of postage stamps has not been uncommon in recent years with the increased use of offset and gravure printing which in many in stances provides a broader use of multi color reproduction.

title: The Doctor's New Dilemma Will I Be Sued?
description: MY examining room is a rather cozy little place, just about big enough for me my nurse, my patient and Mr. McDermott. Oh, occasionally the shade of Hippocrates or Osier or one of my medical school professors manifests itself, but Mr. McDermott  or, rather, his almost palpable spiritus  is always there. McDermott is, of course, my friendly insurance man; it is his company that swears it has me protected with some million or two dollars' worth of malpractice insurance, and it is to him that I will go running ifGod forbida patient ever takes it into mind to sue me.

title: P. W. Reed Jr. Becomes Fiance Of Sallie Riland
description: The engagement of Miss Sallie Jane Riland to Pendin nes W. Reed Jr. has been announced by her parents, Dr. and Mrs. W. Kenneth Ri land. Dr. Riland, an osteo path, is chief physician in the New York office of the United States Steel Corpora tion and a personal physician to President Nixon and Gov ernor Rockefeller.

title: President Requests Emergency Power To Bar Rail Strike
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13  With time running out for settlement of a national rail road labor dispute, President Nixon asked Congress today for emergency powers to block any new interruption of service after the March 1 strike dead line.

title: Familiar Stranger Is Best of Breed at Knickerbocker Dachshund Specialty
description: The Knickerbocker Dachs hund Club, a Manhattanbased organization, held its first point show yesterday at the Hotel McAlpin. New Yorkers were conspicuous by their ab sence when it came time to pick up the winning awards.

title: Rauch LongTime Chairman
description: Since the Westminster show was first held in 1877, there have been only 23 benchshow chairmen. William Rauch served the longest term, heading com mittees for 27 consecutive fix turesfrom 1901 through 1927.

title: BLUES DEFEAT RANGERS, 21;
description: ST LOUIS, Feb. 13The trade that brought Garry Unger to St. Louis from Detroit last weekend finally bore fruit to night against the New York Rangers.

title: McGlocklin Accounts for Key Points as Bucks Overcome Bulls, 103 to 96
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 13 (UPI) The Milwaukee Bucks caught the Chicago Bulls with a little over three minutes to play to post a 103.96 National Basket ball Association victory today.

title: Ramiriz, Martin Victors In Port Washington Tennis
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Feb. 13  Raul Ramirez of Mexico overwelmecl Glen Daw son of Wycoff, N.J., 60, 6.0, today and moved into the quar ter finals of the 18year boys' division of the Port Washington Tennis Classic for juniors. Ra mirez is topseeded.

title: GUENTHER TAKES $70,000 BOWLING
description: OVERLAND PARK, Kan., Feb. 13 (UPI)  Johnny Guenther lost his bid for, a perfect game today, but took first place and the $10,000 winner's check in the $70,000 STP bowling tournament.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Article 8  No Title
description: John Molinari scored 32 points to lead Queens College to a 7371 victory over Hobart State College last night. Queens is now 711 wonlost while Hobart is 611.

title: CENSUS DATA KEPT AT KANSAS BANK
description: PITTSBURG, Kan., Feb. 13 For more than half a million Americans a year who have trouble proving such mundane but vital things as how old they are and where they were born, the answers lie here.

title: Miss Susan Willcox Is Betrothed
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., Feb. 13  Mr. and Mrs. Charles Hall Delamater of West Hartford and Weeka paug, R.I., have announced the engagement of Mrs. Dela mater's daughter, Miss Susan Ainslie Willcox, to John Su therland Mackay, son of Mr. and Mrs. Malcolm Sutherland Mackay of Long Lake, Minn., formerly of Far Hills, N.J.

title: The right neuroses at the right time
description: Frederick Taylor and Henry Ford stand smack in the mainstream of our culture's drive toward mastery of the material universe. Ford has of course become pretty much of totem to us; but Taylor, though un familiar to the average person, is a figure in some ways as impor tant and impressive. He is known today as the inventor of the time andmotion study, a discovery that, as Sudhir Raker lucidly points out in his study of Taylor, stands for a radically new cultural attitude.

title: Here today, gone tomorrow
description: Many mobile Americansone out of every, five families moves each yearwill recognize the problems and the thinking behind this inventive apartment. When Subhash Paranjpe and his wife moved to Washington, D.C. after he had completed his archi tectural studies at Yale, they weren't sure how long they would be living there. They were understandably reluctant to spend much money on furnishings or on making alterations to their apartment. Instead, Mr Paranjpe relied on supergraphics and furniture of his own design, with the results shown here: a simple and lively solution to interim apartment living.

title: Letters
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Powell, in Francey Is Critical
description: PARIS, Feb. 13Enoch Pow ell, one of the leaders of the opposition in Britain to Com mon Market membership, has carried his arguments into the country that twice blocked British bids in the last decade.

title: Hornsby Is Expected to Add Dash to Giant Defense
description: About Pro Football

title: U.S. Set to Take Direct Action In Ridding Sound of Pollution
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 The Federal Government, feeling that New York and Connecticut are not able to do the job, themselves, is about to step in directly for the first time to clean up pol lution in the waters of Long Island Sound.

title: For Young Readers
description: Escaping from a preying falcon, Amabella the dove reverts to the habit of her ancestral relations (tumbler pigeons) and somersaults backward, disappearing over a roof top Mr. Tidier, her devoted mate, mopes until a starling alerts him to Amabella's predicament: she has landed in a chimney too narrow for her wingspread. Also, she has laid an egg there. Mr. Tidier finds her and treats her generouslyenough corn for sixbut there is no sign that Amabella, or the young bird subsequently hatched there will get out. Finally, rather abruptly, a curi ous plumber's boy checks out Mr. Tid ler's strutting and accidentally frees the trapped birds.

title: Clashes in Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Feb. 13 (Reuters)  Cambodian troops clashed with about 300 Vietcong guerrillas today at Samdech Yos airfield, 100 miles northwest of Pnompenh, a high command spokesman re ported. Two Cambodian sol diers were seriously wounded, he said.

title: Souvanna's Rule Seems Firm Despite Many Factions in Laos
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 13 Prince Souvanna Phouma, the suave, durable 69yearold aris tocrat who has been Premier of Laos for most of the last decade, seems assured that his leadership will continue for at least the immediate future.

title: HUGHES PRESSED TO END SECLUSION
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Feb. 12 It was apparent in court here this week that Robert A. Maheu's strategy in his $50 million damage action against Howard R. Hughes is to try to put the billionaire recluse in the position of having to either settle or emerge from seclusion to give a deposition.

title: MUSICAL LINCOLN SEEN BY CHILDREN
description: Yesterday afternoon, a rainy one, a sizable crowd of hope fullooking children and adults attended Young Abe Lincoln, a musical aimed squarely at the youngsters, at Town Hall. The show was delightful.

title: Geraldine Gerrard Is Planning Marriage to Andrew C. Mitchell
description: Mrs. Edward Gerrard of Dublin has announced here the engagement of her daughter, Miss Geraldine Gerrard, to Andrew Clair Mitchell, son of John Mc Clellan Mitchell of Stamford, Conn., and Greensboro, Vt., and Mrs. Barbara J. Mitchell of Stamford.

title: Letters
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: U.S.C. CONQUERS OREGON, 93 TO 78
description: EUGENE, Ore., Feb. 13 (UPI) Southern California, getting numerous second and third shots at the Oregon basket, broke from a tie midway through the second half today and downed Oregon, 9378, in a Pacific Eight Conference game.

title: Montauk Club Opens Its Doors To Families as Rolls Dwindle
description: The oncefashionable Mon tauk Club in the Park Slope section of Brooklyn is opening its ornate Victorian doors these days, to young, familyoriented business and professional men.

title: Providence Victor, 8876
description: PROVIDENCE, Feb. 13 (AP) Ernie Gregorio a sophomore, scored 22 points to lead Provi dence to an 8876 basketball victory over St. Joseph's of Philadelphia today.

title: 4 NETS SIGN, 7 TO GO AS TRAINING NEARS
description: Four young prospects signed their 1971 contracts with the New York Mets yesterday, leaving only seven players un signed with spring training ap proaching.

title: Excerpts From Tass Summary of New Soviet FiveYear Plan Favoring Consumer
description: Following are excerpts from a summary of the Soviet Un ion's eighth fiveyear plan, made public yesterday and distributed in English by the official Soviet press agency, Tass:

title: Mail: Power Squadrons' Critic
description: To the Editor:

title: MADISON AVE.
description: Nothing like a little expo sure to help sales. What else do you think has brought all those airline ticket offices to such busy strips as Fifth Ave nue, the ChampsElyses, the Via Veneto, Regent Street, Zurich's Bahn Hof Strasse, San Francisco's Post Street and Los Angeles's Sixth Street? Visibility. That's it, visibility.

title: FLORIDA UPSETS KENTUCKY, 7465
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Feb, 13 (UPI)Tom Purvis scored 21 points and Earl Findley added 22 tonight to pace Florida to 74.65 upset over eighthranked Kentucky. Purvis and Findley dominated the backboards de spite Kentucky's 7foot center, Torn Payne.

title: IONA, ST. FRANCIS IN ICE SHOWDOWN
description: Iona College, the Metropoli tan Intercollegiate. Hockey League's Western Division champion, and St. Francis Col lege, playoff champion the past two seasons, will playtoday at 2:30 P.M.,. at Madison Square Garden.

title: Trainer Got His Job Through the YouKnowWhat
description: Dave Dunckley, currently one of the more successful harness racing trainers at Yonkers Raceway, got his job through The New York Times.

title: Marquette Wins, 8167
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 13 (UPI) Dean Meminger sank 27 points tonight to lead second ranked Marquette to an 8167 victory over Detroit and its 20th victory in a row this sea son.

title: Letter to the Editor 1  No Title
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Leafs Crush Kings, 81
description: TORONTO, Feb. 13 (UPI) Paul Henderson scored two goals tonight to lead the Tor onto Maple Leafs to an 81 vic tory over the Los Angeles Kings.

title: JUANA IS WINNER AT TALLMAN SHOW
description: TALLMAN, N. Y., Feb. 13 Juana, Dr. Frank West's 7year old bay mare, won two classes and finished third in the stake today to capture the open HolidayCarousel Horse Show.

title: Reform a National Mood In County Governments
description: County governmentlong re garded as the dark continent of American politicsis un dergoing major reform and ex perimentation across the coun try.

title: Chester, Pa., Drops Charges Against Rights Protesters
description: CHESTER, Pa., Feb. 13 (AP)  Charges against some 300 persons involved in civil rights demonstrations here in 1964 have been dismissed in Dela ware County Common Pleas Court.

title: CORNELL TO SHUT A MIGRANT CAMP
description: ITHACA, N.Y., Feb. 13  Cornell University has decided to close a migrant labor camp it has been operating as part of a research farm following criticism that the migrant work ers were living under bad con ditions.

title: TV Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: National League
description: From Florida to California, baseball training camps will sprout in the next few days and, as the National League National League prepares for its 96th season, freeforalls loom in both the Eastern and Western Divisions.

title: The Joys And Terrors Of Sending The Kids to College
description: WE live in a time in which irony, once the prerogative of poets and professors, has become the daily fare of ordinary middleclass folks. Saving up to buy a better car, they find themselves contributing to pollution and con gestion. With the car in the garage, the husband moonlights and the wife goes back to work in order to be able to send the kids off to col lege in styleonly to discover that to the children this culmination of their parents' working lives is hardly worthy of all that anxious sweat. For the children it is seen all too often not as a deliverance but rather as one more barrier to deliverance.

title: Degnan Asks Ouster of Unruly Pupils
description: FREEPORT, the Bahamas, Feb. 13Disruptive students who prevent other youngsters from learning should be re moved from school, a meeting of New York City school super visters was told today.

title: Books: Business Debt to Society
description: The cover of this book shows a sprinkling of coins, as if they were being thrown away. Perhaps their message is that a humane society does cost money and business must foot the bill.

title: HEAD OF SYRACUSE U. TO JOIN U. OF ILLINOIS
description: CHICAGO, Feb, 13Dr. John E. Corbally Jr., the president and chancellor of Syracuse Uni versity since 1969, was selected today to become president of the University of Illinois next Sept. 1, succeeding Dr. David Dodds Henry.

title: Music
description: IF an unusual number of composers, performers, music educators and theorists beat a path to Rochester, N. Y., next season, there is a good reason. The Eastman School of Music, which is part of the Univer sity of Rochester, will be celebrating its 50th anniver sary. Walter Hendl, director of the school, and officials of the university have planned so many special activities that they are beginning to wonder how they will last through them, much less see that they take place.

title: Anne C. Roome Engaged to Wed R. N. Bavier 3d
description: DARIEN, Conn., Feb. 13 Mr. and Mrs. Hugh Reinagle Roome 2d have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Anne Ross Roome, to Chief Warrant Officer Robert Newton Bavier 3d, U.S.A. A spring wedding is planned.

title: The stuff that nightmares are made of
description: Curled up, with an insulted look on his upturned face, and wearing a peppermintstriped shirt, the fresh corpse of a man is disclosed in a hole in the ground. From the scene of the crime the victim's little boy is carried off, nobody knows why; by a pair of troubled teenagers. And at the same time, a deadly forest fire gets its start in these hills above Santa Teresa: whoever murdered Stanley Broadhurst must have caused him to drop his cigarillo into the dry grass. So opens the new novel by Ross Macdonald, The Underground Man. It comes to stunning achieve ment.

title: G.M. Tarrytown Layoff Set
description: NORTH TARRYTOWN, N. Y., Feb. 13 (AP)Truck production will cease April 2 at the Gen eral Motors assembly plant in North Tarrytown and will re sult in the layoff of 700 work ers, the plant's manager, John Kuyper, said today. Mr. Kuyper said the move came in exfi tensive rearrangement, of plant facilities to make more space available for production of Chevrolet automobiles. The plant employs 5,500.

title: Markets Up Again, But Rally Slows; Volume Hits. Peak
description: THE WEEK IN FINANCE

title: TV Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Male Fails Meter Maid Test
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Feb 13 (AP)Lyle Binks, 23yearold, took an examination Jan. 5 for city meter maid. He was the lone male applicant for the work, which attracted about 220 women. But Mr. Binks, a Wash ington State University gradu ate, failed to place in the top 20. He said he had hoped to get the job, which would have al lowed him to go to graduate school nights.

title: State Aide Is a Master of Ceremony
description: ALBANY, Feb 13For 28 years Louis Sherwin, a crusty, friendly man has been the State Proclamations Of ficer, composing the high flown prose appropriate for scrolls signed by the Gover nor in honor of such events as Grange Week, Eye Donors Week and Jacques Lipchitz Day.

title: Direct Dialing Area in U.S. From London Is Extended
description: LONDON, Feb. 13 (UPI) The staterun post office, in an unannounced move, has ex tended the areas in the United States that can be dialed direct ly from London telephones. Until now, London subscribers were able to dial only New York City directly.

title: War Heim Returns $100 by Capturing $132,100 Strub Stakes at Santa Anita
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Feb. 13 War Heim, a 491 outsider, won the $132,100 Charles H. Strub Stakes by a nose today from Hanalei Bay at Santa Anita Park.

title: Ghosts of Old Movies Haunt Queens Studio
description: The sound stage is a dimly lighted cavern, an un used storehouse piled high with crates and desks and filing cabinets. The televi sion studio is barred shut. The film laboratories and storage vaults are empty and sealed. Where 3,000 peo ple once made movies, now there are 72 caretakers wait ing for the big studio on 35th Street in Long Island City, Queens, to die.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTON  After the 1967 ArabIsraeli war, 5oth the Egyptians and Is raelis regarded the Suez Ca nal as a trump card for negotiations. But they mis calculated. And now, para doxically, because the canal proved far less valuable than they had expected, it sud denly offers a possible, tan talizing way out of their pro longed deadlock.

title: TWO NEW SCHOOLS ARE OPENED HERE
description: Two new schools opened here last week, one public, one private. One is in the Bronx, the other is in Manhattan. One has 400 pupils, the other has six.

title: News of the Rialto
description: THOSE who indulge in the annual summer rit ual of brushing up on their Shakespeare should now include O'Neill. That is if a visit to the Amer ican Shakespeare Festival in Stratford, Conn., is contem plated. There, starting in June, Artistic Director Mi chael Kahn will be staging a revival of O'Neill's Mourn ing Becomes Electra.

title: Laotian Base Attacked
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Sunday, Feb. 14 (AP)  North Vietnafi mese regulars were reported to have launched a major attack, last night against the guerrilla base at Long Tieng, causing severe damage and heavy casu alties, including at least one member of the United States Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Saigon Is Using Deserters as Coolies
description: DONGHA, South Vietnam, Feb. 13When Tran Nam and the other members of his unit crossed into Laos this week, they went as con victs under sentence. They carried no weapons. Nam was certain he would not return.

title: HERO CLEANER WINS REPRIEVE IN BRITAIN
description: LONDON Feb. 13 (AP) Yallya Bahari, the Malayan born railway station cleaner who became a British hero when he chased a litterdrop ping passenger with a sickle won his freedom yesterday from exile to one of London's grubbiest stations. But he lost out to his wife, who didn't want him to return to the little countryside station that he kept the cleanest on the line.

title: DUKE OVERCOMES MARYLAND, 7067
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Feb. 13 (AP)Duke, playing without Randy Denton for most of the second half, held off Maryland in the closing minutes and scored a 7067 basketball vic tory over the Terps today.

title: Kansas Triumphs, 6350
description: STILLWATER, Okla., Feb. 13 (UPI)Oklahoma State stayed with Kansas through the first half today, but the Jayhawks then shook off the Cowboys to record a 6350 victory.

title: Misses Schut and Mittermeier Score at Japan's PreOlympics
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Feb. 13 (AP)  Johanna Schut, The Netherlands' lone standard bearer, narrowly averted a So viet Union speed skating sweep and Rosi Mitternieir of West Germany edged out two French stars in the injurymarred wo men's ski slalom today as Inter national Winter Sports Week, forerunner of the 1972 Olympio Games, neared conclusion.

title: Mrs. Johnson Named
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Feb. 13 (AP) Mrs. Lyndon B. Johnson, wife of the former President, was approved by the Senate nomi nations committee today as a University of Texas Regent.

title: The mystique of the scientist, the mysticism of the priest
description: Energy, more than any other word, gives us a clue to the thought of Teilhard de Chardin, the French Jesuit, scientist and philosopher who died in 1955.
