description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14 (UPI) Russell Train, chairman of the President's Council on En vironmental Quality, said today that his agency was not satis fied completely with the idea of building an oil pipeline across Alaska. He said the council would try to get an swers to several questions about the transAlaska pipeline proposal at hearings here this week, and next week in Alaska.

title: Six Die in HeadOn Crash
description: CITRONELLE, Ala., Feb. 14 (AP)Two cars collided head on near here today killing six persons and Injuring four oth ers. All the dead were young men.

title: BINGHAMTON MAN YACHTING WINNER
description: PUERTO AZUL, Venezuela, Feb. 14 (AP)Ted Moore, a recent Cornell graduate of Bing hamton, N. Y., won the second world Sunfish class champion ship today in waters off this Caribbean port. His score, on the Olympic system employed, was a low 21.7 points.

title: POLISH LEADERS ACT TO END STRIKE
description: WARSAW, Monday, Feb. 15 A fourman Politburo dele gation led by Premier Piotr Jaroszewicz spent four hours yesterday with Lodz textile workers an effort to end a strike that began on Thursday.

title: Builders and Unions Sign an Accord to Curb Strikes
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 14 The National Constructors Association and the Building and Construction Trades De partment of the A.F.L.C.I.O. reached agreement today on uniform work rules and finan cial penalties in jurisdictional disputes.

title: Gerulaitis Reaches Final In Port Washington Tennis
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Feb. 14 (UPI)Vitus Gerulaitis of Howard Beach, Queens, up set Octavio Martinez of Mexi co, 62, 62, in the 18year semi finals of the Port Washington Tennis Classic for juniors to night. In the afternoon he ousted Chico Hagey of Cali fornia, the nation's 10thranked junior.

title: RUSSEL CAPTURES SPECIAL SLALOM
description: BEAUPRE, Quebec, Feb. 14 Shaggyhaired Patrick Rus sel of France, who arrived in Canada earlier this week rank ing fourth in World Cup com petition catapaulted himself into the lead today with a pair of allornothing winning sla lom performances.

title: Cab Findings Questioned
description: News Analysis

title: NEWCOMBE SNAPS 17MATCH STREAK
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 14  Rod Laver finally lost a tennis match today.

title: All 25 on Board Survive Crash of Heart Fund DC3
description: SHAWNEE, Okla., Feb. 14 (UPI)A DC3 carrying 23 pas sengers at a penny a pound to raise money for the heart fund crashed southeast of Shawnee today, seriously injuring nine persons, seven of them chil dren.

title: Youth Symphony Shows Grace and Training
description: The Youth Symphony Or chestra of New York really out did itself in its concert at Car negie Hall Saturday afternoon. The young players (ages 12 to 21) did this by presenting a program that featured Proko fiev's Alexander Nevsky and also included Beethoven's Fan tasy for Piano, Chorus and Or chestra (Op. 80) and music from Ives's Washington's Birthday.

title: Air War in Laos
description: Shortly before South Vietnamese troops invaded the Laotian panhandle backed by awesome American air power, a Laotian general in the area told a New York Times correspondent he did not want American aerial support. Every time the Americans are called in bomb, they destroy friends and not enemies, he said.

title: News of War in Laos Comes in Bits
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 14 The war in Laos is still an out ofbounds, largely secret war.

title: South Vietnamese Troops Reach Supply Trail in Laos, but Are Shelled by the Enemy
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Mon day, Feb. 15An Air Force plane accidentally bombed a friendly unit yesterday morn ing near the United Statessup ported base at Long Tieng in Laos, the military command here announced today.

title: United Air Lines Loses Bid To Raise Fares for 3 Cities
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 (AP) The Civil Aeronautics Board has denied United Air Lines permission to raise fares slight ly in 22 markets involving Chi cago, New York and Washing ton.

title: BIRDIE PUTT HALTS FLOYD'S UPSET BID
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Feb. 14 (UPI)Arnold Palmer, re fusing to buckle under pressure by Ray Floyd, rolled in a 25 foot birdie putt on the first hole of a suddendeath playoff today to take the $140,000 Bob Hope Desert Classic, his first golf victory in 14 months.

title: Frances Lumpkin, Pianist, Married
description: Miss Frances Arlene Lump kin, concert pianist and ac companist for the New York City Ballet at Lincoln Center, was married here yesterday afternoon to Eugene Daniel Renzi, manager of market research and analysis for Teledyne CAE, formerly Con tinental Aviation and Engi neering.

title: Garage in Village Burns
description: A smoky threealarm fire de stroyed a trucking garage and damaged two adjacent build ings in Greenwich Village yes terday. The police said the fire broke out shortly after 6 A.M. in the onestory garage of the Rolling T Trucking Company at 275 West 10th Street. It spread to a onestory truck loading building owned by Harders Express Company, at 140 Charles Street, and to Shep pards Warehouse, a 12story building at 667 Washington Street.

title: Comment From Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14  A Defense Department spokesman said today that he had no knowledge of incidents of con doned cheating on such exami nations. He predicted that the existence of any unqualified of ficers manning missile battalions would not go undiscovered.

title: Judy Padow Group Presents Experimental Dance Program
description: Who would want to see four girls tire themselves out suc cessively with a set of exercises seemingly closer to natural movement than trained dance techniques? Apparently, the hundred or so persons, almost exclusively young, who crowded into a loft at 98 Greene Street Friday night to watch Solos Dances by Judy Padow as per formed by Miss Padow, Rachel Lew, Suzanne Harris and Kate Parker.

title: A Correction
description: In the caption accompanying a photograph of an Atlanta City Council meeting that ap peared on Page 29 in Saturday's editions of The Times, Vice Mayor Maynard Jackson was incorrectly identified. Mr. Jack son was seated at the top right in the picture.

title: Steel Mills Expect Problems to Lead To Delivery Delays
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 14 As the steel inventory buildup con tinues to gain momentum, two problems loom larger and larger. Rollingmill capacity limitations will cause delivery lead times to extend and this problem will be compounded by a shortage of transportation facilities both rail cars and trucks.

title: 10th in Row for Lakers
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Feb. 14 (UPI)The Los Angeles Lakers ran their home winning streak to 10 games tonight by handing the Cincinnati Royals a 125113 defeat. It was the Royals' sev enth loss in a row. Jerry West led the Laker scoring with 22 points. He also had 12 assists to set a team record of 565.

title: Martin Jumps 345 Feet to Set North American Ski Record
description: IRON MOUNTAIN, Mich. Feb. 14 (AP)  Jerry Martin, 20yearold United States champion, set a North Ameri can ski jumping record of 345 Beet today in the first round of the Kiwanis Ski Club invita tion meet on Pine Mountain.

title: Arctic Maneuver Planned
description: ANCHORAGE, Feb. 14 (AP) About 140 Alaska service men will parachute onto polar ice early next month in a train ing mission to prepare them for Arctic searchandrescue and firstaid operations.

title: Lon Nol Reported Cheerful
description: HONOLULU, Feb. 14 (UPI) The ailing Premier of Cambodia, Lieut. Gen. Lon Nol, was re ported alert, cooperative and cheerful today at Tripler Gen eral Hospital. United States Army doctors said that the Pre mier, who suffered a stroke a week ago, had slept intermit tently and comfortably his first night here.

title: FITZGIBBON RETAINS EASTERN NET CROWN
description: Herb FitzGibbon won the Eastern men's indoor tennis championship for the second year in row yesterday.

title: Jewel Best in Maltese Show For Third Consecutive Year
description: The American Maltese Asso ciation's catalogue cover wore a heart for Valentine's Day yesterday and the fifth spe cialty show in the StatlerHit ton had a Jewel, adorned with red bows, as a winner.

title: Allende's First 100 Days: The Socialism Is Low Key
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Feb. 14 Chile's first hundred days on the road to socialism have shown President Salvador Al lende Gossens to be clearly in charge of his leftwing Gov ernment.

title: Stars Edge Penguins, 54
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Feb. 14 (UPI)  Gordon LaBossiere scored his 15th goal of the sea son at 7:20 of the second period and it stood up as the winning margin for the Minnesota North Stars as they defeated the Pitts burgh Penguins, 5.4, today. The victory snapped a sixgame Minnesota losing streak.

title: Washington's Birthday
description: Washington's Birthday is being celebrated today. Fol lowing is a list of services that are, or are not, affected:

title: Byron Janis Plays Romantic Program
description: A moody unpredictability, perhaps appropriate for the overwhelmingly Romantic pro gram he played, hung over By ron Janis's piano recital yester day afternoon at Hunter Col lege Assembly Hall. Although Mr. Janis does not appear here often in recital, he is a major talent whose work, even when it has its ups and downs, as it did this time, commands the attention.

title: CHURCH SERVICES HEED IN LUNAR LAB
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 14 (AP) A cook who also is a Baptist minister conducted brief church services today for the Apollo 14 astronauts, who are quaran tined here in the lunar receiv ing laboratory.

title: Greece Increases Security For Diplomats and Aircraft
description: ATHENS, Feb. 14  Greece's militarybacked regime has stepped up security precautions for civil aviation and the diplo matic corps atter reports of an impending spectacular move by Arab commandos.

title: Flood Washes Out Phones For 50,000 in White Plains
description: WHITE PLAINS, Feb. 14 About 50,000 customers were without telephone service here today as a result of the flood ing of the power room in the New York Telephone Com pany's Spring Street office, which houses exchanges serv ing this area.

title: JACK W. MAYER, 77, EXTHEATER OWNER
description: Jack W. Mayer, a former owner and manager of the Liberty Theater on West 42d Street, who booked hit shows of the nineteen  twenties and thirties there, died Saturday night in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 77 years old and lived at 209 West 86th Street.

title: Doctors' Role in Health Planning Is Called Steadily Diminishing
description: The incoming president of the Medical Society of the State of New York warned yesterday of the steadily diminishing role of physicians in public planning of medical servicesand placed much of the blame on the doc tors themselves.

title: Celtics Top Pistons
description: DETROIT, Feb. 14 (AP)  Two free throws by John Hay Heck with seven seconds re maining enabled the Boston Celtics to edge the Detroit Pistons, 110108, today. Coach Toni Heinsohn of Boston was tossed out by referee Mendy Rudolph for having disputed foul call.

title: U. S. Bombers Strike Trail
description: SAIGON, Feb. 14 (AP)  United States bombers roamed across the eastwest axis of the Ho Chi Minh trail in southern Laos today, the United States command said, attacking sus pected North Vietnamese moun tain outposts overlooking Route 9 on the approaches to the town of Tchepone.

title: Damage Estimate Cut
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14 (AP) The Office of Emergency Pre paredness said today that Tues day's earthquake in California caused only $250million to $300million in damage. It was well below other estimates.

title: Sadat Spells Out Position on Withdrawal by Israelis
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14The United Arab Republic is pre pared to reopen the Suez Canal within six months if Israel will withdraw her troops to the east ern edge of the Sinai Peninsula, President Anwar elSadat has stated in an interview.

title: Resources Data Center
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14 (UPI) The Federal Government has signed a contract for design of a $4.8million data center at Sioux Falls, S.D., to process in formation from satellites and planes about earth resources, it was announced today. The center is a joint project of the Interior Department and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.

title: Virginia Sells Names
description: RICHMOND, Feb. 14 (AP) The state of Virginia sold the names of its registered car owners yesterday to one of the nation's largest reservoirs of information for direct mail ad vertisers. The Department of Motor Vehicles said that the list was sold at auction to R. L. Polk and Company of Detroit for $16,250.

title: TOSCAN CAPTURES PARIS TROT FINAL
description: PARIS, Feb. 14Toscan won the race, but this story is about Tidalium Plo Follow him round the hilly Vincennes track.

title: Code to Be Sought on Food Ads On TV Shows Aimed at Children
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14 Robert B. Choate, who caused a major controversy last year when he questioned the nutri tional content of breakfast ce reals, will propose tomorrow stiff code for broadcast food advertising aimed at children.

title: THIRD RAIL UNION REACHES ACCORD IN STRIKE THREAT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14  The railroads reached a con tract agreement early today with the Brotherhood of Rail way and Airline Clerics, the largest of four unions that had threatened to strike on March 1. The union represents 180, 000 workers.

title: Army Plans to Freeze 3 Million Birds to Death
description: MILAN, Tenn., Feb, 14 (AP)The Army is planning to freeze to death three mil lion or so blackbirds that took up residence two years ago at the Milan Arsenal.

title: Car Collides With Plane
description: SUNRAY, Tex., Feb. 14 (AP) Roy Melton Graves, 20 years old, was slightly injured today when his automobile and a lost airplane collided on a farm road. John Henry Goodwin said he had landed his plane north of Sunray and taxied onto the farm road by mistake.

title: 3YearOlds Asphyxiated; One in Bronx and 2d on L.I.
description: Two 3yearold girls were as phyxiated yesterday in separate accidents in the Bronx and on Long Island.

title: 5 Horses, Dog Die in Fire At Lincoln Downs Stable
description: LINCOLN, R. I., Feb. 14 (UPI) Five thoroughbred horses and a small dog were killed today when fire damaged a section of a barn at Lincoln Downs race track.

title: 11 Northeast States Plan an Intercity Rail Agency
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 14 Representatives of 11 states in the socalled Northeast Cor ridor from Maine to Virginia formulated plans here last week for a nonprofit corpora tion to operate all intercity rail passenger service in the region beginning May 1.

title: 100 Pence to the Dollar
description: BEDFORD HILLS, N. Y.Today is DDay for Britain, when D (for Decimal) currency will replace the familiar twelvecenturyold system. There will be a neat 100 pence to the pound, and halfcrowns and guineas are to become obsolete.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Stage: From Heart of The Idiot, a Bright New Play
description: Robert Montgomery's play Subject to Fits, which opened last night at the New York Shakespeare Festival's Public Theater, is a mad, mad play that is a joy to encoun ter. It is a cerebral play of dazzling intellectuality, manic wit and calm literacy.

title: EPISCOPAL DEAN SCORES PROTESTS
description: The Very Rev. Francis B. Sayre, Dean of the Washington Cathedral, said yesterday that uncompromising demonstra tions and confrontations were not the way to work for peace.

title: Suns Score by 10897
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 14 (UPI)  Dick Van Arsdale scored 29 points and Clem Haskins 22 as the Phoenix Suns defeated the Buffalo Braves today, 10897.

title: Glen Cove Youth Wins
description: A 15yearold Glen Cove High School sophomore, An thony Voboril, won the metro politan junior crosscountry championship, completing the fivekilometer course at the Anthony Wayne Recreation Area in 19 minutes 26 seconds.

title: Tenacious Iranian Negotiator
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Feb. 14 Three days before Christmas, Dr. Jamshid Amouzegar, the Cornelleducated Minister of Finance in Iran, dropped by the stolid London office of the Western oil consortium that operates in Iran.

title: Henry Steinberg, Counsel To Harness Racing Board
description: Henry Steinberg, assistant counsel and hearing officer of the New York State Harness Racing Commission, and execu tive member of the Southeast Republican Club of the 60th Assembly District East, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hos pital. He was 67 years old and lived in the Piccadilly Hotel.

title: Floods Cut Nova Scotia Span
description: BRIDGEWATER, N. S., Feb. 14 (UPI)Ice jams and flood waters knocked out a 175foot span of the bridge over the Lahave River here today and threatened a second span. The Norwal, a Department of Trans port icebreaker, was dispatched from Halifax to this town of 4,500 to try to clean out ice and save the rest of the bridge.

title: F. D.I.C. PLEDGES RECORD BANK AID
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Feb. 14 The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation today agreed to its biggest cash injection in his tory to insure uninterrupted operations of a defunct bank $100million.

title: Msgr. James Hughes, 78, Vicar General in Newark
description: ORANGE, N. J., Feb. 14 Msgr. James A. Hughes, vicar general emeritus of the Arch diocese of Newark, died today in St. Mary's Hospital. He was 78 years old.

title: Peking Reports Rally Against Drive Into Laos
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 14Sev eral hundred thousand people were reported to have attended a rally in Peking today to de nounce the allied move into Laos and pledge support for the Communist cause in Indo china.

title: Jennings Wins Eastern Meet
description: SALISBURY, Conn., Feb. 14 (AP)Bruce Jennings combined the longest jump of the day with enough style points to capture the United States East ern amateur ski jumping cham pionship today.

title: Italian No. 2 Team Paces Lake Placid Bobsledding
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y., Feb. 14 (UPI)The Italian No. 2 team of Enzo Vicario and Corrado del Fabbro took the lead today on the first day of the Kennedy Memorial Games twoman bob sled competition. Their two heat time was 2 minutes 18.64 seconds.

title: Susan Goodwillie of Ford Fund Is Bride of Wesley Umphrey
description: CRANBURY, N, J., Feb. 14 Miss Susan Rhodes Good willie and Wesley. Umphrey were married here this after noon in Rabbit Hill, the bride groom's home, by the Rev. John Gatu, a Presbyterian Minister of Nairobi, Kenya.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y., Feb. 14 (AP)Richie Wurster of Ballston Spa, N. Y., won six of seven events today to de fend his crown for the second straight year in the senior men's division of the Nortlw American outdoor speed skat ing championships.

title: Mrs. Gloria Pitkow Wed
description: ROSLYN, L. I., Feb. 14  Mrs. Gloria Kleinman Pitkow of Rockville Center, widow of Jerome D. Pitkow, was mar ried here today to Dr. Jerome J. Zuflacht, a surgeon. Rabbi Max J. Ruttenberg performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. M. C. Blumen thal, brotherinlaw and sis ter of the bride. Dr. Zuflacht's first wife died.

title: Talk of the Albany Mall
description: ALBANY, Feb. 34Most everyone agrees that this capital city needs a renais sance.

title: New Line on Blaine
description: The State Legislature is engaged in elaborate tactical and moral gymnastics to extricate itself from efforts repeal the socalled Blaine amendment. Last February, the legislators voted overwhelmingly to eliminate Article XI, Section 3, of the State Constitution prohibiting the direct or indirect subvention of churchrelated schools with public funds. However, a second vote by the cur rent session is required before the issue can be sub mitted to the voters for final action on next November's ballot.

title: JoAnn Nevas, Michael P. Price Wed in Westport
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Feb. 14  Miss JoAnn Nevas, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Leo Nevas, was married here this afternoon to Michael Paul Price, executive direc torproducer of the Good speed Opera House in East Haddam and son of Mr. and Mrs. William Price of Chi cago. The ceremony in Temp pie Israel was performed by Rabbi Byron T. Rubenstein, assisted by Rabbis Donald Crain and Stanley T. Relkin.

title: Gerald F. Warburg, 69, Is Dead; Cellist and a Patron of the Arts
description: Gerald F. Warburg, a noted cellist and patron of music, died yesterday in New York Hospital of heart failure. He was 69 years old and lived at 9 East 79th Street.

title: Guinea Wooing the West In Bauxite Development
description: CONAKRY, Guinea, Feb. 2 We are ready to cooperate with private capital and to give it the guarantee of the stability of our Government, President Sekou Toure said during a threehour interview recently. He was, talking about Western investment in his country's enormous bauxite reserves, considered to be the largest and richest in the world.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: BLACK LACE WINS BOXER SPECIALTY
description: Canines from New York to California paraded at the American Boxer Club's 28th specialty show in the Staler Hilton Hotel yesterday but the best, Ch. Nadora's Black Lace, came from Evergreen, Colo.

title: Pentagon Develops New Weapons for Small Units
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14The Pentagon is developing spe cialized weapons and tactics designed to enable a handful of soldiers to operate more effec tively 10, 20 or even 100 miles behind enemy lines to collect intelligence or call in air strikes on well  camouflaged military installations.

title: AEROSPACE LOSS IN 1970 REPORTED
description: The General Dynamics Cor poration reported over the week end a net loss in 1970 of $6, 506,000, equivalent to 62 cents a common share, on sales of $2,223,643,000. In 1969 the com pany had earnings of $2,531,000, or 24 cents a common share, on sales of $2,508,755,000.

title: Italian Premier Bars Role for Reds
description: ROME, Feb. 14  Premier Emilio Colombo, who will visit Washington for talks with President Nixon later this week, firmly ruled out today any possibility that the Com munist party might come to power in Italy.

title: CANON ASKS TESTS OF SCHOOLAID BILL
description: Canon Walter D. Dennis of the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine said yester day that a great many Epis copalians would favor some state aid for parochial educa tion provided proper safe guards were established un der the pupilbenefit theory.

title: Books of The Times
description: STILWELL AND THE AMERICAN EXPERI ENCE IN CHINA, 191145. By Barbara W. Tuchntan. 621 pages. Illustrated with pho tographs and maps. Macmillan. $10.

title: Dizzy Dean Wins Twice For Jumper Crown on L. I.
description: MIDDLE ISLAND, L., I., Feb. 14George Holtzman's Dizzy Dean won two classes and fin ished second in another today to score 13 points and win the intermediate jumper champion ship at the Middle Island horse show.

title: Gangs Clash in South Africa
description: UMTATA, South Africa, Mon day, Feb. 15 (ReutersAt least 18 persons died in fighting be tween rival gangs in the Lusikisiki district of the Trans kei African's first Black African homeland  over the weekend, the police reported today.

title: Smith Show: Significance And Drama
description: The photographs of W. Eu gene Smith; currently the subject of a retrospective exhibition at the Jewish Mu seum, Fifth Avenue at 92d. Street, are so crowded with images of life and so appeal ing in their swift, unexpected glimpses of the human drama, that the spectator is almost required to de tach himself from their immediate impact to appre ciate their signif icance.

title: Bridge: RothRappaport Team Wins Another Open Pair Title Here
description: One of the country's top ranked mixed partnerships added another victory Satur day to a long string of suc cesses in New York tourna ments.

title: NEGROES HOED KEY IN CAROLINA VOTE
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., Feb. 14  Black voters may hold the answer to which of eight can didates will succeed the late Representative L. Mendel Riv ers in a special threeway elec tion April 27.

title: QuakeDamaged Mission on Coast Needs Extensive Repairing
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 14The handsome adobe chapel was I only six years old when it was rocked and ripped by the earth quake of 1812.

title: 4 Arabs Killed, Israel Says
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 14 (Reuters) An Israeli patrol killed four Arab guerrillas who infiltrated from Lebanon in a clash last night in the Upper Galilee, a military spokesman said today. There were no Israeli casual ties, he added.

title: Amsterdam: Interaction in the Ballet
description: Arts Abroad

title: Peanut Butter Can Help Hold Budget Together
description: Chances are you're paying less today for peanut butter than you did 10 years ago if you buy the three pound or larger jars. And consider ing the shrinkage in the food dollar over the last decade, that's good news for the housewife.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14The following is a list loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: Petty Captures Daytona 500 in 1971 Plymouth
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Feb. 14  Richard Petty, who has won more money at stockcar racing than anyone else, cap tured the Daytona 500 today to become the first threetime victor in that annual race for latemodel stock cars. It was Petty's 120th victory in 13 seasons of competition in this class.

title: Rollinson Takes Prix
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Feb. 14 (Reuter)Allan Rollinson of Britain, in a BrabhamFord won the Formula 2 Bogota Grand Prix today.

title: Leslie Parnas Plays In Lincoln Center Series
description: In a departure from its con centration on varied ensemble programs, the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center is devoting a few evenings this season to the presentation of some of its members in sonata recitals. Saturday night the turn of Leslie Parnas came up. He appeared with Brooks Smith as assisting pianist.

title: Franulovic Takes Clean Air Net Final
description: Fighting for purer air, his country and $5,000, Zeljko Franulovic of Yugoslavia won the first Clean Air Tennis Classic yesterday by defeating Clark Graebner of New York, 64, 67, 64, 75.

title: GOTTSCHEE SCORES OVER HELLENIC, 40
description: Gottschee routed Hellenic, 40, and the GermanHun garians defeated the German Americans, 52, yesterday as the GermanAmerican Soccer League resumed league action after nearly two months.

title: U.S. ASKED TO CURB PUBLICLAND SALE
description: DENVER, Feb. 14The Sier ra Club, one of the nation's most influential conservation groups, called today for repeal of the Homestead Act and any other laws that allow the Gov ernment to sell or give away public lands.

title: Mexico's Auto Earnings Lag Despite Higher Output and Sales
description: MEXICO CITY, Feb. 14The Mexican automotive industry has raced into red ink despite record output and sales last year. In fact, auto men here fear that another big sales could mire their industry in deeper troubles.

title: Monroe Tallies 33 As Ballets Topple 76ers By 112103
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Feb. 14 (AP)  Earl Monroe's 33 points, including 15 in the third quarter, carried the Balti more Bullets to a 112103 vic tory over the 76ers today. Philadelphia's coach, Jack Ram sey, said he was protesting the game because the 76ers had been assessed a technical foul for having six players on the court.

title: West 72d Street Isn't the East Side and, to Some, That's Good
description: New chapters are constantly being added to Manhattan's West Side story, and, in recent years, the West Side has developed a shopping area that is as diverse as any in the city. The focal point is a twoblock area on 72d Street running from West End to Columbus Avenues. Some of the, businesses have been there for as long as 40 years (Klein & Shapiro's Kosher Delicatessen) and some have started within the last few months (Forward Look, Inc., a new fashion boutique). In this twoblock span, it is possible to buy a pet, play a game of chess, enjoy a meal of Italian, Chinese, Middle East or American fare, purchase candy made on the premises, take a karate lesson, get one's hair done (male or female), send flowers, buy eyeglasses, antique sweat ers, stationery, handknit dresses, jew elry of all kinds, records, books and booze, among other things.

title: 400 Photographs Detailing Humanity
description: Pick up any magazine. Turn on your TV set. So of ten the picture is a fancy sidestepping of excitement, rather than involvement. You don't send an assault team out to capture a delicate emo tion. Photography will be destroyed if it continues in its present state of superfi ciality.

title: Stokowski Celebrates Beethoven Anniversary
description: Leopold Stokowski made his contribution to Beethoven's 200th anniversary year in the American Symphony Orchestra concert yesterday afternoon at Carnegie Hall.

title: INFLATION LINKED TO JOBLESS LEVEL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13The Government is showing in creasing interest; combined with concern, in new studies show ing that the United States in the present decade is likely to have far more inflation when employment is low than was the case in the 1950's and early 1960's.

title: CH. PRINCE DOMINO IS BEST BULLDOG
description: Ch. Prince Domino of Grabel, a red fawn and white bulldog took top honors yesterday in the Bulldog Club of America specialty show at the Holiday Inn.

title: Police Report Seizing 3 And $2.5Million Cocaine
description: City narcotics policemen ar rested two women and a man and confiscated $2.5million in alleged cocaine yesterday fol lowing a stakeout at the Amer ican Airlines terminal at Ken nedy International Airport.

title: Market Holiday Today
description: The stock exchanges, com modity exchanges and banks in this country will be closed today in celebration of George Washington's Birthday. Foreign markets will be open as usual.

title: UP COUNTRY SCORES AT THREE BRIDGES
description: THREE BRIDGES, N. J., Feb. 14Up Country, owned and handled by Ginger Harvat of Washington, N. J., won the junior working hunter cham pionship with 10 points today at the Hunt Cap Farms horse show. Miss Harvat also swept the equitation division, win ning the Maclay Trophy, the Medal Class and the horse manship championship.

title: MRS. ALEXANDER GENEEN
description: Mrs. Aida DeCruciani Geneen, mother of Harold S. Geneen, chairman and presi dent of the ITT Corporation, died yesterday in Miami. She lived in New York, Key Bis cayne, Fla., and Centerville, Mass. She was the widow of S. Alexander Geneen.

title: Cambodia Gives $2,000 To Victims of Quake
description: PARIS, Feb. 14The Cam bodian Government, which is conducting a shoestring war with the help of over $250 m illion in United States aid, announced today that it would donate $2,000 to help the victims of the Los Angeles earthquake.

title: Proposal Confirmed in U. S.
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14In formed sources confirmed to day that the proposal had been submitted by the allies to the Russians at a meeting Friday in Berlin.

title: A DINNER TOMORROW WILL HONOR MONNET
description: Jean Monnet, often called the Father of a United Europe for his efforts to create a fed eral union of European peoples over more than two decades, will be honored by the Aspen Institute for Humanistic Studies tomorrow night at a dinner at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel.

title: Blacks and Whites Joining To Block Housing for Poor
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14 Construction of muchneeded housing for low and moderate income families is being de layed in cities across the coun try because of opposition by residents to inclusion of the poor.

title: Gaza Council Dissolved
description: GAZA. Feb. 14 (UPI)  Israel today dissolved the Municipal Council in this occupied Arab city on the around that the Arab leadership had neglected its duties and had refused to co operate with the Israeli author ities. The administration of the city was turned over to the Israeli military government.

title: Kentucky Setback Lifts Tennessee's Title Hopes
description: The University of Florida basketball team did little for the morale of the hospitalized Adolph Rupp Saturday night.

title: 5YEAR OIL ACCORD IS REACHED IN IRAN BY 23 COMPANIES
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Feb. 14 Twentythree Western oil com panies agreed today to addi tional payments of more than $10billion to six Persian Gulf states for a fiveyear oil agree ment intended to stabilize the crisisprone industry.

title: Some Benefits Expected
description: PARIS, Feb. 14The Persian Gulf oil settlement was ex pected to have farreaching consequences, not all of them unfavorable, for the West.

title: MONCION, IN DEBUT, DANCES ROLE OF DON
description: Don Quixote is George Balanchine's choreographic homage to despair and trans figuration as it juxtaposes the frustrations and joys of the legendary knight wandering through Spainand, by exten sion, the human condition. Sat urday evening at State Theater, Sara Leland was his romanti cized female, Dulcinea, and Francisco Moncion danced the Don for the first time this sea son for New York City Ballet.

title: New Gunfire in Amman
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Feb. 14 (UPI)Gunfire erupted in Am man today in the fourth con secutive day of clashes between the Jordanian Army and Pales tinian commandos. Machine gun fire was reported in the, railroad area astride the main road to the airport. Neither the, government nor the guerrillas had any official comment on the latest clashes.

title: Display of French Violins Includes Jefferson's Bow
description: As any redblooded Broad way patron should recall, Thomas Jefferson played the violin. In fact, one song In the musical 1776 is He Plays the Violin, sung by his wife to Ben Franklin and John Adams. The violin bow that the reallife Jefferson used, an ivory and gold beauty insured for $50,000, is on display in a Violins of France exhibition at Lin coln Center's Library and Museum of the Performing Arts.

title: Red Baron Best of Poms
description: Ch. Duke's Lil Red Baron of O'KalaTa, owned by Mrs. Joyce Graves of Cypress, Tex., took top honors yesterday at the 52d annual specialty show of the American Pomeranian Club at the New Yorker Hotel.

title: Pope Calls for Prayers For Peace in Poland
description: ROME, Feb. 14Pope Paul VI urged Roman Catholics today to pray for internal peace in Poland.

title: Steamfitting Apprentices' Test Called Discriminatory by State
description: State Attorney General Louis Jr. Lefkowitz charged yesterday that an oral test of reason ing used to select steamfitting apprentices was discrimina tory.

title: FIREMEN SAY CITY COURTS JOB ACTION
description: The president of the Uni formed Firefighters Association warned yesterday that the city was courting a new job action by its 11,300 firemen unless it stopped stalling in contract talks.

title: 3d Death in Upstate Fire
description: GREENWICH, N. Y., Feb. 14 (AP)  The body of a third victim was uncovered here to day in the smoking ruins of the White Swan Hotel, the scene of a blaze yesterday that destroyed a part of the hotel and claimed two other lives. Fire officials in the Washington County community identified the third victim as Raymond Worden, about 89 years old, a resident of the hotel.

title: DATA BANKS SEEN AS AID TO PRIVACY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14 When Senate hearings begin here next week on the Govern ment's rapidly expanding sys tem of surveillance and elec tronic file keeping on millions of persons, the data process ing computer is expected to be pictured as the villain of a dangerous trend toward wide spread invasions of privacy and consitutional abuses in a dossier age.

title: Steel Union Strikes 3 Can Companies After Parleys Fail
description: WASHINGTON, Monday, Feb. 15 (AP)The United Steel workers union struck three large canmanufacturing com panies across the nation early, today after marathon contract negotiations were broken off.

title: Fire Aboard Train In Yugoslavia Kills 34 and Injures 113
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Feb. 14 (Reuters)At least 34 per sons died and 113 were injured today when a fire, started when diesel fuel ignited by an elec trical spark that spread through a local train in a tunnel in cen tral Yugoslavia.

title: Kaye Returning Thursday
description: Danny Kaye is expected to return to the cast of Two By Two Thursday evening. Mr. Kaye tore ligaments in his an kle on Feb. 5, and was hos pitalized for special surgery for four days. He will perform from a wheelchair with his leg in a cast. Two By Two is at the Imperial Theater.

title: Brooklyn Museum Gets Black Hellenistic Head
description: A marble head of a black man of the Hellenistic period, a work of art that was de scribed yesterday as the finest representation of a Negro known from ancient times, has been acquired by the Brooklyn Museum and is now on exhibition.

title: Scribner Suggests Students Help Select High School Principals
description: FREEPORT, the Bahamas, Feb. 14Dr. Harvey B. Scrib ner, the Chancellor of the New York City school system, pro posed today that students  along with parents, teachers and supervisorsparticipate as advisers in the selection of high school principals.

title: Texas Wildcatter's Empire Is Running Dry
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 14For the second time in 20 years, Houston independent oil oper ator of the big rich class has fallen on hard times.

title: 500 Meet at St. John's to Mourn Loss of Bill W.
description: He was my inspiration, and not mine alone, said Marty M., one of the first women mem bers of Alcoholics Anonymous. He was one of the most gifted human beings who ever lived on this earth.

title: For Many, It Was Just Another Weekend
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Feb. 14 Since one of her friends was sunbathing in the Bahamas and another was skiing in Michigan, this was not the best of all possible week ends to ask Marga McPher son what she thought of the new Monday holiday law.

title: F.C.C. Inquiry on WPIX Begini A Debate Today on Procedure
description: This morning in Washington the Federal Communications Commission inquiry into the WPIX broadcast license dispute will surface briefly for proce dural debate, then submerge once again probably until some time in May.

title: KNICKS' REED BACK FOR COAST GAMES
description: Willis Reed's five days of rest are over and tonight at the Forum in Los Angeles he will learn if it was any help to his sore left knee.

title: Hanoi Spurs Recruiting
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 15 (Reu ters)  An army recruitment drive is under way in North Vietnam, the Hsinhua press agency reported today. Re cruitment slogans in Haiphong read. Be prepared at all times to join the army, go wherever our fatherland needs us, the agency reported.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON REGISTER A GAIN
description: The London Stock Exchange was firmer in cautious trading yesterday. Hopes of a settle ment in the postal dispute aided sentiment.

title: BLACKS IN HOUSE MAY MEET NIXON
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Feb. 15The White House indicated today that President Nixon may be prepared to talk with the 12 black Representatives who have been seeking an au dience with him without suc cess for the last year.

title: Cadet Six Routs UConn
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Feb. 15 Ed Roubin scored four goals and Geoff Eaton three to lead Army to a 120 victory over the University of Connecticut in hockey tonight.

title: Dutch Cut CallMoney Rate
description: AMSTERDAM, Feb. 15 (Reu ters)Bankers here cut the of ficial Dutch callmoney rate to 6 per cent from 6 per cent it was disclosed today. The move follows a slight easing in moneymarket conditions on government payments. The rate had stood at 6 per cent since Feb. 9 when it was raised from 6 per cent.

title: Notre Dame Wins, 10075
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Feb. 15 (AP)Austin Carr scored 46 points to lead Notre Dame to a 10075 victory over Valparaiso tonight.

title: Escalation in Ulster
description: There was a time when Bernadette Devlin might have been persuasive with her charge that by sending troops to quell violence in Northern Ireland Britain was at tempting a military and imperialistic solution to a social and economic problem. That time is past. In this crisis the extremist Provisional faction of the Irish Repub lican Army is clearly trying to bring about the unification of Ireland by violence and guerrilla war.

title: Kentucky Fights Off Georgia Rally to Register 10795 Conference Victory
description: ATHENS, Ga., Feb. 15 (AP) Mike Casey and Toni Payne sank a total of 10 free throws in the final lwo minutes, ena1 bling Kentucky to extend its Southeastern Conference bas ketball lead with a 107.95 vic tory over Georgia tonight.

title: SCRIBNER'S STAND IRKS SUPERVISORS
description: FREEPORT, the Bahamas, Feb. 15New York City school supervisors ended their holiday weekend convention here today with many bitterly denouncing Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner for his keynote address last night.

title: Kings Point Swimmers Win
description: KINGS POINT, L. I., Feb. 15 The United States Merchant Marine Academy defeated Long Island University, 7334, in a Metropolitan Collegiate Swim ming Conference meet today in Marshall Pool. It was the second victory in three days for the Mariners.

title: 75 Routed by. Fire At the Commodore; 7 Felled by Smoke
description: Six patrolmen, three firemen and a young woman were in jured, none seriously in fires early yesterday in the Commo dore Hotel and a Times Square restaurant.

title: Reply to Jarring Is Positive, Egypt Says
description: CAIRO, Feb. 15  The Unit ed Arab Republic has sent positive reply to a peace ini tiative undertaken last week by Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the Un ited Nations intermediary in the ArabIsraeli conflict, it was re ported here tonight by Salah Gohar, Under Secretary of the Foreign Ministry.

title: Brazil Bank to Open in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Feb. 15 (Reuters) Sr. A. B. Mendonca Line, of the Banco do Estado de Sao Paulo, said the Brazilian bank would open a representative office here on Feb. 26.

title: ITALY'S BOB TEAM WINS 2MAN HONORS
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y., Feb. 15 (AP)  An Italian entry, piloted by a 29yearold stu dent, won the twoman bobsled competition today in the Ken nedy Memorial Games.

title: Stans's Stock in Penn Central Subsidiary Disclosed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15 (UPI) Commerce Secretary Maurice H. Stans owned stock in a Penn Central Railroad subsidiary worth about $300,000 at the time his department was deeply involved in negotiations for $200million in Federal help to save the railroad from impend ing bankruptcy.

title: Two Blacks Come to Blows, A Melee Flares in Atlanta
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 15 (UPI) A Black Panther and a Black Muslim came to blows today over who would sell whose or ganization's newspaper on a downtown street corner, start ing a melee that 100 riot policemen finally quelled.

title: Amish Await Final Ruling On Compulsory Schooling
description: MADISON, Wis., Feb. 15 The small Amish religious sect, which in quest of its version of eternal wisdom re jects the technology and sophistication of modern so ciety, is again embroiled in a controversy with the school authorities here.

title: Showing the Flag
description: WASHINGTONAs a result of the crisis last September in the Middle, East, many items have appeared, in the press concerning the role of the United States Navy in the Mediterra neam Most of the articles have pretty well confined their approaches to the more superficially visible aspects of Sixth, Fleet operations under tension conditions.

title: Astronauts Study Photographs Taken On Their Moon Trip
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 15 (UPI) The crewmen from Apollo 14 studied hundreds of their lunar snapshots today, identifying specific features and catalogu ing them for use by scientists and later astronauts.

title: Stalled Taxi Commission
description: Getting a Taxicab Commission at City Hall is proving almost as difficult as getting a taxi there. The crude pressures exerted by the taxi union and its leadership packing hearing rooms, picketing Councilmen's homes, issuing election threatsare having their desired effect in sowing confusion. Instead of stiffening the Council's privately expressed resolve to create a taxi commission which would begin regulating this largely unregulated and chaotic industry, the pressures have again made the outcome of a Council vote far from certain.

title: Milestone for Daniels
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Feb. 15 (AP) The Indianapolis center, Mel Daniels, became tonight the first player in the American Basketball Association to have taken more than 5,000 re bounds. Meanwhile, the Pacers lost to the Texas Chaparrals, 119118.

title: Aid to Be Supervised
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15 (AP) The General Accounting Of fice has agreed to watch over delivery of $185million in mili tary aid and $70million in economic aid to Cambodia.

title: Seth Holt, Film Director Specializing in Thrillers, 47
description: LONDON, Feb. 15 (AP)  Seth Holt, British film director, who specialized in thrillers, died yesterday. He was 47 years old.

title: Israelis Disregard Critics, Press Jerusalem Housing
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 15  Dis regarding local and internation al critics, the Israeli Ministry of Housing announced today that it would move ahead with plans for four sprawling housing proj ects in the Biblical hillsides that surround Jerusalem.

title: ADAIR DOWNS REESE IN SQUASH RACQUETS
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 15 (AP) Cohn Adair of Montreal won the singles championship of the national amateur squash racquets tournament today, de feating John Reese of New York, three games to one.

title: Bridge: Professor Makes His Game, But He Does It the Hard Way
description: The Master Pair title at the Greater New York Bridge Association's tournament at the New York Hilton was captured Sunday by two vet eran New York experts, Jay Feigus and Aaron Greene, both of whom were playing the game before many of their opponents were born. With combined ages of close to 140 years, they are per haps the oldest partnership ever to win a major New York title.

title: Abelard Opening Changed
description: A new opening date of Wednesday, March 10, has been set for Abelard and Heloise, Ronald Millar's new play star ring Diana Rigg and Keith Michell, at the Brooks Atkinson Theater on West 47th Street. The play will now present six preview performances, starting Tuesday, March 4.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15  Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr., the scourge of the snoopers, is about to open hearings on the proliferation of data banks, and it's none too soon. Every day, new disclosures make it more imperative that safeguards be imposed on com puter storage, and distribution of per sonal information.

title: 70 Pickets at City Hall Protest Harbour Village Housing Plan
description: A group of 70 Brooklyn resi dents, contending that the city wants to put a 904unit housing development looking like a prison compound in their area, picketed City Hall yesterday.

title: Alberta Oil Output Grows
description: ALBERTA, Feb. 15 (Canadian Press)Crude oil production in Alberta averaged 1,011,956 bar rels a day during the week ended Feb. 8, the Alberta Oil and Gas Conservation Board reported today. This was up from the previous week's aver age of 976,295 barrels a day.

title: World Trade Rise Seen;
description: GENEVA, Feb. 15  World trade could expand this year by between 7 per cent and 11 per cent in value over the 1970 level, the leading inter governmental agency for trade relations forecast today.

title: Chrysler Recalling Trucks
description: DETROIT, Feb. 15 (AP) The Chrysler Corporation an nounced today that it was re calling 1,246 Dodge 1970 model parcel delivery and motor home trucks for replacement of a bolt in the braking mechanism.

title: National Gypsum Elects
description: Darwin D. Tucker has been elected president and chief op erating officer of the National Gypsum Company, of which he has been a ditector since Janu ary, 1969, Mr: Tucker, 55 years old, has resigned aspresident and chief executive of the Me redith Corporation to accept his new post.

title: Second Tristar Flies.
description: PALMDALE, Calif., Feb. 15 (Reuters) The second Lock heed Tristar to be flighttested successfully completed its maiden flight today. The L1011 threeengine jetliner was aloft here 85 minutes.

title: Richey Scores in U.S. Indoor Tennis
description: SALISBURY, Md., Feb. 15 (AP)Topseeded Cliff Richey of San Angelo, Tex., made a successful debut tonight in the $50,000 United States indoor open tennis championships.

title: Britain Releases Painting To New York Art Gallery
description: LONDON, Feb. 15  Per mission for the Wildenstein Gallery in New York to ship out the Velazquez portrait it bought here in November is being granted without fur ther delay.

title: Sales of New Cars Rose for Feb. 110
description: DETROIT, Feb. 15  New car sales climbed to 188,753 United Statesmake autos in the first third of February from 153,495 the year before, with the General Motors Corporation and the Ford Motor Company supplying the gain.

title: BOONE THE GREAT SCORES AT BOWIE
description: BOWIE, Md,, Feb. 15 (AP) AlJo Stable's Boone the Great, shipped from Hialeah for the E. Palmer Heagerty Stakes, easily won the $23,700 fixture from four other Mary landbreds at Bowie today.

title: Jacksonville Victor, 9079
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Feb. 15 (AP)Artis Gilmore checked a late Florida State rally of 6 straight points tonight to spark sixthranked Jacksonville to a 9079 victory.

title: A.M.C. Fills Canada Post
description: DETROIT, Feb. 15 (AP). William S. Pickett, 49, has been elected president and general manager of American Motors of Canada, Ltd., a wholly owned subsidiary of the American Motors Corporation. Mr. Pickett has been vice president of A.M.C. dealer and distributor relations. In his new post he succeed Lawrence G. Rice, who recently resigned.

title: Israelis See Some Hope
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 15Israelis drew some hope from President Sadat's statement to Newsweek magazine that Egypt would be willing to guarantee the in violability of the borders of all states in the region, including Israel.

title: Atoms Star Has a Score to Settle in 800
description: Cheryl Toussaint's first look at the international world of track and field came in Moscow two winters ago, on the heels of a group of So viet halfmilers led by Lud mila Bragina, the national champion.

title: Seminary Chief Is Named
description: CINCINNATI, Feb. 15 Dr. Alfred Gottschalk of Los An geles was designated acting president of the Reform Semi nary, Hebrew Union College Jewish Institute of Religion, here today. Dr. Nelson Glueck, the president, died yesterday after 23 years in the post.

title: WILLIAM T. WEST JR.
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., Feb. 15 William Taylor West Jr., a re tired cotton merchant, died to day at his home. He was 85 years old and lived at 601 Fair mount Avenue.

title: Van Gogh Show: Drawings Stand Out
description: Now that Vincent van Gogh's ear has become as famous as George Washing ton's cherry tree, the an ncruncement that 114 of his, van Gogh's, paintings and drawings are on exhibition at the Brooklyn Museum should pack the galleries without further ado. Here are versions of all the favo ritesthe sunflowers, the selfportrait at an easel, the drawbridge, the pair of old shoes, the artist's bedroom at Arles. It is a rare nerson who as a college student in the 1930's, or as a high school student in the 1950's, or as a kindergartner in the 1960's, hasn't had a post card reproduction of a van Gogh propped on his desk or tucked into the mirror frame or carried home as a souvenir of his first museum visit.

title: Politicians Join Fun at a Mardi Grass Ball
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15 Mardi Gras got off to an ear ly start here Saturday. About 2,000 Louisianians and their friends and relatives joyously celebrated their heritage at the 24th annual Washington Mardi Gras Ball presented by the Louisiana State Society.

title: Out With the Boys? Yes, but for a Knitting Lesson
description: The eight men who bent over their knitting needles in Melinda Nix's apartment on a recent evening had started out confident that anything a woman can do, a man can. They were mainly in their 20's and included a lawyer, two United Nations transla tors, an engineer, a social worker, a graduate student in economics, a writer and a real estate man.

title: POLAND REVOKING FOODPRICE RISES MAT LED TO RIOTS
description: WARSAW, Feb. 15  The Polish Government, facing con tinuing economic discontent, announced today that the rises in food prices that set off anti Government riots in December would be revoked on March 1.

title: OldTimers Strut in Broadway Style
description: But if you wanna see old folks, you're in the wrong hall tonight, sang out 25 vintage players in a mirrored rehearsal studio at 1755 Broadway. They sat on three benches, facing the musical director of 70, Girls, 70, Oscar Kosarin. At his signal, as Karen Gustafson thumped the piano, they whipped out 25 banjos, continuing the opening number. The room throbbed to a rich plinkety plink as the oldtimers, most of them well over 60 years of age, paraded in formation, minstrel style.

title: HENRY B. KANE, 69, M.I. T. FUND AIDE
description: LINCOLN, Mass., Feb. 15  Henry B. Kane, director, of the Massachusetts Institute of Tech nology alumni fund from 1940 until his retirement in 1966, died Friday at his home here after a short illness. He was 69 years old.

title: Advertising:
description: Royal Crown is preparing to do something that appears to be fairly unusual in cola advertising  where others are the real thing or have a lot to giveand supply the consumer with a reason to buy. It sounds a bit dar ing.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: POLICE SEIZE HEAD OF DEFENSE GROUP
description: Rabbi Meir Kahane, leader of the militant Jewish Defense League, was arrested on charges of harassment and ver bal abuse yesterday on a com plaint signed by a staff mem ber of the Soviet Mission to the United Nations.

title: BRITISH APPRAISE TRISTAR'S ENGINE
description: LONDON, Feb. 15  The British Government has appoin ted a team of technical experts to appraise the RollsRoyce RB 211, the illfated engine de signed for Lockheed's Tristar airbus.

title: Aid Rushed to U.S.Backed Base In Laos Alter Foe's Penetration
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 15 Reinforcements and supplies were flown today to the Ameri canbacked base at Long Tieng, which was penetrated yester day by North Vietnamese com mandos.

title: 900 FANS ATTEND A RUSSELL STOMP
description: MARTINSVILLE, N. J., Feb. 15Memories of the late Pee Wee Russell, the jazz clari netist, and the sounds of tradi tional jazz yesterday drew, more than 900 friends and fans of both to the second annual Pee Wee Russell Memorial Stomp. Mr. Russell died on Feb. 15, 1969.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15For weeks Prosser had believed that be would come through this winter in good shape. It had been years since he had weathered a winter without needing major repair, but when January went out without even blowing any shingles off his head and February blew in without rusting his knee hinges, Prosser became optimistic.

title: CANADA, IN 1970, WON PAYMENTS SURPLUS
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 15 (Canadian Press)Canada had a $1,279, 000,000 surplus in her balance of international payments last year, in contrast to the 1969 deficit of $722million. It was the first surplus since 1952.

title: Harlem Prep and Academies Periled
description: The Urban League Street Academy program and the Har lem Preparatory School  two bold experiments widely her alded for retrieving highschool dropouts and sending them on to collegehave lost major cor porate and foundation financing and face uncertain futures.

title: LastMinute Concessions Made to Iraq by Oil Concerns to Avoid Alienating Her
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Feb. 15 Western oil concerns made special concessions to Iraq in the closing hours of the Persian Gulf price negotiations rather than risk alienating her radical Arab leadership, Western sources disclosed today.

title: FOE'S TROOP FLOW IS REPORTED CUT BY DRIVE IN LAOS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Feb. 16Military offi cials asserted yesterday that the sweep westward into the Laotian mountains, where thousands of South Vienamese troops are trying to block the Ho Chi Minh Trail network, had already succeeded in cutting off the flow of enemy supplies and troops into the northernmost province of South Vietnam.

title: DR. EPHRAIM J. LONDON
description: Dr. Ephraim J. London, ad mitting physician at Kings County Hospital in Brooklyn, died last evening in North Shore Hospital, Manhasset, L. I., of a heart attack. He was 58 years old and lived at 9608 57th Avenue, Rego Park, Queens.

title: Mrs. Rockefeller's Bequests Spread Hope in Arts
description: The large bequests of Mrs. Martha Baird Rockefeller, widow of John D. Rockefeller Jr., to Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts, Inc. ($10 million), the Metropolitan Opera ($5million), the New York Philharmonic ($1 million), the New England Conservatory of Music ($1 million) and the Martha Baird Rockefeller Fund for. Music, Inc. ($5million) have spread unexpected joy and hope and created a few wor ries.

title: Mrs. Alex Gottlieb, Sister Of the Showman Billy Rose
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 15 (AP) Mrs. Polly Rose Gottlieb, sis ter of the late Billy Rose, Broadway showman, died Sat urday at Cedars of Lebanon Hospital after a long illness.

title: Man Sought Off S.I.
description: A car with four young men in it plunged into Kill Van Kull off Mariners Haibor, S. I., early today. Three passengers swam to the old Elizabeth Ferry Slip off Richmond Terrace and were taken to St. Vincent Medical Center where they were re ported in fair condition. The police were continuing to search for the driver, who was identified as Richard Kronlin, 22 years old, of Irvington, N. J.

title: 10% Aid Rise for Cambodia Is Sought by U.S. Embassy
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Feb. 15  The United States Em bassy here will ask Congress for $250million for military aid to Cambodia for the next fiscal, year, an authoritative embassy official said today.

title: CORPORATE BONDS GROW IN VOLUME
description: Even though the Federal Rei serve Board lowered the dis count rate last Friday evening and bankers are already talking about yet another cut in their prime lending rate, the bond market isn't particularly happy with the outlook.

title: Detective Slain by a Prisoner Who Is Then Shot Dead
description: A prisoner who was being fingerprinted yesterday in Bronx police station grabbed detective's revolver, killed him with two shots and sprayed the squad room with the remaining bullets.

title: DR. LOUIS S. VVEGRYN, LED SURGEONS GROUP
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Feb. 15 Dr. Louis S. Wegryn, a sur geon here for more, than 30 years, died yesterday in Long Branch after a brief illness. He was 68 years old and had lived in Sea Girt the last four years.

title: U.S. Funds Aid Connecticut To Study Water Pollution
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 15 (UPI) The state Health Department will study mercury in waters along Connecticut beaches with funds from the New England Interstate Water Pollution Con trol Commission.

title: Boston College Expects Students To Pay for Athletic Expansion
description: College Sports Notes

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: VASSAR STUDENTS OPPOSE I.B.M. CENTER
description: ROCHESTER, N. Y., Feb. 15 (AP)  Vassar College students threatened today to boycott classes and to urge graduates to withhold gifts if school offi cials went ahead with a plan for a technological graduate center financed by the Interna tional. Business Machines Cor poration.

title: Japanese Orbit Satellite
description: UCHINOURA, Japan, Tues day, Feb. 16 (Reuters)Japan put a satellite into orbit today for the second time. Tokyo Uni versity scientists launched a fourstage, solidfuel rocket, MST1, carrying a 138.8pound experimental satellite. The ex periment is designed to test rocket and satellite systems for launching the nation's first sci entific payload later this year.

title: Policeman Is Shot In a Store Holdup But Kills Suspect
description: A young offduty New Ro chelle patrolman was critically wounded yesterday as he in tervened in an attempted hold up in a Bronx supermarket. One of the two gunmen was shot dead, and the other cap tured a few blocks away.

title: JACK WEEKS DIES; NEWSMAN WAS 63
description: MIAMI, Feb. 15Jack Weeks, an author, news reporter and editor, died in his sleep here yesterday. He was 63 years old and lived at 4171 Malagy Ave nue in Cocoanut Grove.

title: THAIS ABANDONING HARD LINE ON REDS
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Feb. 15  The Americansupported South Vietnamese incursion into Laos has been met here with official silence that is a measure of how far Thailand has come from the time when she was one of the most vocal supporters of a hard line against Communism in Asia.

title: HARNICK REVIEWS THEATER CAREER
description: Sheldon Harnick, whose lyr ics can be heard in two current Broadway musicals, Fiddler on the Roof and The Roths childs, traced his development as a songwriter, and its rela tionship to his development as a person, with wit and insight and a big bouquet of songs Sunday night at the 92d Street Young Men's and Women's Hebrew Association.

title: William Reinhart, Coached Basketball in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15 (AP) William J. Reinhart, who coached 24 years at George Washington University and was elected to the Helms Basketball Hall of Fame in 1956, died yes terday of cancer. He was 74 years old, and had been in Georgetown University Hospital since Dec. 26.

title: BUILDING UNIONS EXPECT A FREEZE ON PAY AND PRICES
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 15 President Nixon may impose soon a temporary freeze on wages, prices and profits in the construction industry pending creation of machinery to stabil ize soaring industry costs, union officials said here today.

title: Southern Novelist Indicted In Slaying of Negro Soldier
description: HUMBOLDT, Tenn., Feb. 15 (AP)Jesse Hill Ford was in dicted today by a Gibson Coun ty grand jury on a charge of firstdegree murder.

title: Givenchy's Shop A Sportswear Hit
description: It's rare these days to see clothes that are not laden with gimmicks. Hubert de Givenchy is to be recom mended for having made them that way and Bergdorf Goodman for presenting them that way. And anyone who's tired of looking like a walking accessories shop should hie herself over to Givenchy's Nouvelle Bou tique on the store's second floor.

title: PROFIT HITS PEAK FOR OSCAR MAYER
description: Oscar Mayer & Co., Inc., the nation's sixth largest meat packer in terms of sales, achieved record sales and earn ings in the first fiscal quarter ended Jan. 30, it was reported yesterday.

title: Kennedy Portraits Hung
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15 (UPI) The portraits of President Kennedy and his widow Mrs. Aristotle Onassis, were officialy hung in the White House today. The portraits, both by Aaron Shikler, were unveiled at a press preview Feb. 4.

title: A Concorde Part Falls Off, Grounding Both Prototypes
description: LONDON, Feb. 15 (Reuters) A part of an air intake on a jet on a prototype of the Con corde supersonic airliner fell off in flight last month, a test pilot said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Inflation and Taxes Squeezing France's Middle Class
description: PARIS, Feb. 15  Judging from the family man who pays the who buys a dishwasher for his wife, who perhaps tries to maintain a country home, the middle class is on the stretching block, here as it is elsewhere in Western Europe and in the United States.

title: State Crime Agency Seeks to Review Tax Returns
description: ALBANY, Feb. 15The head of the state's new organized crime task force is seeking au thority from the Legislature to review state income tax returns for evidence of criminal activi ties and official corruption.

title: City Will Get $4.1Million To Fight Drugs in Schools
description: Governor Rockefeller an nounced yesterday that the New York City Board of Edu cation would receive $4.1mil lion instead of $4.7million in state grants for programs to combat drug abuse in high schools.

title: Bold and Able Wins at Hialeah and Labels Himself as Flamingo Favorite
description: MIAMI, Feb. 15  An im pressive performance by Calu met Farm's Bold and Able in a preliminary race eclipsed the feature attraction  the two division Mimosaat Hia leah race track today.

title: Holiday Mood Pervades Stores
description: In a city that was even quieter than usual for a holi day, the stores were by far the busiest places in town yesterday.

title: Susan B. Anthony Honorea
description: ADAMS, Mass., Feb. 15 (UPI) While the test of the nation celebrated George Washing ton's birthday today, this com munity celebrated Susan B. Anthony's. The suffragette was born in this city near the New York  Vermont Massachusetts border 151 years ago.

title: GROSSMAN'S GROUP PLAYS HANDEL WORK
description: Julius Grossman, conducting his Municipal Concerts Cham ber Orchestra Sunday night at Tully Hall, offered a tasty little dish of a program, lively and balanced.

title: COMPLAINTS CITING POLICEMEN RISE 40%
description: An increase of more than 40 per cent in the number of com plaints against policemen dur ing the last year was reported to Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy yesterday by the Civilian Complaint Review Board.

title: BONN PARTY BACKS ALLIES ON BERLIN
description: BERLIN, Feb. 15The lead ership of West Germany's gov erning Social Democratic party endorsed today the allied stand on Berlin. It is known to include an offer to declare that West Berlin is not an in tegral part of West Germany.

title: Hambros Confirms Loan
description: LONDON, Feb. 15. (Reuters) The Hambros Bank, Stock holmes Enskilda Bank and White, Weld & Co., are arrang ing a $30million 15year bond issue for Allmanna Svenska Elektriska Aktieboliaget. Cou pon and issue price will be fixed just prior to Feb. 24, the offer ing date. The loan is noncall able for eight years and will have an average life of 11 years.

title: A Rising Demand for Marijuana Lures the Young Into Smuggling
description: The rapidly rising demand for marijuana, and more recent ly for hashish, in the United States is opening up new sources of the drugs and at tracting increasing numbers of young Americans into smug gling.

title: Volpe Reports Cargo Rise For Section of the Seaway
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15 (AP) Cargo moving through the MontrealLake Ontario section of the St. Lawrence Seaway in creased nearly 25 per cent in 1970, according to Secretary of Transportation John A. Volpe.

title: Nixon Back at White House
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15 (AP) President Nixon, along with Mrs. Nixon, their daughter Tricia and several aides, re turned to the White House to night. The Presidential heli copter landed on the South Lawn after a short flight from Andrews Air Force Base, Md.

title: Legislators Open a Civic Service Center Uptown
description: On a tour reminiscent of elec tion campaign days, three legis lators walked through East Harlem yesterday, shaking hands, distributing leaflets and, inviting residents to a joint storefront office that they de scribed as a new concept of government.

title: Dr. Harry B. van Dyke, 69, Dies; A Columbia Medical Professor
description: Dr. Harry B. van Dyke, pro fessor emeritus of phar macology at Columbia Univer sity's College of Physicians and Surgeons, died Sunday in Co lumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center after a short illness. He was 76 years old.

title: Francis Clings to Towel He Reportedly Threw In
description: Emile Francis, the general managercoach of the New York Rangers, denied yester day that he had conceded first place to the Boston Bruins.

title: BELLE BARTH DEAD; CAFE ENTERTAINER
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Feb. 15 Belle Barth, the entertainer, died last evening of cancer at her home here. She was 59 years old.

title: Pinkham Papers! Tonic for Nostalgia
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass,  It was the face that launched a thousand nips.

title: Surrender in Teheran
description: The surrender of the Western oil companies in Teheran to the demands of the Persian Gulf petroleumproducing nations is a dramatic demonstration of the power that an effective cartel of rawmaterial producers can exert upon the highly industrialized nations of Western Europe and Japanand upon the international corporations which have previously held the whip hand in the world oil market.

title: Cockney Rhyming Slang Won't Take New Coins
description: LONDON, Feb. 15Bobby Redrupp, a vegetable seller at a stall in Chapel Market, Islington, is a natural ex pert in the imaginative word play that is Cockney rhym ing slang.

title: Markets Are Closed
description: Stock exchanges, commodity exchanges and banks in the United States were closed yes terday in celebration of George Washington's Birthday. Foreign markets were open as usual.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Platform Tennis to Favorites
description: RYE, N. Y., Feb. 15John Mangan of the host Manursing Island Club and Robert Kings bury of Fox Meadow Tennis Club in Scarsdale, seeded No. 1, won the annual Rye platform tennis tournament today. They defeated Bradley Drowne and Dwight Lowell of Short Hills (N. J.) Club, 46, 63, 62, 62, in the final.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Chandler Weighs Campaign
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., Feb. 15 (UPI)A. B. (Happy) Chandler, former major league baseball commissioner and two  time Governor of Kentucky, an nounced today that he might run again for Governor. Mr. Chandler, 72 years old, told a news conference he was con sidering running as an indepen dent, though he is a Democrat.

title: Brazil's OH Agency Tests Extent of Offshore Find
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 15 Petrobras, the state oil explora tion and production monopoly, started today to determine the extent of its offshore oil dis covery 7 miles off Aracaju, capital of the state of Sergipe.

title: Theater: Horovitz Double Bill Opens at the De Lys
description: It is fairly easy to see what Israel Horovitz's play Line, which opened last night at the Theater Do Lys, is about, but rather more difficult to see why it is about it. Line is about a line.

title: It's Time for Tournament Bids And Colleges Pound the Drums
description: This is the time when college coaches, sports information di rectors and alumni make pro fessional politicians appear like amateurs.

title: National Can Reaches Accord With Steelworkers
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15 The United Steelworkers of America reached a threeyear labor agreethent today with the National Can Corporittion as a strike began against the three other Major can manufacturers,

title: Legislator Is Among 43 Accused in Carolina School Bus Incident
description: DARLINGTON, S. C., Feb. 15 A Darlington County grand jury received a bill of indict ment today from the State At torney General's office that un expectedly included a state legislator, along with 42 other men, who were charged with riot, last year at Lamar.

title: Scheel in U.S. for Talks
description: Foreign Minister Walter Scheel of West Germany arrived here by air yesterday for a five day visit that will include talks with Secretary of State William P. Rogers and Commerce Secre tary Maurice Stans.

title: Los Angeles Area Hit by Minor Quakes
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 15 (UPI) Aftershocks from last week's devastating earthquake jiggled the Los Angeles area today, but they were not severe enough to cause any new damage.

title: U.S. Colonel in Vietnam Convicted in Drug Case
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Feb. 16 (AP)Col. Gerald V. Kehrli of the United States Air Force was found guilty today of smok ing and possessing marijuana and of asking enlisted men in his squadron to obtain it for him.

title: Libyans Reported Cool to Soviet, Warming to U.S.
description: TUNIS, Feb. 15The Govern ment of Libya has indicated to Tunisian officials that it is op posing efforts by the Soviet Union to spread its influence in that major oilproducing center of the Arab world.

title: POST COLLEGE. RADIO IS ON THE AIR AGAIN
description: BROOKVILLE, L. 1., Feb. 15 The FM radio station of C. W. Post College began broadcast ing tonight after almost three months of silence.

title: The Conservative Reply
description: ROUGEMONT, SwitzerlandThe movement Murray N. Rothbard an nounces as causing a burgeoning split with the conservative movement reminds me of the legendary con spiracy to overthrow the state, en tered into by an assistant professor and two poets. Mr. Rothbard broke with National Review eleven years ago on the question of Khrushchev's visit to the United States, our posi tion being that manifestations of dis pleasure with K were altogether appropriate, it being known that he had taken an active part in the Stalin ization of the Ukraine. Rothbard took the position that there was no dis cernible moral difference between Nikita Khrushchev and Dwight Eisen hower, because as commander in chief of the Allied Expeditionary Force Eisenhower had killed as many people as Khrushchev had in the Ukraine. It requires that one take seriously such an analogy in order to take seri ously Mr. Rothbard.

title: MRS. LUCY DICKINSON
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., Feb. 15Mrs. Lucy Dickinson, who was a Republican National Committeewoman from New Hampshire from 1948 to 1952, died today in the Bloomfield Convalescent Home. She was 88 years old.

title: Rock Island Line
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 15 (AP) Rock Island Lines reported on Monday a net loss of $16.6 million in 1970 despite gross revenues totaling $273.5million or nearly $14million more than those for 1969.

title: Hodgson to Press 3 Goals For Better Job Relations
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15 (UPI)  Secretary of Labor James D. Hodgson said today that he planned this year to press for three main goals making the American work place safer, eliminating Job dis crimination and improving col lective bargaining.

title: C.&O.B.&O. Elects New President, 45
description: Directors of the Chesapeake & OhioBaltimore & Ohio rail roads elected yesterday Hays T. Watkins Jr. as president and chief executive officer, ef fective March 31.

title: COURT TO APPOINT CARLTON RECEIVER
description: Appointment of a receiver was ordered yesterday for a brokerage house that the Secur ities and Exchange Commission said might figure in the first aid from a new Federal agency to protect stock investors.

title: Vote for a Capital In South Italy Lost By Reggio Calabria
description: CATANZARO, Italy, Tuesday, Feb. 16 (AP)Catanzaro was voted the capital of the Cala bria region early today as the rival southern city of Reggio Calabria lost a ninemonth struggle for the designation.

title: Britain Decimalizes the Pound to 100 New Pence
description: LONDON, Feb. 15For a thousand years the English pound has been divided into 240 pence. Today Britain went decimal, dividing the pound into 100 pence.

title: British Mail Strike Goes On As Union Rejects a 9% Rise
description: LONDON, Feb. 15Hopes for an early settlement of Britain's 26day postal strike were dashed tonight when union of ficials rejected an acrossthe board 9 per cent pay increase tied to new productivity ar rangements.

title: 2 PAKISTANI LEADERS IN CLASH ON CHARTER
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Feb. 15  Two major political leaders one from West Pakistan, the other from the East  clashed today on the constitution that the forthcoming National As sembly has been called to write.

title: Advertising:
description: Figures are now beginning to come in to show just how bad the television advertis ing slump really is.

title: RAMIREZ CAPTURES JUNIOR NET CROWN
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Feb. 15Raul Ramirez, seeded No. 1 in the Port Washington Tennis Classic and the top ranked junior in Mexico, de feated Vitus Gerulaitis of How ard Beach, Queens, today in the final, 63, 62.

title: All Snug in the Harbor
description: It has taken five Years of negotiation between the city and the trustees of Sailors' Snug Harbor to save six landmark structures on the Staten Island waterfront from that fate worse than death known as modernization.

title: Basketball Poll WRITERS' RATINGS
description: The leading college basket ball teams, with. points tabu lated on a 2018161412109 87654321 basis (firstplace votes in parentheses) and won lost records through games of last Sunday:

title: TRIAL OF CALLEY RESUMING TODAY
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Feb. 15  The murder trial of first Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. enters its climactic phase to morrow with the resumption of the courtmartial of the 27 yearold officer charged with the mass execution of unarmed South Vietnamese civilians dur ing the so called Mylai mas score.

title: Peace on the Rails?
description: The Nixon Administration's renewed call for stronger statutory curbs on transportation strike emergencies seems to have had the desirable effect of reviving some small capacity on the part of railroad labor and manage ment to arrive at agreements without a Congressional assist.

title: British in Peking Back In Offices Gutted in 1967
description: PEKING, Feb. 15The British mission here has moved back into the building it left three and a half years ago after fire.

title: Arab Guerrillas Squabbling Again Over Goals
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 15 Once again, the Arab com mando movement is reapprais ing, its goals and is engaged in squabbles over its organiza tional structure. The difficul ties of the guerrillas, or fedayeen, are caused in part by the continuing military pres sure from the Jordanian Gov ernment and in part by recent efforts toward a peaceful settle ment of the ArabIsraeli con flict.

title: 200 Score Plan to Shut Rheumatic Heart Clinic
description: More than 200 friends and parents of patients at Irvington House, a private, nonprofit rheumatic heart clinic, were joined by a handful of medical school professors yesterday in picketing to protest plans to close the clinic.

title: TURKS INVADE BASE AND REMOVE A G.I.
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Feb. 15 (AP)A small band seized an Air Force sergeant inside a United States military instal lation early today, fled with him in an American truck after shooting past unarmed gate guards, then released him 17 hours later.

title: Hunger Parley Delegates Say State and Local Officials Are Callous to Poor
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15 Poor people, physicians, social action workers and lawyers lashed out angrily, sarcastically, even tearfully today against the asserted callousness of state and local officials to alleged widespread, continued hunger in America.

title: South Carolina Five Fears Losing Joyce on Leg Clot
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., Feb. 15 (AP)  Frank McGuire, Uni versity of South Carolina bas ketball coach, said today there was a possibility that Kevin Joyce, star sophomore, would be out for the remainder of the season.

title: Lon Nol Reported Gaining
