title: Mets Check In to Hodges Looking Lean and Hungry
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 17  Spring training camps came alive along Florida's Gulf coast today as the countdown began for the baseball season.

title: Launched Rocket Explodes
description: VANDENBERG AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Feb. 17 (UPI)A ThorAgena booster combina tion exploded shortly after it was launched today. The Air Force said the missile, which was carrying a secret payload, burst into a ball of flame about 40 seconds after liftoff. There were no injuries.

title: PORT AUTHORITY DROPS BAY PLAN
description: Austin J. Tobin, the executive director of the Port of New York Authority, said yesterday that the authority would abide by recommendations of the Na tional Academy of Sciences and the National Academy of En gineering and not build new runways for Kennedy Interna tional Airport in Jamaica Bay.

title: Julia Richman School Upset by Subway Incident
description: In the lobby of Julia Rich man High School, at second Avenue and 67th Street, a paper banner urges Make Julia Richman No. 1.

title: Senator Supports Pipeline; Would Make Operator Liable
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (UPI) Senator Mike Gravel, Demo crat of Alaska, urged construc tion of a controversial trans Alaska oil pipeline today but said its builders and operators should have total and abso lute responsibility for any damage to the environment.

title: Police Sergeants Warn on Pay Parity
description: The head of the Sergeants Benevolent Association warned yesterday that his men would not accept a new contract with the city that gave them less pay than fire lieutenants.

title: Laver Downs Ralston in 4 Sets for 10th Straight in $210,000 Tennis Series
description: A backhand placement down the line, a short chip shot that Rod Laver thought was a little wide, but was ruled good, became the momentum behind the 32yearold Austra lian's 10th straight singles vic tory in the $210,000 Tennis Champions Classic last night.

title: Withholding of Rents Upheld in Some Cases
description: A Civil Court judge, here has upheld the right of ten ants to withhold rent when the landlord deliberately tries to force them out by refusing to make the premises habit able.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Blocked Road to Welfare Reform
description: No single task facing the 92d Congress is more urgent than reform of the nation's demoralizing welfare system, but political infighting seems likely once again to stymie action.

title: Cairo Remains Silent
description: CAIRO, Feb. 17The Egyp ban Government chose today to let pass in silence what ap peared to be a rejection by Abba Eban of the recent peace initiative by Dr. Jarring.

title: Separation: The Worst Status of All?
description: It's the worst of all pos sible worlds.

title: COLOMBO WITNESS ACCUSES THE F.B.I.
description: A former coin dealer who pleaded guilty to Federal charges of conspiring with Joseph Colombo Jr. and two other men to melt down coins for their silver content testified yesterday that Mr. Colombo had not personally financed the alleged operation.

title: PRESIDENT PRESENTS FOREIGN AID REPORT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (Reu ters)  President Nixon told Congress today that the United States spent $3.7billion in for eign aid last year, and he called it a proud American invest ment in the future of all man kind.

title: BACKTAX PAYMENTS PROSPECT AT AKZONA
description: Akzona, Inc., formed last year by the merger of the American Enka Corporation, the International Salt Company and Organon, Inc., may have substantial assessments for ad ditional taxes as a result of examination of Federal income tax returns, a footnote in its 1970 annual report said.

title: WinnDixie Sales Advance
description: WinnDixie Stores, Inc., Jack sonville, Fla., yesterday report ed that its sales for four weeks ended Feb. 6 rose 12.7 per cent to $128,970,375 from $114,480, 213 in the like 1970 period. Sales in 32 weeks were up 12,8 per cent to $961,398,155 from $852,493,066.

title: Providence, Set Back in E.C.A.C., May Drop Hockey
description: College Sports Notes

title: Executive Changes
description: G. Willing Pepper, vice president and director international operations at the Scott Paper Company, has been elected a vice chairman of the company, effective Feb. 27.

title: INSURERS IN TEXAS PLANNING MERGER
description: Merger News

title: Mrs. King 63, 63 Victor Over Miss Pigeon in South
description: LIGHTHOUSE POIINT, Fla., Feb. 17 (AP)Mrs. Billie Jean King of Long Beach, Calif., de feated Kristy Pigeon of Dan ville, Calif., 63, 63, in the first round of a women's pro fessional tennis tournment today.

title: Defense Says Calley Regarded Victims as an Enemy
description: FORT KENNING, Ga., Feb. 17The chief counsel to First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. said today that the lieutenant did not feel he was killing humans when he ordered and participated in the execution of two groups of Vietnamese civilians at Mylai.

title: ...And Besides Everything Else, Geoffrey Holder Can Cook
description: Cooking, said 6foot6inch Geoffrey Holder, dancer, choreographer, actor, singer, radio commentator, author and painter, is the only thing I can turn off with.

title: Portugal Acquits Priest Who Opposed Her Wars in Africa
description: LISBON, Feb. 17A Portu guese village priest, the Rev. Mario Pais de Oliveira, who openly opposed this country's wars against rebels in African overseas territories, was ac quitted tonight.

title: KENNEDY ASSAILS VIETNAMIZATION
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (UPI)  Senator Edward M. Kennedy, said today the United States policy of Vietnamization was actually a policy of violence that has resulted in the inva sion of Cambodia, the invasion of Laos.

title: Trial Reported Still Open The Washington Star
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 17 Informed sources said here to day that despite the South Vietnamese incursion, North Vietnam still retained the ca pability to move its men and supplies south through the Lao tian panhandle.

title: Going to Church in Louisiana1943
description: ORANGEBURG, S.C.Daddy wasn't a numbers runner, Mama wasn't a loose woman, my two brothers were neither pickpockets nor pimps, and I have never seen heroin in my life.

title: RIBEIRO IS PROMISING IN HIS VIOLIN DEBUT
description: Gerardo Ribeiro, a Portu guese violinist now studying at the Juilliard School, was pre sented in his New York debut at Carnegie Recital Hall on Tuesday night by the Concert Artists Guild.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: YIELDS INCREASE ON QUALITY BONDS
description: Yields of highgrade bonds took a goodsized step upward yesterday, and investor interest seemed to perk up.

title: FRESHMEN RULE IS FURTHER EASED
description: The Eastern College Athletic Conference voted yesterday to permit freshmen to compete in all varsity sports at the college division (small college) level starting Aug. 1.

title: The Threat to Man Is Man Himself
description: ROMEThe disorders of our age affect all societies, irrespective of their culture, political regime, social and economic philosophy and degree of affluence or paucity.

title: Lord Brookeborough Plans To Wed Mrs. Eileen Calvert
description: Viscount Brookeborough, 82yearold former Prime Minister of Northern Ireland, announced Tuesday that he and Mrs. Eileen Calvert, 65yearold council member of the Ulster Union party, will marry, The wedding date was not announced.

title: LINDSAY IS NO. 1 WITH COLLEGIANS
description: College students in the United States who were asked to rate 11 American political figures gave Mayor Lindsay more favorable points than any of the others, according to a Gallup Poll made public yes terday.

title: Joffrey Ballet's Opener Shared By Arpino, Jooss and Bolender
description: Mayor Lindsay was at the opening of the City center Jof frey Ballet at the City Center last night because, a spokesman told this writer, he likes the company. The Mayor is also president of the City Center.

title: 132 IN HOUSE SEEK CONSUMER AGENCY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 Legislation to create an inde pendent Federal agency with broad authority to advocate and protect consumer interests drew 132 cosponsors today in the House of Representatives.

title: Haywood Is Sidelined by Court Decision
description: Spencer Haywood will no longer be permitted to play with the Seattle Supersonics.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17The 1971 allpurpose, anyday, anyweek news roundup:

title: Rockefeller Asks Tripling of Fees for Car Drivers
description: ALBANY, Feb. 17Motor ists would pay triple the cur rent rate for operators' licenses and substantially higher regis tration fees under a bill sub mitted to the Legislature today by Governor Rockefeller.

title: Garages Warned by City On Charging for Strike Days
description: Owners of garages in which 70,000 cars were stranded dur ing the recent 10day strike were warned yesterday by Consumer Affairs Commis sioner Bess Myerson Grant not to charge monthly customers for the strike period.

title: Revised Wholesale Price Index Advanced by 0.7% in January
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (UPI)Wholesale prices, pushed up by sharply higher costs for food, rose 0.7 per cent last month, the sharpest increase in a year, the Labor Department reported today. The report showed inflation had contin ued to plague the economy. The department reported ear lier, on the basis of incom plete information, that whole sale prices rose only 0.6 per cent last month. The revision raised the figure in all major categories.

title: Big Board Margin Debt Off
description: The New York Stock Ex change announced yesterday that its memberfirm stock mar gin debt fell $20million in Jan uary to $3.9billion. Over the same period, stock prices, as measured by the exchange's common stock index, rose 4.8 per cent, while average daily volume on the exchange climbed to a record of 17.4 million shares.

title: 9th Seale Juror Seated
description: NEW HAVEN, Feb. 17Wil liam A. Fanucci of Seymour, 33yearold white bank worker, was added to the jury in the Bobby G. Seale murder trial here today, bringing the num ber of jurors to nine. Mr. Fanucci was the 873d person to be questioned in the jury selection, which began in November. He was the 835th white person.

title: STARS TELLS HOW HE GAINED STOCK
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 Secretary of Commerce Maurice H. Stans explained today his holding of stock in a subsidiary of the Penn Central railroad. He said he did not know whether he owns that stock now.

title: Chess: Good Moves Can If Better One Is Beckoning
description: When you see a good move, according to Dr. Emanuel Lasker, a onetime world champion, don't make it. Look for a better one.

title: Search for Space Spurs a Population Boom in Nevada
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., Feb. 14Twelve years ago, Hilton and Willa Klepfer left Mead ville, Pa., and settled in San Jose, Calif. Like millions of other participants in the great westward movement, they were looking for a Warmer climate, better job opportunities and a good place to raise their children. And they found it.

title: Yastrzemski Makes Baseball History With a $500,000 ThreeYear Contract
description: WINTER HAVEN, Fla., Feb. 17 (AP)  Carl Yastrzemski of the Boston Red Sox signed a threeyear contract today that may make him the highest paid player in professional baseball history.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Wonderful Turnout Seeks Arts Aid
description: Some 600 representatives of New York State arts or ganizations  more than twice as many as last year met yesterday at Lincoln Center's Vivian Beaumont Theater to open a twin pronged appeal for greater state and national support for the arts.

title: CITY RELIEF ROLLS OUTPACING BUDGET
description: New York City's relief rolls have returned to a rate of in crease that more than triples the current budgeted expecta tions, with a rise of 17,988 per sons during December  the largest monthly increase in 26 months.

title: CITY WILL STUDY PHONE RATE PLEA
description: Mayor Lindsay instructed the city's Interdepartmental Com mittee on Public Utilities yesterday to conduct an im mediate study of the New York Telephone Company's applica tion to the Public Service Com mission for a 29 per cent rate increase.

title: Tragedy by Adoption
description: As a result of two extremely distressing cases, the New York Assembly is now considering a bill to revise this state's adoption laws. In each case a mother Who had relinquished her child for adoption later changed her mind, with harrowing effect on the adoptive parents and possibly worse effect on the child.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Bulls Topple Cavaliers
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 17 (AP) Bob Love scored 20 points and Chet Walker got 17 in the sec ond half tonight to lead the Chicago Bulls from a 10point thirdperiod disadvantage to a 109104 National Basketball Association victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers.

title: CIVIC UNIT SCORES CITY HOUSING PLAN
description: The Citizens' Committee for Children of New York yester day strongly assailed a pro posal by the city to house wel fare families in abandoned housing at Brooklyn's Floyd Bennett Field.

title: Garden Meeting: An Acquisition Is Winner
description: The annual meeting of the Madison Square Garden Cor poration ran into overtime yesterday.

title: NETS SCORE, 128120, FOR THIRD STRAIGHT
description: RICHMOND, Feb. 17With three playersBill Melchionni, Rick Barry and Manny Leaks scoring in the high 20's, the New York Nets defeated the Virginia Squires, the American Basketball Association's East ern Division leaders, 128120, here tonight.

title: Rejected by Board, Ousted Rabbi Plans New Congregation
description: The board of trustees of strifetorn Reform synagogue on the Upper East Side refused 11 last night to reconsider its de cision not to retain its spiritual leader.

title: DEMOCRATS ALTER REFORM FORMULA
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 The Democratic party's Execu tive Committee modified today the proposals of the reform commission headed by Repre sentative James G. O'Hara of Michigan for the allocation of votes at the 1972 party con vention.

title: Braves Check Bullets
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 17 (UPI)  Bob Kauffman and Mike Davis combined for 46 points as the Buffalo Braves defeated the Baltimore Bullets, 118114, tonight.

title: Nixon Is Encouraged
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17  President Nixon said today that he was encouraged by develop ments in the Middle East, par ticularly since the Egyptian Government had been more forthcoming than we expected.

title: Flyers Sink Kings, 40
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Feb. 17 (UPI)Gary Dornhoefer scored on a 50foot shot and added two assists and Doug Favell registered his second goal tending shutout of the season tonight as the Philadelphia Flyers routed the Los Angeles Kings, 40.

title: Quebec Has High Hopes For Mt. Ste. Anne Run
description: News of Skiing

title: Two German Sides Meet
description: BERLIN, Feb. 17  Egon Bahr, West German State Sec retary, said today that the talks between West and East Germany were moving into a more interesting stage.

title: DRAFT CHIEF HALTS CRITICIZED LETTER
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17  The Selective Service System has stopped sending to poten tial conscientious objectors form letter warning that too many objectors could cause the nation to demand each citizen bear his load.

title: John King's Counterclaim Against Bank Is Dismissed
description: DENVER, Feb. 17 (AP)Fed eral District Judge Alfred Arraj dismissed yesterday a $25mil lion counterclaim filed by John M. King against the Overseas Development Bank of Geneva.

title: City Asks Nixon's Office to Help Bring In Outside Electric Power
description: New York City has sought the help of President Nixon's office to bring electric power here from outside the metropoli tan region in an effort to help the powershort Consolidated Edison Company resume pre ventive maintenance before high summer demands.

title: City Planning Parking Lot Near Yankee Stadium
description: A plan for 800 more parking spaces in the Yankee Stadium area was disclosed yesterday by the City Planning Commis sion.

title: F.D.A. ASKS RULES ON DRUGS' VALUE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17The Food and Drug Administration today proposed strict new safe ty and effectiveness standards for fixed combination drugs, in cluding many of the most wide ly sold prescription and over thecounter products.

title: Strike by Brokerage Workers Shuts the Bourse
description: PARIS, Feb. 17Workers in Paris brokerage houses went on strike today for higher pay, closing down the stock ex change for the first time since the social upheaval in France in May and June, 1968.

title: PRESIDENT VOWS ACTION TO CURB COST OF BUILDING
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17  President Nixon pledged today that the Government would take action to slow spiraling inflation in the construction in dustry, but he declined to say what that action would be.

title: Trudeau Is Accused of Using an Obscenity in Response to a Critic in Parliament
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 17  Ten sions over the continuing high level of unemployment in Can ada have goaded Prime Minis ter Pierre Elliott Trudeau into increasingly curt responses to the gibes of his parliamentary critics.

title: N.Y.U. FENCING TEAM DOWNS COLUMBIA
description: New York University's fenc ing team stretched its victory streak to 22 meets over three seasons by defeating Columbia, 198, in the losers's gym last night.

title: REV. WILLIAM STIEVE OF LUTHERAN AGENCY
description: The Rev. William M. Stieve, executive secretary of the spe cial ministries department, Atlantic District, the Lutheran ChurchMissouri Synod, died Tuesday in Nassau Hospital, Mineola, Li., after an illness of several months. He was 55 years old and lived at 183 Bregman Avenue, New Hyde Park, L.I.

title: Daniel Pressley, 53, Dead; SelfTaught Artist in Wood
description: Daniel Pressley of 458 East ern Parkway, Brooklyn, an artist who expressed himself through what he called the lost art of woodcarving, died yesterday in St. Rose's Home. He was 53 years old.

title: STATE AID NEEDED TO AVERT A CRISIS, BIG 6 MAYORS SAY
description: ALBANY, Feb. 17  The Mayors of the state's six largest cities warned today of severe service interruptions and widespread local tax increases if greater local aid was not in cluded in Governor Rockefel ler's budget.

title: Kennedy Introduces a Bill To Limit Use of Firearms
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (AP) Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, in troduced a bill today to require the registration of firearms and the licensing of gun owners.

title: Oklahoma U. Official Quits
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (AP) Dr. Edward L. Katzenbach announced today that he was resigning as vice president of the University of Oklahoma. His resignation will become ef fective July 1, he said in a statement issued here.

title: Mecom Hearing Put Off
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb 17The bankruptcy hearing involving John W. Mecom, the oil man, was postponed today until March 3 by the Federal Dis trict Court here.

title: LEONID S. SOBOLEV, PASTERNAK CRITIC
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 17  Leonid S. Sobolev, a writer who head ed the conservative Russian Republic Writers Union from its founding in 1959 until his retirement last year, died here today after a long illness. He wag 72 years old.

title: EBAN SAYS ISRAEL INSISTS ON KEEPING SOME ARAB AREAS
description: TEL AVIV, Feb. 17Abba Eban, the Israeli Foreign Minister, served notice today that Israel would insist on re taining some occupied Arab territory under a peace settle ment.

title: Koroll and Pappin Help Black Hawks Rout Sabres, 51
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 17 (UPI) Cliff Koroll and Jim Pappin scored two goals each tonight to lead the Chicago Black Hawks to a 51 victory over the Buffalo Sabres. The victory was the 26th in 31 home games for the Hawks this National Hockey League season.

title: Insurer Sets Highs
description: The Hartford Fire Insurance Company yesterday reported net operating income for 1970 of $54million, a record. The figure was up 31.5 per cent from 1969's net operating in come of $41.1million.

title: SWEDE CHARGES BIAS AT CLUB HERE
description: A Swedish television pro ducer and journalist, in New York to work on a book about Harlem, said yesterday that he had been deprived of his mem bership at the Metropolitan Club after he brought black guests to the club.

title: Ewen Cameron MacVeagh Dies; Law Specialist Here Was 75
description: Ewen Cameron MacVeagh, a partner in the law firm of Davis Polk & Wardwell, died yesterday in Doctors Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived at 860 Park Avenue and in Dublin, N. H.

title: Lon Nol Reported Gaining
description: HONOLULU, Feb. 17 (UPI) Premier Lon Nol of Cambodia has made steady progress in his recuperation from a stroke, doctors at Tripler General Hos pital, where he was admitted last weekend, said today.

title: Canadian Will Head Brooklyn Museum
description: Duncan F. Cameron, na tional director of the Cana dian Conference of the Arts, will be the new director of the 148yearold Brooklyn Museum.

title: Corvair Heater Hearing Set
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (AP) The Senate Commerce Com mittee announced today a pub lic hearing, scheduled for Feb. 24, on the potential safety hazard involved in the opera tion of the heaters in 1961to 1969model Corvair automo biles.

title: Goodrich to Close Plant
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., Feb. 17 (AP)The B. F. Goodrich Company announced today that it would close its Niagara Falls plant by the end of March. The company linked the closing to lack of expansion room and the ability of other Goodrich plants to take over the produc tion.

title: Rangers Suffer Second Shutout of Season as Canadiens Win 4th in Row, 30
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 17The surging Montreal Canadiens won their fourth straight game tonight and the sixth in their last seven by blanking the New York Rangers, 30, before 17, 251 appreciative fans at the Forum.

title: STOCKS ARE FIRM ON LONDON BOARD
description: The London stock exchange closed firm yesterday in quiet trading. Heavy trading on Wall Street and the strength of ster ling offset disappointment over the failure to settle the postal strike, apparently imminent Tuesday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: LOCKHEED READY FOR ROLLS TALKS
description: LONDON, Feb, 17  ?? J. Haughton, chairman of the Lockheed Aircraft Corpora tion, arrived here today for talks with RollsRoyce and Government officials about the RB211 engine needed for Lockheed's Tristar airbus.

title: Honeywell Offers Six New Computers
description: Honeywell, Inc., said yester day that it was alive and doing well in the computer business as it announced six new ma chines designed to capture a share of the largescale data processing market.

title: Bridge: New England Knockout Title Turns on 3NoTrump Contract
description: The New England Knock out Team Championship, played in Chicopee, Mass., last weekend, attracted sev eral teams with national rep utations. The winners, in a field of 69 teams, were Mark Blumenthal of Philadelphia, Robert Lipsitz of Hartford and Eric Kokish and Joe Silver of Montreal.

title: Stocks Move Lower on Amex For First Time in 5 Sessions
description: Prices moved lower yester day on the American Stock Ex change for the first time in five sessions.

title: A Superior Brucknerite
description: If you are going to con duct the symphonies of Bruckner or even listen to them seriously, it is necessary to accept first that they revel in repetition and, sec ond, that in spite of their postRomantic orchestral ap paratus they adhere to steady motivic and rhythmic pat terns in a way that recalls such 18thcentury composers as Vivaldi.

title: SUSPECT IS LINKED TO J.D.L. WEAPONS
description: A 26yearold Philadelphia man, described by the United States Attorney in Brooklyn as a major supplier of weapons to the Jewish Defense League, was under arrest here yesterday on charges of violating the Fed eral Firearms Control Act.

title: President Reaffirms Opposition to Forced Suburban Integration
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17  President Nixon said today that his announced opposition to forced integration of the sub urbs was based on economic, not racial, reasons.

title: THE GREAT SOCIETY SCORED BY AGNEW
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 The Johnson Administration's Great Society programs were an administrative nightmare that President Nixon's New Federalism must correct, Vice President Agnew declared to night.

title: Outspoken Gaullist Party Leader
description: Man in the News

title: Planning Board Moves to Allow Trailer Home Parks in the City
description: The City Planning Commis sion proposed a zoning amend ment yesterday that would per mit both private developers and the city government to set up trailer parks here on a limited basis.

title: Defiant Chilean Peasants Are Seizing More Farms
description: SAN FERNANDO, Chile, Feb. 17  A new wave of farm seizures has taken place here in the rich wineproducing prov ince of Colchagua with peas ants disregarding Government admonitions to wait for legal land reform.

title: New Enemy Units in Laos
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 17High military sources reported today that two additional North Vietnamese regi ments had moved into new positions in southern Laos in what appeared to be a serious threat to advancing South Vietnamese troops.

title: LABOR MAPS PLANS FOR '72 VOTE DRIVE
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 17Political action leaders of the A.F.L.C.I.O. began making plans here today for the 1972 election campaign.

title: EARNINGS EXPAND AT FIRST BOSTON
description: Propelled by the most power ful bond market rally in the postwar era, earnings of the First Boston Corporation soared in the second half of 1970 to more than four times the yearearlier level.

title: Senator Edward J. Speno Dies; Favored Parochial School Aid
description: ALBANY, Feb. 17  Sena tor Edward J. Speno of East Meadow, LI., one of the Re publican leaders of the Legis lature, died of a heart attack this morning at St. Peter's Hos pital here. The 50yearold Sen ator was taken to the hospital from the DeWitt Clinton Hotel, where he was staying for the legislative session.

title: MORTGAGE RATES ARE CUT % TO 7%
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17The interest ceiling on Government backed home loans was cut for the third time in less than three months today, rolling the rate back from 7 to 7 per cent, the lowest mark in more than two years.

title: Commuter Service Receives Support In I.C.C. Definition
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17The Interstate Commerce Commis sion established a definition of commuter service today that made it unlikely that commuter trains would be discontinued as a result of the creation of a new national rail network run by a quasigovernmental corpo ration.

title: Thomas Mallee Is Dead at 83; With Election Board Since '41
description: Thomas Mallee, who retired as a commissioner of the Board of Elections at the end of last year, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital after a short ill ness. He was 83 years old and lived at 252 East Gist Street.

title: Democrats Offer Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (UPI) A group of House members proposed a comprehensive health insurance bill today jumping the gun on a proposal President Nixon is expected to send to Congress.

title: DR. BERNARD SMALL, OPHTHALMOLOGIST
description: Dr. Bernard L. Small, direc tor of ophthalmology at Adel phi Hospital, Brooklyn, and the Central Brooklyn Group, Health Insurance Plan, died Tuesday of a heart attack at his home, 57 Neptune Avenue, Woodmere, L.I. His offices were in Brook lyn and Woodmere.

title: SYRACUSE SUBDUES ST. JOHN'S BY 78.73
description: SYRACUSE, Feb. 17Syra cuse won its 15th basketball game of the season and its fifth in a row tonight, defeat ing St. John's, 7873, before 4,200 at Manley Fieldhouse.

title: Reggio Calabria's Center Calm; Disorders Continue in Suburbs
description: REGGIO CALABRIA, Feb. 17 Tense calm prevailed in the center of this city today after five days of rioting, but new disorders occurred in two sub urbs.

title: Alioto Appears Before U.S. Jury Investigating Alleged Bribery
description: SEATTLE, Feb. 17  Mayor Joseph L. Alioto of San Fran cisco went before a Federal grand jury today to defend him self against accusations that his feesplitting with a former Washington State Attorney General constituted bribery.

title: LITTON IS SEARCHING FOR OIL IN ALGERIA
description: Litton Industries, Inc., an nounced yesterday that it had begun a border  to  border search for natural resources in Algeria under a $8million contract that is hoped will dis close oil, gas, minerals and underground water deposits.

title: Pope's Assailant Burns Bible
description: MANILA, Feb. 17 (Reuters) A Bolivian painter, Benjamin Mendoza, charged with trying to kill Pope Paul VI, burned a Bible today outside the Manila City Hall. Mendoza, who is 35 years old, had just left the court, where his trial was ad journed until Feb. 26, stopped in the courtyard, unwrapped a Bible from a newspaper and set it afire.

title: Commerce Department View
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (UPD) The Commerce Department said today that its own eco nomic forecasts for 1971 con flicted sharply with the opti mistic projections on which President Nixon foresaw de clining unemployment and in flation this year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Test Vote Due in Senate Today On Easing Filibuster Curb Rule
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17  After more than three weeks of repetitious debate, the Sen ate will finally get around to a preliminary vote tomorrow on whether to curb its tradi tional practice of extended de bate by changing its antifili buster rule.

title: Policemen Are Citizens
description: Legislative efforts to require policemen and other uniformed municipal employes to live in the city fly the face of simple justice and civic prudence. The only effective answer to the unhappy exodus of policemen to the suburbs is to make New York a more attractive place in which to live and bring up all families.

title: EDUCATOR REPORTS FRATERNITY CRISIS
description: Robert H. Strotz, president of Northwestern University, told an alumni group here last night that fraternities and sororities are in trouble be cause today's students view them as part of the Establish ment.

title: FLORIDIAN SOUGHT IN MURDER PLOT
description: A Florida resident is being sought by a Manhattan grand jury for questioning about an alleged conspiracy with an in dicted gambler, Hugh Mulligan, to kill a witness to a 1964 armored car robbery involving $500,000.

title: EVERGLADES WON BY HIS MAJESTY
description: MIAMI, Feb 17His Majes ty of the Darby Dan Farm streaked into the lead at the last stride to take the $34,100 Everglades today.

title: GRAEBNER, NASTASE AND RICHEY VICTORS
description: SALISBURY, Md., Feb. 17 (AP)Ilie Nastase of Rumania, the defending champion, and Cliff Richey, last year's runner up, advanced to the quarter finals with straightset victories tonight in the $50,000 national indoor open tennis champion ships.

title: Market Place: A Land Problem At One Community
description: It's a long time since the phrase land poor was in vogue. In the Great Depres sion, the phrase was applied to wealthy landowners who suddenly found themselves unable to cover expenses on unremunerative property.

title: U.S. Gold Stockpile Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (UPI)  Representative Harold T. Johnson, Democrat of Cali fornia, suggested today that the Government stockpile $430 million in gold to insure de fense and space requirements for the metal and help revital ize the domestic gold mining industry.

title: Brazil's Bishops Back Torture Charges
description: BELO HORIZONTE, Brazil, Feb. 17 (AP) The National Conference of Brazilian Bishops drafted letters at the close of its meeting here today support ing two fellow Roman Cathoi lic bishops who have charged the Government with torturing, Catholic leaders.

title: Seventh Avenue Still Dodging the Issue
description: The American designers are paying absolutely no at tention to the fact that the French ones have decided the long skirt is a dead issue, for summer anyway. Curious, in view of the rapidity with which they followed the French hemlines downward less than a year ago.

title: BUCKS BEAT 76ERS FOR 8TH STRAIGHT
description: MADISON, Wis., Feb 17 (AP) The Milwaukee Bucks, led by Lew Alcindor's 41 points, scored their eighth straight Na tional Basketball Association victory tonight with a 119114 rout of the Philadelphia 76ers.

title: Negro Sheriff in Alabama Indicted on Federal Charge of Beating a Prisoner, Also Black
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Feb. 17 Alabama's first black sheriff in modern times was arrested today on a Federal indictment for beating a prisoner.

title: John Budd Marries Mrs. Ritchie
description: John M. Budd of St. Paul, board chairman and chief executive officer of the Bur lington Northern railroad, married Mrs. Alice Otis Ritchie on Saturday in St. Paul.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: A happy blend of excel lent illustrations and a sen sitive, perceptive text makes The Secret Life of the Forest (American Heritage Press, 111 pages, $7.95) an exceedingly attractive publi cation.

title: England Regains Ashes After 12 Years of Defeat
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Feb. 17 (Reuters)England regained The Ashes, traditional sym bol of cricket supremacy, when it beat Australia in the seventh cricket test today and won the series, 20. Vic tory came on the fifth day when Derek Underwood dis missed Terry Jenner, who was caught at silly midoff by Keith Fletcher, and Aus tralia was all out for 160 runs.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: BETHLEHEM STEEL TO CUT OPERATIONS
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Feb. 17 (AP)  The Bethlehem Steel Corporation plans to discon tinue operations and product lines that cannot be made to contribute adequately to profits, Stewart S. Cort, chair man of the company, told stockholders in the annual re port released today.

title: Big Thicket Park
description: The survival of Big Thicket is a testament to nature's resiliency. This extraordinary wilderness in East Texas has been overcut by lumber companies and flooded with brackish water by oil companies. Yet 300,000 acres, onetenth the original forest, still retain their natural quality. The Big Thicket has been called the biological crossroads of North America. Here the almost extinct ivorybilled woodpecker and the bald eagle are making a last stand. It is a favorite stopping place for countless migratory birds. A remarkable variety of trees and flowers from the maple to the wild orchid can be found along its bayous.

title: Housing Starts Gain Seen
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (Reu ters)Housing starts would be between 1,750,000 and 2,000,000 units in 1971, up nearly 20 per cent from the 1970 total, Sec retary Romney predicted today in testimony prepared for the Joint Economic Committee.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 24 YACHTS FINISH 3,600MILE RACE
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 17 (AP)Eight more boats crossed the finish line today in the 3,600mile CapetowntoRio de Janeiro yacht race.

title: F.B.I. STUDY ASKED IN TOMBS HANGING
description: United States Attorney Whit ney North Seymour Jr. asked the Federal Bureau of Investi gation yesterday to look into the death of a Tombs inmate who was found hanged in his cell last Nov. 3.

title: RollsRoyce and Ethics
description: Economic Analysis

title: Utility Seeks Issue
description: NEWARK, Feb. 17 (AP) The Public Service Electric and Gas Company asked the New Jersey Public Utilities Commis sion today for authority to is sue and sell 500,000 shares of a new series of cumulative and preferred stock valued at $100 a share.

title: Transcript of the President's News Conference on Foreign and Domestic Matters
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17  Following is a transcript of President Nixon's news conference today:

title: Screen: Old Story Retold
description: Roommates is about Henry, a young New Yorker who wears his hair in the Modified Jerome Ragni bob favored by weekend drop outs. He works for the All State Collection Agency, shares a railroad flat with Solly and has a girl named Sandy. Although Henry pre tends not to feel anything, you don't believe it for a minute. He likes to take off his clothes and sit in the file room, fantasizing him self in the saffron robes of a Buddhist monk, meditating in Central Park.

title: Advertising:
description: After an 18month absence, the Virgin Islands Govern ment account has returned to the Lampert Agency. Pack your bags, boys; and let's do some research.

title: Sports of The Times
description: A week after his 17th birthday, Bill Skinner dropped out of Wilmington (Del.) High School and joined the Navy. High school had become, he says, redundant. He spent four years and three months in service, some of that time aboard the U.S.S. Canberra, grew a mustache, earned a high school equivalency diploma, shaved his mustache, and was discharged a secondclass petty officer. Back home, he married and became a sheetmetal worker. In 1963, when Skinner was 24, a friend invited him to come along one afternoon while he practiced throwing the jave lin. The friend had thrown in high school. Skinner had never touched a javelin before. But by the end of the day he was throwing it 200 feet. I was hooked, he says. I thought it might be a natural thing for me, so I kept fool ing around.

title: SCHOOLGIRLS WIN SPORTS EQUALITY
description: The Board of Education voted last night to let girls compete with boys for the first time in such noncontact high school sports as tennis and swimming.

title: Rolls TakeOver Becomes Law
description: LONDON, Feb. 17 (Reuters) A bill empowering the Brit ish Government to take over unspecified assets of bankrupt RollsRoyce, Ltd., became law today. The measure was given royal assent following its rushed passage through both houses of Parliament.

title: State Democrats Back Marijuana Bill
description: ALBANY, Feb. 17  The Democratic legislative leader ship today endorsed a state commission's proposal for an acrosstheboard reduction in the penalties for the sale or possession of marijuana.

title: Two Fire Bombs Hit Wall Of U.S. Embassy in Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Feb. 17Young men threw two fire bombs outside the American Embassy this afternoon, and sped away on motorcycles. The incident caused little damage to the walls surrounding the heavily guarded embassy. Em bassy employes repainted the wall.

title: Britain Cut Anguila Force
description: LONDON, Feb. 17 (Reuters)  Britain plans to cut her forces in Anguilla by half next monthfrom about 200 to about 90after a relaxation of tension there, the Foreign Office Minister of State said today.

title: She Changed Her Verbs, and Shop Became Serve
description: There was a time when Mrs. Barbara Babcock Las siter, granddaughter of the late R. J. Reynolds, the to bacco magnate, found herself being drawn in by that little New York world of hair dressers; designers, chic lunches, charity benefits and the telephone.

title: 200 Laos Civilians Wounded In Bombing Error Are Moved
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Feb. 17 (AP)About 170 wounded civilians have been evacuated from Long Aieng to United States hospital at Van Son, reli able sources reported today.

title: STOCK PRICES SLIP AS TRADING EASES
description: The stock market for the second consecutive session yes terday marked time as declines outnumbered advances by a moderate margin in slower trading.

title: Scheel Sees Nixon, Is Hopeful on Berlin
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17  Foreign Minister Walter Scheel of West Germany, who met to day with President Nixon and other United States officials, reportedly said that Bonn did not expect progress in the Big Four talks on Berlin until after the end of the congress of the Soviet Communist party in April.

title: Administration Assails Economic Critics
description: The Nixon Administration counterattacked yesterday its critics who have been charging that its target of $1,065 billion for the gross national product this year was a politi cally inspired guess designed to minimize the likely size of the deficit in the President's budget for fiscal 1972.

title: Tobacco Sales Rise
description: R. J. Reynolds Industries, Inc. which includes Reynolds tobacco, the largest domestic cigarette producer, posted rec ords in sales, revenues and earnings for the fourth quarter and all of 1970, the company reported yesterday.

title: GOVERNOR NAMES 2 FOR CLAIMS COURT
description: ALBANY, Feb. 17Governor Rockefeller today designated State Human Rights Commis sioner Robert J. Mangum and a Bronx lawyer, Adolph C. Or lando, as State Court of Claims judges.

title: Scientific Post Filled
description: KINGSTON, R. I., Feb. 17 (AP)Dr. John A. Knauss of the University of Rhode Island has been named chairman of the National Scientific Commit tee on Oceanography by the National Academy of Sciences. Dr. Knauss is, provost for marine affairs at the university and dean of its Graduate School of Oceanography.

title: Treasury Asks $40Billion Rise In Debt Limit, to $435Billion
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17The Administration asked Congress today for a $40billion increase in the statutory debt limitthe largest since the end of World War IIand for repeal of the longstanding 4 per cent ceil ing on the interest the Govern ment may pay on its bonds.

title: At Border Crossing Into Laos, the Litter of Troops and History
description: ON ROUTE 9, near the Lao tian border, Feb. 15Now there is only the garbage of war. Empty Cration cans of fruit cocktail and turkey loaf, an empty Pall Mall cigarette pack age, a single khaki sock and two mounds of sandbags are strewn about at the border crossing into Laos on Route 9.

title: Soviet Affirms Suspension Of Travel by Rostropovich
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 17 (UPI)A Soviet cultural official today confirmed that Mstislav Rostro povich, the cellist, would not appear abroad in the near fu ture, but he justified it as a travel suspension related to commitments in the Soviet Union.

title: Piersall to Leave Roanoke
description: ROANOKE, Va., Feb. 17 (AP) Jim Piersall, the former ma jor league baseball player, is resigning as general manager of the Atlantic Coast Football League's Roanoke Buckskins.

title: State Audit Urges Reforms In L.I.R. Internal Controls
description: ALBANY, Feb. 17  More than 100 reforms in the Long Island. Railroad's generally weak system of internal con trols were recommended in a state audit report released to day.

title: 3 BIG ITALIAN BANKS TO WORK TOGETHER
description: ROME, Feb. 17Three Italian banks with joint resources of $10.5billion announced yester day that they had reached an agreement to collaborate at home and abroad.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Baseball Signings

title: Mayor Gibson and City Council, Meeting in Cahill's Office Reach Compromise on Newark Tax Package
description: TRENTON, Feb. 17Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson and the Newark City Council, meeting in the Governor's office here, reached a compromise on a city tax package today while state policemen held back a group of striking Newark teachers.

title: U.S. JURY INDICTS 8 IN ARMY CLUB CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17The Army's former topranking en listed man and seven others were indicted today by a Fed eral grand jury on charges that they plotted to defraud non commissioned officers' clubs in Vietnam.

title: A BLAVK COALITION PLANNED AT A.&P.
description: Seven A. & P. employes charged the company with racism and employe exploita tion yesterday and announced their intention to form a coali tion with a group that is boy cotting the food chain's stores in 20 cities.

title: After Years, Figures of a Rare Sculpture Reunited
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17  Two figures from a small bronze casting dating from the early Italian Renaissance have been reunited after a separation of more than a century and 3,800 miles.

title: Colombo Arrives in U.S., Will Confer With Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (Reuters)  Italy's Premier, Emilio Colombo, arrived to night for a fiveday visit during which he will have talks with President Nixon.

title: 9 Are Injured in Explosion Of Bomb in Bar Near Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Feb. 17 (AP)A bomb exploded in a bar near Belfast today, in juring nine civilians.

title: Soviet Weekly Is Skeptical On Promises to Consumers
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 17 A So viet weekly newspaper that has fought many campaigns on be half of the consumer expressed skepticism today about the lead ership's new promises for a substantial improvement in the living standard.

title: NIXON REFUSES TO RULE OUT WIDER AIR ROLE IN THE WAR OR A SAIGON PUSH TO NORTH
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 President Nixon said today that he would put no limit on the use of American air power in Indochina except that the use of tactical nuclear weapons was banned. He also refused to rule out a South Vietnamese thrust into North Vietnam.

title: $75,000 CONTRACT FOR STOTTLEMYRE
description: Mel Stottlemyre, the Yan kees' highest paid player, and Frank Baker, a young short stop, agreed to contract terms yesterday. Twentyseven of 39 players are signed.

title: Japan's Satellite Transmits
description: TOKYO, Feb. 17 (UPI) Japan's second satellite is off course but its radio transmitter is working perfectly, Tokyo University scientists said today. The 138.6pound satellite was orbited yesterday by a four stage rocket launched at Uchi noura on Japan's southern is land of Kyushu. Nicknamed Tansei (light blue) after Tokyo University's color, the satellite is designed to radio back data only on its own performance.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Westminster Judge Does Not Dog It
description: News of Dogs

title: At Clarion Concert, a Homey Touch
description: On one side of the stage, the musicians. On the other, a carpet, two lamps, chairs and a bench. Around the props, the Abbey Singers, informally dressed. Next to the harpsichordist, the con ductor, seated, turning pages, gesturing to the small orches tra or to the singers once in a while. It was all very homey.

title: Theater: A Thrilling Hedda Gabler
description: The New York season  which is getting better, bet ter and betterlast night rolled out another immaculate and thrilling production of a classic. The classic is Ibsen's Hedda Gabler, the place is the beautiful Playhouse Thea ter, and the company is led by Claire Bloom and Donald Madden. Hedda is alternat ing weekly with The Doll's House, already in repertory. See both.

title: DOUGLASS G. TOMKINS
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Feb. 17  Douglass G. Tomkins, who re tired several years ago as treasurer, controller and man ager of the general business and accounting office of Esso Refining and Research Com pany, died yesterday in Over look Hospital. He was 72 years cud and lived at 38 Silver Lake Drive.

title: Somersault in Warsaw
description: The past two months have seen many surprises in Poland. None of them can compare, however, to the policy somersault represented by the decision to roll back the price increases that only a few weeks ago brought rioting, the death of workers at the hands of police and the replacement of Wladyslaw Gomulka by Edward Gierek. Officials had held there was no alterna tive to price rises. Now comes a reversal.

title: DAVID MAYS DIES; PULITZER WINNER
description: RICHMOND, Feb. 17David J. Mays, a leading member of the Virginia bar who won na tional recognition as a histor ian, died today following a short illness. He was 74 years old.

title: Saudi Government, Ever Wealthier, Maintains Firm Grip and Slow Pace
description: JIDDA, Saudi Arabia, Feb. 11The Saudi Arabian Govern ment continues to move along slowly but vigorously long after most other Arab monarchies have fallen by the wayside.

title: Air Force to Try 7, Not 14, In Thailand Mess Hall Case
description: WASHINGTON Feb. 17 (AP) The Air Force said today that it erred in announcing courts martial for 14 officers and non commissioned officers accused of mishandling mess hall funds in Thailand.

title: Advertising:
description: One of the dream relation ships of advertising has come to an end. Norman, Craig & Kummel has resigned the Maidenform bra account.

title: POTATO FUTURES PLUNGE IN PRICE
description: Potato futures rose sharply on Tuesday in the wake of last week's Government report, but the upswing proved shortlived yesterday. After a jump in price at the opening, the key May contract plunged to set a new lifeofcontract low.

title: Seton Hall Downs Iona
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Feb. 17Although Art Wiggins of Iona passed the 1,000point mark with 12 points, Seton Hall University scored an 8257 bas ketball victory over the Gaels tonight. Seton Hall now has a wonlost record of Iona is 07.

title: Chase Set to Form A Bank in Suburbs
description: The Chase Manhattan Cor poration, parent company of the Chase Manhattan Bank, joined the parade yesterday of major New York City banking organizations seeking to form new banking subsidiaries in the suburbs.

title: JOSEPH DAMES DIES; JEWISH APPEAL AIDE
description: Joseph Dames, director of special gifts of the American Jewish Committee's Appeal for Human Relations, died yester day after heart surgery in St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 50 years old and lived at 3368 21st Street, Long Island City, Queens.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: $18,000 in Sea Food Stolent
description: An $18,000 cargo of sea food was hijacked in lower Manhat tan yesterday by three men who forced the driver of the sea food truck into another truck, the police said. The dri ver, Gustav Walz, 60 years old, of Short Hills, N. J., told the police that the men, in a sedan and a truck, forced him to the curb at Canal and West Street. His truck is owned by the G.K. Trucking Company, of Jersey City.

title: DETROIT NUN SLAIN BY SHOT INTO ROOM
description: DETROIT, Feb. 18 (UPI) Sister Julita Maria Williams, who devoted her life to teach ing the young and the retarded, died early today of a bullet fired through the draperycovered window of her convent room.

title: One Democrat, One Vote
description: The Democratic National Committee meets today to apportion the delegates to the 1972 convention. Earlier this week the Executive Committee, after one day's con sideration, rejected the apportionment formula which a special commission headed by Representative O'Hara of Michigan had developed after a year of study and hearings.

title: GAF BUYING PART OF CADENCE UNIT
description: Merger News

title: MARKET IS LOWER AS TRADING EASES
description: Trading on the New York Stock Exchange eased lower yesterday in the quietest ses sion in a month.

title: U.N. Request Said to Be Ignored
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. V., Feb. 18  The Israeli authori ties have ignored a request for information from Secretary General Thant about their plans for the urban development of Jerusalem, informed sources said today.

title: Hanoi Says Moves by U.S. Pose Threat to Red China
description: PARIS, Feb. 18North Viet nam charged at the peace talks here today that the United States was threatening to ex tend the war to North Vietnam ese territory and by so doing was menacing Communist China as well.

title: Argentine Guerrillas Step Up Drive; Experts Foresee BigScale Attacks
description: BUENOS. AIRES, Feb. 19 Argentina's smoldering guer rilla war has been fought in ecent months on an increas ingly bloody scale, and guerrilla incidents are occurring at the rate of about one a day, with bands taking over entire towns for brief periods.

title: RESERVE INJECTS RECORD CREDIT
description: The Federal Reserve was forced to inject recordbreaking amounts of credit into the bank ing system to meet extraordi nary demands in the latest statement period, the weekly list of central banking statistics disclosed yesterday.

title: Kaye, His Leg in Cast, Rejoins TwobyTwo
description: Danny Kaye, irrepressible even with his leg in a cast and hobbling on a crutch, sang, mugged, adlibbed and stumbled his way into the hearts of an audience last night that had filled the Im perial Theater to welcome his return to Two by Two.

title: Tito, Conferring in Egypt, Receives Soviet Message
description: CAIRO, Feb. 18President Tito of Yugoslavia received a message today from the Soviet Government as he neared the end of consultations with Pres ident Anwar elSadat on an apparent new initiative to seek a settlement of the ArabIsraeli conflict.

title: CRITICIZED AIDE QUITS INTERIOR JOB
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18  Under Secretary of the Interior. Fred J. Russell has abruptly resigned. Interior Department officials said privately, He was fired.

title: Lakers Rout Blazers
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Feb. 18 (AP)  Gail Goodrich, Keith Erickson and Hap Hairston combined for 72 points tonight as the Los Angeles Lakers posted a 136114 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers.

title: Board in Yorkville Fighting Planners
description: A community group with record of success in moving both the big wheels and little cogs of a stubborn city bu reaucracy announced a new plan yesterday to preserve Yorkville.

title: Zumwalt Arrives in Chile For OneDay Courtesy Visit
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Feb. 18 Adm. Elmo Zumwalt, United States Chief of Naval Opera tions, arrived today for a one day visit to Chile during which he will pay courtesy calls on defense officials and inspect the Chilean Navy.

title: Inquiry on Secrecy Slated
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Feb. 18 (AP)The California As sembly created a commitee to day to study secrecy in govern ment.

title: RICHEY BEATS KOCH TO GAIN SEMIFINALS
description: SALISBURY, Md., Feb. 18 (AP)Cliff Richey, the topseed ed player, defeated Tomas Koch of Brazil in 50 minutes tonight and advanced to the semifinal round of the United States in door open tennis champion ships. The scores were, 62, 62.

title: Last Brahmin's Will Aids History and Art
description: BOSTON, Feb. 18 (UPI) The will of the last of the Boston Brahmins has been filed in Probate Court. Sec retary of Health, Education and Welfare, Elliot Richard son and two other nephews of Henry L. Shattuck are among its beneficiaries.

title: President Agrees to a Meeting With 12 Black House Members
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18 President Nixon has agreed to meet with the black members of the House of Repre sentatives, one year after they requested and he rejected such a meeting.

title: HOWE STANDS OUT AS WINGS WIN, 53
description: DETROIT, Feb. 18 (AP)  Gordie Howe scored the 850th goal of his National Hockey League career tonight as the Detroit Red Wings beat the Minnesota North Stars, 53.

title: Big Powers Meet
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 18Representatives of the Big Four powers met again to day to discuss the question of bigpower guarantees to bolster an eventual ArabIsraeli peace settlement.

title: Lawsuit Looms in Offtrack Bet Logjam
description: Accusing the state's race tracks of giving him a com plete runaround, Howard Sam uels indicated yesterday that court action might be the only means of getting offtrack bet ting out of the starting gate.

title: Stage: Three by McNeal
description: Claude McNeal's three one acts that opened last night at the Provincetown Playhouse under the collective title, Things That Almost Hap pen, are plays that do not happen. They startslowly and proceed slowlyand start againand then finish sort oflike this sentence. They are more writings than plays.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Not so long ago the liberals, aided by the leftist news media, staged a tremendous campaign to save the lives of a few Basques who had engaged in an unsuccessful revolution against Franco's Spain.

title: Philadelphia Bank Cuts Rates
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 18 (UPI)  First Pennsylvania Bank today cut interest rates on all residential mortgage loans. Conventional mortgage loans will he scaled as low as 7 per cent.

title: Selkirk, N.Y., Soldier Killed!
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18 (UPI) The Defense Department an nounced today that Specialist 4 James V. Picarazzi, of the Army, of Selkirk, N. Y., had been killed in action in South east Asia.

title: Cornelius J. McQuillen Dead; Former Brooklyn School Aide
description: Cornelius J. McQuillen, for mer Assistant Superintendent of Schools for District 20, Brooklyn, died yesterday in the Veterans Administration Hos pital, Brooklyn, after a long ill ness. He was 65 years old and lived at 8701 Ridge Boulevard, Brooklyn.

title: Model Cities Fund Freeze Dropped by White House
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18 (AP) The White House has done an abrupt turnabout, Adminis tration sources reported today, on a plan to impose a nation wide freeze as of next Dec. 31 on Federal funds for the Model Cities program.

title: SYDNEY G. GUMPERTZ, WON MEDAL OF HONOR
description: Sydney. G. Gumpertz, a re tired advertising man who won the Medal of Honor in World War I, died Tuesday in the Vet erans Administration Hospital. He was 91 years old.

title: Hofstra Tops L.I.U., 7170
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Feb. 18 A pair of free throws by Bob McKillop with eight seconds remaining provided the differ ence tonight as the Hofstra five edged Long Island University, 7170. Two foul shots by Dave Bell gave Hofstra a 6968 lead with 1 minute 49 seconds to play and McKillop's shots raised it to 7168. Bell led all the scorers with 18 points.

title: Laird Picks Panel to Curb Army Spying on Civilians
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18  The formation of a high level, civiliandominated board to as sume direct control of investi gations in this country by mili tary intelligence operatives was announced today by Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Grumman Aerospace Corporation, a sub sidiary of the Grumman Corporation, announced yes terday the election of J. I. Evans as chairman and chief executive officer. Mr. Evans, who was presi dent, succeeds E. Clinton Towl who resigned the chairmanship of the subsidiary but continues as chairman of the corporation. William M. Zarkowsky, a senior vice president of the subsidiary, was elected president. William T. Schwendler, chairman of the executive committee of the Grumman Corporation, resigned his post as vice chairman of the aerospace subsidiary. The subsidiary also elected Corwin H. Meyer as senior vice president and Ross S. Mickey as vice president.

title: Pfeiffer Rites on Sunday
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Feb. 18  A memorial service for Timothy N. Pfeiffer, president of the Legal Aid Society of New York from 1950 to 1955, will be held at the Princeton University chapel on Sunday at 1 P.M. Mr. Pfeiffer, a charter trustee emeritus of Princeton University, died here on Feb. 12 at the age of 84.

title: Ivan Cherevichny, 61, Pilot Of Soviet Convoys in Arctic
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 18 (Reuters) Ivan Cherevichny, arctic pilot, has died at the age of 61, the Soviet press agency Tass re ported today. A hero of the So viet Union, Mr. Cherevichny es corted convoys of ships through ice floes, flew to remote Arctic stations and took part in rescue operations in the extreme north.

title: REGIONAL LEADER OUSTED IN POLAND
description: WARSAW, Feb. 18The pro vincial Communist party chief in Opole, one of Poland's agri cultural areas, was replaced today, the eighth such change since Edward Gierek came to power in December and the fourth in the last two days.

title: Heath Insists a Fast Reply to Lockheed Is Not Possible
description: LONDON, Feb. 18Prime Minister Heath made clear to day that his Government would not be able to give the Lock heed Aircraft Corporation a firm answer by Feb. 26 on the future of the RollsRoyce RB211 engine.

title: BIG FOUR INTENSIFY PARLEY ON BERLIN
description: BERLIN, Feb. 18The four power talks on Berlin moved into the stage of fullfledged negotiations today.

title: SYLVIA MAREOINE GIVES CONTRASTS
description: Sylvia Marlowe's fourth and last evening of Contrasts at Carnegie Recital Hall on Wednesday night threatened to be all elegance. There was, to be sure, the opposi tion of the fast and the slow, of wit and sentiment. But these were superficial fac tors in music that was con stantly blandishing to the ear. The genuine contrast was provided finally at the end of the program, when the harpsichordist and her colleagues turned to Falla's astringent Concerto.

title: Survey of Lincoln Square Area Proposes Some Changes There
description: The Lincoln Square area should have a network of pedes trian paths, cityowned hotels for the elderly, oneway traffic on stretches of Broadway and Central Park West and relocate subway entrances, a consult ing concern recommended yes terday.

title: Quebec Medicare: Doctors and Patients Trying to Cope
description: MONTREALAfter a period of shock in the medical pro fession, a strike of specialists and fears that there would be a mass emigration of doctors, both the profession and the patients are coping with the difficulties of making Quebec Province's comprehensive new medicare system work.

title: Italian Premier, After Talk With Nixon, Reports Reassurances by U.S. on NATO
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18  Premier Emilio Colombo of Italy met with President Nixon today. The Premier said after the meeting that he had been reassured that the United States would maintain its forces in the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

title: Disclosures Sought On Investor Rights
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission proposed today to force companies to tell public investors in advance of the right to receive dividends or of other rights of stockholders.

title: SHORT INTEREST UP ON BIG BOARD
description: Shortinterest positions on the New York Stock Exchange as of the Feb. 11 settlement date rose to almost 19.6 million sharesthe highest level in six months, the exchange reported yesterday.

title: MAYOR ASKS STATE TO PAY FOR CITY U.
description: Mayor Lindsay demanded yesterday that the state take over the city's share of the cost of running the City Uni versity's nine senior colleges.

title: G.E. Earnings Up 18% in Year;
description: The General Electric Com pany, buoyed by its best fourth quarter ever, reported yester day an 18 per cent increase in 1970 earnings on a rise of 3 per cent in sales.

title: Tuesday Weld Gets Divorce
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 18 (Reuters)  A Superior Court judge today granted Tuesday Weld, the movie actress, a di vorce from her husband, Claude Harz, who is a writer, on the grounds of irreconcilable dif ferences. Miss Weld, who is 27 years old, waived alimony. She was granted custody of her daughter, Natasha, 4, and $100 monthly support for the child. Mr. Harz, 34, married Miss Weld in New York in Oc tober, 1965. They separated, three years later.

title: DECAVALCANTE PLEA CITED IN '69 CASE
description: Simon Rizzo (Sam the Plumber) DeCavalcante, the re puted leader of a New Jersey Mafia family, pleaded guilty in al secret Federal court hearing in Newark last month to a charge of conspiring to operate a $20millionayear numbers racket.

title: Knapp Panel Studying District Attorney Offices
description: The Knapp Commission, which is investigating the ex tent of police corruption, also is investigating how well the city's five District Attorney of fices have controlled police graft.

title: Barbers for Men, Yes; But Now Beauticians?
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 18 (AP) Barbers closed their shops today and gathered in the State Capitol to fight a pro posal to permit men to have their hair cut in women's beauty salons.

title: ISRAEL ADAMANT ON HOUSING PLANS
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 18The Minister of Housing, Zev Shar ef, said tonight that Israel was determined to continue to de velop Jerusalem as a unified city regardless of the political boundaries that emerged from the peace talks.

title: EXLINER ELIZABETH IN TOW FOR CURACAO
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Feb. 18 (UPIThe former liner Queen Elizabeth was under tow by two salvage tugs today bound for Curacao. She was taken in tow Tuesday night after boiler trouble left her out of control in the Windward Passage, be tween Cuba and Haiti.

title: Homosexual Militance
description: To many people, the recent demon strations and confrontations concern ing homosexuals' civil rights might seem to be just another of those libera tion movements which are so popular at present. There may be a minor ele ment of truth in this view, but the gay liberation movement is primarily con cerned with profound issuesa few of which will be mentioned hereinvolv ing the very basis of man's psychologi cal and physical relationship to man.

title: McGovern Seeking A $20Billion Plan For Rural Housing
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18 Senator George S. McGovern called today for an emergency program, costing about $20bil lion over five years, to meet what he called truly shame ful housing needs in neglected rural areas.

title: 2d Woman Admits Role in TateLaBianca Slayings
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 18 Patricia Krenwinkel Insisted on being heard at the penalty phase of the TateLaBianca murder trial today and then ad mitted that she had partici pated in at least two of the seven killings.

title: NIXON'S HEALTH CARE PLAN PROPOSES EMPLOYERS PAY $2.5BILLION MORE A YEAR
description: Excerpts from the President's health message, Page 16.

title: BUCHANAN VOTED FIGHTER OF YEAR
description: On a runoff ballot influenced by Muhammad Ali's elimina tion, Ken Buchanan, the world lightweight champion from Scotland, outpointed Joe Fraz ier by one vote yesterday to win the Edward J. Neil Me morial Award as 1970's fighter of the year.

title: EXAIDE ASSAILS NIXON G.N.P. PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18  A former high economic official of the Nixon Administration criticized today the Administra tion decision to aim for rapid expansion of the economy this year with a gross national product of $1,065billion. The former official was Maurice Mann, who left as assistant di rector of the Budget Bureau late last year. He is now with the Western Pennsylvania Na tional Bank of Pittsburgh.

title: Treasury Announces Results Of $1.2Billion Strip Bill Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18The Government reported late this afternoon the results of a sale of $1.2billion of strip Treas ury Bilk maturing for six con secutive weeks beginning May 27, 1971.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: EGYPT DECLARES SHE WOULD SIGN PACT WITH ISRAEL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18The United Arab Republic has in formed Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nations intermediary for the Middle East, that it will sign a peace treaty if Israel withdraws from all Arab terri tories captured in 1967, well placed diplomats disclosed to day.

title: OdorFree Pulp Mill Planned in Canada
description: MONTREAL, Feb. 18 Can ada's first odorfree pulp mill will be built in northwestern Saskatchewan and will create 1,600 jobs in an area of chron ically high unemployment and a large Indian population.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: WASHINGTON  Proposed new guidelines will assist the President's Council on Envir onmental Quality in achiev ing the goals set forth in the National Environmental Poli cy Act of 1969, says Malcolm Baldwin, senior legal asso ciate of the Conservation Foundation.

title: Service Held for Burrows
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 18 (UPI) A memorial service for Larry Burrows, the awardwinning lime magazine photographer, was held in St. John Cathedral today. Mr. Burrows and three other combat photographers were reported missing Feb. 10 after antiaircraft fire over Laos brought down their helicopter.

title: SENATE ATTEMPT TO CHECK DEBATE FAILS BY 9 VOTES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18On the first test vote, the Senate refused today to cut off a Southern filibuster against a move to make it easier to halt filibusters.

title: Songs and Style of Luisa Maria Add New Zest to Spanish Fare
description: A new generation of Span ish singer has arrived at that bastion of traditional Spanish song and dance, the Chateau Madrid, 48th Street and Lexington Avenue. Its repre sentative is Luisa Maria, a slim, warmeyed, round faced girl just out of her teens, originally from Cuba but now working out of Spain.

title: Two Doctors Say Calley Lacked Ability to Premeditate Slayings
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Feb. 18Two defense psychiatrists said today that First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. lacked the mental ability to premedi tate the murder of 102 South Vietnamese civilians during the alleged Mylai massacre.

title: Theater: The Gershwins Are Back
description: There is little doubt that Do It Again, which opened last night at the Promenade Theater, is far more in the nature of a cabaret without a cabaret rather than theater with a theater.

title: Advertising:
description: The shampoo market is in a lather the likes of which it hasn't seen since Procter & Gamble introduced its Head & Shoulders in 1963.

title: Big Board incorporated; Fails Increase in January
description: The New York Stock Ex change, which yesterday com pleted the necessary procedures for incorporation and is now known as New York Stock Ex change, Inc., said that the monthly fails incurred by its member firms in all markets in January rose to $1.56billion from $1.39billion in December.

title: HANS FOY
description: Hans Foy, an artist and col lector of Chinese and Oriental art, died of a heart attack Wednesday at his home in Whitestone, Queens. He was 78 years old.

title: Lady Cromer Expected to Add Style to Capital Scene
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18 Lady Cromer, wife of the new British Ambassador to the United States, stepped off the plane here not long ago only, to find that Rolls Royce was in receivership and that the Embassy was about to be torn apart to in stall central airconditioning. For the moment there are enough limousines to meet the Cromers' needs, but the remodeling may be more complicated.

title: Saint Laurent Retorts
description: PARIS (UPI)  Yves Saint Laurent says the critics who attacked his World War II floozy look for spring are petty, narrowminded reac tionaries.

title: Impeachment Debate Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18 (Reu ters)Representative Paul Mc Closkey, a California Republi can, today suggested that the nation might discuss the ques tion of impeaching President Nixon over his recent moves in Indochina.

title: Accountants Held Lax in Setting Up Proper Standards
description: The public accounting pro fession was bitterly criticized yesterday for failing its basic job of setting adequate stand ards for corporate financial reporting.

title: ARMY PX INQUIRY REPORTED KILLED
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18  An Army investigation of brib ery, kickbacks and smuggling in the post exchange system in Korea was first obstructed and then killed by senior Army of ficers stationed there, a Senate subcommittee was told today.

title: Buckley Votes to Keep Traditional Filibuster Rule
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18  Senator James L. Buckley, casting his first vote on a con troversial issue in the Senate, today supported the retention of the Senate rule requiring a twothirds vote to cut off filibusters.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Met Pitchers to Take Troubles Through Hodges's Open Door
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb., 18  Manager Gil Hodges be gan an unusual series of con fessional interviews with his New York Mets today in an effort to rebuild the pitching staff.

title: Cambodia Gives Quake Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Feb, 18 (UPI) The Cambodian Government has donated $2,000 in token humanitarian aid to the vic tims of the Los Angeles earth quake, the State Department said today.

title: ROBERT E. BOHONAN
description: NEPTUNE CITY, N. J., Feb. 18  Robert E. Bohonan, di vision manager of steam sales with Consolidated Edison in New York City, died here yes terday at the Jersey Shore Medical Center. He was 58 years old and lived at 3 Wind sor Terrace here.

title: ADOLF A. BERLE JR. DIES AT AGE OF 76
description: Adolf A. Berle Jr., the lawyer, economist, law professor, diplo mat and Liberal party leader who first came to prominence as one of the original members of President Franklin D. Roose velt's Brains Trust, died Wednesday at his home, 142 East 19th Street.

title: Federal MonitorsOr Keyhole Kops?
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  Much ado about nothing. With that Shake spearean allusion a Federal judge re cently dismissed a lawsuit to halt Army spying on the lawful conduct of citizens. Characterizing military Intel ligence as an assemblage of Keystone Kops, the judge was unimpressed by the alleged ill effects of surveillance. Taken alone, the Army's activity may be insignificant, especially since the public mea culpas by former agents have helped abort Its expansion. But military spying is symptomatic of growing governmental intrusion on our lives and heightened threats to constitutionally guaranteed rights.

title: MRS. HAROLD O'CONNOR
description: Mrs. Frances Story O'Con nor, widow of Harold H. O' Connor, a former New York lawyer, died Tuesday in Clear water Beach, Fla. Her age was 88.

title: JAMES RUSHFORTH
description: NEWARK, Feb. 18James Rushforth, secretarytreasurer of the Fiske Brothers Refinery Company here, died Tuesday, apparently of a heart attack, at St. James Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived in West field.

title: Burl Ives Divorced
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 18 (AP) Superior Court has issued a divorce decree ending the 26 year marriage of Burl Ives, the ballad singer, and Helen Peck Ives. The 62yearold Ives must pay $2,000 a month alimony. Mrs. Ives, 54, is the entertain er's former business manager.

title: Business and Labor Help Edit Politics Out of a Tax Form
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18 Last Thursday morning a large van pulled up to a loading dock at the Government Printing Of fice and was loaded with thou sands of new tax forms.

title: DRAFT OBJECTOR GETS A HUNG JURY
description: A jury failed to reach a ver dict in Federal Court here yes terday in the draftevasion trial of a 23yearold graduate stu dent at Rockefeller University who challenged the constitu tionality of the war in Vietnam and refused to be inducted into the Army.

title: A $1,300aMonth Patient for Life
description: Man in the News

title: PANTHER WITNESS CITES BUSY LIFE
description: A police undercover agent testified yesterday that he had led such a busy life pretending to be a Black Panther that he could not remember to put everything into the daily re ports he made to his super visors.

title: JOBLESS IN BRITAIN AT AN 8YEAR HIGH
description: LONDON, Feb. 18 (AP)The Government reported today that unemployment in Britain and Northern Ireland rose to an eightyear high for Feb ruary, with 3.1 per cent of the working population jobless.

title: Pact Is Reached in Urban Renewal Building Strike
description: An agreement was announced last night between building service workers and the city to end an 18dayold walkout in cityowned buildings scheduled for demolition in urban renewal areas.

title: CITY HUNTS GRAFT IN WRECKING BIDS
description: A major investigation into possible rigged bidding and pay offs to city employes by demo lition companies seeking lucra tive contracts on wrecking jobs is being conducted by the city's Department of Investigation.

title: Nevada Kills Effort To Ruralize Brothels
description: CARSON CITY, Nev. Feb. 18 (UPI)  A bill to confine houses of prostitution to Nevada's rural counties was killed today when legislators referred it to the Agriculture Committee.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE UNDERGROUND MAN. By Ross Mac donald. 273 pages. Alfred A. Knopf, $5.95.

title: KNICKS TURN BACK ROCKETS, 116115
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 18 (AP) Calvin Murphy sparked a San Diego rally in the final four minutes tonight, but the New York Knickerbockers hung on for a 116115 National Basket ball Association victory.

title: 2 Women Who've Invaded Career World Where Men Are King
description: When Mrs. Timothy O'Shea arrives at the St. Regis each morning, she is wear ing a dress. But she promptly changes into dungarees before beginning work.

title: IRT MISHAP SLOWS LINE FOR 5 HOURS
description: A cracked wheel derailed a southbound Lexington Avenue subway at the 51st Street stop yesterday morning, causing confusion and delay for thou sands of commuters on the East Side during the rush hour.

title: David Davis Gives An Erratic Flavor To a Violin Recital
description: David Davis, a violinist of undoubted native gifts and strong schooling, played an er ratic recital at Alice Tully Hall on Wednesday night. That Mr. Davis could handle the instru ment ably enough came through clearly in many pages of the Bartk Sonata No. 1, for in stance, and his robust tone showed itself in Ravel's Tzi gene, notably in the unac companied early portion of the work. There was, moreover, a sensuous murmur to VillaLo bos's O Canto do Cysne Negro (Song of the Black Swan), in which Mr. Davis's controlled bowing produced an aptly dusky, mysterious tone.

title: Real Estate Loans Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18 (AP)  The Federal Reserve Board says realestate loans by banks rose an estimated $400million fast December as a result of its policies to free loan money.

title: Future in the Courts
description: The basketball future of Spencer Haywood is as cloud ed as the legal entanglements in which he is immersed.

title: Speno Rites Changed
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Feb. 18  Governor Rockefeller and other state officials will attend a funeral service for State Sena tor Edward J. Speno on Satur day at 12:30 P.M. in St. Agnes Roman Catholic Cathedral, Rockville Centre. Previously, services for Senator Speno, who died yesterday in Albany, had been scheduled for 11:30 A.M. in Sacred Heart Church, North Merrick. The change became necessary because of the desire of many of his friends and as sociates to attend the services.

title: Store Sales Increase
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18The Commerce Department today estimated last week's depart ment store sales at $597mil lion, up 11 per cent from the yearearlier $539million. Last week's total retail store sales were about $6,571,000,000, up 4 per cent from $6,333,000,000.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISGeneral de Gaulle used to say France had only two real political parties, his own and the Communists'. The present Communist boss, Georges Marchais, doesn't agree and assigns importance to parties on the non Communist left which his own move ment would now like to join in coali tion, thereby seeking power through a ballotbox revolution.

title: Fanny May Puts Off Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 18 (Reu ters)The Federal National Mortgage Association today postponed its scheduled auction Monday to March 1 to give sellers the opportunity to assess implications of the halfpoint reduction in Federal Housing Administration and Veterans Administration loans to 7 per cent.

title: Market Place: New Directory: Money Markets
description: It isn't the first time some body has made money copy ing information out of the telephone book.

title: Mrs. Phoebe W. van Beuren Married to John D. Archbold
